"Stay away from that kid; he's bad news..."

Naruto winced, jerking back a bit. Kiba, noticing this, reached a hand out toward him, making sure to keep a grip on his shorts with his other. "Naruto, what..."

Naruto stumbled a bit, almost tripping over his clothes that were now far too large for him, and were growing even larger still. "Seriously, just..."

"Little freak...graffiti'd all over the front of my shop..."

"Get lost! Can't you tell when you're not wanted?"

"If it weren't for the Hokage, you'd be kicked outta this village in no time! Then at least you wouldn't darken anyone else's doorstep again..."

As the memories continued slamming into his mind, NAruto staggered back, this time tripping over his clothes and falling square on his rump. His heartbeat quickening, he held up his smaller hands in front of him, whimpering a bit as he saw them become smaller and smaller. "I-I changed my mind!" Naruto blurted, beginning to breath rapidly as he heard his voice become lighter and his clothes become bigger and bigger. "I-I don't wanna do this anymore!"

Kiba, even having shrunk to the point where he was practically tripping over his own clothes, clambered over to Naruto. "Naruto, what's wrong?" he asked, his even lighter voice a bit frantic. Akamaru, likewise, whined, darting up to Naruto and looking up at him in concern.

Hunter, in the meantime, watched with growing horror. Damn it...how did I not see this coming?! he swore, rushing over to the regressing boys and kneeling by Naruto. The kid had a hellacious childhood, and we talked him into revisiting it...

Unaware of Hunter's private musings, Naruto stared as his hands became smaller and smaller. "Stop...please stop..." he pleaded, noticing offhand that his voice now sounded just slightly deeper than it had when he was a child. Alas, the process had not yet run its course, and his hands continued to shrink. "Please...please..." As the last 'please' left his lips, his voice became a bit choked up, and tears began forming around his eyes.

Hunter, Kiba, and Akamaru watched helplessly as Naruto continued to shrink, and the tears began to drip down his cheeks, even as the dog-nin's own regression progressed. Within a matter of minutes, both Naruto and Kiba had fully reverted to 8-year-old children, and the little blonde boy was looking at his hands, then at his clothes, which now draped over him like a blanket, in abject horror, his sobs slowly intensifying. "N-no...no..." Squinting his eyes shut, he brought his legs (now covered totally by his shorts) up to his chest, wrapping his small arms around them and planting his face in his knees as he began crying harder.

Kiba, for once unsure of what to say, simply crawled up next to Naruto (unable to walk properly in his oversize clothes) and placed a surprisingly gentle hand on his shoulder. Akamaru, likewise, hopped up on Naruto's lap and began licking his face, doing his best to soothe the boy. And Hunter...

Hunter winced, hanging his head in abject shame. This is my fault... He clenched his paws. All my fault...

Taking a deep breath, Hunter edged closer to Naruto. Giving the boy a little shake, he flinched as Naruto looked up from his knees at the anthro. "Naruto, I'm so, so sorr---"

"Save it!" Naruto snapped, shoving Hunter's paw away forcefully. He glared angrily at the wolf. "Did you really think that if I did this, I wouldn't remember just how lonely and bad it was the first time around?!" His eyes brimmed with tears. "Guess I really AM an idiot if I let you talk me into it!"

Kiba looked toward his friend, shocked. "Naruto, calm down! He was just trying to..."

"Piss off, dog-breath!" Naruto screeched, shoving Kiba roughly and knocking the little dog-nin flat on his back. "You sure as hell didn't help!" Whining, Akamaru hopped off Naruto's lap and ran over to Kiba, privately relieved that his pal was more shocked than hurt as he sat back upright, staring back at his friend with more than a little guilt.

Sniffling, Naruto swung out at the others. "J-just go away! L-leave me alone!" Sobbing, he curled up into his clothes, his little body shaking as sobs and hiccups ravaged it.

Kiba, eyes widening, reached out toward him, but Hunter gently stayed his arm. "We should...probably just leave him alone for the moment," he said softly told the little dog-nin.

Kiba's eyes widened. "But...!" he protested.

Hunter shook his head. "Look, I screwed up, and he doesn't wanna talk to any of us right now; it's best if we just let him calm down a bit..." Kiba, though looking far from happy at the situation, nodded sullenly. Akamaru, crawling up Kiba's clothes and hopping onto his head, whimpered. What are we supposed to do in the meantime, though?

Hunter gave a strained smile. "I got some more stuff in my bag; why don't we give those a look-see?"

And so, the anthro-wolf and the regressed dog-nin and nin-dog made their way over to Hunter's bag, the dog-nin still wearing his oversized teen clothes, and began rooting through it. Throughout it all, though, they kept on throwing sad, regretful glances at the little blonde boy curled up on the floor, sobbing and shaking...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Things Go Wrong

choices: "Kiba was telling me about pictures from other worlds?  Can we see 'em?"
"Can we go play?"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Hunter sighed lowly, as he forced himself to dig through his bag and pull out his phone. "What is that thing?" Kiba asked, audibly disinterested as he too, felt immeasurably guilty for talking his still sobbing buddy into this endeavor. "It's called a cell phone. Where I come from, people use it to write out messages and send them to each other instantly from any distance," replied Hunter, occasionally glancing back at the crying little boy in the back. Still trying to ease the tension, Kiba worked up a smirk and said, "Huh, that sounds like it could come in pretty handy. Only thing that'd be even better is if you could use it to talk to people from great distances too."

Despite himself, Hunter smirked just briefly at that unintentional critique of modern society. "I think that's what cups and wires are for," noted Hunter. "It even has pictures in it. Pictures I took from all over the various places I traveled, like..." groaning to himself, Hunter hung his head a little lower in shame, ears drooping slightly as the sounds of Naruto's sobbing grew louder. Kiba too, hung his head a little lower, unable to really pretend much longer.

Unbeknownst to anyone, Akamaru never took his gaze off the poor boy, and once this moment of regret between the dog-nin and world person had transpired, the little pup slowly trotted over to the boy's side, seeing him still convulsing with each heavy sob, occasionally hiccuping as he tried desperately to silence those awful memories to no avail. "Stupid...*Hic*...stupid stupid..." muttered Naruto to himself. "Knew it was a bad idea, but dumbass Kiba just had to keep pushing and pushing...and then that stupid wolf goes and gives us his stupid vial of his stupid formula...and then stupid me has to go and drink it, because I'm just a big stupid bonehead..."

The young blond then lowered his head into his knees even further, sobbing harder as the awful shouts of hatred from his childhood just kept coming.

I didn't ask for any of this... he thought to himself, eyes clamped shut as tears streamed down his cheeks.

Then, the boy flinched slightly as he felt something press against his calf. Raising his head just slightly, he opened his red, puffy eyes, and looked down to see Akamaru staring right back up at him, front paws still pressed against the boys' thigh, making him stand up as he looked up at Naruto. "Please, just go away, Akamaru. You know I can't understand a word you say..."

But the pup didn't say anything, nor did he move. He just stared up at the poor boy, then forced himself up higher as he crawled atop his leg and gently hopped onto his arm, as the two just stared face to face in silence. Deep down, he wanted badly to tell the poor kid that he wasn't alone, that those bad memories were all in the past and that those villagers were just ignorant, scared and selfish, but he knew trying to tell the boy anything would just make him feel more isolated. Instead, the tiny pup just gave the boy a hearty lick across the face.

Another moment of silence passed. Just then, Naruto, still sniffling, slowly forced a faint smile as the pup started wagging his tail slightly and licked him again.

His smile grew a bit wider, as more tears streamed down his cheeks. But this time, they were tears of gratitude. Slowly, he reached a hand over to the pup's head and ruffled his head, causing Akamaru to bark happily as he licked him a third time, this time, eliciting a slight laugh from the boy.

Immediately, Hunter's ears perked up as Kiba too, raised his head and in unison, both turned to the sight. Taking a deep breath, Hunter turned to Kiba, who nodded, as they both turned back to Naruto and slowly rose to their feet, quietly approaching the boy as he and Akamaru carried on.

Kiba sat next to his pal, rubbing the back of his head as he cautiously asked, "Feeling better?"

Naruto's faint smile softened a bit as he nodded slightly, still giving the pup all his attention. Rubbing the back of his own fuzzy head guiltily, Hunter knelt down to the boy's level, and said, "Naruto, I...I know it probably doesn't mean anything, but...I really am sorry." Stopping for a moment, Naruto wiped his eyes with his forearm and faintly glanced up at the anthro wolf. "I didn't think it was gonna get that bad, I just...after what you said at the steakhouse, I thought maybe; however brief, I could show you that you could experience what you DESERVED to experience the first time around...but it was a dumb idea-"

"No it wasn't," Naruto finally spoke up, earning the attention of all three.

"I know you were just trying to help, but the truth is, those bad memories will always be there. Nothing can ever undo that..."

Hunter nodded solemnly, but understandingly.

"Of course nothing can be done about it. The past can't be changed," replied Kiba, trying to maintain rationality, "but the past can't hurt you either. What happened, happened. That doesn't mean it'll happen again. This isn't a second chance at childhood, it's a chance...to just be a kid for a day and enjoy it...WITHOUT the crap from last time. And you're gonna take that chance and have a blast. And there's two reasons why."

Naruto turned his attention to the young dog-nin, still sniffling. Nevertheless, Kiba held up two fingers, "One; cause you're tough as nails, and you aren't gonna let those stupid jerks from before haunt you like this. And two?" Naruto's eyes widened as Kiba gently patted him on the shoulder and smiled warmly at the poor boy. "You ain't alone this time. Me'n Akamaru got your back. Now, and always...cause that's what friends are for."

A moment of silence passed as Naruto's eyes watered more than before. Neither Kiba nor Akamaru had abandoned him and left him alone with those bad thoughts of his past. It was just like the dog-nin said, he wasn't alone. His friend was still by his side, just like he had been time and time again.

Finally, a warm, grateful smile rose upon the boys' face as he finally said, "...Thank you..."

The young dog-nin just smiled back and wrapped his arm around the boy's neck brotherly, earning a soft laugh from the boy, even as Akamaru barked happily and licked the boys' face once more. Naruto turned to the pup and equally grateful, said, "Thank you both."

Hunter grinned slightly at the sight. Then, to his surprise, Naruto glanced back at him. "You too. Everything you've done these past few days for me'n Kiba here, I just want you to know, that means a lot...and I just wanna, say I'm sorry to both of you for freaking out like that...you two didn't do anything wrong."

The wolf gratefully smiled and, still down on the boys' level, gently ruffled his head, both playfully and gratefully. "I appreciate that, little guy, really..." he then sighed and added, "I just wish this moment wasn't so painful for you."

Wiping his face, Naruto just shook his head and added, "It doesn't have to be. Like Kiba said, my past may never go away, and it might always haunt me, but it's all in the past...it can only hurt me if I let it..."

Both Hunter and Kiba smiled at the boy. "Now you're talkin'," Kiba laughed, as both youths turned to Hunter and said, "Hey, how about we start by getting those new duds?" Hunter laughed and nodded as he headed back to the closet, signalling Akamaru to follow as the two youths continued chatting and making amends. As Hunter dug through the clothes, he looked down at the little pup and smiled, "That was pretty impressive, little fella. How'd you managed to get through to the kid?"

The pup wagged his tail, yipping happily. When someone's in a dark place, they can't be brought back with reason, or words. Sometimes, the best thing you can do for someone in need...is to just be there for them...

Hunter smiled at the pup and ruffled his head, nodding in understanding. "Heh, y'know something? Those two are pretty lucky to have you watching out for them." Akamaru just licked the wolf's paw and barked happily. Not as lucky as they are to be such great friends.

Smiling, Hunter finally grabbed a hold of both new attires for the youths and handed them over. "Here you go, boys. Once we're ready to start this thing over, what would you two like to do?"

Naruto, still wiping his face a bit, turned to Kiba, and grinned as he looked back up at the anthro-wolf and replied...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Akamaru tries to cheer a still crying Naruto up...

choices: The four reach the ice cream place, and they each order one huge sundae
The four reach the ice cream place, and decide to share one mammoth sundae
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Hunter grinned in response to the question. "You wanna see some of the pictures I took?"

Naruto nodded eagerly. "Yuh-huh! I got kinda curious hearing you talk about the different places yuou've visited, anyway..." He adjutsted the bundle of clothes in his arms a bit. "First, though, could you maybe give us a second to change?"

Hunter laughed, ruffling Naruto's head and causing the boy to giggle a bit. "Go right ahead, boys; besides, I need to get the pictures ready." The anthro-wolf chuckled. "There's a bathtub with a curtain in there, too, so you can both get changed."

Kiba grinned, hoisting his own bundle of clothes up. "Thanks, Hunter!" Sharing a smirk with Naruto, the boys made their way over to the bathroom (almost tripping over their clothes a few times in the process,) Akamaru following close behind. Entering at roughly the same time, the door shut behind them.

Shaking his head and smiling, Hunter turned his head back to his phone, getting some of the pictures ready. Naruto seems a lot more cheery, now. He sighed. Still, I gotta be careful; I don't want the kid getting upset again...

Soon, both Naruto and Kiba emerged from the bathroom, proudly wearing their new duds. As the boys walked toward Hunter, the wolf's ears twitched, and he looked over his shoulder at them. "Oh hey, boys; lookin' mighty snazzy!"

Laughing, Naruto rubbed the back of his head. "Aww, thanks!"

Chuckling, Kiba looked at his shoulder and ruffled Akamaru's fur, the pup nestled snugly in his hood. "Yeah, and Akamaru likes it too; don't ya, boy?" The pup happily barked his assent, licking Kiba's cheek and causing the boy to giggle a bit.

Naruto was clad in an outfit style he wasn't used to, but had quickly found he'd liked; specifically, a red, short-sleeved button-down shirt and black cargo pants. Kiba, on the other hand, was clad in an outfit that, by some stroke of serendipity, greatly resembled an outfit he'd had when he was a Genin. It was, quite simply, a long-sleeved black hoodie with white lining in the hood, which sat down around his shoulder and within which Akamaru nestled snugly, as well as a wide-cut v-neck, going far enough down his chest to fully expose his necklace-a simple accessory with a metal tag at the end. Two thick, yellow stripes ran from the top of his left shoulder and continued all the way to the bottom of the hoodie. In terms of pants, he wore long, white khaki pants that stopped above the ankle.

Hunter smiled at the sight, wagging his tail. Oh wow; nice job, Midna. Then again, given that she's essentially a queen, it makes sense she'd have good fashion sense... Out loud, Hunter smiled and motioned with his head. "Alright, boys, I've got the pictures ready; c'mere and give 'em a look-see." Eagerly, Naruto and Kiba rushed to his sides, peering over his shoulder at the device he held in his paws. Chuckling at their enthusiasm, Hunter reached up to the screen, fiddling with it a bit before the first picture came up. To their surprise, Hunter winced a bit as he noticed it. "Ah, great, him..." Confused, the boys leaned in to get a better view of it.

The picture depicted what appeared to be a pale-skinned, thinly-built man in a sleeveless white bodysuit that, oddly enough, had several diamond-shaped cutouts in it. He had short white hair, and lips that were, oddly enough, the same shade.He wore a rather odd-looking cape, and the one ear that wasn't covered by his hair was oddly-pointed.

Naruto blinked in confusion. "Who's that guy?"

Hunter groaned. "That...that is the Demon Lord Ghirahim."

Kiba's eyes widened. "Demon Lord?!"

Hunter nodded. "Yeah; he's kinda creepy, and he has absolutely NO comprehension of the term 'personal space...'" He chuckled a bit. "...but damn if he isn't the most fabulous demon lord you've ever met." Naruto, Kiba, and Akamaru all shared a befuddled glance at Hunter's choice of words.

"Moving on..." Hunter muttered, fiddling with the screen again and bringing up another picture. At this, Naruto, Kiba, and Akamaru's eyes all widened. What the hell... Akamaru barked, tilting his head.

Laughing, Hunter looked back at his phone; it depicted what appeared to be a rather tall creature that could only be described as a humanoid tree. On his shoulder, what appeared to be a raccoon perched, arms folded and face contortd in what was either a scowl or a cocky smirk. The raccoon was clad in what appeared to be an orange, sleeveless, two-piece bodysuit, though his clawed feet remained unadorned. In addition, he had something slung across his back.

Kiba raised an eyebrow. "Is...is that a raccoon?"

Hunter smirked. "That," he began, chuckling, "is Rocket, and that big guy he's standing on," he gestured to the tree-creature, "is his buddy, Groot." He smiled as he examined the picture closer. "They're a couple of bounty hunters, but once ya get to know 'em, they're not so bad. Groot's really nice..." Even if all he says is "I am Groot", he mused. "...and Rocket...well, he's got some serious anger and attitude problems, but once ya get past all that, he's a real softy." His expression suddenly grew panicked. "Just, uh, don't tell him I said that, OK? I really don't fancy getting vaporized...or getting my face ripped off..." In spite of themselves, Naruto and Kiba giggled a bit at his expression. Clearing his throat, Hunter fiddled with the screen again. "Moving on..."

The next picture he brought up was of a, frankly, rather frightening creature. It was a spindly, purple-scaled, reptilian creature that looked like a cross between a dragon and a pterodactyl, with a long neck, a long tail with a pointed tip, large leathery wings, and cruelly glinting yellow eyes.

Naruto gulped. "Um...who's that?"

Hunter looked equally discomfited. "That," he began slowly, "would be Ridley, leader of the Space Pirates."

Ridley? Akamaru whined. What kinda name is that?

Hunter shrugged. "Dunno, but the Space Pirates, at least from what I've heard, are a nasty bunch; they go from planet to planet, razing it and stripping it of whatever resources they can find." He grimaced. "They're really into scientific experimentation, too, but they don't much care for proper scientific method..." Or even if their subjects survive, Hunter thought, his gorge rising slightly at the few things he'd glimpsed when he'd been unlucky enough to end up sneaking around in one of their labs. Composing himself, he continued, "Ridley, though, he's the worst of them. He's as savage, sadistic and brutal as they come, but he's incredibly intelligent and cunning, not to mention he can talk..." he shuddered. "I've only met that maniac once, and even that was too many times..."

"How didja get away?" Naruto asked, a bit unnerved but still curious.

Hunter shrugged. "Sheer dumb luck is all I can chalk it up to." Shaking his head, he fiddled with the screen again. "Let's see if we can pull up something more pleasant, shall w---"

Naruto's head suddenly darted up. "Did you guys hear something?" he asked, tugging at his collar.

Confused, Hunter, Kiba, and Akamaru looked toward him. "N-no, I didn't hear anything," Kiba spoke up, raising an eyebrow.

I got nothin', Akamaru added, tilting his head a bit.

Hunter shrugged. "No, I don't hear anything." He looked closely at Naruto. "Are you still holding up OK?"

"Wh-what?" Naruto exclaimed. "Yeah, of course I am! Just coulda sworn I heard someone talking..." He shook his head. "Probably just hearing things is all..."

At this, Kiba, Akamaru, and Hunter shared an awkward look. However, before one of them could comment on it...

Grrrroooooowllll....

Naruto blushed as his hands flew to his tummy. "H-heh, sorry about that," he laughed, rubbing the back of his head. "Guess it's been a while since the steakhouse..."

Kiba, smirking, playfully slugged Naruto in the arm. "Ah, don't sweat it, Uzumaki; I'm actually feelin' a little hungry, too."

Me three! Akamaru piped up, wagging his tail even as he lay nestled in Kiba's hood.

"Me four," Hunter chuckled, standing up. Pocketing his phone, he rubbed his stomach eagerly before looking down at the two children. "How would you boys like some ice cream?" The boys said nothing, but their faces damn near lit up as huge grins split their faces. Grinning in return, Hunter ruffled both their heads. "I'll take that as a resounding 'yes'." Walking toward the door, he held it open, motioning for the three tof ollow. "C'mon; I saw an ice cream place on the way here that looked really good." Smiling, he headed out the door.

As soon as he walked out of sight, NAruto and Kiba shared competitive grins. "Last one there's a rotten egg!" Naruto blurted, darting out the door after Hunter.

Grinning savagely, Kiba hurried after him, Akamaru still nestled snugly in the hood. "Guess that's gonna be you!"

Even as the four made their way out of the inn and onto the streets, Hunter couldn't help but smile and wag his tail as he heard the boys racing, bickering, and laughing behind him. Well, that's a marked improvement, the anthro thought, relieved. Hopefully, they're only gonna continue to improve...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: "Kiba was telling me about pictures from ot...

choices: And immediately, they dig in...
Naruto suggests they try and make it competitive...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Panting heavily, the two youths slouched forward, both laughing heartily albeit in a strained manner. "Good game, Inuzuka," huffed Naruto, still clutching his knees and catching his breath as he panted heartily. Kiba; who fared no better, just grinned and lightlu nudged his pal in the arm. "Right back at'cha, Uzumaki. I didn't you'd actually beat me like that, but damn!" Naruto just laughed some more and rubbed the back of his head. "What can I say? When ice cream's on the line-"

A sudden loud rumbling caught both theirs and Akamaru's ears. They all looked up as the rumble grew louder and discovered the source, was actually the wolf's tummy, causing all three to laugh some more while Hunter just chuckled sheepishly and placed a paw against his stomach. "Heh, guess I'm a little hungrier than I thought," he mused, but nonetheless, smiled at the happy sight of the boys, and at the fact that directly before the four, was the ice cream place. "Good timing I guess, cause here we are!"

Hunter opened the doors, allowing the two youths and pup atop one of the said youths' head to enter as he followed behind and called out to the guy running the counter. He was initially taken back by the sight of a walking wolf person, but nonetheless, worked up a smile and said, "Welcome! You or the little fellas see anything you like?" To which, Hunter turned to the boys and asked, "Whadduya guys feel like havin'?"

The two youths glanced at the menu up top for a moment, seeing all sorts of tasty flavors on the board...but then one particular sight caught their eyes. Sensing what they were about to order, Akamaru whined to himself. Heeeeere we go again...

Naruto reached out and tugged at Hunter's paw as he pointed up at it. "Ooo! Ooo! Hunter! I know what we should get!" he beamed excitedly. Hunter just laughed and said, "I'm all ears, kiddo." To which, Naruto grinned and replied, "Can we four extra jumbo sized sundaes?" The man at the counters' eyes widened for a moment, seeing the small size of the boys and pup, but nonetheless shrugged. "And what flavors did you guys want those in?"

"Classic chocolate's fine with me," said Hunter. Naruto grinned and said, "Can I get the Vanilla with extra chocolate syrup and whipped cream?" The man nodded as he jotted down the first two orders. Kiba continued pondering, until he grinned and said, "Lemme get the mint chocolate chip with extra chocolate syrup and those nut thingies!" The man nodded and added it to the list, chuckling at the 'nut thingies' remark. Despite himself, Akamaru's tail wagged as he saw an item that caught his eyes. Well, since they have it...can I get strawberry without chocolate syrup, but extra whipped cream and a cherry on top?

Grinning, Kiba reached up and ruffled the pups' fuzzy head as he relayed his order to the man. "Alright, fellas. That'll be about ten minutes to get everything ready, so just go ahead and take a seat anywhere'n we'll get your orders ready." Hunter smiled and paid the man up front before heading towards the tables with his (currently) younger companions.

The four turned and IMMEDIATELY shuddered as the first thing they saw was a booth, calling out to them, almost mocking them....and immediately, the jumped to the nearest table they could find, graced with the freedom of chairs. The four continued to chat and talk amongst themselves while they waited, until finally, the man wheeled out a cart with all four of their orders waiting for them.

Eagerly, they grabbed them and placed them on their massive sundaes. Both Hunter and the man watched as the boys struggled with theirs, grunting and huffing to carry them over to their tables. The sight was enough to make both the anthro and the man just go "Awwww...." in unison before turning to each other and chuckling embarrassingly as the man took his leave and Hunter turned his attention back to the boys. Kiba had managed to get his bowl on the table and hauled the strawberry sundae over besides his own bowl for Akamaru to enjoy as he hopped off his head and trotted eagerly towards his bowl.

The four stared eagerly for a moment as their tummies rumbled for the deliciously chilled desserts bestowed upon them...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: They reach the place, and get one huge sundae each

choices: Hunter, Kiba, and Akamaru swiftly realize what this means
Before any of them can react, the voice in Naruto's head calls out again
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
"Wow," Kiba muttered, staring at his behemoth of a sundae. "That's a lotta ice cream..."

Indeed it was; each sundae consisted of at least twelve huge scoops of their respective flavors of ice cream, each lathered liberally with their requested toppings. The whipped cream was slathered on, the chocolate sauce running into the ice cream, the nuts dotting as much of the surface as they could, and a huge, juicy cherry on top (in Akamaru's case).

Chuckling, Hunter dug his spoon in, retrieving a big spoonful of ice cream and toppings. "Heh, sure is..." Openiing his muzzle, he put the spoon in. His face, subsequently, lit up as he withdrew the empty spoon. "Oh wow...this stuff's great!" Wagging his tail, he dug his spoon back in.

Kiba, even as he eagerly dug his spoon in to take a taste, raised an eyebrow. "Wait a minute; how can you eat chocolate? You're a wolf, aren't you?" Akamaru, who had eschewed chocolate syrup for that very purpose, barked his agreement. He put his own spoon in his mouth, a huge grin subsequentlhy spreading acrosshis features.

Hunter chuckled again, taking another spoonful. "True, but my body functions closely enough to that of a human to let me eat chocolate without any ill effects."

Akamaru growled a bit. Lucky... Shaking his head, he trotted closer to his dish and prepared to take a bite.

Naruto, giggling a bit at the exchange (even if he couldn't understand Akamaru), prepared to take a bite...

...but stopped with his spoon halfway to his sundae.

Hunter, noticing Naruto's hesitation, looked toward the boy. "Um, Naruto? You feelin' OK?" the wolf tentatively asked, somewhat worried that the poor boy was experiencing another resurgence of painful memories.

To his and Kiba's relief, Naruto looked up at him and beamed. "Yeah, I'm doing fine," the boy assured. "I was just thinkin'..."

Kiba scoffed good-naturedly, even as he dug his spoon back in. "You, thinking? That's a new one..."

Naruto scowled at the other boy. "Shaddup and listen," he retorted, though his smirk betrayed his true mood. "So I was thinkin', instead of just eating these normally, I was thinking maybe..."

"Eating contest?" Kiba cut in, his eyes lighting up.

Giggling, Naruto nodded. "Eating contest."

Akamaru, pulling his head out of his dish, whined. Oh great, not this again.. Absentmindedly, he licked his muzzle, getting some of the strawberry ice cream off. Oh wow, it's so sweet and creamy...

Hunter nodded, grinning. "That's actually a good idea; I mean, I dunno about you..." He gave the boys a mischievous smile. "...but I feel like I can eat WAY more than twelve scoops of ice cream. The sooner we finish these monsters, the sooner we can get more ice cream!" He rubbed his stomach, grinning. "I saw a brownie sundae on the menu that I looked good...buuuuut I won't get that 'till I've finished this." He looked back down at Naruto. "So, what're the terms of the contest?"

Naruto smirked. "Weeeeelll, I was thinking maybe we try to eat these monsters as fast as we can, and whoever finishes first gets to choose what we get next." His smirk became mischievous. "And whoever comes in last has to pay for these..."

What if I come in last? Akamaru piped up, interested in spite of himself. I mean, I don't have any money...

Laughing, Kiba repeated Akamaru's question to Naruto, who looked rather befuddled. "Um... I hadn't thought of that..."

"How about this," Hunter piped up, tail wagging. "If Akamaru comes in last, he has to smell Naruto's feet." Naruto's eyes bulged at that, but Kiba and Akamaru looked far from displeased. "Heh, wouldja lookit that, boy?" Kiba said, ruffling the dog's head playfully. "Heck of a motivation, don't ya think?"

Akamaru barked happily, licking Kiba's hand. Tell me about it. The rest of him smells bad enough...

Hunter snorted at that, a paw flying to his muzzle. Naruto, already a little offended, looked up at him irritably. "What? What the hell's so funny?"

"N-nothing," Hunter assured, stifling his snickers as best he could. "A-anyway, why don't we get started?" Naruto, though he still wasn't convinced, nonetheless turned back to his own sundae. Grinning competitively, Kiba and Akamaru did the same. "Alright, boys, get ready," Hunter spoke up, priming his spoon. "And three, two one...GO!"

With that, the anthro-wolf, the pup, and the two boys dove into their sundaes, shoveling as much in at a time as they could and doing their best, with varying degrees of success, to avoid brain freeze.

As Naruto shoveled his vanilla sundae into his waiting maw, something stirred at the edges of his subconscious:

Nnngh...hello?

Naruto's eyes flew wide open at the voice. There it is again! Naruto thought, shocked. Taking a look at the other three, he saw them continuing to shovel ice cream into their mouths/muzzles; they gave no indication they'd heard the voice. Shaking his head, Naruto continued shoveling ice cream into his mouth, but his brows were set in concentration.

He KNEW he'd heard something, and that it wasn't just his imagination. But what...

Can...can anyone hear me?

Naruto, even as he continued shoveling ice cream in, narrowed his eyes. That...that sounds like a little kid, he realized. Sounds about as old as me n' Kiba are right now, maybe even a little younger. But who...

W-wait...why am I in a cage?! The childlike voice suddenly spoke up again, its pitch rising in shock. Grunts of effort sounded in Naruto's head. Nngh...why won't these bars budge?!

Naruto's eyes widened slightly. Bars...? he wondered idly, recognition niggling at the edges of his mind.

Come...come on! the voice grunted, now sounding a bit panicked. Please! I-I don't wanna be stuck in here! It's dark and wet and...and scary!

Naruto's eyes widened a bit more, recognition slowly beginning to dawn on him. Dark and...wet?

L-lemme out! the voice cried out again, panic now very much evident in its tone. Wh-why am I in prison?! I didn't do anything wrong! Old Man?! Gyuki?! Pl-please! S-somebody h-help...

At this, comprehension flooded Naruto's mind, much as his awful memories had earlier that day. N-no way! His body went slack, and his spoon fell from his hand and clattered to the floor. Hearing this, Hunter and Akamaru's keen ears twitched, even as they dug into their sundaes. Sitting up and swallowing their current mouthfuls, they directed concerned stares in Naruto's direction. Kiba, noticing this, looked up from his own sundae, his mouth spattered with melted ice cream. Frowning, he wiped his face on his hoodie sleeve and asked, "Uh, Naruto? You OK?" Hunter said nothing, but placed a soothing paw on Naruto's back, just in case.

Naruto struggled to process the sudden revelation, and thus remained silent for a few more seconds. Then, finally, he closed his eyes, took a deep breath, and replied, "N-no, it's not." He appeared rather shaken.

"You flashin' back again, kiddo?" Hunter asked gently. Maybe bringing him out wasn't such a good idea...

But Naruto shook his head. "N-no, it's not that. It's just, um..." His face screwed up as he tried to think of how to phrase what he was about to say. Hunter, Kiba, and Akamaru watched him with bated breath, before Naruto finally opened his eyes and said:

"I...I don't think I was the only one affected when I drank that vial."
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Naruto suggests they try and make it competitiv...

choices: Resume eating and let Kurama calm down before attempting anything
Try and talk to Kurama
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
The trio; Kiba and Akamaru especially, just stared dead-eyed at the young blonde, as he rubbed the back of his head, still trying to process what was going on. "Y-you don't mean..." Kiba started, but stopped as Naruto immediately nodded back. "Yep."

Please! I...I don't want to be here...!

Again, Naruto's eyes widened as the sound of said 'child's' voice continued to call out to anyone who would listen, anyone who could hear it. Hunter caught this, wincing a bit nervously, expecting the worst, as he leaned closer to the boy and asked, "Should we go?" But the boy immediately shook his head, but only half paying attention to the anthro. His eyes were still a bit distant as he listened to the sealed creature continue to wail out, hearing most rustling at some kind of cage. "This is...huh..." Naruto muttered, not remotely sure what he should be doing.

Akamaru turned to Kiba and barked curiously. Well, what's he saying?

Naruto raised an eyebrow at the pup, but Kiba translated the question and relayed it back to the boy, who scratched his head, a bit surprised to hear himself say what he was about to say, nevertheless, "...He's...scared. I don't think he knows where he is or why he's sealed inside of me..."

Both the young dog-nin and his pup shared a glance, and turned back to Hunter. I don't understand. We all drank the vial, and we still had all our memories intact.

Kiba nodded in agreement and added, "Y-yeah, why wouldn't you-know-who remember why he was sealed away?"

Hunter, legitimately bewildered himself, raised his shoulders and shook his head, unable to think of an answer. "I've only ever given this vial to people and creatures in this physical plain of existence, never...well, THAT internal..." He then looked away and grimaced. Well...except maybe that one time I tricked Ghirahim into drinking it so he wouldn't be tall enough to magically appear behind me and flick his tongue all weird the way he does...but he just reverted back into a floating sword...and he still teleported behind me...and STILL managed to flick his sword-tongue out all weird...

Unbeknownst to the wolf, both Kiba and Akamaru were still just staring dully at him, tilting their heads curiously as his mind continued to go off on a tangent. Finally, he shook it off and turned back to them. "Sorry, w-what were we-RIGHT...right...you-know-who reverting, right...yeah, I really have nothing. What's he-"

Hunter's eyes widened a bit as he saw a bit of a saddened look on Naruto's face. Both the other boy and pup turned and saw it as well. "Hey, what's wrong?" asked Kiba. Naruto shook his head a bit assuredly, then piped in. "I...really can't believe I'm about to say this, but...I actually kinda...feel bad for him..."

All three, in perfect unison, gaped at the boy in silence.

"Are you KIDDING me?!" blurted out Kiba. "After what he put you through?!"

Naruto turned to his friend, face kind of screwing upward like before as he said, "Yeah, I know, but..."

Internally, he began to hear that childlike voice sob softly to itself, weakly batting at the cage.

"...If he really doesn't know what's going on, then...at least for the time being, he's being isolated and punished for something, and he doesn't even know why," replied Naruto as he looked down, a bit more distantly and added, "...I know the feeling."

"Yeah, and HE'S the reason you know that feeling!" snapped Kiba, a bit angrily. Hunter raised his paw, trying to cool things down a bit, concerned that it would blow up again like before. But to his surprise, Naruto didn't reply in anger, rather, he nodded softly, simply saying, "I know. But he doesn't. At least...not like this, he doesn't."

He had to admit, it was a very surreal feeling. Living with the Kyuubi sealed away inside of his body had made his childhood a proverbial hell on earth. There was a tremendous amount of resentment held against Kurama for that, but the two had gradually grown to 'tolerate' one another as time went on. But right now, there was just a scared young Kyuubi sealed away, alone, and completely isolated from his companions and the sage he greatly admired and respected, and frankly...it was kind of heartbreaking for the boy. As if a bit crude, his tummy rumbled a bit, as if to remind him, 'Sundaes first, sealed Kyuubi's later,' but obviously, Naruto being Naruto, he stilled those thoughts, and continued to ponder on how to properly 'deal' with this situation.

Finally, he took a deep breath, and decided to...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Hunter, Kiba, and Akamaru realize what this means

choices: ...and the four end up in Naruto's subconscious
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
"Hunter?" Naruto asked, opening his eyes and looking straight at the wolf. "You, uh, think we could go somewhere private?"

Hunter raised an eyebrow. "Uh, sure, but why?"

Naruto took a breath, not quite able to believe what he was about to say. "I'm...I'm gonna try to talk to the fox."

Kiba's eyes flew wide open at this. "Are you NUTS, Uzumaki?!" the boy exclaimed, slamming his palms on the table and hoisting himself up a bit out of his seat. "What if the bastard's just trying to trick you? He's lived with you literally your entire damn life, and he would know EXACTLY what you would do in a situation like this!" Hunter recoiled a bit at the outburst, but managed to calm himself. After all, he was only worried for his friend...

Naruto thought for a moment. That was definitely a possibility; the fox had made no secret of his desire to break free and wreak havoc in the past...

O-old Man? G-Gyuki? Matatabi? Anybody? Please, I don't like it in here! The boy heard more rustling against the cage. Please! I'm scared...

The boy's expression softened as he heard the 'child's' tearful entreaties. "I...I don't think he is," Naruto finally spoke up, looking directly at Kiba. "He...he really sounds like he doesn't know what's going on." Naruto looked downwards. "I...I guess I can kinda relate."

Kiba scowled, evidently still not happy with Naruto's decision, but he nonetheless lowered himself back into his seat, folding his arms. "Well, yeah, but we still don't know what the hell's going on; talking to him, even when he's like this, could be really dangerous."

Yeah, and it's not like you'll be able to become Hokage if you end up as fox kibble, Akamaru protested. Wisely, neither Kiba nor Hunter elected to translate.

"L-look, Naruto," Hunter finally spoke up. "It's really nice what you wanna try to do, but I kinda gotta go with Kiba on this one; we don't know what you're getting yourself into..."

Hic...someone...please...

Naruto's eyes hardened. "Sorry, guys, but I can't let him go through this, at least without knowing what's going on." He clenched his fists noticeably, and gave Hunter, Kiba, and Akjamaru his most determined glare. Kiba returned it, but Hunter simply closed his eyes, pinched the bridge of his muzzle, and sighed deeply. A few seconds passed like this, with neither boy willing to give an inch. Then...

"Boys, come on," Hunter spoke up, opening his eyes and pushing his seat out. "We're going back to the inn." Kiba gaped at him in shock.

"Wait...you're actually going ALONG with this?!" the young dog-nin protested, even as Hunter rose to his paws. "Are you crazy?!"

Hunter shrugged, unable to help the side of his muzzle quirking up ever so slightly. "I've been told that, yes, but it's evident Naruto's not gonna budge on this." He gave an understanding look to the blonde boy as he hopped down out of his chair. "Besides, I think I have an idea as to how we can minimize any risk to Naruto."

Kiba glared at the anthro for a few seconds before, finally, huffing and looking away. "Fine, but I still don't like it." Grumbling, he scooped Akamaru up, placed him in his hood (still on his shoulder), and hopped down.

Nodding, Hunter put the payment for the four sundaes on the table (after all, even if they'd barely touched them, they'd still bought them), and motioned for the boys to follow. Together, they left the parlor, their ice cream sundaes lying forgotten on the table.

---

"Alright, everyone set?"

Some time returning to the inn, Kiba, Akamaru, and Hunter sat in a circle around Naruto. The two canines and boy had small, metallic nodes attached to their heads, each of which had a small cord on it that attached to a small node on Naruto's forehead. The blonde was sitting with his legs folded under him, his eyes closed in deep concentration.

"Y-yeah," Naruto replied, not opening his eyes. He frowned. "You guys don't have to do this, you know..."

Kiba scoffed. "What, you think we're just gonna let you go in there alone?"

Akamaru barked, licking Naruto's hand. Either you're going in there with us, or you're not going at all.

Wagging his tail at Akamaru's comment, Hunter nodded, tugging his cord lightly to test its strength. "Yep, and besides, if things go south, one of us can disconnect and bring the rest with us." He gave Naruto an encouraging smile. "It should be safe." At least, it had BETTER be safe...Rocket, if you gave me a piece of junk just to screw with me, I swear I'll...

He took a breath and composed himself; now wasn't the time. "Alright, kiddo," Hunter said to Naruto. "Just do what you usually do whenever you go to talk to the Kyuubi, and this little gizmo," he tugged on it again for emphasis, "will drag us along for the ride." He looked around. "Everybody ready?" Kiba and Akamaru nodded, both looking rather determined. Smiling a bit, Hunter looked back toward Naruto. "Go for it, kiddo."

In spite of himself, a bit of sweat dripped down Naruto's forehead. "Al-alright..." Taking a deep breath, he relaxed his hands, and concentrated...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Try and talk to Kurama

choices: He introduces himself and the others
He tries to explain the situation
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
...and his eyes flew open as he heard a light splash, feeling a wetness around him. Looking around, he noted that he was within his 'mindscape', the Kyuubi's prison. "G-guys?" Naruto spoke up, shuddering a bit at the way his voice echoed. "You here?"

"Yeah, we're here," Kiba's voice spoke up. Turning his head in the direction of the voice, Naruto saw the little dog-nin resting on his hands, Akamaru still in his hood. Naruto sighed in relief, smiling... until something occurred to him. "Wait, where's Hunter?"

"Here!" Hunter's voice gasped. A bit alarmed, Naruto and Kiba looked toward the sound of his voice...and, in spite of the situation, giggled as they saw the wolf on his front, hoisitng himself up on his front paws as his fur, noticeably drenched, dripped. "You...heh...OK?" Kiba snorted, holding his hand over his mouth.

Groaning, Hunter shook himself, sending water spraying everywhere. "Yeah, I'm fine," he grunted. Climbing to his hind paws, he looked around. "So...this is where he's kept..."

"It's kinda dark," Kiba admitted, getting up. He sniffed. "It smells weird in here..."

Naruto rolled his eyes a bit, getting to his own feet. "Well, sorry it doesn't smell like roses..."

At this, they fell silent for a few seconds as they looked around, taking stock of their surroundings. They appeared to be in a long, dingy-looking hallway of some sort. Toward the end of it, which wasn't all that far away, were a set of red bars. From within, they could glimpse something shifting a bit, and they could have even sworn they'd heard sniffling and the occasional muffled sob.

"That him?" Hunter asked, getting a little nervous. Naruto merely nodded. "Thought so..."

A bead of sweat dripping down his face, Kiba nonetheless smirked and put a hand on Naruto's shoulder. "Well, considering you're so damned determined to do this..." he grinned. "...you ready?"

Naruto took a deep breath to calm himself. "Y-yeah, I guess..." he looked at his companions. "You guys?" Akamaru barked, and Hunter smiled and gave a paws-up. "Alrighty, then..."

Together, they slowly made their way up to the bars, the sniffles and sobs becoming ever louder. As they got closer, they could see that whatever was behind them was rather orange and furry.

Closer they drew to the bars, and louder the cries became, until, finally, they were standing directly in front of them...and they could see what lay behind them. Kiba, Hunter, and Akamaru simply stared at the sight, unsure of what to think. Naruto, however, gaped, struck by the change that had come over his 'passenger'.

When he had faced the Kyuubi before, the fox had been positively massive, easily standing as tall as a building. His pose had always been self-assured and confident, almost arrogantly so, and his slitted eyes had glinted with hatred, malice, and a promise to hurt everything that Naruto had ever cared about.

The being he saw in front of him was none of that.

Instead, what he saw before him was a rather large fox kit, his proportions softer, and younger than Naruto had ever seen him. easily towering over an adult human, but was still nowhere near as huge as he had been as an adult. His tails, which had always flowed and swished about, were noticeably shorter, fanning out in back of him, and his arms, which had been thin but well-muscled, were now noticeably thicker and shorter. These arms supported the young Kyuubi as he sat perpendicular to the bars, his eyes shut as tears dripped from them, his sniffles and sobs now audible for all to hear. "*Hic*...someone, please..." he pleaded. The other three's eyes widened; he sounded no older than Naruto or Kiba at the moment, maybe even a few years younger.

Kiba and Akamaru shared a glance, unsure of what to make of the display; if he was faking, he was doing a damn good job of it.

Naruto, for his part, managed to remind himself why they were there. HE clenched his fists, took a deep breath, and said...

"Um...hello?"

Like lightning, the fox kit's eyes shot wide open, and they locked right on the boy. All four recoiled a bit, until they realized it was not hatred with which he was looking at them, but shock...and fear.

"AAH!" The young creature cried, falling onto his rump and scooting back. "Wh-who are you?"

Before Naruto could reply, Kiba blurted, "Why don't you tell us who you are first?" Hunter and Akamaru gave him a shocked look, but said nothing else.

The child's still-puffy eyes widened. "M-me?" Gulping, he looked around his cage fearfully before focusing back on Kiba. "K-Kurama...my-my name's Kurama."

Kurama...? All four wondered.

He sniffed again. "Wh-who are you?" He looked at his bars, chewing his lip a bit. "A-and why am I in here?"

Naruto, gulping, debated what to do. Then...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: ...and the four end up in Naruto's subconsc...

choices: Head back to the Ice Cream place and pick up where they left off
Regroup for a moment before doing anything else
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Naruto took a deep breath and exhaled, trying to process what to do next. Akamaru whined a bit to himself. Both Kiba and Hunter shared a nervous glance, uncertain how things were going to play out. Finally, he replied, "H-hi, Kurama. My name is..." He stopped for a moment, looking down as his fists started shaking a bit...

...My name is Naruto Uzumaki...the boy's whose entire childhood you ruined, because you're a hateful, manipulating, good for nothing BASTARD...!

Head still lowered, his gaze grew more fierce as he felt earlier memories begin to resurface, filling him with more uncompromising rage. In his current state, part of Naruto wanted nothing more than to scream at Kurama, to curse his very existence as loudly as he possibly could. But as he finally looked up once more, he saw the tear soaked eyes of the young Kyuubi...visibly trembling with fear. Then, his gaze softened, and he remembered why he was here with the others in the first place. Because this frightened creature; at least in this very moment, hadn't become the said hate-filled monster sealed away within the boys' body and causing every living creature around him to fear and detest him. This was just a 'little' fox kit. Alone, confused, and terrified.

Naruto wasn't about to lash out at this creature for something that wasn't his fault. Blinking away a few tears that had welled up from the heat of the moment, the boy forced a smile, and said, "...I'm Naruto. Nice to meet you..." he then turned to the others and added, "This here is my good pal Kiba. The little fella on his head is Akamaru, and the wolf person here is Hunter."

Both Hunter and Kiba worked smiles, still noticeably nervous and waved ever so slightly at the Kyuubi. "P-pleased to meet'cha..." said Hunter. Seeing the creature still shivering a bit with fear, Naruto held his hands out assuredly and said, "Don't worry, we aren't going to hurt you, Kurama. You have nothing to be afraid of."

Young Kurama whimpered to himself and nervously asked in between sobs, "D-do you know w-w-why I'm here...?"

The boys' strained smile faded as a look of some notable sadness grew over his face. Naruto's entire reason for coming here was to help young Kurama understand what was going on, but then, another thought occurred. He was going to be like this for a majority of the day, and however long Naruto would be regressed, so would Kurama. For that entire time, the frightened young kit would have to carry the weight of knowing what his older self had done, and what he would grow up into. In all likelihood, Kurama would remember everything once the formula wore off, but until that moment came, he'd still be 'innocent'.

Finally, Naruto glanced back at the creature and said, "Can you tell me what the last thing you remember was?" The young kit shifted nervously as he looked around his cage apprehensively, still sobbing slightly. "I...I was with the others, and the old man. He...he told us he was..." again, the young Kyuubi's eyes welled with more tears as he shut his eyes, causing the tears to trickle down his furry face, and added, "...was going to be...l-leaving us soon...but that we'd all be together, even if we were far apart...and that we'd all guided down the...the right path...but the rest...n-no, I can't remember..."

His sobbing grew louder as more tears trickled down his orange furred cheeks.

"...I miss him...I miss all of them...I...I want to go home..."

Akamaru whined with sympathy for the creature. Even Hunter and Kiba couldn't help but feel sympathy for the poor creature, neither one believing he was playing a game this time. Naruto sighed to himself, knowing that wasn't going to happen. But just then, anotehr thought entered the conflicted young boys' mind...

"...The...'old man' told you that you'd be sealed within another being and guided down the right path?" he asked. The kit; eyes still clamped shut, simply nodded, still crying to himself. Then, a smile rose over Naruto's face, as he added, "Well...t-that's why you're here, Kurama."

The young Kyuubi's eyes slowly opened as they focused back on Naruto, hesitantly as he nervously asked, "...W-what?"

"You're sealed within my body, because...because I'm going to help you set on the right path."

The trio behind Naruto simply glanced at the boy, unsure what to make of what he was telling the kit, but none dared to so much as utter a word. And so, Naruto continued...

"...I'm gonna help you...grow stronger, wiser, and then...someday....we're gonna accomplish really great things together."

"W-we are...?" asked Kurama, weakly. Naruto just nodded confidently.

Then, after a moment, the creature still whimpered sadly as he said, "...B-but...I...I'm all alone over here..." At this, Naruto simply shook his head and replied, "No, you're not. You've got me. This is within my body. If ever you're feeling lonely, just...lemme know and I'll drop by and keep you company." Kurama's face softened slightly as he leaned down towards the front of his massive, red cage, and laid his head down just in reach of Naruto to meet the boys' level, and, almost hopefully, he asked, "....Y-you promise...?"

A moment passed, then, to the shock and concern of the others, Naruto stepped closer and closer to the cage, and; despite his bettr judgement, reached past the cage and placed his hand gently against the still large face of the young kit, both of whom flinched at the action initially, but once his palm made contact with the furry kit, Naruto simply smiled warmly at him. "I promise."

Hunter inched further and further back, just half a second away from yanking the cords and pulling everyone out, in fear that the young fox was about to make 'fox kibble' as Akamaru put it, out of Naruto. But that never happened. To his, Kiba, and Akamaru's surprise, the young Kyuubi...smiled back.

The boy just smiled back and playfully pat the kits' face before stepping back. "Feeling any better?" asked the boy. The kit rose up just slightly, and nodded back at the boy. "Good. Now, my friends and I have to go, but don't worry, I'll visit you again, sometime. You have my word." With that, the boy stepped away and headed back towards the two canines and the young dog-nin, as they walked onward, until out of sight from the young kit, who sat back down and finally, gratefully said, "...Thank you...Naruto..."

Once clear from Kurama's cage and his radius altogether, Kiba finally turned to his friend and asked, "I thought you were gonna tell him what was going on....why he was REALLY sealed away like that." Naruto raised his shoulder, and then replied, "I was...but, I couldn't do that to him. That Kyuubi hasn't become the one that screwed up my life. I didn't want him to hurt and feel bad for something he hadn't even done yet. Then, I'd be no better than those villagers who did the same thing to me as a kid...and that wouldn't be fair to him..."

At this, Hunter smiled warmly at the young boy and knelt down, patting Naruto's shoulder. "You know something? You're a really good kid, Naruto," the anthro said, causing the boy to smile back, laughing a bit as Kiba pat him on the other shoulder. "He's right, pal. That was actually, really swell of ya!" The pup yipped in agreement, kicking the boys' hand before hopping back up atop Kiba's hood.

"Ya think Kurama will remember any of this when he reverts back to his usual self?" asked Kiba. But Naruto just shrugged once more. "Maybe he will, maybe he won't. Doesn't matter. Long as this Kurama isn't hurting or scared the way he was, that's all that matters to me."

Finally, after some doing, Hunter managed to yank the cord and in unison, all four were sucked out of this strange realm, and back to reality, all a bit dazed and weary...

*RUUUUUUUUUUMMMMBLLLEEEE!*

...And with a loud rumbling from all four of their tummies in one audible moment, QUITE famished. So, they decide to...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: He introduces himself and the others

choices: Hunter is suddenly struck with inspiration
Naruto and Kiba suddenly get an idea
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Hunter winced, clutching his belly. "Oh man, I'm starving...guess that little trip took more out of us than I thought..."

Kiba rubbed his own tummy, even as another growl came forth from it. "Y-yeah, not to mention we only ate a little bit of our sundaes..." He looked up at Hunter. "Ya wanna head back to the ice cream place and get some more?"

Akamaru barked happily from within Kiba's hood. Ooh, that sounds good; that ice cream was really tasty...

Naruto looked down at his own stomach. "Y-yeah..." Slowly, he reached a hand up to his midsection and clenched it. This was not lost on Kiba, who realized that Naruto's hand-clench had very little to do with his own hunger pains. He opened his mouth to say something, but Hunter interrupted before he could.

"Normally, I'd be all for it, but like I said, that trip took a lot outta us." The wolf blinked slowly, looking somewhat dazed. "Maybe we should stay here and gather our wits first."

"Oh, c'mon!" Kiba protested. "I'm starving! Besides, we're not THAT outta sorts!" The boy hopped to his feet to demonstrate, but he quickly lost his footing. "Wh-wha---" waving his arms in a circle he tried to keep his balance, but succeeded only in falling flat on his rump. He winced and rubbed the seat of his pants as Akamaru ran up to him, making sure that he was alright. "O-OK, MAYBE I'm still a little dizzy, but..."

"A-actually, I think that might be a good idea," Naruto spoke up, sounding oddly relieved. "We-we don't wanna get ourselves in trouble..."

In spite of himself, Hunter chuckled. "Yeah, we might end up in an even worse situation than that thing with the booth!" Immediately, all four shuddered at the incredibly embarrassing memory, but quickly shook it off. "Besides, I have a few snacks we can munch on to help take the edge off, 'least till we're ready to go again." As if to punctuate this, his stomach rumbled again, this time rather audibly. "Heh...guess that's my cue." Carefully getting to his paws and wobbling a bit, he nonetheless made his way back over to his duffel, where he began rooting around.

As the wolf searched through his bag, Kiba looked toward Naruto. "What're you so happy about? Even with snacks, we'll probably still be hungry until we can walk around again..."

Naruto winced as his own tummy audibly reminded him that it needed food, but he nonetheless managed to look back at Kiba. "What're you talking about?"

Kiba rolled his eyes. "I'm TALKING about the fact that you actually looked happy when Hunter said we couldn't go out just yet! Why are you..." the boy slowed to a stop as Naruto's hand again clenched his stomach, and he inwardly kicked himself for failing to see it. "It's about Kurama, ain't it?" At Naruto's slow nod, Kiba gave his friend his best reassuring smirk. "What're ya so worried about? Ya talked to him, cheered him up a little...why are ya still lookin' so down?"

Naruto shrugged. "I-I dunno. I guess..." he sighed deeply. "...I guess I just feel bad for him, locked away in that cage, all wet and dark..."

Hunter's ears twitched as he rooted through his bag, and he felt a pang of sympathy for the young Kyuubi, even as he resorted to using his nose to dig something up.

Kiba frowned. "Yeah, well...it's not like we can do much for him there..."

Naruto frowned in return, but he knew exactly what Kiba meant; if he undid the seal and let Kurama out, things would probably be fine at first, but once he reverted back to his proper age....the blonde shuddered, not wanting to think about it. "Y-yeah, and it's not like we can just pull him out either, 'cause, you know..." Kiba, grimacing, nodded. He'd never seen it personally, but he'd heard about what happened to Jinchuriki who'd had their Tailed Beasts removed...

Akamaru whined, looking up at Kiba. Yyyeah, I think we wanna avoid that...

Hunter, even as he withdrew a few bags of chips from his bag, shook his head. It really was a sucky situation; a (currently) young, innocent creature, locked in surroundings that were, frankly, dank and depressing...it was a raw deal for anybody. Damn it, if only I had something in my bag that could help...

Now, his bag contained a great number of things: clothes and common amenities, certainly, but also items of great power, sentient relics that should have never seen the light of day, technologies from far-off galaxies that could work all manner of wonders, up to and including ripping the fabric of space-time...but nothing that could let Kurama roam free, nor anything that could extract him without Naruto giving up his life in the process.

But it's not fair! Hunter thought angrily, zipping up his bag. The kid's lonely, he's away from those he cares about...he should at least have the chance to play like any kid has a right to! His face clouded a bit, he nonetheless got up and made his way over to the two boys. Sitting down, he almost shoved two bags toward the boys. Taken a bit off-guard by Hunter's unusually stormy expression, they nonetheless accepted the proffered snacks. In a matter of moments, their bags of chips were open, and they were dipping their hands (and paws) in, munching on the salty snacks, with Kiba giving Akamaru a few. All the while, though, they thought of Kurama's unfortunate situation, and wondered what, if anything they could do to help.

As they neared the end of their bags...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Regroup for a moment before doing anything else

choices: "It's worth a shot."
"...Maybe it's too risky..."
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
The boys and canines continued munching on their salty snacks, minds more than occupied by the poor fox kit sealed away in the blonde. More and more, their bags depleted, and while not enough to sate their hunger even remotely, it at least served to silence their groaning tummies, if at least temporarily.

"Mmm, boy did I need that," Kiba exclaimed, patting his tummy happily. Naruto wiped his mouth of some crumbs and nodded back, still fairly perplexed. Akamaru looked up at the boy and whined. I've never seen Naruto this deep in thought...in fact, I'm still getting used to the idea that he's capable of thinking at all... Kiba couldn't help but chuckle somewhat half heartedly, still admittedly feeling some sympathy for the Kyuubi as well.

Hunter had finished his chips in no time at all, and was now licking his chops clean almost forcefully, as though it did absolutely nothing for him, except maybe silence his rumbling stomach for the time being. Propping himself on the floor, he folded his hind paws together, tapping on his temple with his hand-paws, also in deep thought. Both Kiba and Akamaru caught this, then turned to see a similar position and expression from Naruto.

There has to be SOMETHING... the wolf thought to himself. Again, he rummaged through his bag, trying to think of something that would work. He had plenty of strange gadgets and relics to be sure, but not a single one of them was enough to do the trick. But then...

"Waaaaaait a second..." Hunter muttered to himself, face lighting up as he dug a little deeper and a bit more frantically, earning the attention of the two boys and tiny pup. Some more rummaging continued, then, to everyone's surprise, he pulled out a bizarre looking stone owl with its' wings closed. Thank. You. Mid-NA! he mused internally. Then, a smile quickly formed over his muzzle as he dug around some more. The boys were still gaping at the odd looking statue. "Ummm, Hunter...w-what is that thing?"

Still digging around, Hunter only half paid attention as he muttered, "A possible answer," and continued rummaging about. "Aha!" he yipped happily as he reached in and pulled out another statue, identical to the last one and placed it next to the other.

"Now, all I need is...."

Hunter dug and dug, while the others watched. Akamaru tilted his head curiously at the sight. Jeez, there is a LOT more stuff inside that bag than I realized...

Finally, Hunter stopped rummaging, and; laughing victoriously, quickly pulled himself out, carrying something delicately up in the air with both front paws. If the others didn't know better, they could have SWORN they heard an odd 'discovery' melody playing as Hunter held it up.

"What's that?" asked Kiba, scratching his head curiously. Slowly bringing his paws down, Hunter revealed an unusual blue instrument. It looked like a rounded flute, with a few distinct holes on the front. "This; boys, is the 'Ocarina of Time', and those statues, are Kaepora Gaebora statues."

The trio just stared dully, not sure what any of that meant. Hunter chuckled a bit to himself and said, "Lemme explain. This here," he held up the Ocarina for emphasis, "is a musical instrument that unleashes magic with every unique melody you play into it. But there's one song in particular that's proven fairly useful in tight jams. The 'Song of Soaring'. Basically, you play it, and you will magically teleport wherever these statues reside, so long as you've activated them."

"How do you do that?" asked Naruto, still wrapping his already bewildered mind around the idea. Hunter just grinned and placed one statue at the center of the inn. Then, Hunter reached into his bag once again and grabbed a bizarre looking stick. "May not be the Sword of Time, buuuuut..." and with all his might, he whacked the statue on the head as hard as he could, startling the other three youths. In an instant, it began to glow, and in a flash of white light, that same statues closed wings opened nice and wide. "And there you have it. Now, if I play the song, me and everyone within proximity of the Ocarina will be teleported right back to this spot."

Naruto's eyes lit up as he quickly began to piece it all together. But then, another thought entered his mind. "Well, wait, wouldn't that just be a one way trip?" Hunter grinned and pointed towards the second unactivated statue. "Only if it's the only one activated."

Hunter then turned to the boys a bit more focused. "Here's what I'm thinking. We all feel bad for the kit and wanna do something for him, right?" The others nodded a bit somberly, then Kiba added, "But we also know if we break the seal, and he eventually reverts back to his normal form...that we're...in trouble." Hunter nodded, fully aware, then added, "Well, what if we didn't break the seal?"

The others glanced curiously at him as he turned his attention back to the statues and the Ocarina. "If we found a way to get this statue inside Kurama's cage, and activated it there, we could play the song, and all teleport in between his cage and the statue at the inn. That way, we slip between subconscious to the physical, and the seal remains perfectly intact!"

"Y-you really think that'll work?" asked Naruto, a bit hopefully. Hunter shrugged, and said, "I really don't know, but...that's as close to a shred of an idea as I can really come up with." Internally, Hunter almost shuddered in annoyance, half expecting Rocket to demand to know how much of a percent of an idea a shred was, but quickly shook it off.

"Whadduya guys say? Should we give it a shot?"

Naruto then looked back at the others, no one looked entirely convinced, but no one looked completely against the idea either. "It's up to you, Uzumaki. If you think it's worth a shot, then so do I," said Kiba, nudging the boy encouragingly. Akamaru barked happily, tail wagging; obviously in agreement to his companion.

But Naruto on the other hand, was still in mid-turmoil. He wanted very much to help this current Kurama out, because even after that talk, he knew it was going to be rough, all alone for however long he and Naruto were going to be young. At the same time, however, having Kurama in the physical world...that was a tall order. Deep down, he knew the kit wasn't that same monster he knew (yet), but to have such a powerful creature back in the physical world like that...was tricky, to say the least.

Finally, Naruto nodded to himself, then turned back to Hunter...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Hunter is suddenly struck with inspiration

choices: They get back, and find Kurama's a little too big for the room...
They get back, but one of them's 'downsized'...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
"I know it's gonna be tough," Naruto began, clenching his fists, "but I ain't leaving Kurama in there by himself. I know what it's like to be all alone, and I'm not gonna leave him to it, too." He glared at Hunter, determination gleaming in his eyes. "I'm doing it." He looked toward Kiba and Akamaru. "You guys with me?"

Kiba smirked. "What, are ya deaf, ya idiot?" He playfully slugged Naruto in the shoulder. "We said we'd be behind you whatever you decided, didn't we?" Akamaru, standing up out of Kiba's hood, barked his agreement. Naruto scowled a bit at the insult, but then he smiled as it registered for the playful jibe it was.

Hunter, smiling a bit, nodded. "Alright, then. In that case..." bending down, he grabbed the other statue and stood up with it. "...we just need to find a way to get this inside Naruto's subsconscious, and we're golden." His muzzle wrinkled in a frown. "Only problem is, I don't know how the hell we're gonna do it..."

Kiba tilted his head, puzzled. "Couldn't ya just use that weird gizmo we used to talk to Kurama?"

Hiunter shrugged. "Wish I could, but it only works for living beings; it won't do a thing for inanimate objects, even if they're magical." A thought occurred to him. "Unless..." Naruto and Kiba, curious, leaned forward, eager to hear what what Hunter had to say. To their annoyance, he looked away. "Yeah, that could work..." he muttered to himself, tail wagging.

"WHAT could work?" Naruto demanded. "C'mon, now's not the time to hold out on us!"

"Hmm?" Glancing toward the boys, Hunter winced and rubbed the back of his head. "Eh, sorry about that, boys; I get a little carried away sometimes. But never mind that!" Walking toward the boys, he bent down, statue still in hand. "Here, hold this for a second, willya?" He held it out to the boys. "I'm gonna get that little gizmo from earlier."

Kiba blinked, even as he reached out to take it. "Sure, but didn't you just say that wouldn't work?"

Hunter winked. "I did, but that was before I thought of my idea." Once he was sure Kiba had a good grip on it, he loosened his paws. "Be careful with that, though; it's sorta fragile." He stood up, releasing his grip completely as he did so.

Kiba smiled. "Heh, suAAAAAAH!" Eyes flying open, he scrambled to get a better grip on the statue as it dragged his arms downwards. As it was, he was barely able to hold the statue a couple inches off the floor. "Th-this thing weighs a freaking ton!" Sweating a bit, he glared at the wolf, even as he rooted through his bag to try and find the device again. "How were you able to lift this damn thing?!"

Hunter shrugged. "'Cause I'm not fun-size right now, that's why." A grin spread across his muzzle as his paws closed over the device; nodding, he pulled it out, walked over to the boys and pup, and once again got them all hooked up to it.

"Alright, now what?" Naruto asked. "You said you had an idea..."

"Wh-whatever it is," Kiba grunted, trying to keep the statue from falling, his little arms straining, "just tell us already! I don't think I can hold onto this for much longer!" Akamaru, whining from within Kiba's hood, licked the boy's cheek, trying to provide some comfort."

Chuckling nervously, Hunter bent down to the boys' level. "Well...it kinda involves you still holding the statue..."

"Are you KIDDING me?!" Kiba barked, scowling and wincing as he tried ever harder to keep the statue aloft.

Hunter held a paw up. "Lemme finish," he cut in patiently. "It involves you, and all three of us, holding onto this statue tight as possible. That way, it might get transported with us, same way our clothes are."

Akamaru tilted his head. But...our bodies are still gonna be in the real world. How is something physical gonna...

Hunter chuckled and ruffled the dog's head. "Sometimes, Akamaru, ya can't sweat the small stuff." Before the dog could protest Hunter reached a paw out and tightly gripped the statue (and causing Kiba to sigh in relief as the weight abated a bit.) Gripping the Ocarina in the other paw, he turned to the other two and said, "Alright; Naruto, Akamaru, your turn."

Still a bit confused,Akamaru hopped out of Kiba's hood and onto the floor, where he proceeded to trot up to the statue and, with some doing, stand on his hind legs long enough for him to rest his front paws on the magical statue. Naruto, a bit puzzled by the odd sight, nonetheless reached both hands out to the statue, wrapping them around it as much as he could. "Everyone got the statue?" Hunter asked. The other three nodded or barked in confirmation. "Great!" He smiled reassuringly at the blonde. "Naruto, if you please..."

Nodding, and not quite able to hide his smile, Naruto closed his eyes and concentrated....

---

Kurama sniffed bit, folding his front legs/arms and lying his head down upon them. It wasn't the most comfortable, but it beat laying in the water...

I knew Naruto said I wasn't alone, but... he sniffed again, a tear running down his cheek. ...I still feel alone in here.

More tears accumulated in his eyes as he thought of the Old Man, and of his companions. He felt an ache in his chest; he missed them all more than words could say. Matatabi, Isobu, Son, Kokuo, Saiken, Choumei, Gyuki...heck, he even missed Shukaku.

}I wonder if Naruto would be willing to talk... the young Tailed Beast wondered. After all, the boy HAD said to let him know if he was ever feeling lonely...

The kit shook his head closing his eyes. N-no; he was just here, and he'd probably get annoyed if I called him back so soon...

"Hiya, Kurama!"

At the youthful voice, Kurama's eyes flew wide open, and joy exploded in his chest as he saw Naruto smiling and waving at him through his cage.

"Naruto!" Kurama exclaimed, muzzle lighting up with a huge smile. In a flash, he got to his paws and ran up to the cage. "You're back!"

Laughing, Naruto rubbed the back of his head. "Hey, I said I'd be back, didn't I?" He reached through the cage and patted Kurama on his face, eliciting a giggle from the young Kyuubi.

"Yeah, dunno why you're so surprised; bonehead always keeps his promises..."

Eyes widening, Kurama looked behind Naruto to see the people who had come with him before. The other boy-Kiba, he thought it was-was smirking at him, hands in his pockets; he must have been the one who had spoken. The puppy in his hood-Akamaru?-barked a greeting.

"Huh?" Kurama asked, sitting up straighter. "Why are you guys here too?"

The weird wolf that wore clothes and walked like a person-Hunter, wasn't it?-grinned, stepping aside to reveal some sort of weird statue that looked like an owl on the ground. "Oh, us?" He directed his grin at the blonde. "Why don't you tell him, Naruto?"

Kurama blinked, tilting his head. Tell me? he thought anxiously. That anxiety promptly vanished when he saw Naruto's face light up, and his mouth stretch out in a grin. If it had been something bad, he probably wouldn't have been smiling like that...

"Weeelll," Naruto began, folding his arms behind his head and rocking on his feet a bit, "they're here to help me get ya outta here."

"They are?!" the kit exclaimed, his own face lighting up; in his excitement, he rushed even further toward the cage, practically pressing his face against it (and startling Naruto enough that he feel clean on his rump.) "I don't hafta be stuck in here anymore?!"

Naruto giggled, getting back to his feet. "Nope!" he replied happily. "See, Hunter here has a couple of Kippura Gabbora..."

"Kaepora Gaebora," Hunter piped up, unable to stifle a snicker.

"...Kaepora Gaebora statues," Naruto continued, throwing an annoyed glance in Hunter's direction, "and, well, the way it works is, if ya got two of 'em activated at separate locations, Hunter can play something on that weird instrument of his," Hunter raised up an odd, flute-like instrument, waving it about, "and it'll transport ya to wherever the other one is!"

Kiba nodded, grinning. "We already have one activated in the real world," the young dog-nin began. "All we gotta do is activate the one here, play that tune, and we should all end up back in the real world!"

If at all possible, young Kurama's happy grin grew even wider. "Really? Just like that?"

Hunter chuckled. "Just like that." Picking the statue up, he carried it forward, setting it down just behind Kurama's cage. Procuring an odd-looking stick seemingly out of nowhere (hey, it was a subconscious mind; the laws of physics didn't exactly apply...), he raised it over his head and brought it down with a resounding WHACK. Just like before, the statue let out a flash of light, spreading its wings as it did so.

The wolf nodded, pleased with his work. "Alrighty, then; everyone gather around Kaepora, and I'll play the Song of Soaring!"

They needed no second bidding: Kiba and Akamaru rushed up to the statue, as did Naruto (who had a rather shorter distance to go). Kurama, likewise, got close to the statue, body practically vibrating with excitement. Laughing, Hunter walked up, lifted the Ocarina to his muzzle, and began to play. It was a simple, short melody, consisting of three notes in ascending order repeated multiple times.
