How could he not appreciate such a vibrant and unique sight? How could anyone not appreciate it for that matter? Nonetheless, he smiled and shrugged at the others. "Sounds like fun to me."

Kiba shrugged, a bit less interested. "Eh, whatever," the dog-nin replied, earning a chuckle and nod from Hunter. "Very well, lemme show you boys around."

The anthro then led the four youths throughout the field, showing them the grassy plains, the Observatory, and Great Bay past the snowy Snowpeak section, all the while, continuing to explain some of Termina's history to the four youths, noting how much more dangerous wandering the fields was back when monsters roamed its' lands, before they all fled with the departure of the frightful moon, and how a lone child by the name of Link, managed to save this entire world from certain doom.

Then, Hunter stopped the boys as he saw a circle of bushes begin to wave about...then jump from their roots. "Whoa, what the heck is goin' on there?" asked Kiba. Hunter turned towards Kurama and said, "See that? That means a Keaton is right there. To summon him, you need to destroy all those bushes in one single burst, and then he'll appear and...quiz you."

The four turned towards Hunter and raised an eyebrow. "Quiz?" they all asked (and barked) in unison. "Yup. See, Keaton's are well regarded, not only for their mythology, but because they're very intellectual creatures...they're also kinda snooty about it sometimes, but only a few. Basically, they want to test your knowledge of Termina and the more colorful characters that reside in it, and if you get it right, they'll give you a Keaton mask...and sometimes, even jewels!"

Upon hearing that, almost immediately, both Naruto and Kiba ran towards the still jumping bushes and tried attacking them to summon the Keaton, but the bushes...dissipated, leaving nothing. Hunter just laughed. "Told ya, it had to be done in one attack...and in most cases, that means you need a sword."

The boys pouted as Kurama giggled. "Did you ever win that mask, Mr. Hunter?" Hunter chuckled then shook his head. "No, came pretty close though!" Then he looked away and grumbled in annoyance to himself. Would'a aced it, but c'mon, how the HELL was I supposed to know what color undies that weirdo Tingle wore over his tights?! the wolf mused internally, then shook it off and said, "Well, the rest of Termina, we can't really explore without better, so you guys ready to see where the REAL fun happens in this place?"

The four youths glanced amongst themselves for a moment...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: They appear in a field

choices: The boys eventually finish playing, and they head to Clock Town
Hunter nods off, and the boys rouse him to go to Clock Town
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Kurama gulped, pulling at the collar of his shirt as he looked at the two boys. "Um...would it be OK if we played first?"

Naruto and Kiba blinked, somewhat taken off guard. "You sure?" Naruto asked, scratching the back of his head. "I mean, Hunter said that Clock Town's where most of the fun is..."

Kurama winced. "S-sorry," he replied. "I-I mean, don't get me wrong, Clock Town sounds fun and all, and I definitely wanna go there. It's just..." He looked around at the lush surroundings-tall grasses that swayed in the gentle breeze, several trees dotted about-and his expression softened, his eyes once again gleaming slightly in wonder. "There's so much <i>space</i>, and its so pretty, and..."

The young Nine-Tails trailed off as he saw Naruto snickering. "Wh-what? What's so funny?" he asked uncertainly, feeling a little hurt.

"Heehee...sorry, Kurama," Naruto apologized, getting his mirth under control. "It's just...you don't have to apologize just for wantin' to play. Besides," he added, reaching out and resting a hand on the kit's shoulder, "I kinda have a lotta pent up energy, so..."

Kurama's eyes widened. "You...you don't mind waiting to go to Clock Town?"

Naruto, grinning, opened his mouth to reply, but Kiba abruptly shouldered in next to him. "Here, I can answer that for ya..." Reaching an arm out, he rapped Kurama lightly on his foreleg.

Kurama winced. "Ow! What was...."

"You're it!" Kiba exclaimed, grinning. Turning around, he rushed off into the grass, Akamaru hopping out of his shirt and running alongside him.

Hunter, having watched the whole scene, smirked. Well, that's one way to answer...

Naruto laughed. "Ha, he got you good, Kurama!" he exclaimed to the kit, who was looking a bit dazed. The young fox said nothing, but simply stared after Kiba's retreating form. "Uh, Kurama? You OK?" Still, Kurama said nothing, causing Hunter to frown in concern a bit. Is something wrong with the kid?

Oblivious to Hunter's musings, Naruto stepped closer to Kurama. "What, do ya not know how to play tag? 'Cause if ya don't, its really simp-"

The boy let out a surprised yelp as nine bushy tails suddenly swung around and knocked him onto his rump. "Ow! What the..." He trailed off as he looked up and saw Kurama grinning down at him mischievously.

"Now you're it!" the little Tailed Beast exclaimed gleefully, rushing on all fours off into the grass after Kiba. Nruto, for his part, simply stared after him, rubbing the seat of his pantts absentmindedly with both hands.

Chuckling, Hunter came up beside Naruto and knelt beside him, bending at the knees. "Well, it looks like Kurama got you good, Naruto..." the wolf joked, nuding the boy playfully in the shoulder.

"Y-yeah, I guess he did..." Naruto groused climbing to his feet and looking out into the grass where his friends had run.

Hunter smiled and tousled Naruto's head. "Aw, c'mon, don't be a sore loser." He looked out into the grass. "Besides, the game's only just begun...and I do believe you're 'it', as it were."

At this, Naruto grinned, tensed his legs...

...and took off into the grass, eventually vanishing into it alongside the others.

Before long, a triumphant cry of "You're it, dog-breath!" rang through the air, followed by a giggling Naruto being chased out of the grass by an equally merry Kiba, Akamaru, and Kurama. Naruto, however, had a pretty good lead on them, prompting him to look back, stick his tongue out...

...and promptly yelp as he tripped, falling flat on his face. Hunter winced, but as he stepped forward to help, Kiba, Kurama, and Akamaru closed the distance and pounced on him, just as Naruto flipped onto his back.

The blonde yelped again, scooting back just as they landed, causing the other three to land with a pained "Oof!" in a tangle of limbs. As they struggled to get up, Naruto, seeing an opportunity, smirked, got to his feet, and jumped upon them. This time, they were unable to get up as Naruto crashed upon them.

Hunter, a bit bemused, watched as the others tumbled about in a ball, shouting, laughing, and swearing as arms, legs, and tails flailed about. As more and more gleeful laughter and giggles emanated from the tangle, the anthro smiled as they tumbled about.

Yep; definitely a good idea to bring them here, the wolf mused, sitting down and watching the four tumble, chase each other, and generally have the time of their lives. Wait'll we get to Clock Town, though; they might never wanna leave!

Shaking his head and smiling, Hunter reached into his pocket, pulled out his MP3, and put the buds in his ears. Hitting the play button, he put it back in his pocket, sat up straight, and smiled as he watched the boys (and dog and fox) roughhouse. Ah well; nothing to do right now but listen to some tunes and enjoy the sights....
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: The boys wanna play in the fields first

choices: All that roughhousing worked up an appetite
Explore the town
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
The anthro continued watching the three youths and pup continue rough housing in the grass and chasing after each other in the fields, laughing (and barking) merrily as they did so. As more time passed on, Hunter began to feel his eyelids getting heavier as the cool breeze greeted his fur. Eventually, the wolf nodded off altogether and collapsed on his back, sprawled on the grass as the boys; oblivious, continued playing about, as the buds from his mp3 player continued to serenade the wolf's ears with tunes.

More time had passed, as the anthro began snoring. That was short lived, however, when he felt three pairs of tiny hands gently rocking against his shoulder, shaking the wolf playfully before his eyes fluttered open, and saw two youthful faces and two fuzzy faces looking down at him and smiling widely, (in Akamaru's case, from atop Kiba's head)

"Mmph, afternoon to you as well, boys," replied Hunter as he pulled his ear buds off, sat up and yawned heartily, rubbing his eyes groggily before putting on his glasses and hopping up to his hind paws with surprising grace. "So, you boys have fun?" Hunter asked, earning enthusiastic nods from all four.

"Sure did!" replied Kurama as Naruto laughed and wrapped his arm around the kits' shoulders pulling him close. "Yup! And man oh man, does this guy know how to give a fella a run for his money! I almost couldn't catch 'em! Almost..." the blonde replied, ruffling the young kyuubi's head playfully, causing the fox to giggle merrily as Kiba chuckled. "Yeah, so he had me flank 'em by surprise, but then we all ended up rolling down the hill in a massive dog-fox pile!"

Akamaru just snickered. I'll have you know that I caught Kurama just fine...I'm just so tiny that I don't think he noticed.

Kurama just giggled. "Course I noticed! You jumped onto my face!" replied Kurama playfully, causing the pup to snicker some more, with the two boys cracking up at the sight of Kurama running around with a tiny pup clamped onto his face. Hunter just chuckled, "Well, glad you kids and kit had a good time. Now you ready for some REAL fun?"

Immediately, all four youthful faces lit up with excitement and anticipation as Hunter smirked and led the kids onward towards the walled off town. Upon arriving, all four were absolutely bewildered as Hunter smirked and said, "Welcome to Clock Town, boys."

It was an absolute rush. The sight was filled with life, people carrying about and kids running after each other and playing in the cobblestones and little ponds near the entrance. There were several buildings and shops stacked right next to each other, but no sight more overwhelming than the massive stone tower looming over the entrance with, what looked like an equally massive and strangely patterned clock ticking right in the heart of the tower.

"So THAT'S why they call this place Clock Town," blurted Naruto, as though in sudden realization. Kiba snorted and said, "Yeah, go figure the town with a freakin' giant clock would name their town after its' most distinguishin' feature." Naruto immediately scowled and barked back with, "H-hey, I've never been here before, dog-breath! For all I know, the entire town could'a been made outta clocks, so shut-" The blonde stopped when he noticed Kurama's smile dissipate with a more nervous and slightly fearful look. "Kurama? Something wrong, buddy?"

The kit rubbed the back of his orange-furred head and said, "There's...a l-lot of people here...w-what if they don't want me here...? They could get really mad...or worse..."

Naruto immediately placed his hand on the kits shoulder and smiled warmly, "Hey, c'mon, remember what Hunter said? People aren't afraid of you here, in fact, they like creatures like you!"

"B-but what if they don't...?"

His concerns were stilted for a moment when he saw Naruto, Kiba and even Akamaru looking in a different direction near Kurama and grinning, causing the kit to tilt his head curiously. "Huh? W-what is it...?" the kit asked hesitantly, earning a soft chuckle from Hunter. "Ya might wanna turn around, kiddo."

Complying, Kurama turned around and jumped back slightly when he saw a young boy, probably a little younger than Naruto and Kiba beaming up at the kit. "Uh...h-hello..." greeted Kurama, smiling nervously.

"Woooooow...a Keaton!" exclaimed the child in awe. "Hey, Mommy! Look! There's a Keaton in town!"

Kurama and even the others were a bit taken back as the boys' mother and some other nearby onlookers crowded the kit. "Holy cow....y'know, I've never seen one of you guys up close before," replied a large construction worker, still hauling a large plank of wood on his shoulder. The boys' mom smiled and said, "You know, my kids ALWAYS wanted to meet one of your kind before...I just didn't think one of you would ever actually show though!"

A bit sheepishly, Kurama chuckled and said, "Well...n-nice to meet'cha all..."

Immediately, the kit and his four other friends were startled when an old man jumped from the crowd and grabbed Kurama's front paws, as though shaking them as he said, "And it's a great honor to meet YOU! And may I say...what....dazzling attire you wear!" The kit blushed a bit beneath his fur and said, "Aww, thanks! I just...thought it looked really cool is all."

"Mommy? Can I have a shirt like his?" another small boy asked. The mother gazed at the flame swirl on Kurama's shirt and said, "Any shirt good enough for such a majestic creature is good enough for you, sweetie! Come to think of it, I didn't know Keaton even wore clothes!"

Reluctantly, Kurama worked a smile and said, "Err...we don't USUALLY..." then, as though getting the hang of it, the kit; a bit more confidently, added, "...buuuuuuuuut I thought since I was visiting your wonderful town, I thought I'd try something different!"

"So very wise," the old man replied graciously, earning surprised stares from Naruto, Kiba, Hunter and Akamaru, but made Kurama giggle a bit and say, "Awww, you guys are too nice."

Then, a large old man with a mustache approached the crowd, and a bit more sternly, said, "I think I speak for everyone here when I say, welcome to Clock Town! Now, the rest of you lot, SCRAM! How is this magnificent creature supposed to see our glorious town if all he sees are your faces crowding HIS?" The crowd nodded in unison and, after bidding the kit farewell and thanking him for reasons unbeknownst to either himself or his friends, took off, leaving the kit standing there in awe as the others stood there in silence for a moment.

Akamaru glanced curiously. Ummmm...what just happened...?

Hunter smirked and said, "Like I said, these guys really like Keaton." Naruto approached Kurama and smiled, "Told'ja you had nothin' to worry about."

"They were actually happy to see me..." mused Kurama. Kiba just snickered and internally, thought, Probably because you're not a giant fuzzball accidentally knocking over their giant clock tower.

Kurama turned to Hunter and, smiling widely, said, "This place is gonna be awesome!"

Hunter smiled and ruffled the kit's head. "Sure is, kiddo. Suuuuure is." He then glanced at all four youths and asked, "So, whadduya boys wanna do first?"

The four youths glanced amongst themselves for a moment...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: The boys rouse Hunter to go to Clock Town

choices: They reach the Gallery, and one of the boys goes first
They reach the Gallery, and Kurama goes first
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Kurama's head whipped about, his eyes full of wonder as he took in all the sights. "Can we check out the town first? It seems really cool!"

Kiba nodded, tilting his head upward and sniffing. "Yeah, and there are all kinds of interesting smells, too; I don't think I've even smelled half of them before!" Akamaru, from atop Kiba's head, barked his agreement.

Naruto grinned. "Well, I can't smell like Kiba 'n Akamaru can, but I'm with Kurama; this town seems really neat!" He looked up at Hunter expectantly. "Can we look around?"

Hunter smiled, tousling the blonde's hair. "Hey, that's why I brought you guys here, isn't it?" His tail wagged as the youths cheered happily." Ha ha, that's the spirit!" Turning around, he motioned for the boys to follow him. "C'mon, follow me: I'm gonna show you a part of town where there's a lotta fun stuff going on!" Tail still wagging, he set off, the other four following behind him.

"Which part is that, Mr. Hunter?" Kurama inquired as he trotted alongside the others on all fours (after all, even if he could sit up like a human and use his forelegs as arms, he still needed to get around on all fours.)

Hunter looked back at him and grinned. "That part, Kurama, would be East Clock Town."

---
Soon, the five had reached the area that Hunter had mentioned, and before long, the youths were "ooh"ing and "ah"ing at the various sights.

Hunter chuckled at their reactions. "Heh, it's pretty nifty, ain't it?" He spread his arms wide as they strolled through the streets, smiling warmly as several townsfolk passed by and waved enthusiastic greetings at Kurama. A bit flustered, Kurama nonetheless grinned and waved with his tails.

It was a weird feeling, to be sure: when he'd been with the Old Man, he and the others had always been feared by humans, who would often scream, run, and occassionally throw rocks at them. When he'd asked the Old Man why they acted like this, the sage had explained that people feared what they did not understand...that, and the fact they were originally the Ten-Tails, the creature that had terrorized the world. It hadn't been like they'd done anything, though, except maybe break some stuff by accident...

But the people here...they were happy to see him; thrilled, in fact! Kurama smiled as he thought of all the warm words, the praise, and the happy surprise he'd had showered upon him, and all he'd done was show up in town!

Kurama sighed happily. I hope we can stay here for a few days...

"Kurama? You OK?"

At this, the fox's head snapped up, and he looked toward Naruto, who was looking at him with concern. Giggling, Kurama shrugged his shoulders. "Yeah, I'm fine. I was just thinking...this place seems really nice..."

Naruto smiled. "Yeah, it does, doesn't it..."

Kiba smirked. "Eh, yeah, it seems nice, but let's see what we can do here, first..."

Hunter, ears twitching, looked back at them. "Oh, there's plenty of fun stuff to do here. There's the Treasure Chest Shop-that's where you go through a maze to get to a treasure chest with goodies inside-, Honey and Darling's Shop..."

Kurama's little muzzle contorted in disgust. "Ewwww...that sounds icky..." Naruto and Kiba quickly grumbled their assent.

Hunter chuckled. "Oh, trust me, its more fun than it sounds. Ya play a certain type of game, and ya have to get a certain score before the shop's proprietors stop dancing. If ya do, ya get a prize." Turning back to the front, he folded his arms behind his head. "And then, of course, there's the Shooting Gallery, which is pretty much exactly what it sounds like."

Kiba smirked. "Sounds like a lotta fun1"

Hunter grinned. "Sure is, and that's only this part of town! There's also the Deku Scrub Playground, a park, the Lottery Shop..." Abruptly, he stopped and turned around, the kids skidding to a stop as he did so. "Sounds like an awful lot just to do in one day, doesn't it?"

Kurama nodded. "Yeah, sure does..." His eyes suddenly widened, and he looked up at Hunter. "Wait; you mean..." he asked, eyes wide and voice full of so much hope it was almost heartbreaking.

Shaking it off, Hunter managed a grin. "Boys," he began, folding his paws behind his back. "I would like to take this moment to personally welcome you all to your week-long Terminan vacation."

Naruto and Kiba's eyes widened. "A week?" Naruto asked. "We're really gonna be here for a week?"

Hunter laughed, tousling both their heads. "Yep; there's a lot to see in Termina, and one or two days just ain't enough..."

The anthro's eyes widened as he felt something clamp around his legs. Blinking, he looked down to see Kurama hugging him tightly. "Th-thanks..." the little Nine-Tails muttered, looking up at Hunter with the most grateful smile the wolf had ever seen.

A bit taken aback, Hunter nonetheless smiled. "Aw, don't mention it, little guy." He flicked one of Kurama's long ears affectionately, eliciting a happy giggle from the kit.

Naruto, Kiba, and Akamaru, though far from displeased, looked at each other uncertainly. They'd already been gone from the village a few days; how were they gonna react to them being gone for a full week?

However, Hunter caught their look. He smiled and gave them a knowing wink. A bit confused, the three nonetheless looked at each other and shrugged. Doubtless, Hunter had figured out hat was bothering them, and would work something out...

Slowly, smiles formed on their faces as they looked at one another. Might as well enjoy themselves....

Finally, Kurama released Hunter's legs, though he still looked up at him with a huge smile on his face. "So, Mr. Hunter, which place do ya think is the most fun?"

Hunter winked at the kit. "Well, they're all pretty fun..." he glanced around for a moment, as though getting a feel for his surroundings. "...but we're closest to the Shooting Gallery, so whaddaya say we check that out first?"

At the boys' eager assent, Hunter chuckled and continued leading them on...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Explore the town

choices: Either Kiba or Hunter tries next
Kurama gives it a shot
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Hunter continued leading the way with the young Kurama merrily trailing just besides him, more than eager to see what the (currently) elder wolf had in store for him and his new friends, who trailed not too far back. While both Kiba and Akamaru chattered amongst themselves, Naruto found himself observing the young kyuubi, happily taking in all the sights, the sounds and the occasional greeting.

There was something about seeing the youthful creature so happy and...if Naruto didn't know better; humbled by the town and all its' people, that just tugged at the boy's heart. Despite himself, he couldn't help but smile back at the sight. Kiba, however, caught wind of this, and found himself thinking differently.

"Hey, Uzumaki...can I ask you something...?" the young dog-nin whispered to the blonde, who turned his attention towards Kiba. "Huh? Why're ya whispering?" asked Naruto, only be subtly hushed by Kiba. "I was just wonderin'..." Kiba stopped himself and exhaled, nervously rubbing the back of his head, much to Naruto's and even Akamaru's curiosity.

"Are you okay with this...?"

Naruto scratched his head. "Being here a whole week? Weeeell, it'd be cool, but-"

"No no, not that..." interrupted Kiba as he pointed towards Kurama, who was once again getting greeted by a few more ongoers. "...That. Look, I don't wanna throw a wrench into anything, but, it doesn't bother you that, well, when you were a kid, you got a bum deal cause'uh him...but now that he's a kid, he's...kinda getting treated like royalty?"

Akamaru whined a bit to himself. How is that NOT trying to put a wrench into things...?

To his surprise however, Naruto smirked and shook his head. "Well, for starters, these people think he's something else. Think if we were back home, he'd even get a chance to see sights like this? Besides..." Naruto stopped and turned towards the kit, seeing him giggle as a rather large butterfly began fluttering around his nose, earning another smile from Naruto, as he said, "...that's not the hate filled monster I know. He didn't do anything wrong...and, like me...he's paid for the other Kurama's crimes too. I'm just glad he can have this...however long or brief it might be."

A bit taken back, Kiba looked down a bit, before glancing back up at Naruto and warmly wrapping his arm around the blonde boys' shoulder, patting his arm playfully as he did. "Y'know somethin', Uzumaki? You might be a pint-sized, dopier than dopy dope...but I hope you never change." Rolling his eyes, Naruto smirked and nudged the boy back. "Yeah, yeah, don't get all mushy on me, dog-breath." Akamaru just wagged his tail at the sight from atop Kiba's head.

"Alright, boys, here we are!" exclaimed Hunter, causing all four youths to line up excitedly before the anthro as he pointed to what looked like a massive wooden statue of a squid-like creature mounted atop a large wooden building. "East Clock Town Shooting Range. Where archers put their skills to the test, and laugh at the one or two dopes who forget how hard shooting a bow and arrow can be...shall we?"

Eagerly, all four nodded as Hunter smiled and held the door open for all four. Surprisingly, the building wasn't as rustic as the exterior made it seem, but instead...quite colorful. From behind a blue and purple painted archers line was a large pool with no targets in sight. "Welcome tuh the range, fellers," greeted a huskier, more heavy set voice.

Immediately, all five turned to a large, hulking man wearing patterned pants, an opened brown vest exposing his bulky body, a bull cut hairstyle and a mug that only a mother could love...if she were blind.

Clearing his throat, Hunter smiled and approached the counter from which the man was standing. "Hello, sir! I'm visiting from...somewhere else, and I thought I'd show my young friends here a fun time at your glorious shooting range!"

"Uh huh. And which one'uh them's goin' first?" asked the large man with disinterest. Immediately, Naruto raised his hand and hopped up. "Ooh! Ooh! Right here! I've always wanted to try one of those things out!"

"Aren'tcha a lil small, kid?"

"Bah! I got this!"

Shrugging, the burly man handed Naruto a bow and quiver with 20 bows in it. Immediately, the man slammed on a switch, and from the water, popped three wooden 'squid-like' creatures with piercing but dopy and sad looking yellow eyes and a large beak.

Grinning confidently, Naruto held up his bow, and reached for an arrow while all four others watched him with anticipation. And as soon as the arrow was along the strings, Naruto pulled back...or...tried to, unable to build up enough strength to pull the string of the bow back, causing the arrow plopped right down to the floor.

The others stared blankly at the grounded arrow for a moment, then immediately burst into a fit of laughter, much to Naruto's annoyance.

Rolling his eyes, the man took the bow and said, "Told ya, kid. Here, we got somethin' more your size..." He then handed Naruto an odd looking slingshot with a bag of hard and bizarre looking nuts of sorts. "Now, give it a shot."

Shaking off his earlier embarrassment, Naruto loaded up his slingshot, took aim, and...

*POW!*

Blasted one of the targets dead in the face, much to his relief and the impressed gazes of his four buddies. "Hey, that wasn't half bad, bone-head," remarked Kiba, admittedly impressed. Kurama smiled and said, "Show those mean ol' squid thingies whose boss!"

Grinning confidently, Naruto fired some more, hitting more targets. But then, the targets began to move, causing Naruto to either miss or not hit them in time before they could be called back. He got lucky and nailed a few others, but by the end of the game, he'd hit...MAYBE seven or eight targets...out of twenty.

"Not bad for a first try, kid," said the burly man as he took Naruto's slingshot and glanced down at the others. "So? Who else wants tuh give this a go?"

The others glanced amongst themselves for a moment.
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Reaching the Gallery, one of the boys goes first

choices: "We're a little hungry; I don't think we had breakfast"
"What other cool stuff is there to do?"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
An orange-furred paw shot up into the air. "Ooh! Ooh! Can I go next?" Kurama asked, face alight with anticipation.

Kiba laughed a bit, reaching an arm out and giving the kit a friendly pat on the back. "Eh, I guess you can go ahead."

Smiling warmly, Hunter put a paw on Kurama's head, looking down at him. "Go for it, kiddo!"

Kurama needed no second bidding: he bolted out from under Hunter's paw and rushed up to the man. "Can I have the slingshot, please?" He thought for a moment. "And that bag of shoot-y nuts, too?"

Raising an eyebrow, the man nonetheleass handed him the weapon and the ammo. A Keaton, using the gallery? That's a first....

Taking it in his paws, Kurama giggled. "Thanks, mister!" Still giggling, he placed the slingshot in his mouth, rushed up to the top of the steps, and settled back into an upright sitting position. Alright, now how did Naruto do this... Taking the slingshot in one paw, he held it up in front of him, grabbed the band, and pulled it back. A grin lit up his face. Perfect!

Looking back at the man, Kurama exclaimed, "OK, mister! I'm ready to start!"

Shaking his head at the strangeness of the whole situation, the man shrugged and slammed on the button again, once again bringing up the strange wooden squid-creatures. "And...go!"

Grinning, Kurama loaded up one of the nuts in the slingshot, pulled it back...

Wait a minute...

Turning back toward the man, he asked, "Um, 'scuse me? Mister?" When the man looked up at him, he continued, somewhat nervously, "I know we usually get hat bow or slingshot to hit the targets...but if we could it it ourselves, would that be OK?"

"Huh?" Naruto asked, scratching his head. "He's not gonna use the slingshot?"

Raising an eyebrow, Kiba folded his arms. "How the hell's he expect to hit them without it?"

Scratching an ear, Hunter tilted his head a bit. "Uh, I got nothing." Still, something tells me he's got something planned...

Akamaru, from atop Kiba's head, whined. I have a really, really, REALLY bad feeling about this...

The man, oblivious, stared at Kurama for a few seconds before shrugging. "Eh, nothing that says ya can't..."

Kurama's muzzle split in a wide smile. "Yay! Thanks, mister!" Turning back around to face the gallery, he set the slingshot back on the steps, took a deep breath...and then, to their surprise, settled back into his upright sitting position, resting his forelimbs on the ground.

"Eh?" Naruto asked. "What's he doing?" Louder, he called, "Hey, Kurama?" Ears twitching, Kurama turned his head, smiling warmly at his blonde friend.

"Yeah, Naruto?" the kit asked. "What is it?"

Naruto rubbed the back of his head. "Um...what are you doing?" To his surprise, the kit giggled and winked back at him. Akamaru gulped. Scratch that; I've got a really, really, really, REALLY monumentally bad feeling about this...

Oblivious to the dog's musing, Kurama focused his attention back on the pool and the wooden creatures inside it. He took another deep breath. OK...let's hope this works... Closing his eyes, he tilted his head back and opened his muzzle as wide as it could go. His friends and the man watched, utterly confused...a confusion which only increased when small particles of various reds and blues began materializing and gathering above the kit's open mouth. "Uh..." the man began, not remotely sure what was going on.

Hunter wasn't much better. "Naruto, what's he doing?" he whispered to the blonde boy. Naruto simply looked back at him with an equally confused look and shrugged.

Soon, enough of the particles had gathered to form a dark purple/black orb above Kurama's mouth. Kiba's eyes widened. "The hell..."

That...doesn't look good... Akamaru whimpered.

All the whiles, the particles continued gathering, slowly swelling the ball larger and larger. Kurama grunted a bit. Nngh..c'mon, just a liiiiittle bigger...

At this point, the particles were coming in more slowly, and the ball wasn't growing as quickly, but grow it did, until, finally, it was about softball sized.

Kurama grinned at the sight of it. Eh, it's not as big as Gyuki can do it...but I think this is good.

With the ball suspended in front of his muzzle, Kurama slowly lowered his head, bringing it to directly to face the pool. His eyes dancing with delight and anticipation, he opened his muzzle wider...

Kiba jerked as he saw Akamaru clamber down the front of his face and into his shirt. "Akamaru? What's wrong?"

The pup shuddered. I just thought it might be a good idea to take cover.

Kiba blinked. "How co---"

...at that moment, the ball streaked from Kurama's jaws. It made a beeline for the nearest target, striking it dead-on....

*FWOOOSH!*

...and detonating in a massive explosion that engulfed the entire pool area, rising up and sending the water splashing all over the room, hitting everyone standing in it. Oddly enough, smoke still accompanied the massive surge.

As the dust cleared, Naruto, Kiba, Hunter, Akamaru, and the gallery's owner were all staring, as one, at the young kit that had created the tremendous explosion, their jaws doing their very best to make contact with the ground. Surprisingly, the steps were still intact, but as the smoke cleared away completely, they could see that the pool and targets...had not been so lucky.

There appeared to be a huge crater where the pool used to be, all the water in it completely gone. There were various pieces of wood scattered about the crater, with more still raining down into the pit. As they looked up, they noticed that the roof appeared to have a rather sizable hole in it, though not anywhere near as big as the crater was.

Eyes widening, Kurama examined what he'd done. Whooaaaaa...that's the biggest Tailed Beast Ball I've ever done... Turning around, he saw the others staring at him with equally wide eyes. Blinking, he took a breath....and broke out in a huge grin. "So? How'd I do?"

None of them said anything for a moment. Then...

"Kurama?" Naruto spoke up in a low voice.

Kurama flinched a bit, and he looked back at the destruction. He gulped. He'd gotten so carried away, he'd wrecked this place, just like he and the other Tailed Beasts had accidentally done. "Y-yeah, Naruto...?" the kit enquired uncertainly, tugging at his collar.

The boy looked up...and his own face split in a huge grin. "That was AWESOME!"

Kurama recoiled a bit at this sudden exclamation, only to grin as Naruto rushed up the steps and slapped his hands on his shoulders. "Y-you're not mad?"

Naruto scoffed. "Hey, the object was to hit all the targets, right?" He indicated the wreckage of the wooden squid creatures. "Looks to me like you hit all of them..."

Kurama followed Naruto's hand. "Yeah, I guess I did. Which means..." His eyes flew wide open. "I won!"

Like lightning, he took off, accidentally making Naruto stumble as he rushed up to the gallery's owner. As soon as he reached the man, though, his smile faded, and he remembered how much damage he had done. "Um, Mister? A-about your shop..."

The man shrugged. "Eh, don't worry about it; I was thinking about remodeling this place anyway." Then, to his surprise, the man smiled. "First, though, I gotta give you your prize."

Kurama tilted his head. "Prize?" He asked, anticipation in his voice as Naruto came up behind him.

The man nodded and walked back over to his desk, withdrawing a rather sizable bag from it. Grunting, he brought it over to the kit and dropped it in front of him. "Here ya go, kid; for hitting all the targets in record time, you get 200 Rupees."

Naruto scratched his head as Kurama began rooting around in the bag. "Huh? What the heck are..."

Kurama's eyes widened as he came across something. "Naruto, look!" the kit exclaimed. Curious, Naruto walked over and knelt down...and his eyes widened as he saw what was within the bag. There were a great many gems inside of varying colors, and they all seemed to sparkle. "Wow.." Naruto breathed.

"Yeah..." Kurama noted, picking one up and examining it. "It's so pretty!"

Chuckling as he, Kiba, and Akamaru came up behind them, Hunter ruffled Kurama's head. "Those there are Rupees, kiddo. They're the main form of currency around here..." He grinned as he saw the bags contents. "...and with that many, there's a lot you can buy!" Looking around, he grimaced. "And considering the place is wrecked, we'll probably need other stuff to occupy our time..."

Kurama grinned. "No problem; there's a lot of stuff to do in town, right?" At Hunter's nod, he grabbed the bag, tugged...and grunted. "Ugh, it's really heavy..."

Hunter chuckled. "Here, lemme take care of that for ya." Reaching down, he grabbed the bag, hefted it over his shoulder, and stood up. "Sorry about all this," he apologized to the man. "If there's anything we can do..."

The man waved him off. "Like I said, don't worry about it."

Hunter blinked. "O...OK..." Shrugging, he turned around and beckoned for the youths to follow him. As they neared the exit, Hunter asked, "so, kids, we got some money; whaddaya wanna do?"

The four thought for a moment...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Tailed Beast Ball Ballistics

choices: "Can we get the roasted Cuccoo Platter?"
"Can we have five 72 oz Romani Ranch Steaks?"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Their train of thought was interrupted as; yet again, a more than audible rumbling emanated from the young kits' tummy. Blushing bright red beneath his orange fur, the young kyuubi placed a paw on his stomach and; somewhat sheepishly, said, "Ehehe, s-sorry about that. I think summoning such a ginormous Tailed-Beast Ball made me kinda hungry."

Just then, some slightly less audible rumblings emanated from the tummies of the other three youths. Laughing, Naruto wrapped his arm around the kits' shoulder and said, "Haha, now that you mention it, I'm kinda famished too." Nodding, Kiba rubbed his stomach and said, "No surprise. I don't think we had any breakfast yet."

Akamaru barked in agreement. And all that world traveling and gallery exploding's enough to work up an appetite for ANYONE!

Chuckling, Hunter nodded, just as his own stomach began rumbling hungrily. "All valid points," the anthro remarked, rubbing his stomach hungrily. "Luckily, I know just the place! And as it so happens...it's also the only place in this town where a group of weary travelers can rent a room for the night...or seven, hehe. Right this way, boys!"

And so, Hunter the led the way, bag of Rupees firmly at hand with Kurama eagerly trotting right besides him. Naruto, Kiba and Akamaru, however still hesitant about the seven nights remark, nonetheless smiled eagerly ready to sate their hunger, and followed close behind, all the while, coming across another batch of colorful faces, greeting the group and Kurama especially. As they did, Akamaru couldn't help but tilt his head as he saw people idly greeting the group and Hunter especially.

I get that this is a different world from ours, but still, I'm a little surprised that people here don't seem so...shocked about a walking, talking wolf person strolling around through town. Do you visit here often?

Hunter chuckled and shook his head. "Every so often, sure, but not as much as I'd like. Besides, Termina's a VERY colorful place, if you haven't noticed by now, an anthropomorphic wolf is one of the more normal things you're likely to see in a world occupied by talking tree people, volcano dwelling rock eaters, and-" Hunter stopped mid-sentence when he saw a rubbery white-skinned fish man approaching them with what looked like a large fish skeleton made in the shape of a guitar.

The timing was just too perfect, Hunter snickered and added, "-and those."

Oblivious, the Zora glanced back at the gang and said, "Oi! You blokes know where da Mllk Bar's at? If I'm late f'er re'ersal, me manag'uh's gonna take me ov'a t'uh Pinnacle'n feed me to a bleedin' eel!"

The four youths just blinked blankly for a moment.

"...A-anyone speak fish...?" asked Naruto, scratching his head nervously.

Hunter just laughed. "I didn't know The Indigo-Go's were back in town! You the new guitarist?"

The Zora nodded, waving his 'bangs' as he did. "Used to jam with Mikau all the time before he...well, you know...so I thought I owed it tuh him to keep the band afloat with Lulu, Evan and the other blokes aaaaaaand now I'm officially 'bout tuh be chum...less the place is right beneath us 'er somethin'..."

Smirking, Hunter gave the Zora a wink and said, "Well, you're in luck, cause the Milk Bar is just down these stairs."

Face lighting up, the guitarist sprinted down, waving back at the gang. "Bloody brilliant, mate! Milk's on me if ya ever get drop by!" he said as he sprinted down towards the bar, leaving Hunter grinning and the others...well, confused, to say the least.

"Uhhh..." Naruto started.

"...What just happened...?" added Kiba, earning a nod of agreement from Naruto as they all looked up at Hunter for an explanation. "Haha, loooooooong story, boys. Anywho, here we are!" The wolf pointed upward towards a two story building. The sign up top read, 'Stock Pot Inn.' Again, Naruto scratched his head uncertainly. "So wait, we're eating an Inn...?"

Hunter just ruffled the boys head. "Trust me, you guys won't be the least bit disappointed."

Despite themselves, the others just shrugged. Afterall, Hunter hadn't steered them wrong so far. And so, they headed on into a very polished and modest looking inn, with a tall, red headed woman looking to be in her mid twenties standing behind the counter. "Oh! Hello there!" she said in a peppy tone as the others approached. "Welcome to the Stock Pott Inn! My name is Anju!"

Hunter chuckled and rubbed the back of his head. "Heh...err, yeah, I remember from the last couple times I dropped by."

"Oh, I-I'm sorry, heh, I'm not so good with faces, to be honest."

Kurama giggled. "Not even fuzzy faces like his?"

Looking down, Anju's face lit up. "Oh! A Keaton!"

The others jerked back, startled as the peppy woman rushed over and leaned in towards a taken back Kurama. "You know, I've always wanted to see one of you guys up close before! Sure, I have once or twice...but I...kinda forgot...STILL, a grand honor!" She then reached her hand and gently pet the top of Kurama's head. "I'll say this much, I may not recall the other Keatons, but I KNOW they didn't look anywhere near as adorable as you do!"

Giggling, the kit blushed beneath his fur and smiled up at Anju. "Awww, thanks!" the kit replied, earning snickers from the others. Just then, Kurama's stomach rumbled louder than ever, making the kit's blushing actually visible beneath his orange fur. Hunter just laughed and said, "Speaking of which, we were wondering if the kitchen's open, cause my young friends and I are quite famished from our travels! Also, could we get a room?"

Anju nodded. "Most certainly!" She then glanced down at Kurama and smiled warmly. "And don't you worry about a thing, little fella, you won't be hungry for long once you see what our new chef can whip up!"

Kurama smiled graciously at the woman and took two Red Rupees out of his bag to pay for the room. "And don't worry about the food. It's on us! But...you may wanna tip the chef when you're done. He gets...kinda cranky..." Anju remarked as she led the gang over to the cafeteria, where only they resided, all seated on a table in the center of the area. "Go ahead and take a look. When you're ready to order, lemme know."

Naruto looked around curiously while the others glanced down at their menus. "Seems kinda dead, doesn't it?"

Hunter glanced idly at the empty cafeteria and nodded. "Business is typically fairly slow, yeah. But you should see this place during Festival Season. Anju and her mother wrack in more business during the festivities than they do in the entire year."

Kurama giggled as he glanced back to where Anju had exited and said, "She's a really nice lady!"

Kiba grinned mischievously. "AND she thinks you're cute..."

Once again, the normally orange furred kits' face lit redder than a cherry. But Hunter just laughed assuredly. "Sorry, kiddo, but she's taken. Y'know, fun fact, this place didn't used to be an Inn. It actually used to the most renown restaurant in all of Termina. But then the first owner of this place, Tortus; Anju's old man, passed away and left it to her and her mom...and of course, Anju; sweet as she may be, can't cook to save her life...soooo they turned it into an Inn."

The others then glanced up at Hunter questionably.

"Then...why are we eating here...?" asked Naruto. To which, Hunter pointed in the air, just as the fryers sounded off from the kitchen. Suddenly, a heavenly aroma wafted across the table, enticing all who took a whiff. "THAT'S why," replied Hunter slyly.

"Holy crap..." remarked Kiba, practically salivating. "Smells like pot roast, but...oh man...I can taste the spices...the seasonings from HERE!"

"Yep!" piped Hunter happily. "I dunno who their new cook is, but whoever he or she is...they can cook. I hear Anju and her husband are actually planning on making a 'grand announcement' to the town about it once she gets a few more taste testers. For now, she just keeps it to her customers. That's why it was on the house. Which reminds me...no dark purple plasma-er-whatever balls here, Kurama."

Again, the kit giggled, blushing as he did and nodded. "Ehehe...yeaaaah...honest, I didn't mean to wreck that big guy's store! I just got a lil...carried away..."

Akamaru tilted his head. A 'little'...?

Snickering to himself, Naruto once again patted the kit on the shoulder and said, "Hey, carried away or not, that was still pretty damn awesome! Besides, he was cool with it, wasn't he?"

Hunter glanced quizzically, hearing that last remark and nodded. "Yeah, he was...still kinda weird actually...I half expected us to be out on our rumps after that...or for him to use that bow and arrow and make US his new targets..." remarked Hunter, shuddering at the thought. But Kiba scoffed and said, "Ah, he could probably afford it! I mean, if he's giving away that much money for knocking all the targets at once, then he probably doesn't mind spending a bit more to spruce his place up."

Akamaru barked in agreement. Though, I'm willing to bet he won't be as okay with letting people destroy targets 'on their own' after that...

The group shared in a laugh, as Naruto stared idly for a moment, but nonetheless laughed anyway. Eventually, they glanced back down at the menus, until Anju returned with a pen and paper ready.

"So, have you boys decided what you'd like?"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: "We're a little hungry actually..."

choices: Anju brings the platter out, and the four youths marvel at it before digging in
Anju brings the platter out, and the five fall upon it without delay
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Kurama looked up from his menu. "Ms. Anju, what's the Roasted Cuccoo Platter?" he asked, looking up at the woman. "It sounds yummy..." Naruto, Kiba, and Akamaru looked at each other, confused, but Hunter simply wagged his tail; he knew exactly what the kit was talking about.

Smiling warmly, Anju patted the kit on the head, eliciting a giggle from the young creature. "You'd certainly be right about that. Well," she began, stepping back, "the Roasted Cuccoo platter is an extra-large Romani Ranch Cuccoo roasted and cooked with the best herbs and spices this side of Termina, with mashed potatoes and peas on the side..."

Little Kurama's muzzle screwed up at that. "Ewww, peas?" the young Nine-Tails muttered. "I don't like veggies..." To emphasize his point, he screwed his eyes shut and stuck his tongue out. This, in turn, elicited a round of snickers and snorts from Naruto and Kiba.

Anju, for her part, didn't seem offended at all; if anything, her smile deepened. "Well, that's not surprising, considering how young you are, but trust me, once you taste these peas, you'll change your tune...."

Kurama, in spite of himself, opened his eyes and looked at Anju curiously. Hunter, not wanting to spoil anything, cut in. "Yeah, and peas taste really great when ya mix 'em up with mashed potatoes." He winked at Kurama. " Trust me, you ain't gonna be disappointed."

Kurama tilted his head at Hunter, but nonetheless smiled. After all, he'd been nice enough to take him to this cool town, take him out of that scary place, AND treat him to the single yummiest thing he'd ever eaten in his life, and if Hunter said it was good, then it must be good. With that thought in mind, he looked toward Naruto and Kiba. "Is the roasted Cuccoo Platter good with you guys?" He beamed as they nodded enthusiastically.

Chuckling, Hunter looked toward Anju. "Well, in that case, tell your chef we'll take the Roasted Cuccoo Platter."

"Excellent choice!" Anju chirped, scribbling on the paper. "And would you like anything to drink with that?"

The anthro thought for a moment. "Hmm...could we get a pitcher of soda and some glasses?"

Anju nodded, scribbling the additional request on the paper. "You certainly can!" Standing back up with the paper in hand, she bustled off. "I'll give your orders to the chef, and he'll get right on it!"

Hunter nodded, smiling at her energy. Well, at least we know the chef's a 'he'... he mused.

"Mr. Hunter?"

Hunter looked up. "Hmm?" He directed his attention toward the fox kit. "Something up, Kurama?"

The kit shifted in his seat a bit. "Um, you ordered something for us to drink called 'soda'. What's that?"

Chuckling, Hunter raised a paw, but Naruto motioned for him to hold off. "I ain't gonna spoil it for ya," Naruto began, throwing a friendly arm about Kurama's shoulders. "but I'm gonna say this: you're gonna love it."

Immediately, Kurama's face lit up. "Ooh! Is it gonna be as yummy as ice cream?!"

Kiba laughed, leaning back in his chair and folding his arms behind his head. "Weelll, it's a little different, but yeah; it's real good."

Kurama looked over at the little dog-nin. "Really?"

Akamaru barked. You better believe it!

Hunter laughed, rubbing the back of his head and marveling at the sheer ease with which the youths interacted. They really had become good friends in such a short time, Naruto and Kurama especially....

S'not fair,} Hunter thought, his smile fading a bit. Just because that sweet, innocent, adorable little kit grows up into a vicious, hateful monster...and I STILL have no idea how that happened...he's gonna hafta go back inside Naruto once the week's up. He shook his head. It's just not fair...

"Hunter?"

Shaking himself (and feeling a surge of relief at the distraction,) Hunter looked across the table at the young blonde. "Y-yeah, Naruto?"

Naruto frowned, scratching the back of his head. "This is gonna sound weird...but what's a Cuccoo?"

Hunter blinked. "What's a..." Realization hit, and he chuckled a bit. "Oh yeah, you're new to Termina..."

Kiba rolled his head. "What, ya didn't realize that before? But yeah, we wanna be sure we're not gonna be eating some sorta weird animal...."

Hunter smiled. "Not to worry, boys; Cuccoos are basically just this world's version of chickens. So, we're basically gonna be eating a big ol' roast chicken with the works."

Kurama's eyes lit up, and he licked his chops. "Ooh, I like chickens..." His muzzle screwed up again, this time in thought. "But how big is it gonna be?"

Hunter smirked. "Youuuuuuu'll see," the anthro wolf replied teasingly. "Oh, and one more thing, Kurama..." Seeing he had the kit's attention, Hunter rubbed the back of his head a bit nervously. "Um, between the five of us, the Cuccoo's probably not gonna do much more except make us look like we had a really good meal-ya know, making our guts bulge beneath our shirts but not much else- but just in case we decide to get something else afterwards..." Taking a deep breath, and praying it wasn't gonna come out creepy, asked:

"You're not going commando, are you?"

Naruto and Kiba spluttered at the question, but Kurama just tilted his head. "Huh? What's 'going commando'?" the young Tailed Beast asked, completely oblivious to the shocked looks on his human (and canine) friends' faces.

Hunter laughed nervously, scratching the side of his head. "It, um...it means you're wearing pants without any underwear." Seeing Kurama's confusion deepen, he continued, "I-I mean, since you're covered head-to-toe in fur like yours truly, its not like anything would be showing anyway if your fly ends up needing to be opened, but I was just wondering..."

To his surprise, Kurama giggled. "Heehee, don't worry, Mr. Hunter; I found a really cool-looking pair of underwear while I was lookin' for these clothes in the closet." He beamed. "They're really comfy, too!"

Naruto and Kiba stared at Kurama, their faces set in awkward expressions, but before they could say anything....

"Oh wow," Naruto exclaimed, taking a deep sniff. "Wouldja smell that!"

Kiba's face lit up as he and Akamaru sniffed the air in unison. "Oh, I smell that...oh man, the spices, the seasonings...they smell AWESOME!"

Smiling as he took in the heavenly aroma, Hunter nodded. "Heh, just wait till you try it..."

The five lapsed into silence as they continued taking in the delightful aromas of the Cuccoo cooking, until...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: "Can we get the roasted Cuccoo Platter?"

choices: They all tear into the Cuccoos at incredible pace
Kurama decides to try soda for the first time
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
The sound of footsteps approaching caught the ears of all five parties, and immediately, they turned to the source. Hunter chuckled softly as he saw the faces of his (currently) youthful pals light up like children on Christmas morning.

Seeing this, Anju smiled back at the youths as she approached them, carrying a rather bountiful platter of Roasted Cuccoo's. Indeed, as Hunter described it, they looked just like slightly larger roasted chickens, but the sheer abundance of spices, herbs, seasonings wafting from the roasted Termina paltry was enough to make all four youths mouths and maws water.

Chuckling softly herself, Anju placed the platter down atop the table and glanced at the four youths. "Yeah, we get that a lot, these days," she remarked with a smile as she placed down five plates in front of her patrons, each one loaded with an ample pile of mashed potatoes and peas on the side. Again, Kurama glanced down at the peas for a moment and grimaced. Blech, veggies...icky! the young kyuubi thought for a moment, but rather than verbally express his disdain, he recalled what Anju had said earlier, then looked up at her, somewhat skeptically, but nevertheless, asked, "Ms. Anju? Are you sure these peas aren't going to be icky...?"

Again, the other boys; even Akamaru started snickering to themselves, but Anju just smiled and nodded assuredly. "I promise, one bite and you'll know how 'un-icky' they are," she said as she playfully pet the kit's head, once again eliciting more amused giggles from the young kyuubi as he nodded back, smiling a wide smile as he did.

"Lemme go get your drinks," she added before heading back, leaving Naruto, Kiba, Kurama and Akamaru to just gaze upon the roasted Cuccoo glory, taking in all the scents at once. "Not bad, eh?" remarked Hunter, earning enthusiastic nods from all four youths.

"T-that...is...the YUMMIEST thing I've ever smelled!" the young fox kit exclaimed eagerly. Naruto grinned and playfully nudged Kurama. "You ain't kidding, buddy! Heck, I almost wish I had that scent mask on right about now!" Grinning impishly, Kiba snorted and said, "Yeah, me too, then I wouldn't hafta look'it your ugly mug."

Hunter just snickered a bit, while Kurama glanced curiously at the dog-nin, before snickering a bit himself. What he said was mean, to be sure, but Kurama had quickly learned that was just the way these two communicated with each other, possibly even part of what made their friendship so strong, or why hanging out with them was proving to be so amusing for the kit. Surprisingly, Naruto didn't even give the remark much heed at all, due to simply being overwhelmed by the zesty scents wafting across their table.

Then, Anju returned, placing an ample pitcher of cola next to the platter, and placed cups all around the table before taking a step back. "Well, don't suppose I have to tell you, but...bon appetit!" she said cheerfully, then headed back to her other duties at the Inn.

Hunter grinned then said, "Well? We gonna sit here and oogle the roasted Cuccoos all day? Or are we gonna cram as much of these zesty birdies as we can possibly fit into our maws?"

Immediately, little Akamaru barked eagerly, wagging his tail enthusiastically as he did. You don't gotta tell me twice!

Oblivious, Naruto just shrugged and jokingly, added, "What he said! W-whatever that might'uh been...unless he was making fun of me...again..." Laughing, Hunter nodded, and; held his paw forward, gesturing to the Cuccoos as each youth immediately reached in and placed one on their plate, followed by Hunter, shortly after. Kiba; of course, grabbed two and placed one atop Akamaru's plate for him, earning another happy bark from the pup as he hopped up and licked his dog-nin companions face, earning a laugh from the boy as he ruffled the pups' head and placed him before his plate.

Naruto licked his lips eagerly and grabbed his fork and knife, ready to sink his teeth into this roasted bird, but stopped as he saw Kurama eagerly licking his chops as well. Smiling, he put his silverware down and said, "Say, Kurama," he started, earning the kits attention. "Would'ja do the honors of takin' the first bite'n lettin' us know how it is?"

"Really?" the kit asked, earning a nod and a friendly pat on the shoulder from the blonde boy.

"Hey, I trust your judgement, plus, you probably got better taste buds than the rest of us...cept maybe dog-breath, but he's a dunce, so who cares?" Naruto replied, earning a scowl from Kiba, and snickers from Hunter and Akamaru. "Ah, look who's talkin', Mister-I-Locked-Myself-Out-Again-Cause-I'm-Emperor-Dumbass..." grumbled Kiba.

Admittedly, Kurama wasn't sure why Naruto and company wouldn't just take the first bite and taste for themselves if these Cuccoos really were as yummy as they smelled. Nonetheless, he beamed warmly at his blonde friend, for the kind words and vote of confidence as it were. And so, glancing at the way the others were carrying their forks and knives, Kurama reached down and did the same, and; quickly putting two and two together, dug his fork into the breast portion of his Cuccoo and with his knife, cut out a decent piece of white meat, which he proceeded to stick into his eager and curious maw.

Hunter already knew first hand how great roasted Cuccoo was, but nevertheless, watched the kits' face, curious to see his reaction.

Low and behold, the young Kurama's eyes widened and his face lit up, utterly astounded. Naruto grinned eagerly, "Heh, that good, huh?"

Gulping down his piece of white meat, the kit beamed and exclaimed, "That...was the yummiest piece of meat I've ever eaten!" Smiling, Hunter reached over and ruffled the kits' head and turned to the others. "Well, you heard the little guy, let's dig in!" the anthro exclaimed, as he and the others wasted no time tearing into the roasted Cuccoos and taking their first bites. Like Kurama, both Naruto and Kiba's faces lit up, even Akamaru was astounded by the rush of flavor. "H-holy crap..." Naruto muttered. "The seasonings, the spices, the herbs...all of it...just the right amount...i-it tastes freaking PERFECT!" Kiba blurted out.

Akamaru licked his chops after gulping down a hearty piece of dark meat and nodded enthusiastically. What he said!

Hunter also found himself impressed with the flavor. He'd tasted this particular plate before and knew how wonderful it tasted, but even last time, it wasn't this perfectly seasoned. Wow, whoever Anju's chef is, knows what he's doing in there... the wolf thought before digging in for more, right alongside the others.
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Anju brings the platter out and the youths marvel

choices: They dive right back into their Cuccoos
Naruto and Kiba decide to get competitive with the soda
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
The five continued cutting into (or, in Akamaru's case, biting into) the roasted birds, chewing happily and savoring the meaty tenderness and flavorful seasonings before jumping right back in for more.

Mmm...oh man! Naruto thought, cramming a large piece of dark meat into his mouth. This has gotta be the best chicken...er, Cuccoo...I've ever eaten! He gulped it down, licking his lips. It's almost as good as Ichiraku's! Ripping a drumstick off the Cuccoo, he brought it up to his mouth, ripping off a huge mouthful and giggling as he kicked his legs a bit.

Kurama, meanwhile, had a drumstick in each hand, ripping chunks out of each and beaming as he did so. This Cuccoo...it's so yummy! He giggled, chewing eagerly. I've had chickens before, but they were never THIS tender or tasty! He gulped the mouthfuls down, but as he lifted the drumsticks back up to his muzzle, he realized something. Oh wow... he thought, depositing the drumsticks on the plate and leaning back in his seat. These are good, but they're kinda makin' me thirsty... to punctuate this, he smacked his chops.

As he contemplated what to do, his eyes fell upon the pitcher of dark, bubbly liquid that Ms. Anju had brought; 'soda', the others had called it...

"Mr. Hunter?" Kurama piped up, sitting up and looking toward the anthro as he forked some mashed potatoes into his muzzle.

The fork still in his mouth, Hunter looked across the table at the kit. "Hmm?" Pulling the fork out of his mouth and swallowing, he licked his chops to get the extra potato off his muzzle. "Something up, kid?"

Kurama nodded. "Um, this Cuccoo's really, really good, but its making me thirsty." His eyes flicked toward the pitcher. "Can you..."

Hunter smiled, nodding. "Way ahead of ya, Kurama." Reaching across the table, he grabbed the pitcher, lifting it up. "Alright, now if ya don't mind just holding your glass up..." Kurama obliged, grabbing his cup and holding it near the pitcher. Nodding in return, Hunter tilted the pitcher forward, pouring the bubbly liquid into the cup. "That good?" he asked, once he'd filled it a little past half-way. At the kit's nod, Hunter straightened the pitcher back up and began filling up his own cup.

As he did so, Kurama held up his own cup, examining it. So...this is soda... He tilted his head, ears twitching a bit. It was a lot different-looking than water; for one, it was completely dark, not see-through at all, and it fizzed and bubbled noticeably. The kit gulped, a little nervous. I-it's bubbling almost like Son's lava... The young Nine-Tails shuddered, remembering the time Shukaku had dared him to dip one of his tails into the Four-Tail's lava. He'd cried a lot, and it had taken weeks for the fur on his tail to grow completely back...

Kurama shook his head. N-no; the lava was really hot, and this feels cold. 'Sides, Ms Anju seems nice; she wouldn't give us anything that'd hurt us....

Gulping again, and determined not to lose his nerve, Kurama lifted his cup up to his muzzle, and took a single, cautious sip. Naruto, having noticed this even as he dug into his Cuccoo, looked up at the kit and grinned. "So? How is it?"

Kurama set his glass back on the table, smacking his lips a little bit. "It's..." he began, inwardly marveling at the bubbly sensation it left on his tongue, and the fizzy feeling it produced as it flowed down his throat. "It feels kinda funny in my mouth and goin' down..."

Suddenly, his face split in a wide, toothy grin. "...but it's really, really sweet and yummy!" Licking his lips eagerly, he picked his glass back up and began guzzling it down in earnest.

Laughing, Naruto playfully winked back at him. "Heh; told ya you'd like it."

Within seconds, Kurama had completely depleted his glass. Setting it down, he licked his muzzle, giggling. "That was the yummiest drink I've ever drunk!" He exclaimed gleefully. Grabbing his glass again, he lifted it up toward Hunter. "Mr. Hunter, can I have some more soda please?" He thought for a moment. "And can ya fill it all thte way, please?"

Chuckling, Hunter grabbed the pitcher again and obliged, topping off the little creature's glass. "There ya go, little fella; enjoy."

Kurama, too happy to oblige, lifted his glass back up and, to the astonishment of all present, managed to down the whole thing in a single go. "Aaaaah," he sighed, setting the empty glass back down. "That's good..."

Suddenly, his eyes flew open. Kiba, noticing this, frowned. "H-hey, you OK, fuzzball?"

Kurama nodded absently, resting a hand over his belly. "Y-yeah, I'm OK; my tummy's just feeling kinda weird, like it's all fizzy and full of bubbles..."

No sooner had those words left his muzzle than his cheeks bulged, his mouth flew wide open....


*BURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAP!*


....and he let loose with a surprisngly long, loud belch. Naruto, Kiba, Hunter, and Akamaru all stared at him, mouths gaping open.

Kurama blushed wildly, both paws flying to his muzzle. "U-um, 'scuse me..."

None of them said anythingfor a moment. Then...

Without warning, Naruto suddenly burst into laughter. "H-ha! Good one, Kurama!" he managed through his snickers. Soon, Kiba followed him, then Hunter, then Akamaru...

Kurama watched all of them, utterly confused as to why they were laughing. Still, a smile began tugging at the corners of his muzzle, and soon, he was laughing right alongside them.

As their laughter began to die down...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Kurama decides to try soda for the first time

choices: One of them finishes before the other
Low and behold, it's a tie...again!
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
As the uproarious laughter began to subside, Kurama rubbed the back of his fuzzy orange head, and; amidst a few giggles, asked, "Heehee...so, umm...w-why are we laughing...?" To which Naruto, after wiping a few tears of laughter from his face, chuckled and patted the kit playfully on the shoulder, "Hehe, because that was freakin' AWESOME! Seriously, that had to be the biggest burp I've ever heard in my life!" Hunter chuckled and nodded with agreement. "Sorry, little guy, I probably should'a warned ya about ingesting so much carbonation at once, but that startled look on your face when it was over? Priceless."

To this, Kurama blushed a bit, then Naruto, a bit more lighthearted, smiled back and said, "Still, soda tastes pretty good though, doesn't it?" Despite himself, Kurama beamed happily and bobbed his head up and down. "Yuh-huh! I didn't even know drinks COULD taste that yummy! Or...taste like anything at all!" The others laughed a bit softly at that observation from the young Tailed-Beast. Unable to help himself, Naruto smiled warmly at the gentle creature. There was something about seeing young Kurama so joyously discovering new things; big and small, that was just, simply uplifting. He didn't take any of these; otherwise miniscule moments or items for granted, he appreciated each and every one of them, and seeing how happy he was trying new things, seeing new places, and meeting new people; cliche as it sounds, just warmed the boys heart.

That moment was interrupted however when he saw Kurama's ears droop down and an expression grow on his face that could only be described as 'uh-oh.' Before Naruto could inquire, he and the others turned to see Anju glancing around the cafeteria with a dumbfounded look on her face. "Sorry to bother you, boys, but I was upstairs with my grandmother and I SWEAR I heard an angry Dodongo breaking into the cafeteria again!"

Naruto, Kiba and Akamaru glanced up at Hunter curiously. "Eh, it's like a dinosaur-thing," he said with a shrug, eliciting snickers from the trio as Kurama's face once again flushed bright red beneath his orange fur. The kit chuckled incredibly sheepishly and nervously and said, "Errr...t-that was me, Ms. Anju..."

Anju turned to the kit curiously as he rubbed the back of his head and gave her an apologetic look. "Eh heh...I, umm...n-never had soda before, and I kinda...drank it a little too fast. S-sorry..."

To his surprise, and the surprise of the others, Anju just laughed and wiped her forehead with relief. "Well, that's good know! I thought I'd have to refurnish this entire place...again!" Seeing the kits' face still cherry red, however, Anju smiled and approached the embarrassed young creature and gently ruffled the top of his head. "Don't feel embarrassed, little fella, if anything, I'm flattered!" At this, all five gave the red headed woman a dumbfounded look. "Oh, sorry, I forgot to mention, our soda's homemade. I make it myself! In fact, it's probably the one thing I can make that people actually LIKE consuming!"

Hunter gave the woman an impressed look. That she made the soda and it didn't taste like...well, sewage, was impressive as is, but this tasted downright delightful. "That's pretty neat! But usually, isn't the homemade stuff extra thick and syrupy?" the anthro asked, earning a chuckle and nod from Anju. "Typically. But Talon; the bartender at the Milk Bar, taught me how to properly make drinks as thanks for giving him a place to stay free of charge when he locked himself out of his home again."

Kiba snickered and gave Naruto an impish glance. "Sounds familiar..."

"Ah, stick a dog treat in it..." responded Naruto.

Anju playfully scratched Kurama's long ear, making the young kit giggle warmly and making the woman smile before she took a step back and said, "If there's anything else you boys need, just lemme know. Otherwise, hope you enjoy!" With that, she once again took her leave.

Kurama sighed with great relief. "Phew...I thought she was gonna be mad at me...but she's an even nicer lady than I already thought!" Akamaru wagged his tail and barked in agreement. Tell me about it! I keep expecting her to come back nursing an injured animal back to health! Hunter laughed and nodded in agreement. "Yeah, she's great. I'm glad things worked out for her and Kafei in the end..." Internally, the wolf was scowling angrily. And to think, that miserable dirtbag Sakon had the nerve to steal their wedding mask and even try to lock Kafei in his hideout forever...eh, whatever, least he got what he deserved...

Shaking that thought off, he smiled happily, once again being greeted by the zesty scent of Cuccoo. "Well, boys, how about we get back to giving these birds a nice home?" At this, Kurama smiled wide and said, "Heehee, you mean our tummies?" Hunter nodded and playfully pet the kits' head, earning a happy giggle from the youth. "You know it, kiddo."

With that, Hunter, Kurama, Naruto and Akamaru immediately dove right back into their birds. Kiba, on the other hand, grabbed his pitcher and, with some struggling, much to Hunter's amusement, poured himself a cup of soda, then said, "Y'know, Kurama, the other thing that was really awesome was seeing how fast you managed to gulp down all that soda at once." At this, Kurama gulped down a hearty mouthful of white meat and smiled at the dog-nin. "Heehee, thanks, Kiba! It was just so yummy that I...couldn't help myself." Naruto chuckled and nodded in agreement. "I outta try this homemade soda stuff out for myself," the blonde said. He then grabbed his cup and held it towards Hunter. Taking the hint, the wolf chuckled and poured Naruto's cup to the brim. However reluctant, Kurama nervously held his cup towards Hunter as well.

"P-pretty please...?" the kit asked eagerly but nervously.

Taken a bit back by the cuteness, Hunter cleared his throat and forced a smile. "B-but of course!" he said and poured the kit a drink, near the brim again. "Thanks, Mister Hunter!" Kurama said gratefully, taking a cautious and mild sip, giggling gleefully as he felt that familiar, bubbly sensation slide down his throat, then resumed digging into his bird. Looking away, Hunter pounded his chest and gasped slightly. Oh great beard of Odin! How can something be THAT naturally adorable? How I say?! HOW?!

Once again oblivious, Kiba nudged Naruto and, a bit mischievously, added, "Like I was sayin', I ain't ever seen no one drink soda that fast before. But I bet I can wolf this cup down pretty close to that speed." Naruto snorted and said, "Pfft, as if. I could gulp my cup down WAY faster than you!"

"Oh yeah? Then put your money where your mouth is!"

"That a challenge, dog breathe?"

"You bet your dumb ass it is, dumbass!"

Hearing this, and never once taking his maw off the delicious bird. Akamaru chuckled to himself, tail wagging as he did. Heeeeere we go...again...

No sooner than that, both boys clutched their cups and immediately started guzzling the contents of their respective cups down...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Naruto and Kiba get competitive with the soda

choices: They finish, and Kurama wants to thank the chef
They finish, and they spend a few minutes resting
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Kurama, even as he continued digging into his Cuccoo, watched with rapt attention as Naruto and Kiba gulped their glasses of cola down like there was no tomorrow. Thin rivulets of the liquid ran down the sides of their mouths, but neither paid it any mind, instead glaring at each other as they guzzled their fizzy drinks. Wow, they're both drinking it so fast, Kurama thought, forking a large piece of white meat into his mouth as he watched. Wonder who's gonna finish first... The kit suddenly giggle, even as he chewed. Well, whoever wins, bet they're gonna be burpin' really loud... The young Nine-Tails swallowed, grabbing his own cup of soda and taking a sip, giggling as he did so. Heehee, it's so fizzy and bubbly!

Ignorant of Kurama's musings, Naruto and Kiba continued gulping away, each eager to finish first. Naruto narrowed his eyes as he glared at Kiba. No way in hell am I gonna let us tie again! the boy thought, guzzling away. Kiba, in turn, scowled back.

I'm not gonna let this idiot win! Kiba thought determinedly, tilting his glass back further.

Akamaru glanced up from his Cuccoo to glance at the two. Oh wow, looks like they're at about the same pace, the dog noted, wagging his tail. Probably gonna be another tie...

Hunter, ripping off a piece of drumstick, smiled. Wow, it looks like it's gonna be really close; wonder if they're gonna tie again...

Kurama continued to watch eagerly, swishing his tails a bit. "Keep going, Naruto!" the kit piped, grinning. "You're doin' great!"

At this, Naruto diverted his attention to the kit, eagerly leaning forward in his seat. Though unable to say anything (as he was still drinking,) the boy smiled warmly at his fuzzy friend. Heh, don't you worry, Kurama; dog-breath doesn't stand a chance!

Unfortunately, as he'd been smiling at Kurama, he'd slowed up a bit on his cola consumption. Kiba, having still been focused on his soda, noticed this...and smirked. Heh, keep your eye on the ball, Naruto... Eyes gleaming, he tilted his glass even further back, guzzling down the liquid as fast as he could.

Naruto, sensing something off, looked to the side...and spluttered as he saw Kiba chugging away. Wh-what?! How the hell did he get ahead of me?! Scowling, he redoubled his efforts, attempting to regain his lead.

Kurama shrank back in his seat a bit, ears wilting. This was not lost on Hunter, who glanced over him with concern. "You OK there, kiddo?"

Kurama nodded. "Y-yeah; it's just, well, I just wanted to cheer Naruto on, and he fell behind 'cause of me..."

Hunter smiled warmly at the kit. "If you're worried he's gonna be mad if he loses, don't be; he knows you're a great little fella." He winked at the young fox. "Besides, it's all in good fun."

Kurama smiled bashfully, blushing a bit beneath his fur. "I-I guess you got a point, Mr. Hunter..."

Meanwhile, Naruto and Kiba continued chugging away, and despite Naruto's best efforts, Kiba maintained his lead. Naruto, noticing this, scowled, and chugged faster and faster. Hunter, Kurama, and Akamaru found themselves riveted, eager to see who would finish first. Faster and faster they guzzled, and lower and lower the amount of cola in their respective cups became, until...

"Ahhhh, that was good!"

Naruto lowered his nearly-depleted cup to gape at Kiba, the young dog-nin emptying the last view drops of soda into his mouth and slamming it to the counter. N-no way!

Kiba licked his lips, fixing Naruto with a triumphant smirk. "Ah, don't be like that, Naruto; you shoulda known you couldn't beat my speed." He folded his arms, his smirk growing even more cheeky. "You were doomed from the start!" The dog-nin let out a rather loud belch, but rather than blush, he rubbed his stomach contentedly. "Ahh, there we go..."

Naruto glared at his friend. "Hey, I woulda won if I hadn't been distracted..."

"...sorry."

At this, Naruto glanced over at Kurama, who had once again shrunk back in his chair, his ears lowering. Almost immediately, his annoyance vanished. "H-hey, what's wrong, buddy?"

Kurama gulped. "W-well, it's just, if I hadn't cheered you on, you wouldn'ta been distracted, and you mighta won." Then, to Naruto's shock, the kit hung his head in shame. "I-I'm sorry."

Hunter, concerned, opened his muzzle to reassure the kit that he hadn't done anything wrong, but Naruto beat him to it. "What're ya sorry for?"

"H-huh?" Hesitantly, Kurama lifted his head up to look back at Naruto.

Naruto, seeing he had the kit's attention, grinned. "You really think I'd be mad that you were cheering for me?" He shrugged. "Hell, it's my own fault I slowed down; you don't have anything to worry about."

The kit blinked, a small, hopeful smile coming to his muzzle. "...really?"

Laughing, Naruto leaned forward in his chair. "Of course; you're my buddy, aren't ya?" As he said this, he raised an arm up and reached it across the table, clenching his hand into a fist. Hope he at least knows what to do...

Thankfully, Kurama, after staring hesitantly at the fist, smiled and reached his own fist across the table, bumping his with Naruto's . "Of course I am!" the kit replied, his smile becoming a full-on beam. "And you're my buddy too, Naruto!"

Hunter, Kiba, and Akamaru watched this exchange, more than a little touched. Wow, they've really become tight in just a couple days, haven't they? Akamaru woofed, looking up at Kiba. Chuckling, the dog-nin scratched Akamaru's fuzzy head. "They sure have, pal."

Turning his head away, Kiba scowled a bit. S'not fair Kurama can't stay like this forever, the dog-nin thought. He shouldn't hafta go back to being a monster...

Hunter noticed this and winced, having an idea of what was going through Kiba's head. Eager to change the subject, he grinned and said, "Not to butt in, but we still got a lotta these birdies left; wouldn't want 'em to go cold, would we?" Then, to emphasize, he dug back into his own Cuccoo. Seeing this, the four youths grinned and did the same.

As time went on...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: One of them finishes before the other

choices: The gang drop by the kitchen to thank the chef
They decide to ask Anju about the chef first
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
As if reinvigorated with newfound hunger, all five resumed tearing into their roasted Cuccoos like nobodies business. Tearing at the drumsticks, to forking down ample, juicy chunks of white meat as well. As they did, Kurama glanced at his drink, his Cuccoo, and then...down at the peas and mashed potatoes. Still screwing his muzzle with disapproval, he stuck his tongue at the 'dreaded' veggies, but then stopped and thought for a moment.

Hunter had assured him the Cuccoo would be delicious, and it was beyond one of the yummiest meats he'd ever tasted. Then Naruto assured him he'd like soda, and it was not only sweet and yummy, but bubbly and fizzy and felt really tingly and funny going down his throat and into his tummy.
