So, no matter how much the young kit may have absolutely detested the very idea of veggies on his fork, Hunter and Ms. Anju both assured him that these peas would be yummy too, and Ms. Anju was a really nice lady, she wouldn't lie, neither would Hunter, who even suggested he add them to his mashed potatoes. And so, despite himself, he mustered a bit of courage and proceeded to mix his peas in with his mashed potatoes. Seeing this, Hunter stopped for a moment and glanced curiously at the young kit.

"Hehe, takin' my advice, eh, kiddo?"

Kurama giggled softly and nodded, still admittedly a bit nervous, since he'd always gagged anytime he ever tried to have veggies. "I still think all veggies are icky...b-but you said these would taste better, especially mixed with the mashed potatoes, so...t-time to see..."

The kit gulped nervously as he took a forkful of peas laden mashed potatoes, earning the attention of the other three youths as they saw the young Tailed-Beast slowly raise his fork to his muzzle, and reluctantly, open wide.

Kiba turned towards Naruto and nudged him slightly with his elbow. "Pssst, least if he don't like 'em, it'll be hilarious, right?" Kiba whispered, earning snickers from both Naruto and Akamaru. Hunter, on the other hand, just watched with confidence as the kit slowly bit down on the contents of his fork, pulled the fork away, and ever so slowly, started chewing with an initially pained and reluctant squinting expression on his face.

But then, his chewing softened, and his eyes widened, earning a smirk from Hunter as Kurama continued chewing with an almost curious look on his face. Then, he gulped.

"So, how were those 'icky' peas, kiddo?" Hunter asked, already knowing the answer.

And to confirm this, the kit's muzzle formed a hesitant smile. "They...a-actually...tasted, really, really....really yummy!" The others gaped with surprise, admittedly, neither one having touched their veggies either. "They are?" Naruto asked, legitimately curious as the kit bobbed his head up and down, and immediately dove in for another forkful, now adding it with a piece of white meat. "Yuh-huh! Like, it's all warm and buttery and salted just right! And added to the mashed potatoes, it just tastes like pure yummy-ness!"

Akamaru snickered to himself at that last remark, but proceeded to lap some peas down and beam himself. Well, I'll be! He's dead on the money with these peas! Hearing that, Kiba took a forkful himself, gulped it down and lit up. "Holy crap, these taste great! I think I can even taste a bit'uh lemon pepper too!" Naruto; not one to be left out, proceeded to join them, face lighting up in the same way as the others as they all proceeded to wolf down their peas and mashed spuds.

Hunter just folded his arms behind his head and leaned back, smiling as he did. "And that is why you don't doubt the wolf, boys." And in no time at all, he proceeded to resume wolfing down his meal right alongside his (currently) younger companions. It was an ample amount of food to be consumed in one go, but the sheer surplus of flavor brought from everything; be it the Cuccoo, the peas, the mashed potatoes, and even the soda, it all just too good for anyone to want to slow down.

Of course, as more and more of their meals began to deplete, gradually, all their tummies started to really show just how much all five were putting away. By the time their plates and birds had all been picked bone dry, Naruto, Kiba, Kurama and Hunter's stomachs had all rounded out into a noticeable bulge within their shirts; shirts which just barely contained their larger stomachs. Little Akamaru's tummy had rounded out to where it looked like the pup had swallowed a whole grapefruit. But not a single one minded.

Utterly satisfied, all four leaned back and sighed happily while Akamaru rested on the table besides Kiba, letting his tongue stick out happily as he rested on his side.

"Ohhh man," sighed Naruto happily as he rubbed his belly with content, "that was a helluva meal..." Hunter chuckled and gave the boy a wink. "Not too shabby for your first taste'uh Terminan cuisine, huh."

Kurama licked his chops and nodded merrily, giving his own bloated belly a few happy pats, which once again, inadvertently caused Kurama to burp rather loudly. Once again, the young Kyuubi blushed and excused himself, clamping a paw over his mouth a bit sheepishly, but Naruto just snickered and playfully reached over and nudged the kits' shoulder. "Ah, c'mon, buddy, don't be embarrassed. Trust me, around us, you can cut as loose as ya like." To emphasize this point, Naruto thumped his fist into his chest and let out a much louder belch, grinning childishly afterwards. "Ahh, see?"

The kit giggled with amusement, then, seeing Naruto's silly smile, burst into a fit of laughter. "Heehee, that was awesome!" Kurama exclaimed merrily as the blonde smiled back at him and chuckled. Kiba and Akamaru just laughed softly amongst themselves while Hunter watched the young blonde and fox kit continuing to get along so playfully and felt his heart melting, seeing their happy faces.

Shortly after, Kurama rested both paws on his tummy and smiled, examining his empty plate. "That really WAS one of the yummiest meals I've ever had. I can't believe how good everything tasted!" The kit exclaimed, earning nods of agreement table round. "No arguments there, Kurama," exclaimed Kiba, rubbing his tummy in satisfaction. Then, Kurama's face lit up as Anju returned, smiling as always.

"So, how was your meal?" the redheaded woman asked, fairly confident in their answer. "Yummiest meal I've ever had!" Kurama eagerly exclaimed, earning a chuckle from Anju as she playfully ruffled the kits head, earning a giggle from the young creature. "Well, I'm very glad you enjoyed yourselves," she said with a smile as she proceeded to grab the plates on the table. She was about to reach for Kurama's when he grabbed it and held it up to her. "Here ya go, Ms Anju! Do you need any help taking the dishes away?" the fox kit asked, earning a warm smile from the elder woman. "Well, aren't you just the most adorable, well mannered, little creature I've ever met!" she said, earning a bashful giggle from the young Tailed-Beast. "I appreciate the offer, but I've got it, little fella." She smiled gratefully and took his plate.

Then, before she could leave, the kit raised his paw up. "Ooh! Ms. Anju? I, umm, I was wondering...w-would it be alright if we thanked the chef in person for making such a yummy meal?"

Surprisingly, Anju's expression suggested some hint of reluctance, but, nevertheless, she shrugged, arms gracefully full of plates, and said, "S-sure, he should still be in the kitchen. Should still be there if you want to thank him, or tip him. Just...try not to say something that'd offend him...he's...a bit sensitive..."

She once again thanked her customers and took her leave, leaving Hunter curious. Huh, wonder what that was about...

Nevertheless, he worked a smile and rose to his feet, giving his own bloated midsection a hearty pat as he said, "Well, I, for one, am with the kid, and would love to thank the man responsible for so delightful a meal! Shall we?"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: They finish, and Kurama wants to thank the chef

choices: Anju walks in and tries to smooth everything over
Hunter calms down and explains the situation
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
At the nods from the others, Hunter chuckled. "Great!" He winced a bit. "Just, uh, lemme make some room..." Maneuvering his paws under his rounded belly, he fumbled with his belt buckle a bit.

Kurama tilted his head. "Are you taking your belt off, Mr. Hunter?"

Smiling, the wolf shook his head. "Nah; we ate a lot, but not that much. This bad boy's staying on for now." He undid his belt, holding both ends in his paws. "Still, things are startin' to get a little tight, so I gotta make a few adjustments..." As he said this, he brought both ends of his belt back together. Threading the leather strip through the metallic buckle, he tugged it upward a bit. Once it was threaded through to his satisfaction, he put the metal bit of the buckle through, with notably less notches below it than before. Straightening it out, he sighed. "Ahhhh....that's better," the wolf muttered, giving his belly a few hearty pats. He suddenly belched, eliciting a giggle from the boys, especially Kurama.

Kurama snickered. "Heh, 'scuse you." Then, before Hunter could reply, his expression brightened. "So, can we go thank the chef now?"

Hunter winked back at him. "But of course." Something suddenly occurred to him. "One thing, though; maybe I should lead."

Kiba scowled, folding his arms. "Huh? How come?"

Hunter scratched the back of his head. "Well, Anju said he's kinda sensitive and cranky, and as great as you all are..." Kiba smirked at this, while Naruto and Kurama beamed happily. "...tact isn't exactly your strong suit." He folded his arms behind his head. "Don't worry, though; once I've tested the water, you can all take turns thanking him."

Giving his belly one final pat, he strolled past the boys and indicated a direction with his paw. "Well, boys, shall we go thank the man behind the meal?" At the eager nods from the youths, Hunter chuckled and motioned again, leading the way.

Soon, they made their way to the kitchen's entrance, barred only by a wooden door that was cracked open ever-so-slightly. Smiling, Hunter opened his muzzle...but faltered as he saw Kurama almost vibrating with anticipation. Wow, the little guy really wants to thank the chef, doesn't he? He shrugged. Well, I guess there's no harm in it...

He looked down at the kit and smiled. "Tell ya what, kid; why don't you say hi first?" He ruffled Kurama's head. "Cranky or not, I'm sure he'd appreciate someone who enjoyed his cooking as much as you did..."

Kurama grinned. "Really?!" Then, a bit less enthusiastically, he turned toward Naruto, Kiba ,and Akamaru. "Uh, are you guys OK if..."

Naruto smirked. "Go for it, Kurama!" Kiba said nothing, but gave a thumbs-up while Akamaru barked his agreement.

Smiling warmly at them, Kurama walked up to the door and knocked softly on it. "'Scuse me? Mr. Chef?"

There was nothing for a moment. Then...

"Yeah, whaddaya want, kid?"

Kurama recoiled, a bit taken off-guard by the chef's coarse manner. Hunter blinked, but for another reason entirely. The door had muffled the voice somewhat, but the could have sworn he'd heard it before....

Kurama shook himself and straightened, smiling. "S-sorry to bother you, Mister! I just wanted to thank you for such a yummy meal, and..."

"Quit tryin' ta butter me up, kid," the chef's voice called again. Naruto and Kiba gaped at the chef's rudeness. Not the most friendly guy, is he? Akamaru yipped. Hunter nodded his head, only half-paying attention. Alright, I KNOW I've heard that guy's voice before...

Kurama's eyes widened. "I-I'm not tryin' to butter you up, Mister; I just wanted to say thanks..."

"You wanna say thanks?" the chef replied shortly. "Leave a tip!"

Kurama's smile vanished entirely, and he slouched down. "B-but I just..." Then, to everyone's alarm, tears started to gather in his eyes.

Putting aside the nagging recognition in his mind, Hunter moved to comfort Kurama, but before he could, Naruto glared at the door, balling up his fists. "Hey, watch it, you jerk!" the boy shouted. "He was just trying to thank you!"

The voice scoffed. "Kid, it's my job; no point in thanking me. And if your buddy has a problem, let HIM speak up about it! Little putz..." Naruto spluttered, and Kiba's eyes narrowed as he, too, walked up to the door.

"Hey, piss off, ya jerk! No one calls him an idiot but me!" the young dog-nin protested, drawing an annoyed (yet somehow touched) look form the blonde. Akamaru said nothing, but simply growled. Hunter, though, was still preoccupied with the voice. That voice...it almost sounds like...no, it can't be, there's no way he'd be here....

The chef's voice came from the door, noticeably angrier. "You're tellin' me to piss off, ya little twerp?!"

Kiba clenched his fists. "You're damn right I am!" the boy shouted. "You wanna fight about it, or are ya too chicken?"

Wiping his eyes and sniffling a bit, Kurama looked at Kiba. "K-Kiba, c'mon, you don't have to..."

The chef's irate voice sounded again. "Yeah right! C'mon, let's me and you throw down, right here, right now!"

Kurama's eyes widened. "G-guys, I..."

"Bring it on!" Naruto shouted, glaring at the door.

Hunter simply shook his head. N-no, it can't be...

"Alright, fine, I'm coming out!" The voice replied, sounding riled up. Several footsteps sounded, growing louder as they drew near the door...though the group noted the footfalls were surprisingly light.

Suddenly, the door swung wide open. "Alright, ya buncha jackasses, ya wanted me? Here I...am?"

The chef, stepping out of the door, simply stood and stared at the children as the door swung shut behind him, specifically the young Nine-Tails wearing a shirt and pants. However, that was nothing compared to the confusion at the sight that greeted them.

Standing before them was, of all things, a bipedal raccoon, no more than three feet in height. He wore an stained white apron that covered both his front and his back, with a fairly tall chef's hat perched between his ears. He was wearing no sleeves of any kind, and his clawed feet were similarly bare.

The raccoon stared at them blankly for a moment. "What in the hell..." he muttered, scratching one of his ears. "What's with the weird looking Keaton...?"

"...Rocket?"

At the faint voice, the raccoon's-Rocket's-head snapped up. "Yeah, that's my name, what about i---HUNTER?!"

The raccoon's dark eyes promptly flew wide open as he laid eyes on the anthro, the wolf gaping back at him, muzzle dropping wide open.

As the two stared at each other, Naruto nudged Kiba. "Hey, isn't he that guy Hunter showed us earlier?"

Kiba nodded. "Yeah; wonder what he's doing here...?" Kurama, having no idea what the two were talking about, simply tilted his head.


Neither wolf nor raccoon said anything for a moment. Then, their eyes widened further, they pointed at one another, and yelled:

"What the HELL are you doing here?!"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: The gang drop by the kitchen to thank the chef

choices: Suddenly, the young kit is greeted a large, unusually 'wodden' being...
A certain someone steps outside to "apologize"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
"Uh-uh, I asked you first!" said Rocket, causing Hunter to raise an eyebrow.

"Uhhh, we asked at the same time," replied Hunter.

"Uhhh, I'm sorry, you help save an entire freakin' galaxy from some whacked out, turbo-charged jerkass? No? Well, til you do, I do believe I asked first." declared Rocket, earning a sigh from the anthro as he shook his head. "You can't use that to win EVERY argument you ever get into..."

Rocket grinned slyly and folded his arms together. "Helped me get outta intergalactic jury duty..."

Meanwhile, the four youths just stared at this exchange, utterly dumbfounded and lost, though Kurama was still occasionally sniffing sadly from the raccoons sharp comments earlier.

Finally, with an annoyed grunt, Hunter rolled his eyes and was about to answer, but Naruto gritted his teeth at the smug look on the raccoons face and marched forward. "How about YOU tell us what the hell your damn problem is!"

Hunter winced inwardly. He was so surprised to see Rocket not only in Termina, but working an honest job...quite well in fact, that he'd almost forgotten about the things Rocket said that got everything so riled up to begin with. "You seriously wanna start with me again, you lil punk?" barked Rocket sharply, causing Naruto to growl angrily as he stepped closer. "You're damn right I do! What kinda jerk is THAT mean to someone just trying to thank them for making something they really enjoyed?!"

Rocket scoffed then turned his attention to Kurama. "Oh, you really enjoyed my cooking? Well, la-dee-freakin'-da! What, like your opinion's so important that you just GOTTA lemme know that you APPROVE 'uh my cookin'?! You think you're better than me?! That it, ya snooty lil Keaton brat?! Fine. Tell ya what, your highness," Rocket stopped then marched over to the little coffee table near the kitchen door and grabbed a large, empty jar, labeled, 'TIPS' then placed it down before the young Tailed-Beast. "You wanna thank me? You wanna brighten my day with sunshine and stinkin' roses? THAT'S how ya do it! Cause words ain't worth SQUAT...'specially from some funky lookin' Keaton runt!"

By the time Rocket's surprisingly lengthy rant had concluded, Kurama's ears and head had lowered considerably as the young kit looked down, teary eyed. In contrast, however, Naruto, Kiba and Akamaru were fuming, and about ready to show this raccoon the meaning of respect with their fists. (Or in Akamaru's case; teeth) But before things could get any worse, Anju dropped in and intervened just in time.

"What in the name of the Goddess is going on here?" asked Anju as she stepped towards the heated scene. Immediately, Naruto stepped forward and pointed a digit angrily at Rocket. "This guy's a total jerk!" Kiba nodded then said, "Our friend just wanted to thank him for making a meal he enjoyed so much, and your chef basically told us all to piss off!" Anju saw the tearful and hurt expression on the young Kyuubi's once merry and joyful face, and a look of concern suddenly grew over hers.

Hunter raised a paw to interject, but Rocket spoke up first. "ACTUALLY, I told the kid he could tip me...THEN I basically told him to piss off." He then shrugged innocently and added, "See? Kids; can't trust their words for squat."

Anju simply sighed. "Gentlemen, I'm truly sorry for this. I should have known something like this would happen," she said as she turned to Rocket, looking slightly more stern as she added, "Mr. Rocket, I thought we'd already had this discussion; you CAN'T pick fights with our customers. I'm accommodating you and your large, wooden friend free of charge for your culinary talents and letting you keep all the tips...DESPITE the fact that you tried to convince me that you needed my grandmothers wheel chair to get around the kitchen!" At this Rocket turned away and did his best to retain a few snickers. Even Hunter couldn't help but one cackle accidentally slip; admittedly always amused whenever Rocket would pull a stunt like that.

But nevertheless, Anju concluded the sentiment by saying, "The very least you can do is show a little respect to our customers."

Rocket raised an eyebrow and said, "Hey, it's not like they respect ME! All I get are 'thank you's' and 'nice cookin'.' Do you see a single stinkin' tip for the effort?"

Before Rocket could add anything further, the sound of a few items clinking against glass caught everyone's ears. They all turned and saw Kurama reaching from his bag and dropping several blue Rupees and a purple one into the jar, still looking down as he said, "Thank you. Everything tasted really good. I'm sorry for bothering you..." With that, Kurama turned around and slowly walked outside on all fours; shoulders slumped and ears lowered as he did.

Naruto, Kiba, Akamaru, Hunter, even Anju glanced at the poor retreating creature with a mixture of concern and sympathy. Rocket, being Rocket, was about to snort and mock cry, when he saw just what was in his jar. Wait, the blue ones are worth five a pop...and the purple one's...ain't that worth fifty...? the raccoon thought. How dumb does that kid gotta be to leave a tip THAT high? He really, liked my cookin' THAT much...?

Then, Rocket glanced back Kurama's general direction, and his previously stern expression softened a bit as he scratched the back of his head, almost a bit shamefully.

...Ah crap...

He then looked back up and saw all five glaring back at him.

Double crap...

Outside, on the other hand, was another image entirely, as Kurama sat on all fours, ears and head lowered with eyes clamped shut, and tears streaming down his cheeks. S-stupid...Ms. Anju said we should be careful bothering him...w-why couldn't I just listen...? Why'd I hafta go and spoil the fun for everyone again...? *Sniff* Shukaku was right, I AM just a big...dumb...b-baby... The kit mused internally, and proceeded to sniffle more...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Anju walks in and tries to smooth everything over

choices: When they go inside, the others are still arguing and don't notice them at first
They go inside, and the argument immediately grinds to a halt
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
The kit scrunched his eyes shut tighter, the tears refusing to abate. W-why was Mister Rocket being so mean to me? The kit sniffled again. I-I wasn't sayin' I was better than him; all I wanted to do was thank him for makin' such a yummy meal... Kurama's body shook as a sob escaped him. I-I wasn't tryin' to be snooty or anything... True, sometimes he'd liked to tell Shukaku that since he was the most powerful Tailed Beast-the Old Man had told him this himself-the fact that he had nine tails proved this fact, but that had mainly been to get the One-Tail to stand down whenever his teasing or insults got to be too much. It wasn't like he actually thought he was better than any of the others; Kokuo was faster and physically stronger than he could ever hope to be, Isobu was the best swimmer he'd ever known, Choumei (at least according to the Old Man) would get to fly once he was all grown up...

Wh-why would Mister Rocket call me snooty? Letting out another sob, he brought a foreleg up to his face and, suddenly overcome with emotion, began crying in earnest into his orange fur. A-and why would he think I was sayin' I was better than he was...? Another sob wracked his body, and he shook, the tears continuing to flow.

Suddenly, the black space created by his closed eyes grew darker, as though something was blocking the light. H-huh? Kurama thought through his cries and sniffles. I-is it gettin' cloudy,? Wiping his eyes and taking a few shaky breaths to get his crying down a bit, he blinked open his red, puffy eyes, shaking his head to clear the film that his tears had created over it. Sniffling, he glanced up...and his eyes promptly widened as he saw exactly what was blocking the sun.

The creature, for that is what it was, was tall...really, really, REALLY tall, even taller than Mister Hunter...but that was not what was most surprising about it. No, it was more the fact that the creature appeared to be, for all intents and purposes, a walking tree.

It was shaped like a person, at least-two arms, two legs, a head with eyes and a mouth-but everything other than that was totally different. Its eyes were dark, it had no nose or hair, but most shocking of all, it appeared to be made entirely out of wood, its limbs composed of thick branches that twisted together to form arms and legs. These arms were, currently, holding a rather large basket with what appeared to be assorted cooking ingredients-fruits, veggies, meats, and the like-but Kurama took no note of the specifics. No, he was focused more on the fact that the massive creature was looking down at him, its dark eyes studying him curiously as its head tilted a bit.

At this, Kurama lost his nerve a bit, getting up and slowly backing away from the imposing tree-man. "Wh-who are you?"

The creature studied him for a few more seconds...before its mouth slowly curled up into a smile. Then, it opened its mouth, and said:

"I am Groot."

A bit shocked that the creature could talk, Kurama once again sat down, though he was still tense, ready to run at any given moment. "H-hi, Mister G-Groot," the young Nine-Tails stammered. "I-I'm Kurama..."

The creature-Groot- nodded a bit, before, to Kurama's surprise, it bent down, set the basket on the ground, and knelt down to try to get down to his level (though he still towered well above the kit), and looked him in the eyes, smiling warmly. "I am Groot."

Kurama blinked slowly. "N-nice to m-meet you too, Mister Groot," the kit replied, his unease starting to let up the tiniest bit. "U-um, you're not gonna hurt me or anything, are you?" At this, Groot's eyes widened a bit, before the smile returned and he nodded. Kurama sighed in relief. "O-OK, good..."

Suddenly, without warning, another sob wracked his body, and he grit his teeth as more tears exited his eyes; once the shock had begun to wear off, his hurt had begun returning in full force

Groot, seeing this, tilted his head. "I am...Groot?"

Sniffling, Kurama nodded. "Y-yeah, I-I'm OK..." He winced inwardly as another tear tracked its way down his fur, revealing the lie to his statement.

Frowning, Groot reached a hand out. Kurama's eyes widened, and he recoiled a bit...only for the hand to come rest on his shoulder (encompassing the whole thing in the process.) "I am Groot?"

Kurama shook a bit. "Wh-why am I crying?" he repeated, wiping his eyes again. "Y-you're not gonna be interested..."

"I am Groot." The tree-man's next utterance came out still sounding kind and caring, but oddly firm.

Kurama stared back at Groot, surprised. "Y-you really wanna know?" Groot nodded, the smile returning to his face. Seeing how interested the creature was, Kurama couldn't help but smile a bit himself, even as tears continued tracing down his fur. "W-well, my friends and I just had a really, really, yummy meal, and we went to thank the chef, but..."

Groot's eyes widened for a moment before his shoulders slumped and he sighed. "I am Groot..."

Kurama gaped. "Y-you know Mister Rocket?"

Groot nodded. "I am...Groot." he replied, sounding oddly resigned.

Kurama's eyes widened. "Y-you're his friend?" Groot nodded again, still looking resigned, but he could not quite help but smile.

Kurama sniffed again. "Th-then...can you tell me why he was so mean to me n' my friends?" Before Groot could reply, the kit found himself continuing. "I-I mean, I just wanted to thank him 'cause it was the yummiest meal I ever ate, but he yelled at me 'n called me snooty..." Kurama's body shook as the sniffles intensified. "...a-an' he said that thanks don't mean anything, a-and that I thought I was better than him..." he sobbed a bit, the tears coming in stronger. "...a-an' that we didn't respect him, a-and that I was a runt, and..."

The kit gasped as a vine slowly extended from Groot's body, reaching for his face. He jerked a bit, but his fear became surprise as it slowly reached up to his eyes and wiped a few tears away, the tree-man smiling warmly all the while. "I am Groot," he said softly. Kurama gaped, awed at the sheer kindness the creature was treating him with even though they'd only just met. He looked up toward the entrance of the inn. "I am Groot."

Kurama's eyes widened. "Y-you're gonna talk to him?"

Groot nodded. "I...am Groot." Then, to Kurama's surprise, he smiled, reached out...and seized the fox kit. The kit yelped a bit as he was placed gently on the hulking creature's shoulder. Once Kurama was securely in place, Groot nodded and stood back up. He looked at the befuddled fox kit. "I am Groot?"

Kurama, still a bit confused, nonetheless managed a smile. "Y-yeah; let's go..." Nodding and smiling, Groot headed inside, the kit still perched on his shoulder....
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: I am Groot

choices: "Well, all that fighting kinda made us hungry.  What else can ya cook?"
"What kinda desserts can you bake...?"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Groot and Kurama headed towards the cafeteria, but stopped as they heard more bantering between all parties. Kurama, upon hearing the fighting intensify, shrunk a bit atop his 'seat', which Groot sensed.

"I...am Groot?"

The kit looked down shamefully and replied, "W-well, Ms. Anju warned us that Mister Rocket was cranky...a-and my f-friends were having fun, until I-" The massive creature just smiled warmly as a vine formed besides Kurama and gently ruffled the top of the kits' fuzzy orange head.

"I am Groot..."

Hearing that, Kurama glanced back towards Groot, almost hopefully and replied, "...Y-you really don't think I did anything wrong...?"

The wood-man smiled warmly and nodded his head firmly. Kurama smiled gratefully, until the sound of something shattering startled them both. Kurama gulped nervously as the two headed onward.

Within the cafeteria, Rocket was standing atop of a large wooden box. Besides it, a shattered vase. "How's THAT for temper tantrum?!" barked Rocket furiously. Surprisingly, Anju smirked then glanced back at the others as she leaned down and whispered. "Don't worry, I keep those for stress release. Been doing it ever since I heard there was a kid running into everyone's stores and shattering their vases..." Hunter couldn't help but smirk but the three youths were not the least bit amused. Akamaru growled as he glared up at Rocket. You're lucky you're up there, or else I'd be chewing off your-

He stopped mid sentence as something caught the side of his eye. He turned and immediately yipped frightfully, startling everyone. Kiba looked down at his canine puppy pal with concern and said, "W-what is it, b-"

Like Akamaru, he and Naruto both saw what had spooked his pup...a large...REALLY large wooden man-thing, carrying a basket of ingredients, and perched atop his shoulder; Kurama.

In unison, both boys gaped as Naruto scratched the back of his head and asked, "Errr...m-makin' new friends, Kurama...?"

Rocket on the other hand, just held his arms out and said, "Bout freakin' time! I thought that old fat guy from the Carnival tried to make ya int'uh LUMBER again!" But Groot simply smiled and shook his head, ever gently releasing Kurama back down towards the floor to head back with his friends. Hunter glanced at the young fox kit with concern and asked, "H-how ya feeling, kiddo...?"

Kurama wiped a few tears from his face, but nonetheless, worked a smiled and said, "A little better, thanks to Mr. Groot." The boys once again gaped and; in unison, asked, "Groot...?"

"Oh yeah," interrupted Rocket as he held one paw towards the group then back at Groot. "Groot? Meet jerkwads. Jerkwads? Meet Groot." Hunter gave the raccoon a stern glance, but the others were too in awe at the sight of a walking tree-man to pay any heed to Rocket's rude remarks. "Errr, h-hi, Groot," said Naruto nervously. Groot simply smiled and said, "I am Groot."

The boys stared in silence for a moment, as Kiba added, "Y-yeah, we know, your jerk-ass friend just told us-"

"Who you callin' jerkass, ya little crap? Huh?! How about I smash this next-"

"I am Groot!" remarked the tree-man, rather firmly, catching Rocket's attention, and leaving the others dumbfounded. Even more so when Kurama nodded in agreement and said, "H-he's right!"

Akamaru tilted his head curiously. He's right that his name is Groot...? Y-yeah, I would imagine so...

Hunter just smirked and shook his head. "No, no, see, Groot's speech is...shall we say...limited. You can ask him anything and his answer will always be 'I am G-" He stopped mid-sentence as another thought entered his mind, and immediately, Hunter turned his attention to Kurama. "W-wait, you UNDERSTOOD him...?" The kit bobbed his head up happily. "Yuh huh! Sure did! He talked to me outside, said he'd talk to Rocket and try and calm him down."

Oblivious to this, Groot and Rocket continued conversing amongst themselves.

"I. Am. Groot!"

"Whadduya mean I gotta calm down?! I'm PERFECTLY freakin' calm!"

"I am Groot..."

"Okay, maybe I AM a little pissed off, so what?!"

"I am Groot?"

"No, dammit! Maybe the Keaton kid didn't say anything THAT bad, but his jerkwad buddies-"

Groot pointed back at Hunter curiously, earning a reluctant wave from the anthro. "Yeah, good to see you too, big guy..." He said. Groot smiled, then leaned back towards Rocket and, surprisingly quiet, asked, "I am Groot...?" Rocket shrugged and replied, "Beats me. He was about tuh tell me what he was doin' here with these annoying runts, but then the runts decided to be EXTRA annoying cause I was 'being too mean' to the Keaton kid..."

"I am...Groot...?"

"W-well, yeah, maybe I WOULD be pissed if someone were talkin' smack bout'chu 'er Quill 'er Gamora...DEFINITELY not Drax, but-t-that's different!"

"I am Groot?"

"It...it just IS, okay?! I...I dunno. Maybe it ISN'T...but-"

"I...am Groot?"

Rocket stopped for a moment, then sighed, shaking his head lowly. "No, if someone made you feel the way I made the Keaton bra...Keaton KID feel...I wouldn't show 'em any respect either...fact, I'd probably zap 'em'n beat 'em stupid with robotic arm I snagged from that blond kid in whatchumacallit, hehe..." Groot glanced down and raised what would be an eyebrow in mild disapprovement. Rocket just snickered and said, "Whaaaat? His friend made him a NEW one."

"I am Groot..."

"Ugh, y-yeah, maybe them gettin' pissed at me WASN'T completely uncalled for...b-but-"

"I am Groot?"

"Well, cause the fox kid didn't just tell me off HIMSELF! What, he didn't have the nerve to tell me off?"

"I am Groot..."

"Genuinely hurt...? The hell does that-" Rocket stopped for a moment then looked back at the kit, still a bit teary eyed from the entire exchange, then back at his tip jar, and recalled him leaving after thanking and tipping him...how it could only be described as 'broken spirited'. Then, the raccoon sighed, lowering his head a bit shamefully. "...Guess I DID get kinda carried away again, didn't I...b-but I mean come on, I didn't think people could like my freakin' cookin' THAT much...thought he was just pretendin' tuh give a crap...didn't think he was being serious...but...but I mean, come on...can ya blame me? How many times people come to thank me, see me, and call for pest control'er somethin'? They wanna praise me til they actually see me, then-"

"I am Groot?"

"W-well, no, the kid didn't react that way, he even tipped me...good tip too, and I guess...h-his stupid buddies didn't care either, just that I was being a complete..."

The raccoon scoffed to himself and shook his head. "Heh...guess I CAN be kind of a jerkass, huh..." Then; like before, Groot leaned down towards his fuzzy friend and placed an arm atop Rocket's shoulder gently as he smiled warmly at the raccoon. "I, am Groot..." Despite himself, Rocket smirked and looked back up at Groot. "Heh, ah ya big sap...you too, pal..."

Unbeknownst to either of them; with the exception of Kurama, everyone else simply gaped, utterly dumbfounded at the conversation that had just transpired. "I think I just got dumber..." remarked Naruto, utterly deadpanned. Kiba; without even paying the blonde any heed, uttered, "Not possible, bonehead..." never taking his eyes off the scene. Kurama, despite himself, couldn't help but giggle as saw his friends and Anju all looking so silly in their confusion. His smirk immediately faded however, when he found himself face to face with Rocket once again. To his surprise, the raccoon didn't appear angry, rather, he had a fairly guilty look on his face.

"Look, kid, I....I know I kinda blew up at'cha'n said some things that...well, MIGHT be considered...meanersomethin'...and...well, point'uh this whole, short term conversin' and, uhh..."

The kit simply tilted his head in utter confusion, as did the others.

"...Yup...I'm definitely feeling a brain cell or two calling it quits here," muttered Naruto.

Finally, Rocket sighed, and a bit more somberly, said, "...It ain't easy bein' different, kid. People look down at ya, make ya feel like less than ya are. I guess, ya spend so much time thinkin' y'er nuthin' that when someone says ya ain't, ya don't...really...believe 'em, or maybe, ya just get tired'uh tryin'. I dunno...all I know is, I acted like an ass' ass...and, I'm...I'm sorry. Really."

The mixed looks of confusion and anger subsided, softening a bit as the raccoon seemed genuinely apologetic...and not about to smash a vase into anyone's face. Meanwhile, Kurama; still admittedly hurt, nodded softly and fiddled his front paws together as he looked back at Rocket warmly and said, "I'm sorry too...no one should ever look down on someone for being different. That's not fair. Because...i-if a person is good, then that's all that should matter."

Naruto's previously angry expression, became a bit more sympathetic, like Rocket, he too, knew that pain all too well, but to hear Kurama say that, so genuinely to someone who had verbally lashed him out earlier, brought a warm smile to his face, along with Groot, who nodded at the kit approvingly.

Then, the kit smiled a bit warmly at the raccoon and; to Rocket's surprise, held his paw out as he said, "I heard the Old Man say this once...errr, l-let beegones be...gones...I think." Despite himself, Rocket chuckled, nodding as he reached out and shook the kit's paw. "Swing'n uh miss, but...thanks, kid..."

He then glanced back at the others. "Look, I'm sorry I acted the way I did. I was...kinda outta line, and-well, i-if there's any way I can make it up to you run-errr, kids, and ol' wolfy there, just, say the word."

The group thought for a moment...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: The others are still arguing at first upon arrival

choices: In town, the youths rope Hunter into playing with them
The youths decide to play around in the town itself
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Naruto rubbed his still-rounded tummy thoughtfully. "Hmmm...well, I know we just had a really big meal..."

Kiba patted his own belly in satisfaction. "Really? Couldn't tell..." Kurama said nothing, but poked at his belly through his flame spiral shirt, giggling at its roundness.

Naruto smiled warmly at the kit, before turning his attention back toward Rocket. "...but since it'll probably take a while, what kinda desserts can you bake?"

Rocket raised an eyebrow at the question, having just noticed their rounded tummies (and wondering if he'd need to do a Milk Bar run,) but nonetheless smirked. "Pffft, you serious? Compared to cooking, baking's the easiest damn thing in the world!" Rocket folded his arms and looked at the ceiling. "Now let's see, what can I make...oh yeah! There's cakes, pies, souffles, cookies, muffins..." He looked back at the others and smirked. "Take yer pick; I can bake damn near anything ya want."

Naruto, Kiba, and Kurama's eyes all lit up. "R-really...? An-anything we want...?" Naruto said in a low voice.

Rocket nodded. "Yep; you name it, I'll bake it."

Grinning, Naruto opened his mouth to answer, but Kiba beat him to it. "How about some pies?"

Rocket nodded. "Pies; sounds goo--"

"Hold on just a second!"

Rocket raised an eyebrow as Naruto shouldered up next to Kiba and glared at him. The dog-nin pulled back, scowling. "What the hell's your problem, Naruto?"

Naruto slugged Kiba in the shoulder. "My PROBLEM is that you just butted the hell in without seeing what any of us wanted!"

Kiba shoved Naruto back a bit. "Well, what the hell's wrong with pie?!"

Naruto shoved Kiba back. "MAYBE I feel more like cake!" Scowling, the dog-nin shoved Naruto back. Then Naruto shoved Kiba, Kiba shoved Naruto...

Kurama watched the two go at it, a bit concerned, but not overly so; he'd gotten to know them well enough that this was just how they interacted...

"I am Groot?" Ears perking, Kurama looked up at Groot, who was looking at the two boys with a mixture of befuddlement and concern.

The Nine-Tails giggled. "Nah, it's OK, Mr. Groot; they do this all the time..."

The tree-man still looked a bit confused, but nodded and continued watching the boys. The two continued arguing and shoving each other, earning a worried look from Hunter and, surprisingly, a smile from Rocket. Heh, I mighta misjudged these kids; I like 'em better already...

Nonetheless, he chose this moment to speak up. "Um, kids?" Naruto and Kiba, fistfuls of each others' shirts (or sleeveless hoodie, in Naruto's case) clenched in their hands, glanced back toward Rocket. Seeing he had their attention, the raccoon cleared his throat. "You do realize I can make both, right?"

Slowly, the both of them blinked, then looked back at each other. "...Oh," Naruto finally said, releasing Kiba's shirt. Laughing nervously as Kiba did the same to his hoodie, he turned back toward Rocket and laughed nervously, rubbing the back of his head. "S-sorry; didn't think of that..."

Kiba rolled his eyes, even as he straightened his shirt out. "You're such an idiot..."

Rocket scoffed. "Hate to break it to ya, kid, but you ain't exactly a genius either; I saw ya arguin' just the same as he was." Kiba glared at Rocket, face reddening a bit, but a whine from Akamaru got him to stand down.

Rolling his eyes, Rocket continued. "Alright, so cakes and pies...anybody else?"

Hunter tentatively raised a paw. "Erm, now that you're asking...maybe some cookies and muffins? Don't really care which flavors they are..."

Rocket nodded. "Mmhmm, so cakes, pies, cookies, muffins..." As the small creature rattled off the list, Groot looked at him curiously. That sounded like an awful lot....

Still looking at the others, Rocket looked toward the kit. "So, erm, kid..."

"You can call me Kurama," the young creature replied cheerily, beaming at the raccoon. A bit taken off guard, Rocket shook his head and continued on.

"OK, Kurama," the raccoon continued, "anything in particular ya want?"

Kurama thought for a moment. "Umm...I know it's not really something that's baked, but could you maybe make something with ice cream?" The kit brightened, his tails swishing eagerly. "I really like ice cream..."

To Groot's surprise, Rocket nodded. "Ice cream; got it!" He looked amongst the five travelers. "Any more requests?"

Surprised that the previously grouchy creature was being so agreeable, Akamaru nonetheless decided to take a chance. Umm...I dunno if you can understand me, but could we maybe have some donuts too?

To his relief, the raccoon nodded. "Gotcha!" He held a hand up. "Alright, so lemme see if I got this right..." He ticked off each request on a digit. "Cakes, pies, cookies, muffins, somethin' with ice cream, and doughnuts. That sound about right?"

More than a bit surprised that Rocket wasn't complaining or snarking at them, Hunter nonetheless managed a nod. "Y-yeah, that's everything."

Kurama blinked, tilting his head. "A-are you sure you're OK makin' all that, Mister Rocket?"

Rocket shrugged. "Eh, place is pretty dead anyways, and I didn't have any real plans for the night, 'cept maybe hittin' the Milk Bar...ain't no big deal."

Kurama grinned. "Thanks, Mister Rocket!"

Rocket recoiled a bit, taken a bit off guard by the thanks and just how sincere it sounded, but quickly recomposed himself. "Yeah, well..." He shook his his head. "A-anyways, its probably gonna be a while, so feel free to screw around, look around town, whatever the hell you feel like doin'."

Hunter chuckled, patting his still-rounded belly. "Well, its probably a good idea to work off the Cuccoos while we have the chance....." He looked down at his young companions. "What do you kids feel like doing?"

Kurama waved a front leg in the air. "Ooh! Ooh! Can we go play?"

Hunter laughed, ruffling the kit's head. "Sure! I think there are a few parks here in Clock Town, too; nice and spacious."

Grinning, Kurama looked toward Naruto and Kiba. "You guys OK with that?"

Kiba smirked. "Yeah, I'm always up for runnin' around." Akamaru eagerly barked his agreement. Naruto grinned back at Kurama. "Sounds good, buddy!"

Kurama beamed. "Great! I'll race you guys!" Then, before any of them could react, he rushed toward the exit, running out the door. A bit befuddled, Naruto and Kiba nonetheless grinned and rushed after him, laughing merrily.

Anju, Rocket, Groot, and Hunter watched as they left. "Soooo...." Rocket began, scratching his ear. "How long ya think it'll take 'em to figure out they don't know where the hell they're going?"

Hunter chuckled. "Hopefully we won't have to find out." Smiling, he strolled toward the exit after the youths. Before he exited, though, he looked back at the others. "By the way, Rocket, thanks; that's really nice of ya."

Rocket shrugged nonchalantly. "Eh, like I said, I don't got anythin' better to do."

Hunter chuckled to himself. Sure, that's it...

Out loud, he said, "Well, see ya later, Rocket!" With that, he headed off, following the shouts and shrieks of laughter from the youths.

Once the wolf was gone, Anju turned toward Rocket, more than a bit confused. "Mr. Rocket, what was that all about?"

Groot nodded in agreement, looking down at his diminutive companion. "I am...Groot?"

Rocket smirked. "Eh, like I said, I kinda owed that kid after yellin' at him like that." He shrugged. "Plus, it'll give me an excuse to hit the Milk Bar afterwards."

Groot tilted his head. "I am Groot?"

Rocket rolled his eyes. "So I won't hafta watch them stuffin' their guts, that's why!"

Groot blinked quizzically. "I am Groot."

Rocket scowled. "I don't care that their guts go back to normal afterwards! It's. WEIRD."

Anju, though only catching half of the conversation, nonetheless spoke up as something occurred to her. "Mr. Rocket...exactly how much were you planning on making?"

At that, Rocket turned around, looked up at her...and gave a rather alarming grin. "Groot," he began, still grinning at Anju, "bring a few tables in here." His eyes gleamed. "We're going all out!"
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: "What kinda desserts can you bake...?"

choices: Kurama asks Hunter to play too.
The boys wanna try out more of the towns games.
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Hunter continued wandering down the town and smirked as he saw his young pals chasing after each other, and heading straight into North Clocktown; a section practically DESIGNED for youths, with its' ample playfield, mini-hills, sizable trees, grassy spots, and more important than any of that...a rather large slide. Hunter glanced up at it and smirked to himself. "Oh ho ho mama...now if only I had a Goron Mask...that'd launch me into rolling around for hours..."

Unbeknownst to Hunter, the boys continued racing in a close neck race, eventually reaching the center of the small field, panting and laughing merrily. "Heehee! Wow wee, that was fun!" young Kurama exclaimed merrily, catching his breath as he did. Naruto; whose face was particularly dirty, smirked and gave the kit a friendly nudge in the shoulder. "Heh, you said it, buddy! I forgot how fast you are on all four!" The kit simply giggles and rubbed the back of his head bashfully. Then the blond turned his attention to his dog-nin pal and grinned mischievously. "But you? Man, those birds must'uh added some pounds, cause you were slugging around like a...slug!" Kiba scowled and barked, "Oh, shut up! Least I didn't trip over my own two feet!" Naruto scowled back.

"H-hey! There was a stinkin' branch in the way!"

"There weren't any trees, you bonehead!"

"Yeah? W-well, that didn't stop me from beating you!"

"We. TIED...again..."

Naruto stopped for a moment and tilted his head. "...Again...?"

Another moment passed, then the two boys burst into a fit of exhausted sounding laughter. Akamaru snickered to himself as he playfully nudged Kurama. Yeah, they tied all right...tied for last place, cause I smoked them too! Kurama giggled as well, until the sight of the slide caused his eyes to widen with wonder.

"Whoa..."

Wiping his face, Naruto turned his attention to Kurama, and was about to open his mouth when he saw what his fox kit buddy was 'whoa-ing' about. Kiba and Akamaru looked up and immediately gaped at the sheer size of the slide.

"W-what is that...?" Kurama asked, still gaping. Grinning, Naruto wrapped his arm around the kits shoulder as though an older brother to a little brother and said, "That, my friend, is called a slide. You climb all the way up, and it slides you all the way down. Wanna see?" The kit immediately bobbed his head as Kiba grinned and stepped forward, picking up Akamaru and sticking him atop his head as he turned to Kurama and said, "Observe, fuzzy." He proceeded to climb the ladder, going higher and higher until reaching the very top. "Ready, boy?" asked Kiba, earning a happy and eager bark from the pup as they plopped down towards the edge, and slid right down, landing softly into the sandy part at the end, laughing all the way.

Hunter smirked and said, "Pretty sweet, isn't it." Kiba, still beaming, nodded happily at the anthro and said, "Wow, I ain't EVER been on a slide that long before...but I'll be damned if that ain't a blast!"

Grinning, Naruto turned to Kurama and asked, "Wanna give it a go?" Nodding eagerly, the kit immediately trotted over towards the ladder, climbing higher and higher...and higher and higher. Looking down for a moment, the kit realized that, this slide really was a lot higher up than it looked, almost immediately his smile lowered a bit, almost looking a bit nervous as his climbing began to slow down.

Finally, upon reaching the top, he nervously stepped forward and looked down at the slide, and immediately, the sheer distance caused his four legs to quake as he inched away from the slide. Seeing this, Naruto glanced up a bit curiously. "Hey, Kurama! You okay?" the boy asked from afar. The kit smiled nervously and nodded, but his shaking was quite apparent. Seeing this, Hunter frowned. "...The kid doesn't have a thing with heights, does he...?"

As if to answer his question, a soft kind of whimpering could be heard faintly from above. Akamaru tilted his head.

Yup...

"Don't worry, I got this," Naruto told the others and proceeded to climb up the ladder as well. Looking down, Naruto's eyes widened a bit. "Wow, this thing really IS high up," he said, but nonetheless smirked and reached the top, seeing a shivering Kurama trying to inch further away from the slide. Naruto smirked a bit then cleared his throat, startling the kit as he immediately turned around and smiled somewhat sheepishly at Naruto.

"Oh! H-hi, Naruto! I-I was just-"

"You got a thing with heights, don'tcha."

Kurama's eyes widened as he immediately shook his head. "W-what?! N-no! Heh, t-that would be silly! O-only b-babies are scared uh..." then the kit gulped nervously and nodded. Chuckling, Naruto playfully patted the kits nervous back and said, "You don't have to pretend. Everyone's scared'uh SOMETHING. You wanna know something?" The kit nervously nodded ever so slightly as Naruto rubbed the back of his head and said, "First time I tried to go on a slide...? I almost wet myself..." Despite himself, Kurama couldn't help but snicker just slightly.

"R-really...?"

"Yep..." Naruto said, knowing deep down that 'almost' didn't quite describe it, but still, he shook it off and added, "That's just how things are, y'know? Sometimes, things seem big and scary and you just wanna run as fast as you can. Then you take 'em on anyway, and you see...things ain't so scary. That's just how it is. You never know unless you try, cause if ya do, ya might find what's scary, can actually be really fun and pleasant!"

The Tailed-Beast thought for a moment then glanced back at the slide, still fearful, but nodded firmly at Naruto's encouragement. Immediately, he sat down, looked back at Naruto who smiled and gave the kit a thumbs up, and, after some internal pep talking, slid down. The kits eyes widened as the speed and momentum picked up, filling his heart with a strange rush of adrenaline as the ground seemed nearer and nearer...however, once he'd reached the bottom, he'd leaned back just slightly, and rather than land into the sand patch, LAUNCHED in the air like a boulder from a catapult. The eyes of Hunter, Kiba and Akamaru widened as they watched the little orange kit fly in the air, looking absolutely stunned...and landing straight into the grassy patch, disappearing completely.

Naruto's eyes widened with horror as he leaned down on the slide. "Oh crap! Kurama!"

Immediately, the boy slid down and rushed towards the grass as the others immediately joined him. They found a rather dirtied and dazed looking Kurama laying in the grass, and immediately, Naruto helped the poor creature up. "A-are you okay?!" the boy asked, expecting the worst, but at least thankful he appeared to be intact. To his surprise however, a smile began to form over the kits muzzle as his mouth burst open with a loud...

"Ya-HOOOOO!!!!"

The others jerked back as the kit hopped merrily in the air, pumping his fists excitedly and joyously. "That was AWESOME!!" Kurama exclaimed as he beamed happily and turned to Naruto and the others. "Didja guys see me?! Everything was moving faster and faster and then WHOOSH! I was up in the air...like a BIRD!" The others immediately sighed with relief before Naruto wiped some sweat from his brow and smiled back at the kit. "Heh, told'ja!" he said, still incredibly relieved Kurama hadn't gotten hurt, or been terrified. Then, the kit glanced around at how high the grass was and glanced back at the others, grinning almost mischievously. "Say, Kiba...remember that game you were playin' earlier...?"

Kiba glanced curiously, then said, "Oh! You mean t-AHHH!"

Before he could finish, Kurama leaped upward and pounced atop the young dog-nin, immediately rushing off.

"You're it!" the kit exclaimed merrily as he ran off. Kiba hopped up to his feet and dusted himself off. "Oooh, that was dirty, you little..." Naruto couldn't help but snicker at Kiba's pouting...what he didn't see was Kiba's impish grin as he swept Naruto onto his rump and raced off with Akamaru yipping and trotting happily besides him. "Now, YOU'RE it, bonehead!"

Naruto scowled as he saw Hunter snickering. "Ugh, falling for the same cheapshot twice in a row...? Well, the hell with that!" Immediately, the boy hopped up to his feet and raced after the dog-nin and fox kit. From afar, Hunter watched and smiled warmly as the youths continued playfully chasing and pouncing at one another like a bunch of cubs.

Then, surprisingly, his attention turned to the slide. Shifting his eyes left and right, seeing the boys were far too distracted and no one else was in sight, Hunter smirked impishly to himself. "Ah, what the hell..." Nonchalantly, the anthro strolled towards the slide as the others continued playing, and upon reaching the top, he took in the sights for just a moment, put his glasses in his pocket, took a deep, refreshing breath, and slid down, doing his best not to cheer. And; like Kurama, towards the bottom, he leaned back just enough to get launched into the air.

...UNLIKE Kurama however, the poor anthro landed face first in the grass with a resounding THUD!

Almost comically, Hunter laid sprawled, face first into the dirt, then slowly pulled his head out of the dirt, face conveniently covered in grass and dirt as he spat out a huge chunk of grass; like something out of an old cartoon, then sighed to himself. "Note to self...never slide again...without a Goron mask..."

Thankfully, no one was around to laugh, though he's sure Rocket would have definitely gotten a kick outta that. Nonetheless, he rose to his hind legs, dusted himself off, put his glasses back on...and started chuckling. "That WAS pretty epic..." he muttered to himself, wincing just slightly as he rubbed his still tender muzzle.

More time had passed as the boys continued playing without a care in the world...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Enter; North Clock Town...

choices: The wolf suddenly tackles one of the boys, prompting the others to leap in
The wolf is ambushed by the four youths, and they all begin roughhousing
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Hunter sat against a tree, arms folded behind his head and headphones secured in his ears. He bobbed his head slightly to the tunes blaring through the device, but his attention was focused on the others. He smiled as he saw Kiba tackle Naruto to the ground, only for Kurama to pounce on top of Kiba and send the three of them tumbling in a ball of arms, legs, and tails. Damn, Hunter thought as all three youths laughed joyously, They've been at this for a while, and they've STILL got energy to spare! He chuckled, adjusting his headphones a bit. They're like three little bundles of energy...

As soon as that last thought left his head, he saw a small, white blur leap up and latch onto one of Kurama's tails. The kit yelped in surprise as Akamaru's sharp puppy teeth latched onto the appendage, but it quickly turned to happy giggles as he finally disentangled himself from the pile, rushing about and tails waving, even as Akamaru clung on. Hunter snorted a bit. Make that four little bundles of energy...

In the meantime, Kurama continued rushing about, Akamaru still latched onto his tail and the boys in hot pursuit. Kurama laughed uproariously, waving his tails about faster and faster, and Hunter could not help but raise his eyebrows. Kurama had better be careful, or Akamaru's gonna go flying... Indeed, Akamaru waved about more and more, evidently starting to lose his grip. Kiba seemed to notice, because he bellowed, "Get ready to stick the landing, boy!"

Hunter blinked, giving an amused smirk. 'Stick the landing'?

No sooner had he thought that than Kurama gave a strong wave of his tails, finally breaking Akamaru's grip, The pup went flying through the air, straight toward Kiba...but the dog-nin simply grinned, tensed his legs, and leapt into the air, holding his arms out.

Hunter's eyes widened. Oh wow, look at that height. Then again, regressed or not, they're still ninja...

Giving a happy bark, Akamaru oriented himself in the air, making it so that he was soaring directly at Kiba. Beaming, Kiba grabbed the pup as he neared him and held him close to his chest, grunting as he hit the ground, only to roll upon impact.

Hunter tilted his head. Oh wow...that was pretty impressive...

Kurama, having felt Akamaru release his grip, skidded to a halt and turned his head to double check. However, this was exactly the sort of opportunity Naruto-having rushed ahead while Kiba tumbled with Akamaru- had been waiting for. As Kurama looked at his tails, Naruto closed the distance and pounced upon Kurama, eliciting a gleeful yelp of surprise from the kit as they both crashed to the ground. "Gotcha!" Naruto exclaimed triumphantly, arms pinning the little Nine-Tails to the ground.

Kurama giggled, squirming under Naruto's grip. "Oh no! Help! Help!" Both youths burst into joyful laughter at that. Then, without warning, Kurama maneuvered one of his tails upward, reaching toward Naruto's armpit. The boy's eyes widened as he felt the fuzzy tip brushing against the area. "Oh, come on, Kurama, that's loHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!" The boy dissolved into helpless laughter as Kurama swished his tails about faster and faster, the blonde's arms shaking faster and faster...that is, until Naruto lost his balance and dropped right on top of the young Nine-Tails. The creature gave a small "oof!", but as Naruto composed himself, he seemed none the worse for wear. In fact, as Naruto plante=d his arms on the grassy ground to right himself, he looked up at the boy. In turn, Naruto stared down at the young Tailed Beast. This went on for a couple seconds...before massive grins split their faces and they one again burst into uproarious laughter, Naruto allowing himself to collapse back down atop his fuzzy buddy. Still shaking with mirth, they wrapped their arms around each others' torsos and rolled about a bit, giggling and generally looking as though they were having the time of their lives.

Hunter smiled warmly. Aww, lookit them; can't believe how tight they've become... The anthro's smile deepened as he thought about their interactions over the past few days: Naruto had been incredibly supportive of Kurama, and had been more than willing to explain things to him in the friendliest way possible. Not only that, but he had been the first to defend the kit when Rocket had yelled at him. And the fact that they had started throwing their arms over each others' shoulders a lot, well... Looks like Naruto's got himself a little brother...

Eventually, the two rolled to a stop, panting and giggling in equal measure. Disentangling themselves from one other, the shakily got to their feet (and paws,) Naruto helping Kurama up. Panting, they looked at each other, smiling warmly. Kurama, in particular, looked back at Naruto with something undeniably like admiration

Hunter nodded, smiling and leaning back against the tree. {i{And it looks like Kurama's found himself a big brother...

The two spent some more time standing and catching their breath, before, finally, Kurama eased up. Getting a little closer to Naruto, he said something to him, but since they weren't shouting, Hunter couldn't tell what they were saying at this distance. Naruto, also speaking normally, replied, to which Kurama smiled, nodded...and pointed right at Hunter.

The anthro tilted his head in confusion. Are they talking about...me?

Naruto looked at Hunter, then back at Kurama, giving the kit a huge grin and a thumbs-up. Giving a cheer, Kurama thanked Naruto, turned around, and began running toward Hunter. "Mister Hunter! Mister Hunter!"

In spite of himself, Hunter chuckled at the kit's enthusiasm. "Yeah, kiddo?" he asked as Kurama skidded to a stop before him.

Kurama spent no time getting to the point. "Do ya wanna come play with us?"

Hunter jolted in surprise, his headphones tumbling out of his ears. "Y-you want me to play with you guys?"

Kurama bobbed his head. "Yuh-huh! I mean, you helped get me outta that scary place, treated me to one of the yummiest things I've ever eaten, taken us to this fun place..." The kit looked up at him, beaming. "I gotta thank you somehow, don't I?"

Chest hitching a bit at the eager expression on the kit's face, Hunter's face reddened. "W-well," he began, somewhat flustered, "I-I'm flattered, I really am, b-but I don't know i-if I'll be a good playmate, and, well, wolves play kinda rough, and..."

"C'mon, Mr. Hunter!" Kurama urged, grabbing his paw and tugging at it. "Please? It'll be really, really fun!" The kit stared straight up at the wolf, eyes wide and pleading, his smile toothy and hopeful. Hunter could only stare back, jaw slack and eyes wide.

Oh geez...how can something be THIS cute and not be deliberate?! If the kid ever thinks to use his cuteness to 'persuade' people, there are gonna be a lot of people with mush instead of hearts...

"A-alright," Hunter finally conceded. "Suppose it can't hurt..."

Kurama beamed widely at him, wrapping his forelegs around his middle in a joyful hug, "Thankyouthankyouthankyou!" the kit exclaimed. Releasing the shell-shocked wolf's torso, he turned around and rushed back to the others. "Hey, Naruto, Kiba, Akamaru! He said yes!"

Hunter stared after the young Tailed Beast, eyes still a bit dull as he pocketed his MP3. W-well...guess I better get in there... He slowly got to his hind paws and walked out into the field....
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Kurama asks Hunter to play too.

choices: Rocket has finished preparing the ultimate desserts
Rocket still needs more time to finish preparing
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Hunter approached the small field, towards little Naruto and Kurama, once again removing his eyeglasses and tucking them away safely. However, the closer he got, the more something seemed off. Both boys were unable to retain what appeared to be a rather impish look on their faces. The anthro was about to open his mouth to speak, when another dreaded thought entered his mind. "Wait a second..." the wolf began, "...where is Kib-AAAAAHHHH!!!"

Immediately, Kiba leaped from the pushes and pounced atop the wolf, causing him to tumble backwards into the grass. In no time at all, however, Hunter gained the upper hand, pinning a squirming and laughing Kiba down with with hand paws and grinning equally mischievously as he did. "Sooooo, like surprisin' people, do ya? Well, I daresay, I'm quite...'tickled' by your surprise attack, Kiba..." Hearing that, Kiba's eyes immediately widened. "Uh-oh..." the dog-nin muttered. Resisting even more to no avail, Kiba was unable to prevent the anthro from pulling up his shirt enough to expose his bare stomach...and immediately begin ticklishly fluttering his digits against the boys exposed tummy, making him burst into a hysterical fit as he squirmed helplessly.

"N-noo faAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!! C-come ohohohahahahahaHAHAHAA!!!!!!!" Kiba rambled incoherently, making Hunter's grin deepen as the tickling intensified. Watching, Kurama snickered then turned to his blonde friend and asked, "Shouldn't we help him?" But surprisingly, an impish grin grew over Naruto's face as he nodded innocently and said, "In a bit..."

However, Akamaru wasted no time intervening as he hopped atop Hunter's head and forced him off as he stumbled just a bit, allowing Kiba to recompose himself and pull his shirt back down. Grinning, Naruto nodded and said, "NOW!"

Akamaru immediately hopped off Hunter's head, leaving him befuddled and bewildered for a second or two, leaving him open enough for a two pronged pounce, courtesy of Naruto and Kurama. As he fell back down, he quickly managed to wrap his larger arms around Naruto and Kurama as the trio rolled about, all laughing merrily as they did. However, Hunter had forgotten Kurama's nine advantages, all of which immediately started brushing and fluttering against his armpit, making him laugh; albeit more contained due to being (currently) older than the rest, but enough to loosen his grip on the two as Kurama moved in on the offensive.

"Sorry, kiddo," Hunter began, grinning mischievously as he did, "but I'm not THAT ticklish..."

Kurama yelped suddenly as Hunter grasped the little fox kit and pinned him down as well. "...Are you?" In no time all, the wolf began tickling beneath the kit's tummy similarly to how he had done with Kiba, and like Kiba, Kurama was unable to contain a hysterical burst of giggles as hind and front paws squirmed around merrily. UNLIKE Kiba however, Hunter hadn't taken into consideration just how positively adorable the innocent little creature looked, flailing around with a big grin on his face and his eyes clenched shut, and the merry laughter emitting from him. It was all too much for Hunter to disregard, even in the head of roughhousing. For just a moment, he stopped and gaped at the little creature, feeling his heart practically melting at the seams. Catching that, Naruto grinned confidently and charged. "Don't worry, buddy, I got your back! Or should I say..."

"AHHH!" yelped Hunter as he felt Naruto latch onto his back firmly and shout, "...I got YOUR back!" Laughing, Hunter got up, only to fall right back down as Kurama pounced back against the wolf, causing him to fall to his side, leaving Naruto unscathed as they rolled about.

Finally rising back to his feet, Kiba saw the scene and turned to Akamaru. "Pffft, as if they're gonna have a dog pile without US...?" The pup barked happily in agreement and in unison, the two leaped upward and jumped into the pile. There was an immense amount of rolling and struggling, but finally, Hunter maneuvered himself and managed to stand up with all four still firmly latched onto his body comically, even as he pumped his fists upward in victory...

"Ha-HAaaaaawwww no..."

...A rather short lived victory as the anthro tilted backwards like a falling statue and caused all five to tumble about in a massive pile. Their roughhousing, pouncing, and occasional weaponized tickling had continued for quite some time until they all eventually rolled back into the tree Hunter had previously been lying under. Upon landing, all five detached from the pile and landed besides each other on their backs, all breathing heavily and eventually, laughing merrily; if exhausted.

"Oh...man..." gasped Hunter, still catching his breath as he grinned down at his four younger companions and grinned toothily, "You kids don't mess around, do ya..."

Beaming, Kiba shook his head. "Nope!"

Akamaru panted heavily, tail wagging merrily as he did, then climbed atop Kiba's rising and falling chest, licking the boys face and yipped happlily That's what the 'big bad wolf' gets when he takes on a team like us!

Kiba laughed and playfully ruffled the pup's little fuzzy head. "You said it, boy!'

Still catching their breaths and laying besides each other, Naruto and Kurama turned to each other and laughed. "That was awesome!" exclaimed Kurama gleefully as he turned to Naruto and happily said, "We make a pretty good team, don't we?" the kit asked. Naruto smiled warmly and held his fist towards the kit, who saw and; smiling back at the boy, once again pounded it playfully with his fist. "Damn right, we do!" the boy said back.

Looking back at the two, once again, the wolf smiled warmly at the sight, then rested a hand against his stomach, feeling it had once again reached its flattened state. "Whew, guess we've been playing around longer than I thought!"

Kurama tilted his head curiously, then pressed a paw against his own belly, giggling to himself. "Wow! I can't believe our tummies are already back to normal!" Kiba just smirked and said, "Well, it ain't too surprisin', those birds were great, but we didn't fill up on 'em the way we usually do." Naruto grinned impishly and nodded in agreement, "Oh yeah...just wait til dessert kicks in..."

Akamaru turned to Hunter curiously. Think your grumpy pal's about done getting things prepped up?

Hunter grinned and nodded as he placed his glasses back on. "Could be. You boys ready to head back?" They all turned to each other, grinning, then back at Hunter, nodding in unison as Hunter smirked then rose to his hind paws, along with Kiba, who once again, picked up his puppy pal and placed him atop his head, earning a happy bark from Akamaru as they began heading towards the inn, figuring Naruto and Kurama would follow shortly after.

Naruto quickly hopped to his feet, then reached down to help Kurama, but noticed a warm look on the kits' face as Kurama stared at something in the distance. "Everything okay, Kurama?"

The kit just nodded then pointed back at the object in the distance. Naruto turned, then immediately smirked, seeing it to be that massive slide from earlier. "Liked it, huh?" Kurama bobbed his head then, turned to the boy and smiled almost gratefully at him. "I wouldn't have liked it if you hadn't helped me see how things don't have to be so scary."

Naruto just smirked then rubbed the back of his head. "Ah, it's no biggie."

"Not just with the slide," Kurama said, earning a curious glance from Naruto. "When Mister Rocket got mad at me, you stood up for me. You helped me understand things better. When I felt like my tummy was gonna burst and made me feel weak, you had confidence in me, told me I could keep goin'. And when I was stuck in that scary place...you helped me feel like...like I wasn't alone anymore..."

Naruto recoiled a bit, not expecting such praise all at once from the young Tailed-Beast, but nonetheless, smiled a bit nonchalantly and said, "Well, I can't take ALL the credit, I mean, the guys helped a lot too!" Kurama nodded, well aware. Nevertheless, his smile softened a bit as he glanced more solemnly at the boy and added, "I...I know, eventually, I hafta go back to that scary place...but for everything you've done for me...I just...I wanna say, thanks. It might'uh only been a lil while, but, y-you're the bestest friend anyone could have."

It was all so overwhelming, yet, so sincere. Naruto didn't know how to respond. But then, an idea occurred. "Whadduya say we go down that slide one more time before we eat?" The kit tilted his head curiously. "We?" Then, almost hopefully, he added, "You mean together? Ya mean it?" Naruto smiled warmly and said, "Friends stick together, don't they?" The kit immediately beamed as Naruto smiled and helped him up to his paws.

Leading the way, he and Kurama climbed up to the top once more. The height was still overwhelming for the kit, but he wasn't afraid this time. Instead, he smiled confidently as he sat by the edge of the slide, as Naruto sat directly behind him and patted him on the shoulder. "Ready?" the boy asked, earning a confident nod from Kurama as he leaned back into the boy for support and exclaimed, "Ready!"

Both the boy and kit pumped their fists in the air and slid down the ever high slide, both cheering merrily as they slid all the way down at delightfully rapid speeds, and managing to land safely into the sand patch this time with a soft THUMP!

Both Naruto and Kurama wrapped their arms around each others respective shoulders in a brotherly manner as they laughed gleefully.

Unbeknownst to them, Hunter and the others were watching from afar, and all smiling warmly at the sight, even Kiba. "Dummy or not...Naruto knows what the hell he's doing, when it comes to being a true friend..." remarked Kiba, earning nods from the pup and wolf alike.

Shortly after, the boy and kit rejoined the others and headed back to the inn...
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Hunter gets ambushed, prompting quick roughhousing

choices: The group suddenly hears something....
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
*GRRRRRRROOOOOOOOOOOOWWWWWWLLLLLL*...

Kurama blushed beet red as he trotted behind Hunter. "E-erm...'scuse me..."

Incredulous, Hunter glanced back at the fox kit as he trotted beside Naruto. "Heh; little hungry there, kiddo?"

Stopping and sitting upright, Kurama rubbed his tummy through his flame spiral shirt, smiling sheepishly as he did so. "Y-yeah; guess all that playin' worked up an appetite..."

Also coming to a stop, Naruto glanced at the kit's tummy. "Really? Never woulda guessed..." to emphasize this, he poked Kurama's belly, causing a few giggles to come forth from the kit. He got back on all fours and resumed walking alongside his blonde friend. "'Course, its nothin' to be embarrassed about..." he winced as his own tummy growled, and he rubbed it through his sleeveless hoodie and t-shirt. "I'm feelin' kinda famished myself..."

Kiba smirked and folded his arms behind his head, even as his belly (and Akamaru's) growled audibly. "Heh, same here." He licked his lips. "Can't wait to taste some of those pies..."

"And I can't wait to dip into some cookies and muffins," Hunter added, putting his hands in his pockets. Suddenly, his nostrils expanded, and he grinned. "And we probably won't have to wait long, either; take a whiff, fellas!"

Curious, the youths snifed the air...and grins subsequently bloomed across their faces (and muzzles).

"Oh...oh wow!" Kurama exclaimed, once again coming to a stop. "That...that smells..." He tilted his nose high in the air, taking deep whiffs. "I just wanna eat them!"

Grinning, Naruto sniffed the air as well. "Oh man, you're not kidding!" He licked his lips. "Don't think I've ever smelled smells that awesome before!"

Kiba, having a heightened sense of smell, was too busy salivating to say anything, but a huge, dopey grin was plastered across his features. Akamaru wasn't too much further behind. Oh man...I can smell the donuts...they...they smell great!

Hunter chuckled a bit, even as he took in a few of the delectable scents. There were all sorts of scents in there: thick smells, sweet smells, warm smells...Can't wait to see what Rocket's got in store...

Almost on cue, Naruto turned to the others. "Well, I dunno about you guys," he began, grinning impishly, "but I don't wanna wait around just smellin'..." Curious, Kurama turned to him to ask what he was thinking....but he'd already taken off for the inn.

Kiba smirked. "Heh; idiot actually has a good idea for once..."

With that statement, Kiba took off after the blonde, Akamaru holding onto his head for dear life (and enjoying every second of it.)

Eyes widened, Kurama nonetheless grinned. "Hey, wait up, you guys!" he called, taking off after them on all fours.

Hunter watched the boys rush off, a smile on his muzzle. Heh, eager little fellas, aren't they? He quickened his pace. Can't blame 'em, though; if Rocket's baking is HALF as good as his cooking, we're in for a real treat....

Predictably, the boys reached the inn first. Kurama, leading the pack, skidded to a stop in front of the door, the others coming up behind him (and Hunter following at a brisk pace not too far behind.) Eagerly, he reached a paw/hand up to open the door...

...only for it to swing open and a massive, wooden foot to almost come down on top of the boys. Yelping, they scooted back as Groot stepped out, looking about and smiling...only for him to look down and see the boys pressed up against one another. It didn't take long for him to put two and two together. "....I am Groot," the tree-creature intoned, his tone apologetic.

Shaking his head, Kurama beamed up at Groot. "Aww, it's OK, Mister Groot; I know we're kinda small." The tree man said nothing, but simply nodded and smiled warmly at the three. Naruto, for his part, glanced at Kurama, his expression befuddled. "You really get all of that from 'I am Groot'?" the blonde asked, scratching the back of his head in confusion.

Kurama looked back at him, equally befuddled. "He didn't say 'I am Groot'. He said, 'My apologies, little ones; I didn't see you there.' "

Kiba raised a skeptical eyebrow. "Really?"

Kurama noddded. "Yuh-huh! Mister Groot actually talks like that a lot. Like, when we first met, he said, 'Salutations, little one. I am called Groot; what might your name be?'"

Naruto gaped at Kurama, then at the simple-seeming tree-man. Maybe there was more to him then he'd thought...

At that moment, Hunter came up behind them, smiling when he saw Groot. "Hey, big guy," he waved. "Rocket almost finished?"

Groot nodded. "I am...Groot," he affirmed.
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.title: Designs of Desserts, pt. 1

choices: The group decides to eat their desserts in the cafeteria
The gang grabs chairs and eat right of the tables in the kitchen
1121122211211111112112212121221211212121.content:
Hunter grinned. "I'll take that as a yes?"

Before Groot could nod, Kurama piped up, "He's just taking care of one more thing?" At Groot's nod, Kurama smiled, closed his eyes, and took a blissful whiff of the smells, now stronger than before. "Oh boy, I can't wait till..."

Without warning, his ears twitched. "...huh?" He looked toward his friends. "You guys hear that?"

Straining, Naruto and Kiba leaned forward. "Y-yeah," the blonde affirmed, wiggling a finger in his ear. "Now that ya mention it, I do...."

Kiba nodded as Akamaru's ears perked. "Yeah, it almost sounds like..."

"...music," Hunter finished. He frowned as his ears twitched. That music sounded awfully familiar...

Overcome with curiosity, Hunter shouldered past Groot, muttering an apology as the young ones followed behind him. Groot, for his part, actually looked a little worried. "I-I am Groot," he protested, raising a hand, but it was too late; the others were already headed for the kitchen. His shoulders slumped. "I am Groot..." Shaking his head, he followed after them.

As the group reached the kitchen, the music grew louder, and Hunter could have sworn he could hear a couple lyrics:

...ome and...ove....

His ears shot straight up as realization dawned on him. No way. Is he.... Suddenly, he snorted. The boys loked up at him in concern, but before they could ask, the door swung open, allowing Rocket to come out...dancing, his eyes clenched shut. As he did, he sang along to the music that was now clearly emanating from the kitchen.
