Kotetsu beamed at this, looking inordinately happy for someone who had just given away a huge cash prize. Naruto, however, simply beamed back, now quite used to the boy's odd behavior. But...why is he so damn familiar...?

This thought ran through his mind even as he bade Kotetsu goodbye, accepted the cash prize from the bemused officiant, and got up from his chair, his huge belly shaking as he did so. Grunting, he turned away, taking waddling, lurching steps as he made his way toward the exit and, obviously, back to his bed at the inn, where he would hopefully spend several hours resting off his massive meal.

---

Later that night, Naruto sighed as he laid on his bed, having long digested the massive amounts of ramen he'd consumed earlier that day. He had shucked off his jacket and headband, leaving only his orange trousers and black, red flame-patterned t-shirt. As he did, his mind wandered back to the events of the day: of the contest, of the meeting with Kotetsu, of how damn familiar the kid seemed...

"The heck's going on?" Naruto muttered, scrunching up his brow in concentration. "I know this is my first time meeting him, but I still feel like I...know him..."

Suddenly...
1121122221122221.title: A winner!

choices: "...Who are you, Kotetsu...?"
11211222211222211.content:
*KNOCK!* *KNOCK!*

“Huh? Who the hell could that be, knockin’ at this hour…?” asked Naruto, curiously as he hopped up from his bed and headed for the door. A little reluctant; due to the hour and simple basic caution, he nonetheless unlocked the door and opened it partially, only for his eyes to widen in surprise when he saw who was behind said door.

“Kotetsu…?”

Kotetsu; whom had also digested the ample amount of ramen he had ingested during his contest with Naruto, until his stomach was flat once more, smiled gleefully and rubbed the back of his head.

“Hiya, Naruto!” Exclaimed the young red head happily.

Scratching his head a bit, Naruto asked, “Errr, w-what’re ya doin’ here? How’d you even know where I was stayin’?”

The red headed youth’s smile softened a bit and he added, “Oh, uh, I did a lil asking around! The official guy gave me this address, in case they’d hafta mail the reward’er something, heh. I’m real sorry for dropping in so late, but…it’s just, I didn’t wanna leave with givin’ ya a proper goodbye, sooo…h-here I am, heh…”

Despite himself, Naruto smiled; admittedly, rather glad to see the kid again, even if he still didn’t know what was really going on, there was no denying that Kotetsu was just an all around pleasant and kind individual.

“Well, don’t just stand out there in the cold, come on in, kiddo!”

Beaming; and notably relieved, Kotetsu nodded and headed right into the inn as Naruto shut the door behind them. As Naruto mused what to do or say next, Kotetsu’s face suggested some internal turmoil as well, unsure where to begin…to say what he wanted to say…

Before he could, however…

“Y’know, I really wanna to thank you, Kotetsu. I can’t think of anyone who’d ever be generous enough to just give away such a huge cash prize like that. I mean…I-I know ya said it was just about wolfin’ down the ramen, heh, believe I do…” Naruto rubbed his thinned stomach hungrily as he chuckled, musing on how wonderful all that ramen tasted. Then, after a moment, he stopped and; a bit more genuinely, said, “But even if the cash ain’t no good where you’re from, that was really nice of you, and I just…wanna say thanks. Thanks for being such awesome competition, for makin’ that final round so much damn fun, and…well…for just being a great kid altogether.”

Kotetsu was a bit taken back, unable to hide an immensely grateful and warm smile from his face, before he rubbed the back of his head and said, “Heh, now you’re just being way too nice, Naruto! ‘Sides, you made that last round awesome too! Ya gave it a million and ten percent! Plus, you were really nice to me the whole time! Way nicer than some of the other competitors…”

Naruto smirked to himself, recalling some less than pleasant encounters he’d been more than happy to school early on in the competition. Nevertheless, Kotetsu’s praise had reminded Naruto of what had been nagging at his mind for a good while now…

“Y-yeah, well, you seemed like a chipper and friendly kid…plus, I…” Naruto stopped midsentence and rubbed his forehead with both palms, sighing in frustration as he tried to word what he wanted to say as best he could.

“Y-you okay, Naruto?” asked Kotetsu, already having a fair guess at what was bothering Naruto so much.

“…Yeah, I…well…I dunno…I just…”

Finally, Naruto decided not to keep to himself for a moment longer. Sighing again, his hands dropped and he glanced at Kotetsu a bit uncertainly and said, “Something’s been nagging at the back’uh my head ever since we kicked it off….like, hangin’ out, talkin’, hell, even EATING all that ramen! It all…felt so…so….familiar…and, I don’t know why…why it felt right just chowin’ down together like that, or rufflin’ y’er head, or just…all of it. As if we’d known each other before. And what’s buggin’ me more than anything is, I KNOW I’ve never seen your face before, and yet…something in your eyes feels more familiar than anything else…and I just don’t know what…”

Kotetsu squirmed a bit. How would Naruto react if he knew the truth? Would he…COULD he...actually remember…?

Then, something else caught Naruto’s eye.

“H-hey, Kotetsu…your pants…”

“Hmm? W-what’s wrong with my pants, Naruto?” asked Kotetsu, with a slight nervousness beneath his voice.

“…Didn’tcha bust your button towards the end’uh the final round…?”

Internally, Kotetsu was kicking himself as he maintained composure and felt the front of his pants, remembering it still looked like the pants he was wearing when they were in the last round.

“Oh! Uh, y-yeah! But, I mean, it’s not like that was the ONLY pair I had like that. ‘Sides, I couldn’t spend ALL day wearin’ busted pants, that would look silly!” Kotetsu replied, trying to maintain a calm demeanor as he did so.

“Yeah, I…I guess…” replied Naruto. Naturally, that could have very easily been the reason, but for some odd reason, Naruto wasn’t quite convinced.

But before Naruto could inquire further, the young red head sighed a bit himself and said, “…The truth is, I…I came here for more than sayin’ goodbye…and I…I entered that contest for more than just eating a buncha ramen…though it was definitely a bonus, heh…”

Now quite curious, Naruto raised an eyebrow and asked, “Why else would’ja join the contest then?”

Gulping a bit nervously, Kotetsu worked a bit of nerve and finally, answered.

“…So I could see you again.”

Naruto stood silently for a moment, processing what the young man had just told him….

“…Again…?”

Kotetsu nodded softly.

The two stood in silence for but a moment…
11211222211222211.title: He hears a knock at the door

choices: Naruto asks how Kurama's been doing
Naruto asks about Kurama's age
112112222112222111.content:
"Who...who exactly are you, Kotetsu...?" For once, Naruto's voice was unusually hushed as he asked the question.

Kotetsu gulped, pulling at the collar of his shirt. "W-well..." Taking a deep breath, he turned back towards Naruto, though he wasn't quite able to meet the blonde's eyes. "I-it would be easier to just show you." Clenching his fists, he backed away from Naruto, his head downwards.

Naruto's eyes narrowed. "Show me...?"

Kotetsu nodded, closing his eyes. "Y-yeah...'cause that way...you might remember..."

Naruto's brow wrinkled in confusion. "Remember?" Kotetsu only nodded as he slowly unclenched his fists and slowly brought them closer together. "Wh-what the hell am I supposed to..."

Then, faster than he could blink, the younger boy's hands slammed together into a hand sign.

Naruto's eyes widened. Th-that's the sign for the Transformation Jutsu! His eyes widened even further as something occurred to him. Th-then...the whole time, he's been in disguise? What's he...

Before his thoughts could go any further, the space around 'Kotetsu' erupted into a puff of white smoke, as was the technique's signature. Shaking off his thoughts, Naruto bolted to his feet, getting into a defensive stance should he decide to attack. He narrowed his eyes as he stared into the smoke. Alright, who are---

Once again, his thoughts ground to a halt as something long and bushy cut through the smoke, waving. What? The hell is...

That object was soon followed by another. Then another, and another, and another...

Naruto blinked. Wait...are those...tails?

Soon, there were several tails waving about the smoke, each covered in orange fur...

Naruto's eyes bulged. W-wait...nine tails, orange fur?! What the...

Then, before his thoughts could go any further, the being within the smoke cloud whipped its tails about, apparently spinning in place. A gust of wind emanated from the center of it, blowing the smoke away and buffeting Naruto.

Naruto grunted, holding an arm up to protect himself. Agh! Wincing, he lowered his arm. Well, whoever or whatever 'Kotetsu' is, at least...he's got...style...

His thoughts trailed off as he let his arm drop completely...and he gazed as the entity that had been disguised as a human boy rose out of the crouch its twirl had left it in.

As the being reached its full height, Naruto noted in teh back of his mind that it was roughly as tall as its Kotetsu disguise had been, and it stood upon two legs...but that was where the similarities ended.

The creature before him was covered head to toe in orange fur, save for an area of black fur around his eyes that extended upwards into his rabbit-like ears. It possessed a slender, vulpine muzzle, and its hind legs were shaped like a canine's, with its hand-like paws/hands ending in pointed claws. Its most distinguishing feature, however, were the nine long, bushy tails sticking out of its backside. Set in its head were a pair of red, slitted eyes that nonetheless shone with anxiety. It was, put quite simply, a bipedal nine-tailed fox.

A young one, to be sure; it appeared to be in its preteen years as its disguise had been, as evidenced by its height, and its proportions were roughly like how Naruto remembered his being when he was that age, albeit a bit thinner. However, his arms and legs had some visible definition and muscle, suggesting it kept in shape.

It also wore clothes, though they were quite different from its Kotetsu guise. It wore a red, sleeveless shirt on its upper body, over which was draped an open vest that stopped just above its tails. Curiously, one side was sleeveless, exposing its bare, furry arm that nonetheless had a red band around the wrist. The other side, though, had a long sleeve, concealing his other arm up to its wrist. On its legs and lower body, it wore a pair of baggy orange trousers, a belt looped around the waist. Curiously, it wore nothing over its clawed feet.

Taking a deep breath, the fox looked up at Naruto, giving him a nervous, reluctant smile. "Erm...hi, Naruto..."

Naruto started; the creature had the exact same voice as Kotetsu had had. But more than that...

Wait, Naruto narrowed his eyes and stared closer at the fox, who winced and took a step back. That's definitely the Nine-Tailed Fox, but he's...different from the one in me. Almost like...

Naruto gasped suddenly, and he staggered back as a series of images and sounds slammed into his mind...

...couldn't be more glad to be hangin' out with ya...

...Mornin', buddy!....

...you're the bestest friend anyone could ever have...

...not gonna let you become a monster, alright?...

...hey there, little buddy...

...teach you to sleep with your shirt up!...

The young fox stared at Naruto with worry as the boy panted and knelt over, his hands on his knees. Is...is his memory coming back? I-I mean, Hunter's friend said any three of them would probably remember who I was the moment they saw me, but he said he'd never done anything like that before...

Naruto's eyes bulged as more images and sounds...memories, he realized...surged forth into his mind. No...more like they were rising up. Like they'd been buried, but were now forcing themselves free...

Eventually, the memories stopped coming, and Naruto panted as they asserted themselves in his mind: sorting themselves, putting themselves in the right places...and as soon as they finished, everything made sense to Naruto. Slowly, raising his head up, he stared at the young fox, who recoiled slightly...and yet had so much hope in his eyes it was heartbreaking. D-does he...

Neither of them said anything for a moment. Then....

"...Kurama...?" It was the softest Naruto had ever spoken.

As soon as his name left the blonde's mouth, nodded, a small smile coming to his face. "Y-yeah, it's me," he replied, his voice soft even as his eyes began glistening. "H-how much do you..."

"Everything," Naruto replied, smiling. "Meeting you as a kit, Hunter, our trip to Termina, everything that happened there...."

Kurama's eyes widened, even as his eyes began to noticeably brim with tears. He...he really does remember, just like Mewtwo said he would...

Once again, silence reigned between the two of them, Naruto smiling warmly at Kurama, with the young fox's eyes growing shinier and shinier as his muzzle began trembling....

Then, with a great cry, Kurama rushed toward Naruto, extending his arms outward. Naruto barely had time to react before Kurama had wrapped his arms around Naruto's torso, digging his head into his shirt as he sniffled, his body shaking with sobs as tears trickled down his fur. "I've...I've missed you so much..."

Now, Naruto had about a million questions: how Kurama had come to be in this world again in the first place, why he seemed to have aged when it had only been a few months since the Termina trip...but none of that mattered in this moment. Instead, he looked down at the young fox digging his head into his chest, smiled, and wrapped his own arms around Kurama's torso in a hug. "Hey, hey, what're you crying for, buddy?" Naruto asked in a soothing voice. At hearing the word 'buddy', Kurama only cried harder. "Hey, c'mon, don't cry," Naruto urged softly, his own eyes moistening. "You're happy to see me, arentch'a?"

"Y-yeah," came Kurama's muffled reply.

Naruto closed his eyes, tears dripping from them nonetheless. "That makes two of us." He hugged Kurama harder. "It's so great to see ya again,Kurama. You've shot up like a weed..."

In spite of his tears,Kurama managed a chuckle. "Yeah, well, that's what a few years'll do to a growing kit..." Naruto's eyes widened at this, but disregarded it for the moment.

Eventually, the two disengaged their hug, though they still stared at each other with tearful yet joyful smiles on their faces. Once again, neither one of them said anything, instead opting to enjoy a companionable silence.

Then, after a few long, happy moments...
112112222112222111.title: Kurama

choices: "How'd you get to this dimension?"
"What have you been up to in your dimension?"
1121122221122221112.content:
Kurama wiped his still tear soaked eyes with his forearm and smiled the warmest smile; kit or human, could flash another being. "H-heh...sorry, I...I had to try so hard not to do that as soon as I saw ya at the table..."

Naruto smiled an equally warm smile as he wiped his own tear soaked eyes, then reached over and ruffled the top of Kurama's fuzzy orange head assuredly yet playfully, earning a soft chuckle from the young fox, still too overwhelmed to properly speak. Kurama on the other hand, flashed a slightly apologetic glance Naruto's way and added, "...B-by the way, I...I knew it was buggin' you ever since I showed up in my disguise, and I just...I'm sorry I couldn't tell ya then and there. Believe me, I wanted to, I wanted to so badly...but-"

Before Kurama could finish, Naruto smiled assuredly and pat the fox on the shoulder. "You have nothing to apologize for. I don't care about all that, I'm just...so damn happy to see you, kiddo..."

Surprisingly, a few more tears trickled down Naruto's face once those words had left his mouth. It was all so much still sinking in. Kurama; naturally, caught that and just smiled back, feeling himself getting slightly choked up again. "Me too..."

Then, as Naruto attempted to regain composure, something else had entered his mind.

"Now, those couple'uh years..." Naruto began, raising an eyebrow of genuine curiosity, which caught Kurama's attention.

"Oh! Right! Heh, yeah, guess I oughta explain that one a lil bit," he said with a chuckle as he rubbed the back of his head sheepishly. "Remember when Hunter said he'd take me to a different dimension where I could live my life and not be alone?" To which, Naruto nodded, mind still just slightly hazed on all the specifics, though those little details would resurface in no time at all. "Well, apparently, what I didn't know was not all dimensions follow the same kinda timeline...er...time...span...thingies...as each other."

At that, Naruto scratched his head in slight confusion. Dense as he may have had a tendency to be from time to time, math and science often flew over his head...particularly when it came to different time "thingies" as his fuzzy friend had just put it. Nonetheless, he eventually tilted his head in thought, until his face lit up, putting two and two together.

"Hey, yeaaaaah...now that'cha mention it," Naruto began, confusion beginning to fade as he continued with a bit more certainty, "unless I'm rememberin' wrong, it's only been a few months since our trip to Termina!"

Happy to see Naruto able to follow along, Kurama beamed and added, "Yep! That's why you don't look much older at all since we last saw each other, whereas for me? It's been like, a few years!"

Naruto smirked. "Damn...who knows...a few months later, you might be able to call ME kiddo!"

Admittedly, it was kind of a bittersweet realization. Kurama seemed to getting along just fine and Naruto couldn't be happier for his young friend, but at the same time...to grow up so fast; for Naruto at least, seemed as though he'd almost been left behind to some extent.

But he shook that off and smiled full force.

It didn't matter how fast Kurama's new home moved as far as time was concerned in comparison to Naruto's world. It didn't even matter that Naruto wouldn't be able to see his friend grow or be able to guide him like he'd been able to in their past. The only thing that mattered was that his young fox friend was free to live his new life, and above all else...be happy...

Then, Naruto's smile grew a bit more mischievous. "Still..." he started, earning a curious glance from Kurama, "...you may not be as small as you were as a kit...but you ARE shorter than me for the time being...which means...I can do THIS!"

And before Kurama had a remote chance to react, Naruto reached over and snatched the young Tailed-Beast, pulling him close under his arm and ruffling the top of his head like a light noogie. "Ahhhahaha! No fair!" laughed Naruto as he squirmed playfully swatting at Naruto's arm. Naruto couldn't help but laugh right alongside the fox as he continued; the two laughing uproariously for a good while.

Eventually, the noogie turned into a playful ruffling and the light 'headlock' the blonde seemed to have the fox in turned into another embrace as this time, Naruto pulled Kurama into his torso and wrapped his arms around his back and neck while Kurama; despite himself, eagerly wrapped his arms around Naruto's torso and once again, leaned his head against the elder teen's chest.

"Well, I don't care how big you get, Kurama...no matter what, you're always gonna be my buddy...big or lil..."

Kurama simply smiled, snuggling his head deeper against Naruto's chest and squinting his eyes shut, until a just slightly impish grin formed over the young fox's muzzle.

"Heehee...weeeeeeell, you never know...if I'm ever taller than you, I might be the one givin' ya noogies..."

Naruto laughed softly as he just pat the fox on the back, and after a moment had passed, lightly disengaged their embrace as Naruto smirked and rubbed the back of his head at the notion of Kurama getting bigger as he got older.

"Man, if you ever get that big around me, we might be able to do a bit'uh trainin' together. Seems like you're keepin' in shape, afterall, which reminds me..."
1121122221122221112.title: Naruto asks about Kurama's age

choices: Naruto lays off, allowing Kurama to get his bearings
Kurama manages to reverse his situation on Naruto...
11211222211222211122.content:
"What've you been up to in your new home?" Naruto asked the young fox. "I mean..." He screwed up his brow, concentrating as a few more fuzzy memories became clear. "...Hunter said he was taking you to someplace with...fairy tales, right?"

Kurama giggled, blushing and rubbing the back of his head. "Heh heh; actually, it was a land called Fiore with a wizard's guild called Fairy Tail."

Naruto blinked. "Wizards...? Guilds...?" The young fox nodded eagerly. "And... and the guild is called... Fairy Tale?"

Kurama grinned. "Yep! Fairy Tail!"

The young Kyubi's eyes glinted. "Ya know, 'tail', as in..."

Then, without warning, Kurama fell forward, landing in a crouch on all fours. Naruto raised an eyebrow. "Uh, Kurama? What're you..."

Kurama said nothing, but smirked...and suddenly flared his tails up in back of him, bunching them together. Naruto's eyes widened as it clicked. "Ohhhh, I get it!" the blonde exclaimed, beaming. "Fairy TAIL!" Kurama beamed in return, even as he motioned toward his tails with his head. "Yeah, for a second there, I thought..." Unconsciously, he followed where Kurama was indicating...and his smile quickly became a puzzled frown as he saw something strange drawn on the bunched-together tails. "Huh? Kurama, what is that?"

The 'that' in question was a rather oddly-shaped symbol that appeared to be some sort of odd bird-looking creature, with what looked like a straight leg in front of it, with a waving "tail" in back of it. It was colored a bright red, which actually contrasted rather nicely with his orange fur.

At Naruto's question, Kurama grinned fiercely, a glint of undeniable pride in his expression. "That," he began, standing back up on his hind legs and letting his tails down again, "is my Guild Mark."

"...Guild Mark?" Naruto asked, completely lost.

Kurama grinned even more fiercely. "Yep! It's what shows the world..." He jabbed a thumb toward himself. "...that I'm a Fairy Tail wizard!"

Naruto's eyes widened. "A...wizard?"

Kurama folded his arms, smirking. "Yep! A wizard! We hang out, take jobs that can range from doing community work to takin' out monsters... I especially like the ones that take me to far-off places, 'cause I love traveling... and learn as much as we can about magic!"

That last part caught Naruto's attention. "...magic?" Naruto tilted his head. Like, jutsu or something?"

Kurama chuckled. "Eh, kinda, but its different." His grin became enthusiastic, unfolding his arms and stepping toward Naruto. "Here, lemme show ya." Stopping a few feet from Naruto, he held one of his hands palm-up.

Naruto raised an eyebrow. "Huh? Kurama, what're you..."

Then, without warning, a small flame erupted from the young fox's palm, flaring into existence and burning steadily above...no, directly out of his palm.

"WAGH!" Naruto yelped, jumping back. "Th-the hell is..."

Laughing, Kurama closed his palm, extinguishing the fire. "That," Kurama began, laughing, "was just a little bit of fire magic."

Naruto stared, wide-eyed. It was far from the most impressive display of "firepower" he'd ever witnessed; there had been his battle with Sasuke a few years back at the Valley of the End, where they'd both gone all out-Naruto quickly quashed that thought, since thinking about that always made him upset, and now wasn't the time to be upset-but the fact that he had done it without any hand signs...

"Fire magic..." Naruto muttered, staring at Kurama. "You actually learned how to do magic?"

Kurama shrugged. "Yeah, a bit," he admitted. "I mean, nothin' huge; I'm nowhere near as good as Natsu, or Erza, or any of those guys..." At Naruto's utterly flabbergasted expression, he chuckled a bit sheepishly. "Eh, those are just a couple of the friends I've made at the guild."

At this, Naruto brightened. "Friends?" Naruto repeated, smiling. "You made a lot of them?"

Kurama's expression brightened considerably. "Oh yeah, a lot of them!" he exclaimed excitedly. "Everyone there's really, really nice!"

His tone softened, though the smile never left his face. "I mean..when I first got there a few years ago, for me at least, I was so scared, so worried about what they'd be like, whether they'd be scared..." He looked back up at Naruto. "B-but they all welcomed me, no questions asked! They made me feel at home, l-like I was one of them..." He laughed, scratching his cheek. "It-it didn't take long for me to find my place there."

Naruto nodded, closing his eyes as he smiled and his heart swelled. He figured Kurama had been doing well, but to hear he was surrounded by such welcoming folks...

"M-man, Kurama," Naruto replied, looking up and opening his eyes. "I'm-I'm really glad you'vEHHHHHH?!"

Kurama frowned tilting his head. "Huh? What's wrong, Naruto?"

Naruto gaped, eyes wide. "Your-your clothes..."

Kurama's eye brow raised. "Huh?" He started to glance down. "What about my..." His eyes flew wide open as he looked down at his body. Somehow, all of his clothes had migrated from his body to a pile on the floor beside him; the only thing he was wearing was a pair of orange boxers with several stylized flame patterns streaking throughout it.

"AHH!" Kurama exclaimed, jumping back and blushing red as a tomato. "Damn it, not again!" Flushing even redder beneath his orange fur, he stooped down to the ground and hastily began pulling his clothes back on. It wasn't until he'd managed to slip his pants back on that Naruto had managed to find his voice. "Kurama, what...what the hell was that?!"

Grabbing his belt, Kurama turned toward Naruto, an absolutely mortified expression on his face. "S-sorry about that, Naruto," the young creature apologized, looping it around his waist and pulling it tight. "It's just, uh, one of my friends at the Guild-Gray-sorta has this bad habit of taking his clothes off at really inappropriate times without even realizing it." He grabbed his sleeveless red shirt and slipped it over his head, grabbing his one-sleeved vest and pulling it on over the shirt. "And I guess, well..." He laughed nervously, grabbing his wristband and slipping it over his bare arm. "It sorta rubbed off on me a little bit."

"...takes his clothes off?" Naruto repeated, flabbergasted.

Kurama pulled at his collar. "Yyyyyeah," the young fox replied, nodding. "Everyone at the guild's...a little quirky...."

"A little...?" Naruto deadpanned, not quite able to believe what he was hearing.

Kurama winced at Naruto's tone. "Y-yeah, things can be a little...weird," he admitted. "I mean, sometimes Natsu breaks into Lucy's apartment with some of the others, and Cana drinks more than any human being should..."

At Naruto's increasingly dumbfounded expression, Kurama gulped. "B-but they're still really nice, and they're really good friends..." In an attempt to dispel Naruto's expression, he smiled awkwardly. "Besides, Hunter was kinda weird, and he was one of the nicest guys-er, wolves-I've ever met! That's gotta count for something, right?"

Naruto's expression softened as he thought about what Kurama had just said. "Y-yeah, I guess so..." Naruto admitted. Then, in spite of himself, he smiled, walked up to Kurama, and threw his arm around Kurama's neck, pulling him close and eliciting a round of playful protests from him. "Just so long as they're treating you good, I'm satisfied."

Kurama said nothing, but beamed up at Naruto. "Oh yeah, they've been treating me really good! Natsu, Gray, Erza, Lucy...they're all really great friends." Then, even with Naruto's arm still about his shoulders, he hugged Naruto from the side. "Still, you're always gonna be my best friend, Naruto, no matter where I am..."

Naruto smiled, his heart once again swelling. "Aw, thanks, little buddy." He repositioned his arm in a tight one-armed hug around the young fox. "Well, maybe not so little anymore, but..."

"It's OK," Kurama replied, laughing. "I know I'm still shorter than you."

Naruto grinned. "Yeah, some things never change. Which reminds me..." His simle grew absolutely devilish. "...are you still ticklish?"

Kurama blinked at the odd question. "Am I still..."

He scarcely had time to react before Naruto tackled him to the flor, pinning his lower body down with his knees. "Naruto, what are you..."

His eyes widened as Naruto, grinning evilly, reached to the bottom of his shirt and pulled it up, revealing his orange-furred tummy. "W-wait, Naruto, don't..."

Cackling, Naruto extended his hands toward the young creature's furry belly, and as soon as his fingers made contact, he began fluttering them across the surface.

"HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!" Kurama practically shrieked, wriggling as hard as he could. "C-come on, lay oHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!"

Of course, the harder Kurama struggled, the more Naruto tickled him, and the louder Kurama's laughter rang out. In the back of his mind, Naruto smiled. Just like old times...

Eventually....
11211222211222211122.title: Fairy Tail Tales

choices: Naruto asks about Kurama's locket
Someone's stomach rumbles hungrily
112112222112222111222.content:
The moments just ticked by as Kurama continued laughing heartily and uncontrollably as he squirmed and resisted to no avail against an ever eager and amused Naruto.

"EEHEHEHAHAHAHAHAHAAAA!!!" laughed Kurama as he continued to try and pry Naruto off and swat his fluttering hands away. "Ser-SERIOUSLEEEEEHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!" Finally, after some doing, Naruto stopped for a moment to let his young friend regain some semblance of composure as he attempted desperately to catch his breath. As Kurama breathed heavily, still giggling uncontrollably as he wiped tears of laughter from his eyes, he hadn't noticed that devilish smile still across Naruto's face.

"Soooooo...now that we know you're still ticklish...lemme ask you ANOTHER question..."

Kurama's pupils dilated. "Oh no..."

"Remember how you used to sleep as a kit sometimes? You'd be sprawled on the bed with your hand holding your shirt up and exposing your stomach...remind me...what did I used to do when I saw that...?"

"No...no no no...d-don't even think about-"

Too late.

Before Kurama even finish, Naruto held the young fox down and placed his mouth where he perceived to be Kurama's belly button and blew a raspberry...

"OH COME OOOAAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHEHEHAHAHAHAHAAAAAWWW NO FAAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!"

Pulling his head up, Naruto grinned as his fingers once again fluttered all across the young Tailed Beasts' belly, causing him to squirm and laugh relentlessly.

Wa-hehahaha-wait a sec....Naruuhohohooto's only wearing his T-Shirt... Kurama's mind raced desperately as he resisted. Then, another thought came to mind.

Unbeknownst to Naruto, two of Kurama's tails had now risen right into Naruto's armpits, and before he could even surmise the situation, they began fluttering relentlessly. Within a nanosecond, Naruto stopped tickling Kurama's tummy mid tickle.

Suddenly HIS eyes widened, and within a matter of milliseconds...

"BAAAAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAAA!!!" squealed the blonde as he suddenly began squirming and promptly fell to his back, desperately trying to swat at Kurama's tails.

Grinning a rather mischievous and toothy grin himself, Kurama rose to his feet and stared down at his buddy as his other tails began to flutter eagerly behind him.

"Another lil trick I picked up at the guild..." Kurama remarked as he grabbed the bottom of Naruto's shirt and pulled it up, exposing Naruto's bare stomach. "Time for some payback, buddy..."

Even as Naruto laughed and laughed, he resisted in vein to stop what was coming next. "Ehehehe, n-now Kurahahahama, l-let's beeeheeheeeheee r-r-reasonaBAAAAAAAAAAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHHAHHAHAHAHHAHAAA!"

Too late, Kurama's remaining tails had already begun fluttering all across Naruto's bare belly, making the teen laugh hysterically as Kurama's grin grew wider and wider.

"You were right, Naruto. Some things never EVER change!" chuckled Kurama, as he continued the tickling frenzy at a relentless rate, as Naruto tried desperately to swat the many fluffy tails away, none which did any good as he often found himself recoiling from sheer reflex and hysterics.

Until finally, he gave up on resisting, and instead, quickly reached over and resumed tickling Kurama's orange-furred tummy some more, causing him to laugh uncontrollably yet again as he continued doing the same to Naruto, leaving them both incoherent with laughter as they tickled one another for a good while until they both eventually fell to the ground side by side, disengaging from each other, chuckling relentlessly and eventually wiping tears of laughter from their faces as the young man and younger fox simply laid on the ground, chuckling and breathing heavily to cach their breath.

Eventually, the two shared a glanced, and immediately burst into a fit of laughter, clutching at their sides at the ridiculousness that had just transpired. "Ohhohoho, man, I've missed this!" laughed Kurama as he wiped some more tears of laughter from his face.

"Ahhhhehehe...man, that felt good!" remarked Naruto as he playfully nudged his buddy in the side and added, "Just like old times, right?"

Kurama beamed at this and nodded eagerly. "You said it, pal! Heck, it almost reminds me of that one time we asked Hunter to play with you, me, Kiba'n Akamaru, and he just started tickling every last one of us!"

"Oh yeaaaaah! Back at North Clock Town, right? Where that slide was? Hehe, wherever he is now, I hope he ain't gettin' into TOO much trouble, cause man, that wolf was all kinds'uh crazy sometimes, wasn't he?"

"Hehe, yep! He sure was! But I didn't care, cause he was always so nice and caring."

"And fun. My memories might still be trying to connect all the tinier dots, but one thing I remember with absolute certainty, was never ever being bored around him. And like ya said, he was a real stand up fella. I never met anyone who'd go that far out of their way to help people and make 'em happy the way he did for us." He then glanced back at Kurama, and after some chuckling, smiled warmly at his young friend and added, "Plus, if it weren't for him, we wouldn't have ever 'really' met..."

Kurama nodded at that realization, then; a bit more distantly, recalled all that transpired before and after their first meeting; the memories of his cage...what he could have become were all too vivid for the young creature, recalling when he realized the truth of what he could have become, and dreading it in its' entirety. "Yeah..." Kurama replied, simply and softly, catching Naruto's attention.

"Something wrong, buddy?" asked Naruto, light hearted but sensing something on his friends mind.

"I just...I keep thinking back to those days. When you saw me scared and alone in my cage, and promised me I'd never be alone, or promised me that you wouldn't let me turn into...that monster..."

Naruto recalled that tragic image of a previously much MUCH larger kit behind the bars of that larger red cage...alone and scared, and nodded softly to himself. "When I first saw you as a kit, I...remembered back when I was a kid...feeling alone...scared...and...never having anyone to talk to or make that hurt go away, and never truly knowing why. I didn't want you to go through that either. And, when you found out what you were...ORIGINALLY going to grow up into, I couldn't let it happen anymore. I damn sure wasn't about to lose you..."

"Because you felt bad?"

At that, Naruto shook his head softly and smiled a warm, genuine smile at the fox.

"...I never abandon my friends."

Feeling himself get a little misty eyed yet again, Kurama; quickly blinked those tears away and smiled warmly right back at his friend.

"I don't care if I say it a million times...thank you, Naruto...thank you for everything..."

Still smiling, Naruto didn't respond verbally. Rather, he wrapped his arm around the fox's shoulders and pulled him close, rocking him lightly and playfully, earning a soft chuckle from Kurama as the two sat for a good long moment, until finally, Naruto sighed happily and said, "...It's good to have you back, buddy..."

After another moment...
112112222112222111222.title: Oh, how the tables have turned...

choices: Kurama is still reading when Naruto returns
Kurama tries to look for other ways to amuse himself
1121122221122221112222.content:
GRRRRRROOOOOOOOOOOWWWWWWLLLLL......

Naruto's eyes widened at the sudden, rumbling noise coming from his fox buddy. Kurama, on the other hand, simply blushed like a madman (or madfox) and wrapped his arms around his midsection. "Heh; little hungry there, Kurama?"

Still blushing, Kurama glanced over at Naruto. "Erm...yeah," he admitted, chuckling nervously and rubbing the back of his head. "Guess it's been a little while since the ramen contest, huh?"

Naruto laughed, patting his young friend on the back. "Eh, yeah, it's late at night; no reason to get embarrassed about it." His own stomach rumbled, and he rubbed it through his black shirt. "Come to think of it, I could probably go for something to eat, too..." He turned to the young fox, arm still draped about his shoulders. "You, uh, know if this village has any places open late? I mean, I've been here a couple days, but, uh, I was mostly focused on the contest..."

Kurama grinned, even as his stomach let out another noisy growl. "Oh, you bet! I actually spent a day or two in this village before the contest, just in case, ya know..." He blushed a bit. "...just in case you arrived early."

Naruto's heart swelled just a little bit at that. Kurama had gotten to the village early just on the off chance he'd run into him?

Setting that thought aside for the moment (though not out of disinterest; his stomach simply wished to make itself a higher priority at that moment), he beamed at the young fox. "Really? What kinda stuff do they got?"

At the question, Kurama's eyes lit up. "Oh, they've got all kindsa stuff!" He held a hand up and ticked each item off on a digit. "They've got a pizza place, a tempura place, a bakery, a deli..." He beamed as he held up one final digit. "...and they even have an ice cream place!"

Naruto raised an eyebrow. "Really? Didn't think a village this size would have that many places to eat..."

Kurama shrugged. "Eh, maybe, but those places are how the village makes a lot of its money."

Naruto looked at his friend, confused. "How do you know that?"

Kurama smirked, twitching his rather large ears. "I kept an ear out."

Naruto stared dumbly at Kurama for a moment before he laughed, playfully tweaking the young Nine-Tails' ears, much to his delight. "Heh; shoulda known."

Giggling in spite of himself, Kurama playfully batted Naruto's hand away from his ears. "Heehee, so, whaddaya wanna get?" He thought for a moment. "You want me to put on my disguise?" To emphasize this, he formed the hand sign for the Transformation Jutsu.

To his surprise, Naruto shook his head. "Disguise yourself just after we've met each other again?" the blonde began, smirking. "Nope." The smirk quickly became a grin. "Nah, I was thinkin' you'd stay in your real form for this one; wouldn't be like old times if you changed your appearance, right?"

Kurama tilted his head. "But...if I go out in public like this..."

Naruto chucklled, ruffling his young buddy's head fur. "That's why you're NOT gonna go out."

Kurama blinked quizzically. "Huh?"

Laughing, Naruto continued. "Tell me, Kurama: do any of those places do takeout?"

A bit surprised at the question, Kurama nonetheless nodded. "Y-yeah, all of those places do takeout, but I'm not..."

His ears shot up as a light bulb went off in his head. Ohhhhhhh.....

Seeing that the young creature had gotten his drift, Naruto pressed on. "Yep, way I was thinking, I'd head out, hit up those places, and use summa the prize money you gave me-thanks again, by the way-" Kurama beamed widely at this, squinting his eyes shut. "-to buy us a feast, then bring everything back here and eat 'till we can't feel our feet anymore." Naruto winked at the young Tailed Beast. "Sound good?" If Kurama's huge, toothy grin wasn't a resounding "yes", then the huge rumble that ripped forth from his stomach certainly was. Naruto chuckled. "That's what I thought."

Going off to a corner of the room, he grabbed his sandals and plopped down on the bed to pull them on. "Alright, Kurama, you got anything you feel like in particular?" He set his remaining sandal beside him on the bed and patted his belly as it let out another growl. "Me, I'm so hungry, I don't really care what we get..."

Kurama looked toward the ceiling, deep in thought. "Hmmm...." He looked back at Naruto. "Um, maybe some large pizzas-meat lovers, if ya don't mind-, some seafood tempura, some cakes and muffins, some chicken, and, um..." He stuck his tongue out the side of his muzzle as he tried to think of what he wanted from the ice cream place. "Um...ah gee, this is a tough one...Uh..."

Naruto's eyes glinted. "How about every single flavor they got?"

Kurama's eyes shot wide open at this, and a huge grin spread across his face. "Sounds good!" He licked his lips. "And, uh, if you don't mind, maybe pick up some sundae fixings..." As he said this, he got a sort of faraway look in his eyes, and a warm smile came to his face.

Naruto smiled an equally warm smile at this, knowing full well what his buddy was thinking of. "Well, Kurama," he began, scratching his cheek, "I can't promise that it'll be as epic as when Hunter helped us make that gigantic sundae..." he winked at his friend. "...but yeah, I can totally pick up some sundae fixings!" His heart once again swelled as he saw the immensely grateful smile on Kurama's face. Shaking it off with a chuckle, he pulled his other sandal on and fastened it.

Kurama licked his lips, thinking of all the delightful treats he and Naruto would soon be downing...but a thought suddenly occurred to him. "Wait," he began, frowning. "How are ya gonna carry all that by yourself?"

Hopping to his feet, Naruto turned toward Kurama and grinned. "Like this." He made a hand sign, and, in several dozen puffs of smoke, as many duplicates of Naruto appeared.

Kurama's face lit up. "Oooh, the Shadow Clone Jutsu!" Kurama exclaimed. "I remember that!"

Naruto (the original) grinned and rubbed the back of his head. "Heh, yeah; really comes in handy, ya know?" Walking toward the door, he opened it and turned back toward Kurama. "You, uh, gonna be OK here by yourself?"

Kurama winked. "Eh, don't worry about me. I can find ways to keep myself occupied."

Naruto smiled. "Well, if you're sure..." At Kurama's nod, Naruto nodded back and headed out the door, followed by his several dozen Shadow Clones.

Once the last Shadow Clone had left and closed the door, Kurama got to his feet, walked over to the bed, and plopped down on it. "Ooh, this bed's pretty bouncy..." he mused. Shaking that thought off for the time being, he closed his eyes, concentrated, and, in a flash of light, summoned a decently-sized book. Opening his eyes, he grinned widely. "Ah, Requip magic; never fails."

Settling into a comfortable sitting position on the bed, he leafed through the book until he found the page he'd last dog-eared, and began reading....
1121122221122221112222.title: Someone's stomach rumbles hungrily

choices: Naruto and his clones return with the goodies and spot him
The bed accidentally breaks...
11211222211222211122222.content:
Some ample time had passed since Naruto and his posse of shadow clones had made their way through the village in order to pick up the many delights both Naruto and Kurama would be dining on soon enough. Back at the inn, however, young Kurama was quite enveloped in his literature, reading softly to himself as his eyes quickly darted from left to right; eyes wide with enchantment and the corners of his mouth risen just slightly enough to be considered a smile. Seemed whatever the young fox was reading had him quite engaged. So much so, that it was almost enough to make the young fox forget how immensely hungry he was...though the occasional roar from his stomach would remind him all the same.

Page after page, Kurama seemed ever more eager to delve deeper into his novel, until he jerked back slightly, causing himself to bounce just slightly from the bed springs.

"Wooooooooow..." the young Tailed-Beast exclaimed, "...I didn't see THAT comin' at all!"

Suddenly, he stopped for a moment, and glanced slightly to his hand / paw, now resting by his side on the bed, bouncing just a bit more, earning a slight snicker from the fox. "Heehee...guess this bed really IS bouncy..."

As if an idea was forming in his young fuzzy head, Kurama's eyes darted left and right as he started patting the mattress some more, feeling his paw bounce about more and more. "...I wonder if..."

Then, Kurama stopped and shook his head, immediately grabbing his book and repositioning himself into a sitting position.

"N-no! Nope! Uh-uh! I'm a part of Fairy Tail now!" He told himself assertively. "I-I can't be doin' stuff like that! T-that's for babies! And I'm no baby! Nope! No sir!" He nodded to himself firmly and promptly turned his attention back to his novel, even going as far as to hum nonchalantly to himself as he did so. However, the more he read, the more his body started shaking with excitement, thus causing him to draw the book closer to his face until he was practically wearing it over his muzzle; twitching more and more eagerly until...

"Rrrrrrgghhooookay maybe for a few seconds..."

And immediately, the young fox dog eared his current page and clamped his book shut. Setting it off the bed for just a moment, an especially mischievous expression grew over his face as he promptly climbed atop the bed and steadily rose to his hind legs...and then, after taking a deep breath, he hopped up in the air, landing back down onto the springy mattress, and shot right back into the air again.

Kurama chuckled softly, as though suppressing a full-on giggle.

"H-hehe...that was...pretty fun..." he muttered softly to himself, before hopping again, with the same result. Only, his smile grew ever wider and his chuckle, with a stronger sense of amusement, growing harder and harder to mask as he hopped a third time. And then a forth, and even a fifth, until...

"WEEEEEEEEEEE!!"

The young fox cheered merrily as he found himself hopping up and down on the bed; bouncing in the air and kicking himself right back up again and again each time he made contact with the mattress. With each passing jump, he found himself getting higher and higher, to the point where he was now waving his arms merrily like a toddler each time he found himself high in the air. He squinted his eyes shut and giggled with childlike glee with each and every bounce, having the absolute time of his life.

Unbeknownst to him, however, he WAS bouncing closer and closer to the edge of the bed, but was simply having far too much fun to notice, until finally, with one last hearty yip, he hopped higher than ever onto the bed and bounced upward, higher than ever before...

*THUMP!*

So high in fact, that the young fox had accidentally smacked his head square into the roof, and plummeted straight down to the floor, landing flat on his rump. Yelping, Kurama slouched forward, clutching his head in pain; despite his backside faring none too better, and groaned with a mixture of pain and being dazed.

"Oooooh man, that smarts..." groaned Kurama, still squinting with discomfort as his long ears folded down just a bit. Still rubbing the top of his head tenderly, he slowly rose up to his feet, chuckling a bit sheepishly to himself. "M-maybe this bed might be a lil...TOO bouncy, h-heh..."

Feeling his head still tender but otherwise, no worse for the ware, Kurama leaned down and picked up his book, as he sat back down onto the bed; wincing in pain a bit as his still tender backside made contact with the mattress, and opened his book to the page he'd left off on.

"W-well...good. That was...kinda fun...but, better ya got it outta y'er system before Naruto could see..." Once again nodding to himself firmly and assertively, Kurama read his book for just a few more seconds, until...

"Ah, the hell withit!"

Once again snapping his book shut, he set it aside and immediately climbed back onto the bed with a wide, toothy smile on his face before he proceeded to hop up and down on the mattress and giggling merrily the entire time.

That is, until...
11211222211222211122222.title: Kurama's got some 'bounce' in his step

choices: "Let's start with the regular food first!"
"Let's have dessert first; no rule says we can't..."
112112222112222111222221.content:
Naruto smiled, even as he approached the door to his room, his arms (and those of the Shadow clones behind him) laden with tubs of ice cream, pizza boxes, containers of tempura, and various other goodies. Ah man, he thought, maneuvering his arms so his hands were sticking out and he was still holding the treats. This is gonna be awesome! Me 'n Kurama, stuffing our faces, havin' a blast... he beamed, struggling to het his hand around the doorknob. It'll be just like old times! He gave a grunt of triumph as he finally got a good grip on the doorknob, but as he started to turn it...

Naruto blinked. "What?" He could hear something coming from his room, but he couldn't quite make out what it was. Curious, he strained his ears. Wait...that sounds like...giggling? It was Kurama's voice, no doubt about that. But what was he giggling about?

Naruto smirked, turning the doorknob the rest of the way. {i|}Eh, well, it sounds like he's havin' fun. Chuckling a bit himself, he gripped the doorknob, stepped back and pulled the door open...

And gaped as he saw Kurama bouncing up and down on his bed. The young fox's eyes were squeezed shut, a huge grin on his muzzle as he waved his arms about and giggled like a child half his age. Naruto blinked slowly as he took the sight in. Well. That's...

He smiled warmly. That's damn adorable. Inwardly, he felt a surge of relief; his buddy may have matured a bit, but it was good to see he wasn't afraid to act like a kid...

Still smiling, he quietly made his way into the room. Grinning at the fox, he exclaimed, "Hey, Kurama, I'm back!"

At this, Kurama's eyes snapped open, and his muzzle dropped wide open as he set eyes on Naruto. "N-Naru---?"

This moment of distraction, unfortunately, caused him to misjudge his bounce...and he hit his head on the ceiling. Yelping, Kurama's arms flew to his head, even as his rump plopped down onto the bed. He winced as he landed on his tails, but couldn't help but breath a sigh of relief. Well, least I didn't hit the floor that time...

Suddenly, his mind reminded him WHAT had caused that pain, and his eyes snapped right back open as he stared at the blonde, who was trying (and failing) to hide his grin. The fox blushed deep crimson beneath his fur. "H-hi, Naruto!" Kurama stammered. "I, was just, uh, ya know..."

"...bein' a kid?" Naruto supplied, unable to hide a snicker. Kurama flushed even redder at this.

"S-sorry," Kurama mumbled, head down and ears burning. "I-I mean, I was just readin', and I felt how bouncy the bed was, and-and I just couldn't..."

Naruto laughed, startling the young fox. "Ah, you don't hafta be sorry, Kurama," the blonde assured him. "You were just having fun."

Kurama looked, up, blinking a bit. "You...you don't think I was bein' a baby?"

Naruto tilted his head. "Why would you think that?" he asked teasingly, but with a hint of genuine curiosity.

Kurama gulped. "Well..." He scratched the back of his head nervously. "It-it's just that I'm a little older than when you last saw me, and-and I'm a member of a wizard guild now...one of the most famous guilds in all of Fiore..."

Naruto raised an eyebrow at the unfamiliar name, but shook it off. "Yeah, but you're still a kid; no problem with acting like it. Besides," he added, smirking, "You said the guild was fun, right? I bet a lotta them woulda been right there with ya." He smiled warmly. "I know I woulda been."

Kurama's eyes widened, even as he smiled. Well, I guess that's true...I know Natsu woulda been right there with me...and Happy...heck, maybe even Wendy woulda been willing to join in...

Out loud, all he said was, "...thanks, Naruto." He beamed, squinting his eyes shut. Naruto's heart once again swelled at this sight; for all that Kurama had grown and matured, even if only a little bit, he was still very much the same happy fox kit he'd last seen a few months back (at least in his own world's time).

This thought was suddenly brought to a halt as his arms buckled a bit under the treats he was carrying. "U-uh, not to rush ya, Kurama," Naruto grunted, "but would you mind maybe helpin' me and...the other me's with the goodies?"

Kurama blushed, laughing nervously. "Oh, yeah; sorry about that." He hopped to his feet, darted over to Naruto, and helped guide him over to the room's kitchen area. Once there, he helped Naruto set the various goodies on the counter and table. Once that was done, Naruto called a Shadow Clone in, bearing just as much as he had. Once again, Kurama helped set everything down, practically salivating at all the different goodies and scents that were emanating from them. Then, Naruto called in the next Clone, then the next, then the next...

Soon, the clones were dispersed, and Naruto and Kurama stood surverying the goodies that had been arrayed on the counters and table. There were several stacks of pizza boxes, each at least a dozen high, multiple buckets of chicken (each of which had to constitute at least three whole chickens each), countless containers of various kinds of tempura, several cakes and massive platters of muffins, and, of course, dozens upon dozens of tubs of ice cream, complete with containers of whipped cream, hot fudge, chocolate sauce, sprinkles, cherries, and anything else that could be put onto a sundae.

Naruto, even as he wiped his mouth to keep from salivating, glanced down to see Kurama beaming, a huge grin on his face. "Well, buddy?" Naruto asked, ruffling his friend's head. "Whaddaya think?"

Kurama licked his chops. "It...it all looks so amazing!" he exclaimed. "I-I dunno where to start!"

Naruto chuckled, elbowing Kurama lightly. "Well, lemme help narrow it down. You wanna start with the regular food, or you wanna have some dessert first?

Kurama folded his arms, closing his eyes as though deep in thought. Then, after a few moments, he opened his eyes, looked at Naruto, and said...
112112222112222111222221.title: Smiles and a Smorgasbord

choices: They finish their first plates in no time at all
That tempura's got them parched
1121122221122221112222211.content:
"Yuh'know...all that dessert is gonna be so unbelievably yummy, buuuuuut, I think we oughta start with the regular food first," replied the young fox, earning a smirk and a nod from Naruto. "Heh, you're the boss, kiddo," the teen replied, then added, "...savin' dessert for last it is!"

Kurama chuckled and said, "H-heh, well, the way I see it, we should eat all the regular food while it's nice, warm'n fresh...plus..." the young Tailed Beast rubbed the back of his head as he smiled up at the elder boy and added, "...even if it isn't as humungous as Hunter's sundae...it...still reminds me of the old days, so I kinda wanna save that moment for last, so you'n me can REALLY savor and enjoy it!"

At that, Naruto's heart warmed some more as he smiled back at Kurama and ruffled the top of his head playfully, much to Kurama's amusement. "Y'know something, buddy? I was thinkin' the same thing," replied Naruto, causing Kurama to beam up at the boy before both their stomachs in unison began to rumble hungrily.

"Weeeeeeell, I dunno bout'chu, but I'm ready to redefine the phrase 'chow down,'" joked Naruto as he pulled a seat at the table for Kurama right next to his, just like at the ramen eating contest. Smiling gratefully at the boy, the young fox sat down and examined all the goodies Naruto and his shadow clones had picked up across the village. Taking a big hearty whiff, Kurama practically began to salivate...while Naruto was quite literally salivating...

Holding his arms out towards everything they'd picked up, Naruto turned to his young pal and said, "Time to dig in, buddy! Oh, and in case y'er thirsty..." Naruto pulled a few pizza boxes aside, revealing several liters of cola, causing Kurama's eyes to widen eagerly. "Ooooh, soda!" the young fox remarked, smacking his chops eagerly as Naruto smirked and nodded. "Yep. Sure, it probably won't taste as ultra sweet as Anju's did back when we were all kicking back in Termina...buuuuuuuuuuut it's still pretty damn good." Kurama giggled to himself, recalling just how utterly sweet a beverage Anju's homemade cola truly was.

"Heehee, yeah, Ms. Anju made some really super sweet cola! Then again, she was a really super sweet lady!" Kurama remarked, earning a laugh from Naruto as he playfully nudged the young fox's arm and added, "Haha, remember all the crap dog-breath kept givin' ya about havin' a thing for her?"

Kurama chuckled a bit sheepishly as he rubbed the back of his head, blushing slightly beneath his orange fur.

"H-heh, yeaaah...still, they were both really great guys...err...guys and dogs, heehee..."

Then, his ears twitched as he thought back to Kiba and Akamaru and the time they'd all spent together.

"Come to think of it, how have Kiba and Akamaru been these days?" Kurama asked, eager and curious.

"Oh, uhhh, things've been good...great, actually! H-heh, it's funny, cause, even though we didn't have our memories....the three of us became really tight ever since Termina. Like, we went on way more missions together, trained a lot more together....ATE a lot more together," at that, Kurama giggled, recalling Kiba stuffed to his gills and resting on Akamaru; who was always complaining about looking like he was pregnant with quadruplets. Oblivious to this, Naruto simply continued. "...And, we just...kinda started hangin' out a lot more....and NONE of us knew why! Heh, guess, everything we did, with Hunter, with you, all we'd been through...guess something like that can't just be wiped away, huh."

Kurama nodded, smiling warmly at his friend. "Yeah, plus, they were both really caring, even if Kiba pretended not to be..."

At that, Naruto just snorted and chuckled, nodding in agreement, recalling all the times he and Kiba had given each other crap, bickered, or even gotten into fights. Yet, through it all, they both genuinely cared for each other, and always had each others backs.

"...Yeaaaah, he might be an ass, but-"

"-he's still your friend." finished Kurama.

Naruto smiled softly, nodding as he did.

"Where are they now?" asked Kurama curiously.

"Oh, I was actually gonna ask 'em to tag along for this ramen eating contest, but they're both out on a mission with their team. Sooooo, just us, lil buddy."

At this, Kurama smiled sincerely and said, "...And nothin' beats spendin' quality time with my best friend in the whole wide world."

Unable to help himself, Naruto just wrapped an arm around the fox's shoulders and tugged him close, patting him on the arm brotherly while Kurama squinted his eyes happily at his friend. "Right back at'cha, buddy..."

As if a reluctant reminder, once again, both their stomachs roared impatiently in unison, causing them both to flush a bit with embarrassment, before chuckling and disengaging, to focus on the meal at hand.

The two promptly gathered a massive quantity of practically every meal present on the table, each grabbing one liter each and setting it by their completely stacked plates as they got ready to dig in.

Once again, both the young man and younger fox turned to each other and grinned toothily at one another.

"Get ready for a FEAST, kiddo..."

The two smacked their chops and just gaped in astonishment at how much had actually been stacked on their plates. "Where to begin, where-to-begin..." muttered Naruto, before turning to Kurama and asking, "Where do ya thing we should-"

Before Naruto could even finish, Kurama just saved face and began wolfing down whatever his paws could get a hold of, chomping away at various mouthfuls of tempura and chicken, beaming merrily all the while. "Smart thinkin'..." replied Naruto before turning to his plate and mercilessly tearing right into whatever his hands could get a hold of.

Within no time at all, the two were digging right into their massive piles of food with no signs of hitting the breaks anytime soon...
1121122221122221112222211.title: "Let's start with the regular food first!"

choices: "Ready whenever you are, buddy?"
"Actually, you wanna drink some soda first...?"
11211222211222211122222111.content:
Time ticked by as Naruto and Kurama tore into their utterly stacked plates, grabbing whatever they could find and eagerly gulping it down. They went rather quickly, bits of food flying everywhere, but not out of any desire to beat the other. No, there was a far simpler reason for their speed....

Mmmm, Naruto thought, gulping down the last of a slice of cheese pizza and licking his lips to get the sauce off before diving back in. I can see why the village makes most of its money off of food; this stuff's amazing! As though to punctuate this point, he grabbed a drumstick, lifted it to his mouth, and took a huge bite. Oh man...the skin's so crispy...and the chicken! So damn moist... Eyes lighting up, he polished off the drumstick in a few more huge bites, discarding the bone before grabbing a fistful of tempura and cramming it into his mouth.

Meanwhile, Kurama was tackling several slices of meat lover's pizza, eating his way up from the bottom of each slice and not stopping until he'd eaten the crust. His cheeks full, he chewed eagerly, even as he grabbed another slice. Wow, the young fox thought eagerly as he swallowed his current slice, only to immediately start devouring his next one. I thought this village's RAMEN was good, but the pizza...it's like a flavor of explosion in every bite! Squinting his eyes shut happily, he pulled his head back, tearing off some cheese and chewing it a bit. And the cheese...it's so gooey! Giggling a bit in spite of himself, he polished off the rest of the slice and, like Naruto, began cramming tempura into his mouth.

As they ate, and their plates diminished, Naruto looked at Kurama out the side of his vision; the young fox was currently taking a drink of his liter of soda (lime-flavored,) leaning back in his seat and drinking directly from the bottle. With a smile, Naruto noticed that he was grinning as he did so...and if he didn't know better, he could have sworn he saw his legs kicking a little bit... Ah, Kurama...never change, buddy, never change.

Meanwhile, as Naruto went back to cramming chicken down his gullet, Kurama opened an eye and glanced at Naruto, even as he continued drinking. Oh man, this takes me back! he thought gleefully, even as the sweet, bubbly liquid flowed down his throat and into his belly. Me 'n Naruto hangin' out, playing, eating way too much... He felt his eyes begin to sting a bit, and he abrutply turned his head away from Naruto. I'm so happy I ran into him again...

This continued on for quite some time; both the boy and fox tearing into their plates, glugging down their cola for an occasional respite, and throwing each other warm looks and thoughts while they thought the other wasn't looking. All the while, the towering stacks of food on their plates continued to shrink and shrink as more and more of it disappeared into their waiting, eager bellies...

Before long, both Naruto and Kurama leaned back in their seats, letting out contented sighs as they patted their bellies happily; their plates were picked completely clean.

"Oh man," Naruto sighed, licking his lips, "now THAT'S how you start a feast!"

Kurama beamed happily at Naruto, letting out a little burp as he did so. Blushing, he held a hand-paw to his muzzle, though the smile never faded. "You're not kidding! If the rest of this stuff is HALF as good as what we just ate..." He squinted his eyes shut, unable to suppress a little giggle. "...by the time we're done, forget our feet; we won't be able to feel ANYTHING!"

Naruto smirked, holding a fist up. "I hear that!" Kurama, grinning, eagerly returned the fist-bump. "Still," the blonde continued, looking down at his midsection, "we got a LONG way to go before we reach that point."

Kurama, in turn, glanced down at his own belly, laughing a bit. "Heh, true." Their formerly flat stomachs, owing to the massive amount of food on their first plates, now formed rather noticeable bumps beneath their respective shirts.

Naruto smirked, poking his clothed belly. "Yeah, but if we keep THIS up..."

"...we're gonna look like boulders that swallowed even bigger boulders?" Kurama supplied helpfully.

Grinning at the reminder of their first big meal together, Naruto nudged him playfully. "Eh, with all the stuff we got here, I was thinking...just a little bit bigger..."

Kurama's eyes brightened. "Ooh, that's gonna be fun!" He beamed. "'Specially if we pop our belly buttons out along the way..."

Naruto smirked. "Heh; let's focus on getting our guts a lot bigger first, eh, kiddo?"

Kurama beamed, resting both hands on his belly and patting it. "Heh, sounds good to me!"

The blonde winked back at him. "Well, then, what're we waiting for? There's tons more to eat!"

To that end, both of them took their empty plates and once again stacked them high with every kind of food item present there (with the exception of the desserts, of course). In fact, they made sure to stack them even higher than before...

Once their plates were loaded up, they settled back in. "Well, Kurama?" Naruto asked, doing his best not to salivate at the tower of food upon his plate. "We digging in or what?"

Kurama, momentarily entranced by the sight and scents of his own food tower, nonetheless turned toward Naruto and said...
11211222211222211122222111.title: They finish their first plates in no time at all

choices: Challenged him to a burping contest
Challenged him to a soda chugging contest
112112222112222111222221112.content:
"Actually," Kurama began, earning a curious raise of an eyebrow from Naruto, "all that stuff tasted REAL good...how bout we wash it down with some soda before we move onto the next tower? Afterall, we don't wanna let 'em sit there, right? Plus, all these new flavors taste so sweet! I kinda wanna try 'em all!"

Seeing Kurama's eagerness, Naruto couldn't help but smirk as he reached over and ruffled the young fox's head, much to Kurama's amusement. "Heh, whatever you say, buddy."

'Buddy...' Kurama thought with both a sense of pride and gratitude.

No matter how many times he heard Naruto call him that, it still warmed his heart, to be fortunate enough to have a friend like Naruto.

Nonetheless, he reached for his lime flavored liter; which still had about two thirds of the fizzy, clear beverage bubbling inside and unscrewed his cap. Before taking a swig however, he reached over, grabbed a bottle of traditional cola, and handed it to Naruto.

"Heh, thanks!" said Naruto as he unscrewed the cap. Kurama simply smiled back and took the bottle to his muzzle, once again tilting his head back and chugging away. As Naruto was about to take the bottle to his lips, however, he stopped and glanced at the young fox, his heart strings once again getting pulled relentlessly like a harp.

The young Tailed Beast was leaning back with his eyes squinted shut and a warm, happy smile across his muzzle as he gulped down one ample amount of the carbonated beverage after another. As Naruto looked down, sure enough, Kurama was even kicking his legs about just a little bit from the sheer merriment of it all.

Then his attention turned to the bottle itself, and Naruto's warm expression became one of near astonishment. That two thirds of soda previously in the bottle mere moments ago was being rapidly drained down the young Kyuubi's throat and in a speedy hurry at that.

Damn, no wonder the kid beat me at that ramen eating contest, heh...he can really put it away now! Naruto thought, with an undeniable sense of pride. For however much stayed the same, a lot really had changed in Kurama's time span.

Finally, within no time at all, Kurama pulled the bone dry bottle from his lips, wiped his mouth with his forearm, and sighed a hearty sigh of relief. "Ahhh, now THAT'S refreshing!" remarked Kurama with a giggle. Naruto, for his part, just chuckled and; almost jokingly, said, "Damn, kiddo, I didn't realize you were THAT thirsty."

Kurama chuckled a bit sheepishly and rubbed the back of his head as he did. "H-heh, yeah, well, what can I say? It tasted REALLY sweet...aaaaaaand I kinda wanted to finish this one up as fast as I could so I could see what some of the other flavors tasted like. So-"

Suddenly, Kurama stopped mid-sentence as his facial expression contorted to one of sudden discomfort, catching Naruto's attention.

"Hey, you okay, lil buddy?" he asked in a still light tone, but with some moderate concern. Kurama, on the other hand, winced a bit and rested a hand against his belly.

"Rgh, y-yeah, think I just drank a lil too much too fast..."

No sooner than those words exited Kurama's lips did his cheeks suddenly bulged comically, and his eyes widened immensely. The next thing exiting his lips was particularly explosive...

*BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAPPPPPPPP!!!!

Out from Kurama's mouth came a truly colossal belch, blasting out loud and long for several seconds straight until eventually winding down. When it was over, Kurama; surprisingly enough, wasn't blushing with embarrassment or shrinking in his seat the way he did the first time he'd accidentally done that. Rather, a surprisingly blissful look overcame his face as he sighed with relief and slouched in his chair.

"Phew! Ohh maaaaaan, did I need that!" Kurama exclaimed, patting his belly proudly and letting out a small burp in the process while Naruto chuckled aloud.

"Damn, nice one, kiddo!" Naruto exclaimed, giving the young fox a thumbs up, much to Kurama's delight. "Heh, it's kinda funny..."

Kurama glanced back at Naruto curiously. "Hrm? Whadduya mean, Naruto?"

"Nah, it's just...remember when you were a kit? The very VERY first time you ever tried soda?"

At that, Kurama's face lit up. "Oh yeaaaaaah! I remember!" He rubbed the back of his head sheepishly as he recalled that moment. "It was all bubbly and I'd never drank anything like that...for a sec, I was actually kinda scared of drinking it cause I thought the bubbles meant it might burn'er something...but then I took a swig and it was the sweetest drink I'd ever had!"

Naruto smiled, nodding along as he recalled that moment perfectly. Then a rather impish grin grew over his face as he added, "Then, ya let out that monstrous burp...heh, the look on your face afterwards was priceless..." At that, Kurama blushed a bit. "I didn't even think your face could GET that red til that happened."

"H-heh...yeah...I remember how much the Old Man would scold us if we forgot our manners, and I thought you guys or Ms. Anju might be mad or disgusted...er BOTH..." Kurama's smile warmed up a bit as he glanced back at Naruto and added, "...but you guys were totally cool. Ya didn't make fun'uh me or get mad...you always made me feel like part'uh the gang."

At that, Naruto smiled back and patted Kurama on the shoulder. "That's cause you are, buddy."

Kurama beamed gratefully to his friend as Naruto just smiled back for a good moment. Then, Kurama's smile grew a bit more impish as he glanced back at his pal and said, "Still, that was nothin' compared to that awesome burp you let out at the contest."

"Ahhh right, the one that cost me victory...h-heh, guess it WAS kinda awesome, at least..." remarked Naruto as he grabbed his own cola and proceeded to chug away at a fairly lax pace compared to how Kurama was chugging prior. As he did, Kurama glanced back at his elder friend, clearly debating if he wanted to ask what he was going to ask, then, with a slightly mischievous smirk, turned to Naruto and...
112112222112222111222221112.title: "Actually, you wanna drink some soda first...?"

choices: They manage to down the whole thing before belching
They only drink some of the soda before starting the first belch
1121122221122221112222211121.content:
"Say, Naruto," Kurama began, prompting Naruto to swallow and lower the soda bottle. "Instead of just drinkin' soda normally, I was thinking we could...spice things up a bit..."

Naruto licked his lips. "Whaddaya mean, Kurama?" Naruto asked, even as realization slowly bloomed in the back of his mind.

Kurama grinned. "I mean, between that belch you let loose at the competition and the one I just let rip with, I was thinkin'..."

"Burping contest?" Naruto cut in, grinning.

Kurama grinned back even wider. "Burping contest."

Naruto pretended to think it over. "You sure about that, kiddo?" Naruto teased, even as he adjusted the grip he had on his soda and brought it closer to his face. "I mean, you had a front row seat to the one I let rip with at the end of the contest..."

Kurama smirked good-naturedly, grabbing a bottle of what appeared to be cream soda. "Ohhh, I think I'll manage..." He giggled suddenly. "Not like I haven't had 'em before..."

Naruto's eyes widened. "You have?"

Kurama nodded eagerly. "Yeah; whenever me 'n Natsu are eating at the same table, we usually have burping contests."

Naruto squinted his eyes in thought. "Natsu...that's one of your new friends at the guild, right?"

Kurama smiled warmly. "Yep, he sure is." He chuckled a bit. "He's actually a lot like you; he's loud, he's fun, he's funny, really outgoing..." he laughed a bit. "...and he's even got spiky hair sorta like you do! Yeah, it's pink instead of blonde, but eh, what're ya gonna do?"

Naruto raised an eyebrow at the "pink hair" part, but nonetheless smirked. "Heh, so he's sorta like me?"

Kurama beamed. "Yeah! Believe it or not, he's sorta become my mentor...well, one of my mentors at the guild..."

Naruto smiled, happy to hear his friend had gotten so close to his new friends. "Heh, so what, you've replaced me?" he asked teasingly.

His smile promptly vanished as Kurama's own face dropped, his eyes widening. "Wh-what?! No!" Kurama exclaimed, horrified. He looked at Naruto, startling the older boy as he saw the hurt in the young fox's eyes. "Yeah, the guys at the guild are some of the best people in this or any world, but you're my first friend; my best friend!" Tears formed in his eyes. "How could you possibly think I'd ever replace you; that I COULD replace you?"

Hastily setting his own bottle of soda aside, Naruto reached a hand out and rested it on Kurama's shoulder. "H-hey, easy there, easy," Naruto stammered. "I-I was just kidding, honest!"

Kurama sniffed. "Y-you were?"

Naruto nodded, smiling. "Of course! I know you, Kurama; you're not the kinda guy-er, fox-who'd just replace people like that!"

Kurama sniffed again, wiping his face witha forearm. "Y-you're right...sorry," he apologized, even as he internally kicked himself. "Geez, this is embarrassing..." In spite of himself, he chuckled. "I'm usually pretty good at telling when people are joking..."

Naruto slapped his hand on Kurama's shoulder. "Ah, don't sweat it; no harm done, right?"

Kurama shrugged, laughing nervously. "Y-yeah, I guess not..."

He sighed. "S-still, I'm sorry about that, Naruto," the young fox apologized. "It's just...you're my best friend, and..."

His eyes widened as Naruto threw an arm about his shoulders and drew him in close. "Hey, I told ya," Naruto began, his voice warm, "don't sweat it." HE rocked Kurama playfully. "Like I said, no harm done."

Kurama smiled at this, tears collecting in his eyes. He's...he's still so understanding and friendly...

Shaking it off, he grabbed his own soda bottle and lifted it to his muzzle. "H-heh, well," Kurama began, grinning. "Now that that's over with..." He unscrewed the cap and tossed it off. "ya wanna get on with the belching?"

Naruto smirked in return, bringing his own soda bottle to his lips. "Thought you'd never ask!"

With that, the two were off, chugging their respective sodas as fast as they could....
1121122221122221112222211121.title: Challenged him to a burping contest

choices: They drain their sodas completely dry
They stop half way to catch their breath and burp
11211222211222211122222111212.content:
Both the boy and the fox were on a roll, chugging their respective beverages rapidly. Occasionally, the young man and younger fox would share a competitive but clearly good natured glance, and soldier onward without so much as stopping or catching their breaths. And all the while, as their bellies took in more and more of their carbonated beverages, they began to expand just ever so slightly more with every few hearty gulps.

As the two drank, Naruto couldn't help but glance over at his young friend. Even in the initial competitive but playful heat of the competition, it seemed Kurama couldn't help but get lost in the absolute delight of drinking such a tasty beverage, as evident of the young creature leaning back, squinting his eyes shut, with a soft smile on his muzzle...and yes, even occasionally kicking his hind legs as he chugged and chugged. And even if it was a competition, Naruto could feel his heart warming up considerably at the adorable sight of his little buddy just straight up having a good time.

...Nevertheless, Naruto being Naruto...meant he was unable to resist grinning impishly as he thought, Hehe, whelp, glad y'er enjoyin' the moment, kiddo, cause you're about to learn what a REAL burp is...

Of course, that thought was also once again deterred by just how immensely his little buddy was visibly enjoying himself.

Eventually, after successfully downing about a fourth of their respective liters each, the two youths gasped with relief as they caught their breaths and placed their liters on the tables, and; in unison, both let out huge, bassy belches, which caught both of them off guard, before they both turned to one another and just started laughing uproariously.

"Ehehe, okay, t-that one didn't count," Kurama said, still giggling before catching his breath and getting a more concentrated look on his face. Naruto, muffling a smaller afterburp with his fist, folded his arms and raised an eyebrow as he watched Kurama.

"Alright, kiddo, let's see what'cha got."

Shortly after, Kurama presses one paw firmly against his bloated belly. His muzzle promptly snaps wide open...

*BBBBBBBBBBBRRRRRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRR RRPPPPP!!!*

...and out expels a truly titanic belch, lasting a good few, explosive seconds before winding down. Naruto smirked, giving the young Tailed Beast a thumbs up.

"Hehe, not too shabby, lil buddy," remarks Naruto as he gives Kurama a friendly pat on the back, causing the young fox to inadvertently burp in the process, earning a chuckle from the two youths.

"H-heh, thanks!" replied Kurama, before grinning impishly and adding, "...buuuuuuuuut don't get too confident, cause I can burp WAY louder than that!"

At that, Naruto raised an eyebrow, still smirking good natured, if a bit competitively.

"Oh, reaaaaally..."
