Laughing uproariously, Kurama playfully swatted at Naruto's hand before taking his finger and wiggling it himself, giggling with amusement. "Heehahaha! Oh man, I always loved how funny this felt," the young fox replied. Turning to his own inverted navel, Naruto wiggled his around and chuckled aloud as well. "Haha, amen to that, kiddo!"

Glancing over his own vaster belly as a whole, Naruto grinned toothily. "And I dunno about'chu, but me? I feel like I can DEFINITELY take on this sundae now!" Naruto said, giving his belly a hearty slap and letting out a particularly loud burp in the process. Laughing, Kurama grinned at Naruto and said, "Hehe, nice one, big bro!" He then glanced at his own massive, rounded fuzzy orb of a belly and added, "And I'm right with'cha on that one! I'm ready to scarf down so much ice cream and soda that I won't be able to feel my feet for a good long while!"

Naruto grinned right back at the young fox and playfully slugged his arm. "That's my bro!" He said with a laugh before grabbing his spoon and adding, "Ready to polish this sucker off?"

Kurama grinned right back and licked his chops. "I've never been more ready..."

And with a look of eagerness and determination, both youths turned to the remainder of their sundae, and tore right into it, faster than ever, thanks to the tightness in their midsections being eased with those resounding 'pops'...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: They pop their navels at the same time

choices: Naruto wakes up, only to feel something fuzzy pressed against him...
Naruto is awakened by some wonderful smells...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
Reinvigorated by the big "pop", Naruto and Kurama tore into their sundae, faster than ever, sending bits of ice cream flying everywhere and getting as much of it on their faces as on their mouths. They were relentless, barely stopping for breath as they shoveled the frozen treat into their waiting mouths. Every now and again, they would pause to take several huge gulps of cola, only stopping to let out a satisfied burp before jumping right back into their sundae. And, as the remainder of the sundae and the soda steadily depleted, their already vast tummies swelled more and more. Naruto's stomach pushed further outward, pressing against the table, so much so that h had to adjust it a bit so it was on top of the table so as not to get wedged in. His shirt, already resting completely on top of his globular orb of a stomach, began straining at the seams. Eventually, several of the seams gave way with a loud POP, exposing more of the sides of his stomach.

Kurama wasn't faring much better. His stomach grew even larger and heavier in his lap, forcing his legs apart. His already-ripped pants began ripping even further down the front, exposing more and more of his undergarments, and his vest hiked up even higher. His shirt, also completely on top of his belly, stayed where it was. At one point, realizing his belly was pressing against the table, he scooted back, hefted it up, and placed it on top, before scooting back in and continuing to gorge himself.

This went on for quite some time-the sundae shrinking, the levels of soda in the bottles depleting, and their stomachs growing ever larger-until, finally, both their spoons clattered to the bowl, the dish empty and the bottles of soda bone-dry.

Giving dopey smiles, both Naruto and Kurama slumped back in their chairs, resting their hands on their bellies. "Oh...URP!...Oh MAN," Naruto moaned, sluggishly licking his lips, "Now THAT'S...that's what I call a dessert..."

Kurama smacked his chops, gently massaging his belly. "Size of that sucker...I won't hafta eat for a few months...."

Looking at the two of them, one could certainly believe both of those assessments. Both of their stomachs, resting on the table, were easily the size of large beach balls, their distended navels wobbling with the slightest movement. Underneath the table, their pants were almost completely torn down the front, exposing not just their underwear, but parts of their bare (or furry) legs as well. Kurama's shirt rode up to his chest along with his vest; several of the seams on Naruto's shirt were busted wide open.

Kurama suddenly groaned; concerned, Naruto glanced over at him. "H-hey, you OK, Kurama?"

Kurama opened an eye and looked back at NAruto. "Y-yeah, I'm fine; it's just, I think I've eaten so much I've lost all sensation in my feet..." His eyes widened as he processed that statement, and he beamed widely. "Guess it's "Mission accomplished", then..." He looked at Naruto's belly. "What about you, big brother?"

Naruto got a thoughtful look on his face, and twisted his feet about a bit. He grinned as, despite knowing he'd moved them about, the areas from his ankles down were completely numb. "Heh, yep; can't feel my feet either, little buddy. Like ya said..." He held a fist up in the air. "...mission accomplished." Beaming, Kurama eagerly returned the fist bump.

Right after, they slouched back intheir chairs, sitting in companionable silence. Unsurprisingly, it was Naruto who broke the silence. "So...what now?"

Kurama smirked. "Whaddaya think? We crash for the night, and rest these things off." He patted his belly heartily, giggling as it jostled noticeably.

Naruto laughed, bleching as he did so. "Sounds like a plan to me..." He winced as he struggled to his feet, holding his ruined pants up with one hand and supporting himself on the table with the other. "Ugh...size my gut is now, I'd be better off sleeping on the floor, forget the futon..."

Kurama frowned as he staggered to his feet, also supporting himself and his ruined pants. "You...you sure you don't want me to sleep on the floor? I mean, when I go out on jobs sometimes, I hafta sleep in some less-than-comfy places..."

Naruto's heart warmed at that, even as he raised a brow. "Aww, thanks, little bro...but after all this time, I'd be damned if I let ya sleep on the floor."

Kurama thought for a moment. "Well...alright," he conceded, though he still didn't look entirely happy with it. "At least lemme kick some blankets on the floor for ya."

Naruto laughed, playfully nudging a shoulder into the young fox. "Heh; consider it done..." He winced as the weight of his belly threatened to pull him down. "But, uh, let's focus on actually GETTING over there, huh?"

Kurama laughed. "Yeah, that would help..."

Naruto smiled warmly at his friend's good humor...before something he'd asked earlier clicked in his mind. "Hey, Kurama...when you said I'd see what you'd do for your sleeping clothes...what didja mean by that?"

At this, Kurama's expression brightened. "Oh yeah! Remember the Requip magic I told ya about?"

Naruto nodded. "You mean that magic that lets ya summon stuff outta your own...pocket-dimenion?"

Kurama nodded. "Yep, but that's not all it's good for." With this, he closed his eyes, concentrated...and to Naruto's shock, his buddy's ruined clothes began to glow, growing brighter and brighter. Wincing, Naruto squinted his eyes shut to protect against the light. Once the light began to fade, Naruto slowly blinked his eyes back open...and gaped.

In place of the ruined attire he'd been wearing a moment prior, Kurama now wore a set of fully-intact pajamas; specifically, a pair of black shorts, and a red pajama shirt with some sort of yellow fox face on the front. However, it was still ill-fitting; his shirt rode completely atop his belly, and his shorts were being stretched to their limit.

Giggling at Naruto's dumbfounded expression, Kurama explained. "See, Requip magic also lets ya store whole outfits, and you can summon 'em on you whenever you wanna. Comes in handy when ya don't have time to change normally."

In spite of his confusion, Naruto laughed. "Heh, guess it does..."

Something suddenly clicked, and he stared closer at Kurama's attire. "Hey, Kurama, those PJ's look really familiar..." Come to think of it, what was that fox-creature called again...a Keaton...?

At this, Kurama actually blushed a bit and looked away. "Er, yeah...that's 'cause...they're bigger, custom-made versions of the jammies I wore as a kit back in Termina." He winced a bit. "Ya probably think I'm crazy, right? Getting clothes made that are exactly like the ones I used to have..."

Naruto stared... before giving Kurama a warm smile. "Crazy? Those were some of the best times of my life!" At this, Kurama looked up, his eyes widening. "Nothing wrong with wanting to keep a little reminder of that with ya." Kurama, though still blushing, managed a smile. "Besides," Naruto added, his eyes sparkling with mischief, "you always looked adorable in those."

Kurama's blush returned full force, and he rubbed the back of his head. "Aww, Naruto..." Then, before any more embarrassment could set in, he reached both arms under his belly, and, with a mighty "hup!", he hefted it off the table. He staggered under its weight, but kept its balance.

Naruto smirked. "Heh, my thoughts exactly." Still gripping his ruined pants, he cradled his belly as best he could with his remaining arm. It was considerably more difficult, but he managed to keep his balance.

Before he could start heading over though, Kurama spoke up. "Say, Naruto? Since we're both probably gonna crash as soon as we like down, there's just...something I wanna say to you..."

"Hmm?" Naruto blinked. "What is it, Kurama?"

Kurama took a deep breath...then fixed Naruto with one of the warmest, most appreciative smiles he'd ever seen. "Thanks, Naruto. Thanks for giving me such a great time, for such an epic reunion feast, and, well..." he beamed, squinting his eyes shut. "...thanks for just being such a great friend."

Feeling his chest hitch, Naruto nonetheless managed a smile. "Hey, same to you, pal." He yawned loudly. "Now, I dunno about you, but I'm about ready to call it a night..."

With that, Naruto began lurching toward the side of the bed, Kurama making a beeline for the bed itself. The young fox reached his destination first; reaching an arm out, he swiped some of the blankets off the bed and onto the floor, as well as one of the pillows. Naruto gave his friend an appreciative smile as he reached the area...before falling to the blanketed floor, maneuvering onto his back and flopping down, engorged belly sticking high up in the air. Seconds later, his eyes were shut, and he was snoring.

Smiling warmly at the sight, Kurama took that as his cue to flop back onto his bed as well. Before succumbing to sleep, though, he concentrated, Requipping one last thing into his waiting hands. Once it fully materialized, he held it up, gazing at it with undeniable fondness.

It was, put simply, a plushie of some kind of three-tailed yellow fox with squinted-shut eyes. It was quite obviously well-loved; the fur showed signs of wear and tear, a few singe marks dotted the edges, and there were a few stitches.

Kurama smiled warmly, his eyes growing slightly misty. Our last big hurrah in Termina before I left...I'll never forget it as long as a I live...

With that, he tucked the plush under one arm and hugged to to his chest, finally shutting his eyes. As he succumbed to sleep, the young fox half-consciously grabbed one of his tails, hugged it to his chest, and placed the tip in his mouth, gently suckling on it as, finally, sleep claimed him.

The next morning...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: They continue to demolish what's left of th...

choices: Kurama suggests a trip to Fiore...
Kurama decides to ask later, instead suggests breakfast
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
The efforts of their day combined with just the utter fullness both youths had sustained had knocked both Naruto and Kurama out a good, long, very long while. Hours just ticked and ticked by from well into the evening and night, until well into the morning. Courtesy of both living very active and energy burning lives, they had metabolisms that worked double time compared to anyone who wasn't a ninja or a member of a rag tag group of mages. As a result, those hours allowed their stomachs to slowly but surely work off the vast...vast meals they had both consumed in their feet numbing feeding frenzy, until they were perfectly flat and trim once again.

Finally, as the morning continued to tick away, Naruto's eyes gradually began to flicker, just barely squinting open. Groaning a tired groan, the teen rubbed his eyes groggily, still laying on the floor, before his hand fell down on his bare stomach. His shirt had been hiked high from how bloated his belly was prior. After several, food coma induced hours of digestion, however, it was once again back to its' concave flat form, with his belly button once again returning to its' innie position.

"...Mmm, man was that an awesome feast..." he muttered sleepily to himself with a grin as he gave his stomach a hearty pat. As he did, though, he noticed something else resting against him. Something fuzzy...

Glancing to his eyes, Naruto's heart immediately hitched when he discovered the dozing young fox snuggled into Naruto's left arm and resting peacefully with his tail and Keaton plush tucked in his chest and the tip of his tail in his muzzle, and with his other arm, Kurama had unwittingly wrapped it around Naruto's shoulders. Like Naruto, Kurama's orange furred belly had returned to its' perfectly flat state, and was equally as exposed as Naruto's, due to his past stuffing escapades hiking his pajama shirt waaaaay up.

Back in the days of Termina, whenever Naruto had found a certain young kit snoozing with his tummy exposed, Naruto would mischievously flutter his fingers all across and jolt the kit awake with a flurry of laughter. This time, however, that thought hadn't entered his normally immature mind. Kurama simply looked so peaceful...so content...

If Naruto still had Hunter's rectangular device...right, a camera...this would have been a picture perfect moment. Smiling warmly, he gently ruffled the top of Kurama's head, causing his smile to widen beneath his tail as he nuzzled closer to Naruto.

Then, suddenly, the young fox squinted, and his own eyes began to slowly flutter open with a big, hearty yawn, which released his tail from his mouth and grip. Smacking his chops, Kurama's eyes had eventually opened as he looked straight ahead...and immediately, his eyes widened with shock as he stumbled back nervously.

"N-Naruto! Uhh, h-hi, I...uhhh, I-" Kurama yelped as he looked down and realized his plush was still in his arms. Almost comically, his face reddened like a cherry beneath his orange fur as he smiled a nervous smile, sat upright, and hid the plush behind his back. "S-so, errrr....d-did'ja sleep well...??"

To the young Tailed Beasts' surprise, however, Naruto sat up, wrapped his arm around Kurama's shoulders, and tugged him back down, pulling him in close with a grin. Still blushing, Kurama scratched his cheek and said, "S-sorry, h-heh...I move around a lot in my sleep, sometimes, and I guess, subconsciously, I just felt more comfortable-"

"Cuddlin' with y'er big bro?" Naruto finished with a laugh, before gently nudging Kurama closer. "C'mon, kiddo, you should know by now that'cha never got any reason to be embarrassed or apologize to me for anything. Hell, this almost feels like back when you were a kit."

Chuckling, Kurama nodded back. "H-heh, a lil bit..." Kurama replied, before his grin grew more at ease as he glanced down at Naruto's stomach and gave it a few light pats. "'Cept this was my bed more times than any."

Naruto laughed and nodded. "And man, did'ja keep me warm." The two laughed aloud for a good moment until Kurama's initial shock and embarrassment faded all but entirely. Smiling warmly, he nuzzled closely to Naruto.

"...I guess...subconsciously, being with you again just...just felt too good to be true...like I was dreaming again. So, I guess I just needed...needed to be sure you were real..." Kurama explained with a sigh, before looking up at Naruto and softly adding "...I can't even begin to describe how long I've missed you, big brother...how glad I am that you're really here..." Kurama then hugged Naruto tightly, smiling warmly as he squinted his eyes shut.

Naruto simply smiled and hugged the young fox right back with one arm. "I'll always be here for ya, lil bro...one way or another..."

Once again, Kurama felt himself getting a bit glossy eyed, but it subsided. He was just happy to be with his best friend...his true family again...

Finally, the two sat up, as Naruto smiled back at Kurama and said, "Well, I dunno about'chu, but now that the sun's up, I'm ready to seize the day!" As Naruto said that, he stood upright, and immediately, Kurama burst into a fit of giggles...since Naruto's pants immediately fell off from being torn up, exposing his boxers. Face flushing, the young blonde immediately reached down and held them back up. "...Errr...after a change of clothing, perhaps..."

Kurama was still snickering as Naruto hopped into the restroom to change. Glancing down at himself, he smiled and said, "Eh, may as well change outta my PJ's while I'm at it."

With that, the young fox stood up...and thanks to foresight, held his unbuttoned and unzipped shorts up with one hand. Squinting his eyes shut, he concentrated as his PJ's began to glow bright. In a flash, they were replaced by a black long sleeved shirt with one sleeve torn, leaving his right arm bare and exposing a black wrist band like before. Over that shirt, he now wore a red vest, and white baggy trousers with a red sash wrapped around the waist.

"Ah, that's better," Kurama said with a toothy, 'Fairy Tail' grin.

Shortly after, Naruto emerged from the bathroom, dressed in an orange T-Shirt with a red Konoha Leaf symbol proudly bared on his chest, black trousers, and his traditional headband. "Well, Kurama? Whadduya feel like doin' now?"

Kurama glanced out the window and said, "Well...it's a really nice day out. I wouldn't mind walkin' around the village. H-heh, course, I'll hafta change into my disguise so we don't face any-err...problems, heh..."

Naruto's smile softened as he nodded and shook his head. Catching this, Kurama smiled in an assuring manner to his buddy and said, "It's no problem, Naruto. Really. I know people can't help but be afraid of me here. Long as I'm with'cha, I don't care how I look."

Despite himself, Naruto smiled as Kurama slugged his arm playfully and concentrated again. This time, his entire body began to glow, until, with a great flash, Naruto covered his eyes, only to pull them back and discover that same, red haired preteen he met at the ramen eating contest, dressed in the exact same attire he wore prior. "Heh, y'know what's funny?" Kurama said. "Even though this is just a disguise...it's...kinda how I pictured I'd look if I were ever human."

Naruto chuckled and wrapped his arm around the younger 'boys' neck and playfully ruffled his head, earning a laugh from Kurama. "However ya look, y'er still gonna be my favorite lil fuzzball," Naruto said, ruffling Kurama's head playfully.

"...Still..." Naruto began, "...I really wish ya didn't have to hide yourself. It just ain't fair, y'know?"

Kurama thought for a moment...

"Well...there is ONE way we could really hang out without having to worry about disguises or people freaking out..."

Naruto glanced at his young friend curiously and asked, "Huh? Whadduya mean, kiddo?"

Rubbing the back of his head, Kurama chuckled to himself, as if debating to ask what he was going to ask, then finally...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: Naruto wakes to find something fuzzy next to him.

choices: ...and end up in a forest
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
"Say Naruto," Kurama began, a smile slowly turning the side of his mouth up, "I never DID tell ya how I got to this world, did I?"

Naruto blinked, a bit confused at the sudden change of subject. "N-no; you just said Hunter wasn't involved..."

Kurama giggled. "Nope. Would ya like to hear how?" At Naruto's confused expression, he chuckled. "Trust me, I'm goin' somewhere with this..." Naruto was still confused, but nonetheless nodded. Seeing he had his friend's attention, the disguised fox went on. "Well, I was hanging out in the East Forest-that's a forest outside of Magnolia Town, where the Guild's located-, relaxing under a nice, shady tree and curled up with a few good books..."

"Books?" Naruto blurted in surprise. At this, Kurama flushed a bit. "Err....yeah," he added, scratching the back of his head. "Since I got to Fiore, I've, erm, become a bit of a bookworm, heh heh..." Naruto said nothing in response, but instead gave a big smile to Kurama, replacing his confused expression. Upon seeing this, Kurama smiled, his shyness abating. "Anyway, I was right in the middle of a really good chapter when a Gorian ambushed me..." At Naruto's alarmed expression, he giggled. "Basically a giant, talking monkey with a real nasty attitude. Don't worry, they're more nuisances than anything, but they can get a bit gutsy from time to time." Kurama grinned. "Needless to say, I kicked its ass."

Naruto's chest swelled with pride. It was one thing to see his little buddy again, but to see him so self-confident...

Kurama winced. "Although, err, I MAY have gone a bit overboard when I finally sent him packing...."

"Overboard?" Naruto repeated, somewhat dreading what he'd hear.

Kurama gulped. "Erm... Well, I fired a Tailed Beast Ball at the ground near where he was standing, not enough to actually hit him, but enough to send him flying...don't worry, they're pretty sturdy. I guarantee you, the worst he suffered was a nasty bump on the head and a bruised ego."

Naruto's eyes widened at this, remembering how, as a mere kit, Kurama had unintentionally obliterated a shooting gallery using that very same technique. He must have really refined it if he could fire it with that sort of precision...

Kurama laughed nervously. "Of course, I, erm, kinda failed to take into account that my books were still in the vicinity, partially 'cause they're protected with magic seals...they were from the Fairy Tail Library, see...and, well, while the books themselves were intact..." He scratched the back of his head. "...my chakra musta had a weird reaction with the magic seals protecting the books."

Naruto blinked. "Weird reaction?"

Kurama sighed. "Uh, yeah. It sorta, um, ripped open a hole in the dimensional fabric."

THAT caught Naruto's attention. "...what?" He asked, blankly.

Kurama winced. "Y-yeah; I mean, I had no idea what it was at first, so I ran back to the guild, told Makarov-he's the Guildmaster- and showed him the tear. I explained what happened, and he kinda walked right into it..."

"He WALKED into something like that?" Naruto exclaimed, eyes widening.

The disguised fox gave a wink. "Hey, I said everyone at the guild was a little quirky, didn't I? Anyway, next thing I knew, a really, REALLY ugly-looking creature-it was kinda like a human, except it was bald, had razor sharp teeth, and had swords in its arms, if you can believe it-came flying through, all beaten up and unconscious, and Makarov just came walking back through." He grinned. "Hey, he's the Guildmaster for a reason." He coughed, resuming his tale. "Anyhow, it didn't take much for us to deduce that it was an interdimensional rip after that. Of course, I was afraid of something even WORSE coming through, so I kinda commented on how I kinda wished it opened to someplace a little less terrifying...and then wouldn't you know it, Palutena walked through."

Naruto blinked. "Palutena...?" His eyes widened as he remembered. "Isn't that that goddess friend of Hunter's who told us you..." he faltered a bit. "...had to leave for a while?"

His chest lurched at the reminder, but Kurama nonetheless nodded. "Y-yeah; she looked around, really surprised, saw me, and said, 'Oh, hi, Kurama! You've grown up a bit, haven't you? Sorry I can't stay to catch up, but I have to be somewhere else...' then walked right back into the portal."

Naruto's eyes lidded themselves halfway-shut; from what he remembered of the goddess, she had been remarkably casual, sassy, and even a bit klutzy...

Kurama went on. "Anyway, I had an idea, and then after testing it out a few times, me 'n the Master came up with a theory; since the rip was partially of my creation, I could 'tell' it where to open up..." At this, he looked up and fixed Naruto with a warm smile. "Needless to say, you were the first thing that came to mind when we realized that." Naruto's heart hitched, and he had to fight back the urge to run up and wrap his friend in a tight embrace. "Anyway, I got the Master's OK, I 'told' the portal to open to this world, and, well...here I am."

Naruto's eyes were wide. "That's...that's how you got here?"

The disguised fox shrugged. "Well, I had to do some wandering around, some asking-I was a little nervous that I'd get found out, but I've gotten really good at suppressing my chakra, so as not to set off any alarm bells-but eventually, I heard about this village having a ramen-eating contest, and, well, considering how much we both love ramen, it was a no-brainer." He beamed, folding his arms behind his head. "Ya know...the portal's only a little ways away from the village. If ya want..." he gulped. "...you could, erm, come to Fiore with me for a bit..."

Naruto's eyes widened; THAT'S what he'd been leading up to. "Come...come to Fiore with you...?"

Kurama shrank back a bit. "I-I mean, if you don't want to, it's fine; I-I'm not gonna force ya..." Stupid, stupid, stupid! You just up and asked him to leave his world behind? Why couldn't you have at least told him outri---

His thoughts were interrupted by Naruto reaching an arm out,wrapping them around his shoulders, and playfully tugging him close. The blonde beamed down at his young friend. "Hell, are you kidding? I'd love to hang out with you in your world!"

Kurama's eyes shot wide open, and his heart began hammering in his chest. "You...you don't mind leaving this world behind for a bit...?"

Naruto laughed, playfully ruffling Kurama's 'hair'. "Hey, this village is a ways away from Konoha; I'm not expected back for a week or so. And you said time moves slower in your world, right? Something tells me we'll have plenty of time to hang out!"

Kurama stared at Naruto for a few moments, completely unsure of what to say....then, with a great whoop, jumped up and wrapped his arms around Naruto's neck.
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: Onwards to Fiore!

choices: They make their way to the town and stroll through it
Naruto is still too stunned to speak.
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
---

Before long, the two were fully packed and on the road, well on their way from the village. Naruto, for once not minding not being in front, followed Kurama's lead, eagerly allowing the disguised Kyubi to lead them to the portal. All the while, they chatted and caught up, and Naruto found himself getting both shocked and incredibly proud of just how much Kurama had developed his skills.

For one, he'd discovered a new, natural ability; specifically, the ability to sense emotions in those around him. He was more attuned to, and preferred, positive emotions, but he could detect negative emotions just as well. (Of course, Kurama being Kurama, he didn't use that ability unless the situation called for it or he had permission.) When Naruto had given him permission to 'scan' him, Kurama had almost stumbled from the sudden rush of joy, elation, and pride he felt from the blonde.

For another, he'd greatly refined his Tailed Beast Ball abilities, to the point where he could control its size, shape the blast before he fired it, and various other 'cool things'. When asked what these things were, Kurama had merely winked and teasingly replied "You'll see..."

Finally, there was how much of a scrapper he'd become. Naruto had listened, awestruck and proud, as Kurama described accounts of him tangling with wild creatures like the Gorian, beating the crap out of bandits, and even engaging in battle with mages who sought to use their talents for harmful or selfish gain.

And he's still the same, sweet kid anyway... Naruto thought fondly as his friend went on to brightly describe some of the more mundane tasks he nonetheless enjoyed: helping civilians with a monster problem, assisting in both the demolition and renovation of small buildings, and generally just helping people.

Soon, the two arrived in a heavily-wooded area. They trudged through it a bit, before reaching what appeared to be a thick wall of foliage. This prompted Kurama to exclaim, "Alright, here we are!"

Naruto blinked, staring at the wall. "I...don't see an interdimensional rip."

Kurama giggled. "That's 'cause its behind the vines and stuff, silly." Doing a quick 'scan' to confirm there was no one else around, he first dispelled his disguise, reverting to his natural form in a flash of light, then pulled the vines aside. "Here!"

Naruto gaped at the sight; it was, quite simply, a shapeless 'rip' in space, separating itself from its surroundings by blue, unearthly glow it emitted.

Man, that's weird, Naruto thought, shuddering a bit at the sight of it. He looked toward Kurama. "You sure that thing's safe, little buddy?"

Kurama grinned, nodding his head. "Absolutely!" His tails swished eagerly behind him. "I tested it out, remember? This thing'll take us to Fiore, no problem!" At that, the portal brightened a bit, apparently having been 'told' where to open.

Beaming, Kurama ran up beside Naruto, looking up at him. "Ready, big brother?"

Naruto, still staring at the portal, gulped, fighting back his reservations. "Ready whenever you are, little brother..."

Flashing one another grins, they stepped through the portal.

---

Naruto, for his part, was surprised by just how smooth the transition was; one second, they'd been in a thick, overgrown forest, but as soon as they stepped through the portal, their surroundings had changed to a brightly-lit glen in the middle of a verdant forest. It was almost like stepping through a door, actually...

"Whoa," Naruto muttered, glancing around. There were trees and foliage all around him, many of which he'd never seen in his world, strange birds and creatures flying and scuttling about, and a sort of electricity in the air that Naruto couldn't quite put his finger on.

Looking up at his friend, Kurama grinned. "Feeling a little funny there?" At Naruto's nod, he chuckled. "Ah, don't worry, that's just the ambient magic in the air; you'll get used to it." A knowing smirk lifted up the side of his muzzle. "Of course, if ya think that's something...." Then, without warning, he darted off.

"Wh-what?!" Naruto exclaimed, shocked. "K-Kurama, wait up!" With that, he began running after the young Nine-Tails actually struggling to keep up with him. No wonder, when he was running on all fours.

"K-Kurama, stop!" Naruto shouted. "What are you..."

As they ran, he didn't notice that more sunlight was beginning to peek through the treetops, nor that they were becoming thinner and thinner. It wasn't until Kurama suddenly skidded to a stop that Naruto put on the brakes. As his friend stood back on his hind legs, Naruto looked down at him, shocked. "Kurama, what the hell was..."

Instead of replying, Kurama grinned cheekily and pointed a finger downwards. Curious, Naruto followed it....and gaped.

Before them was a rather large city, multiple buildings of vibrant color and varying size and structure, none of which he'd ever seen back home, jutted skyward. A river ran through the area, dividing the town into parts, with mountains at the sides of the town. And, at the end of it, there was a magnificent building, behind which sat a blue, glimmering ocean.

Grinning widely as Naruto's jaw dropped open, Kurama spread his arms. "Naruto..." he began, his tails swishing in anticipation. "...welcome to Magnolia Town."
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: Onwards to Fiore, Part  2

choices: ...Only to walk in on a classic 'Battle Royal'
...And walked in as Erza had JUST finished disciplining Natsu
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
It didn't take long for Naruto and Kurama to make their way down the hills and into town, and as vast as it looked from afar, for Naruto, it was exponentially more lively and colorful up close and personal. The teen was utterly awestruck by what he had seen. Never in his life had Naruto ever bared witness to buildings of such architecture and scale, surrounded by such towering and lush mountains. For him, it was like something out of a picture book. And as Naruto gaped at the sights all around him, Kurama watched and smiled with amusement as his friends' bewilderment. He'd seen that look on currently on his 'big bros' face multiple times...worn that very look himself whenever venturing to new places, such as his first glimpse of Termina as a kit, or even his own first time in this place that would become his new home.

It was quite a sight indeed...

"Holy crap..." Naruto muttered, still taken back. "This place is...this place is somethin' else...!" Laughing, Kurama grinned and folded his arms behind his head as his head tilted skyward. "Yep! Sure is, big brother! Course, the true heart of any town or city isn't just the buildings or even the landscape, but the people who occupy it." As the young Tailed Beast said that, Naruto could truly see the busy and active townsfolk all around him, lively...and happy.

And as if on cue, a few of those very townsfolk caught wind of Kurama and his best friend and immediately smiled and waved at the young fox, who more than happily returned their waves, as casual as could be. Well, except one particular merchant, whom Kurama seemed especially sheepish around, apologizing about cabbages and carts, before moving on...but that was promptly met with more friendly faces, light hearted and casual greetings, and a lot of thanks and praise. This sight filled Naruto's heart with that all too familiar warmth as he glanced back at Kurama, who beamed back up at Naruto and said, "Quite a change'uh pace from back in Konoha, huh."

Before Naruto could reply, a young boy; no older than seven or eight years old, rushed up to Kurama eagerly, catching Naruto by surprise.

"Oooh! Mister Kurama! Mister Kurama!"

Naruto blinked, seeing and hearing his young friend being addressed as 'Mister' was yet another change of pace. But then again, it HAD been a few years for Kurama, and the young kit he knew had grown quite a bit. Kurama, on the other hand, just smiled at the young boy. "Oh, hiya, Aito! Good to see you again!"

The boys' face lit up as he eagerly reached into his pouch and grabbed a small bag of what sounded like jewels towards Kurama, once again surprising Naruto as the boy; Aito, said, "My mommy wanted me to give this to ya! To thank you for helping Daddy after that monster tried to hurt him up in the mountains."

But Kurama just chuckled to himself and shook his head as he gently ruffled the boys head and said, "Tell your mom that's really kind of her, and I appreciate it big time, but she doesn't owe me a single jewel. I'm just glad I was there when I was." He then grinned a bit more impishly and added, "Besides, that turnover apple pie she baked was waaaaaaay more than thanks enough..."

The young boy giggled while Naruto just laughed softly. Then, the boy rushed up and gave Kurama a big hug, catching Naruto off guard for a moment, but not Kurama, who seemed ready and happily embraced the young boy.

"Thank you for bringing my daddy home safe'n sound, Mister Kurama...I hope that, someday, I can be a hero like you."

Naruto's heart swelled with what would only be described as immeasurable pride. It was one thing to hear of Kurama's escapades and adventures of helping the townsfolk, but to actually see the impact his young friend had on so many others, to see how humble, caring and genuinely selfless he was, and how much these people truly appreciated that, left Naruto simply overjoyed and proud to see how far his young friend had come along...how truly RIGHT he was for this world...

Kurama just grinned softly and with a light chuckle, said, "Hehe, hey, that's what Fairy Tail's here for, right? Now go on, don't wanna keep y'er mom waitin', lil guy!" The boy smiled widely with his eyes squinted shut as he looked up at Kurama and nodded.

"Okay, see ya, Mister Kurama!" said the boy as he scampered off, leaving Kurama chuckling and rubbing the back of his head as he turned back to Naruto. "H-heh, like I sayin'..."

Naruto just smiled warmly at the young fox and rested his hand atop Kurama's shoulder. "I know I'm soundin' like a broken record here...but I'm proud of you, kiddo...really...I mean...not only didja manage to truly make this place a home, but you've grown so much as a person. You're mature, smart, kind, strong, brave...and you're a real hero to these people!"

Kurama just smiled warmly at Naruto and simply said, "I learned from the best."

And almost immediately, that warmth in Naruto's chest grew warmer and brighter, but before he could comment any further, something else caught Kurama's attention.

"Wha-Happy?!"

Naruto blinked. "Uhhh, yeah, course I a-"

"Aye, sir! Welcome back!" called out a much smaller voice. Naruto turned...and immediately gaped at what he saw. It appeared to be a talking blue cat...with wings, flying straight towards the two.

"Uhhh...is that...is that a talking flying cat...?"

Kurama giggled and playfully slugged Naruto's arm. "Happy's no cat, he's an exceed!"

Again, Naruto blinked. "...What..."

Rubbing the back of his head, Kurama just chuckled and said, "H-heh, well, see the difference between-" Suddenly, Kurama's ears twitched as something else caught his attention. "Wait a sec, how come Natsu isn't with you?"

The floating blue 'exceed' rubbed the back of his own head a bit sheepishly and said, "Natsu and Gray were fighting about...I don't remember what...and Ms. Erza happened to walk in on the whole thing."

At that, Naruto could have sworn Kurama had gone ghost white beneath his orange fur as the young fox let out a small 'eep' before Happy went on. "And before she could really let Natsu have it, he sent me away."

"When were ya plannin' on headin' back?" Kurama asked.

"...After Natsu and Gray are done screaming for their lives..."

Naruto himself shuddered at what horrors this 'Erza' could be putting Kurama's fellow mages through. But Kurama just laughed and said, "Ah, I'm sure it ain't gonna be THAT bad...m-maybe...but I was actually on my way back to show-OH!" Kurama slapped his own forehead before immediately shifting his focus on Naruto. "How could I be such a ditz? Happy? Remember how I told ya about my best friend in the whole world who's the only reason I'm even standin' here right now?"

At this, Kurama's smile became one of great pride and gratitude as he turned to Naruto and said, "Here he is! My best friend and my 'big bro', Naruto Uzumaki! And Naruto? This is Happy, Natsu's exceed, and a great pal!"

Despite the craziness seemingly unfolding, Naruto smiled back at the exceed and said, "We don't get many...exceeds where I come from, but it's really nice to meet'cha!" The exceed saluted at Naruto and smiled, "Aye! So that's where you've been all week, eh?"

"Hehe, what can I say? The kid works fast for-all who what now?" Naruto's mind scrambled as Kurama just laughed and nudged Naruto playfully. "Haha, remember what I told'ja, big bro? Time's way faster here than it is in Konoha."

Admittedly, Naruto was still trying to wrap his head around that, but he simply accepted it and nodded for the time being. Kurama, meanwhile, turned his attention back to Happy and said, "I was actually on my way back to introduce Naruto to the rest'uh the guild. Wanna tag along?"

Happy shifted about nervously and said, "...I'd...prefer to wait it out...at least until Erza is done being...Erza..." But Kurama just laughed playfully and said, "Ah, c'mon, it ain't gonna be that bad. And, hey, if it is? I'll keep ya safe'n sound, I promise!" Sighing, Happy reluctantly nodded and floated alongside the two as they made their way back to the guild. "But if we hear any bloodcurdling screams, we're turning in the opposite direction and never looking back," Happy warned.

"...I second that notion..." Naruto added.

Kurama just laughed and nodded to the two. "Haha, deal."

As they went on, Kurama continued to fill Naruto in on how things in Fiore and Magnolia Town worked, now with Happy's help, who also helped Kurama explain more about the Fairy Tail guild and all the members, as well as some of their own individual quirks here and there. To Naruto, they certainly sounded like a rowdy bunch...arguably even more so than Naruto and his own circle of friends and comrades, but they still sounded like a great bunch of people, and if Kurama liked them, then frankly, that was enough for Naruto. Mainly, he was surprised to hear just how much he really had in common with Kurama's main pal and mentor over at the guild, Natsu Dragneel.

Back at the inn, Naruto made a crack about this Natsu guy taking his place as Kurama's pal and teacher, but from the sound of things, Natsu truly had stepped up and really taken Kurama under his proverbial wing. But that hadn't filled Naruto with any jealousy of any kind. Rather, he felt more and more eager to meet this mage, to express his deepest gratitude for giving his 'lil bro' a home and a family...and...if Naruto was being COMPLETELY honest, cause he sounded like a pretty fun guy.

More time passed as the trio continued down their way to the guild, until eventually, they made it...only to be greeted by what sounded like a helluva commotion inside. Both Naruto and Happy gulped nervously as Kurama stepped up and said, "Don't worry, I'll see what's goin' on inside."

So, the young fox reluctantly opened the great doors of the guild, expecting the absolute worst...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: The two pals stroll through town

choices: Kurama flashes back to the day he first met Natsu
The two head off to the Guild
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
"So, whadduya think, Naruto?" Asked Kurama as he beamed down at the portrait-like scene before him. His smile dropped slightly when Naruto hadn't responded. "Naruto?" A bit concerned, the preteen fox turned back towards his friend, and his smile returned full force, seeing the elder teen STILL gaping at the sight. "Hehe, yeah, I was pretty much the same way first time Hunter took me here. And the sight is nothing compared to what this town really has to offer."

Finally, Naruto mutters, "...It's...beautiful..."

"Isn't it though?" Grinning, Kurama slugs Naruto in the arm and added, "...Yknow, if ya WANT, there's really no reason we can't take some time to just hang out up here and enjoy the scene. The Guild isn't going anywhere after all." Naruto, finally shaking off his initial trance, smiles back at the younger creature and wraps his arm around his shoulders and tugs him close playfully. "Sounds like a plan, kiddo."

And so, the two sat side by side, marveling at Magnolia and the accompanying surrounding mountains, lush with green, from afar. Naruto kept one hand planted on the ground beneath him for support while his left arm was still wrapped around the young Tailed Beasts' shoulders. The two simply sat there for some time. Kurama smiled warmly at the sight and liveliness of the city.

"You know something, Naruto? I've come up here at least once virtually every day I can. Sometimes with Natsu and Happy, sometimes by myself, and this sight never stops amazing me...never stops making me grateful for everything you and the others did to give me a place like this to call home..."

"I just wish I could'a been here to share it with'cha..."

"I know, but really, you can't leave behind your life back in Konoha...all your friends...or even all the people who depend on ya. Besides," he grinned impishly as he patted Naruto on the back and added, "...now that I know the cross dimensional traversing works, there's no reason ya can't come by'n visit every so often, right? Especially with the way time works here."

The young blond just smiled back and rocked the young fox playfully. "I like the way you think, kiddo." Naruto's smile grew warmer as he added, "...Still, I'm just glad this Natsu guy was here for ya. I know I've said it a trillion times, but, seeing what you've grown up into, I couldn't be prouder...and I'm glad this guy was here to help steer you on the path you've taken."

Kurama smiled warmly at his 'big brother' and wrapped one arm around the elder teen, tugging him right back in a brief hug. "Yeah, I owe a lot to Natsu. He's a great, funny guy, an excellent hands on teacher, and really, one of my best friends...but you'll always be my BEST best friend...and my 'big bro.'"

Naruto just laughed and ruffled the young fox's fuzzy head playfully. "Ah, I know that, fuzzball. Trust me, I'm glad he's such an amazing friend to you, and I hope you only continue to make more and more friends, and with a bubbly personality like yours, I doubt that'd be a problem, hehe."

The two chuckled softly for a moment, before Naruto asked, "So, what was it like, being taught things like magic? It sounds pretty similar to how I was taught to channel chakra, and how I've always been trained in various forms of ninjutsu. Heck, we even have teams and go on mission together like you guys."

"Well, I wouldn't say we go on missions. It's more or less job postings we get in the Guild Hall. Do a job, collect jewels, rinse repeat. Sometimes, it's reconstruction work, sometimes, it's fending off monsters, or fighting bandits or rival Guilds, or anything along those lines. It can get pretty competitive actually, but it's always a blast, hehe. And Natsu, because of how experienced he is with his particular skills, was able to understand my abilities, and figured out how to translate that into his techniques, allowing him to teach me point by point how to use Fire Magic and using my Chakra to fuel that. Really, he was an amazing teacher, because all throughout, he was showing me the ropes, was always patient when I screwed up, and was there for me every step of the way. See, he...he never needed time to get used to me being around or anything like that like I was initially scared of. Literally as soon as Hunter introduced me to him, Natsu just treated me like I was part of the Guild...part of the family...they all did really. H-heh, but Lucy...? Ohhh boy, when Natsu first introduced me to her...I don't think I'd ever heard anyone make such a high pitched squeal...or been squeezed as tight..."

Naruto grinned impishly at that and gave the young kyuubi a playful squeeze with his arm. "Well, you WERE a freakin' adorable lil kit..."

Kurama rubbed the back of his head as his cheeks flushed a bit before softening a bit. "H-heh, guess I was, huh...but that's part of what makes this place so special to me. I wasn't something to be feared...or something to be treated as different or even weird. Just one of the guys, hehe..."

At that, Kurama looked out distantly yet fondly back at Magnolia Town...reflecting on all this wonderful place has given him, all the friends he's made, all the adventures he'd been fortunate enough to go on, but most of all...on his close friend and mentor, who had to taught him so much and been there to guide him at every step of the way; Natsu Dragneel...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: One Bewildered Ninja

choices: Naruto tears into his plate, demolishing it and loading it up for seconds
Naruto begins gushing about how good it is
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
Naruto's slumbering form twitched, his arms and legs sprawled about every which way. Somewhere, at the edges of his subconscious, a thought registered. Mmmf...smells nice...

Morning had come, and, owing to his active metabolism, Naruto's grossly swollen belly had completed digested back to its trim state, his navel returning to an innie. His clothes still bore the marks of his and Kurama's feast, the sides of his shirt being torn up and the front of his pants ripped open, exposing his undergarments. In between that and his sprawled position, his pants had slipped down further and his battered shirt was still riding up high, exposing his flat belly.

He snored a bit, a bit of drool at the corner of his mouth. Again, though, his nose twitched. Mmmm...whazz...whazz tha' smell...?

Suddenly, his eyes flew open...only for him to squeeze them shut as the morning light hit them. Grumbling, he sat up, his shirt falling back down over his torso. He sniffed again...and his mouth began to water. Oh man...what's that smell...?

There wasn't just one smell, truthfully; it was several deep, rich smells that permeated the room...all of which smelled absolutely fantastic. There were sweet smells, cheesy smells, savory smells, salty smells...all mixing into a truly delectable aroma. Still, after that initial shock, he didn't want to open his eyes just yet....wait...

He frowned a bit. Is...is somebody humming?

Slowly-very slowly-he blinked his eyes open, slowly letting the light in. From the blurry image this presented, there was someone in the kitchen...and yes, they were most definitely humming...

Brain waking up a bit more, realization seeped into Naruot's head. K...Kurama...?

Shaking his head a bit, he blinked several more times, clearing his vision...and when the image before him came into focus, he gaped.

Kurama was in the kitchen, humming merrily and dancing a bit as he...Naruto squinted to make sure he was seeing this right...cooking.

Garbed in his pajamas and what appeared to be a long, red apron (though it was a bit hard to tell from the back), he shook his rump a bit as he went about, scrambling eggs, flipping pancakes and french toast, and various other things, occasionally twirling from place to place. What was more, though...he was doing many of these things with his tails.

Indeed, as he twirled from place to place, one of his tails would be doing something. A couple were wrapped around the handles of several of the pans, flipping and mixing them, while still others dipped their tips into several of the pots and brought themselves to Kurama's mouth, where he would taste the contents. Depending on the contents, he would either nod in satisfaction or have a thoughtful look on his face, in which case another one of his tails would grab something, like salt or some other condiment, and shake a bit into the requisite pot.

Naruto continued gaping. Huh....wha....

Oblivious to his friend's shock...or even to the fact he was awake, in fact...Kurama continued dancing, humming, and cooking. Seeing this, Naruto's eyes wandered to the table, and his eyes widened as he saw that there were already several plates on the table. There were sticky buns, sausage, jugs of milk, some cut-up fruit, and some bagels. And, as Kurama cooked, some of his unoccupied tails grabbed several empty plates, tossed them over to the table where they landed perfectly, then grabbed some pans in his tails and flipped them over his shoulder, where they landed effortlessly on the empty plates. He continued in this manner for a bit, until the table was creaking under a veritable breakfast buffet.

"And..." grinning, Kurama whirled around to face the table, folding his arms as he stared proudly at his work (and revealing that the apron was indeed a bright red with "Fox says 'Time to Eat!'" emblazoned on it in fancy white font), "...that is a wrap."

He nodded in satisfaction...before his ears twitched, and he saw Naruto gaping at him.

"ACK!" Yelping, Kurama jumped bit. "N-Naruto, don't scare me like that!"

"Sorry," Naruto mumbled, still trying to process what he'd seen....then, all of a sudden, it clicked.

"Kurama," he began, "what...what WAS that?"

Laughing nervously, Kurama rubbed the back of his head. "W-well, when I'm cooking, I kinda get a little animated, so..."

"N-no," Naruto cut in, shaking his head. "I-I mean...you were cooking! When...when did that happen?"

Kurama grinned sheepishly. "It's, uh, something I picked up in Fiore. A-as it turns out, I kinda have a talent for cooking." He shrugged. "I-I mean, I'm nowhere near as good as Rocket, but..."

"Who cares?" Naruto cut in, startling the young fox a bit. "Hell, if any of that stuff tastes HALF as good as it smells..."

He came to a stop as something occurred to him. "Wait...you made us breakfast?"

At this, Kurama blushed a bit, looking away. "W-well...I got up a little earlier than usual, and you were still sleeping, and I didn't wanna disturb you, s-so I figured I might as well make us some breakfast..."

Naruto's heart hitched a bit at the sincerity in that statement, and glanced at the table to shake it off. "W-well, it looks like you really went all out..."

Kurama looked back toward Naruto, his blush subsiding a bit. "W-well, I wasn't sure what you wanted, s-so I made...everything I could think of, heh heh..."

Again, Naruto's heart hitched. This time, he shrugged it off by smirking. "Well...I'd say everything sounds good." He grinned. "And I MEAN everything."

Kurama's ears perked. "Y-you really wanna go all out? This early in the day?"

Naruto shrugged. "Hey, like ya said, it's early, so we probably won't pass out after we've finished everything. Figure afterwards, we can relax, let everything digest..." His smile turned warm. "..and maybe you can tell me what you've been up to."

At this, Kurama's expression eased a great deal, and he smiled. "Th-that sounds great!" He beamed, undoing his apron. "No time like the present, right?" He set his apron to the side, walked over to the table, and plopped down. "C'mon; dive on in!"

Grinning, Naruto moved to get up. "Don't mind if I do!" He stood up...and his mangled pants promptly dropped to his ankles. His face lit up to the point it was practically glowing, and Kurama's paws flew to his mouth as he fought to stem the tide of explosive giggles that came forth.

"H-heh...you....wanna change clothes, first?" Kurama managed, several cackles escaping.

Slowly, Naruto reached down and pulled his pants up. "That might be a good idea...."

Still blushing, he shuffled off to change. Still giggling, Kurama poured himself a glass of milk and loaded up his plate with eggs, bacon, and toast. He'd just finished spreading his butter when Naruto came back in, wearing a short-sleeved white t-shirt with a red flame spiral and navy blue trousers-in short, larger versions of the clothes Kurama had loved as a kit, and which he still owned appropriately-sized versions of.

A smile on his face, Naruto walked over to the table, plopped down, and made his own plate, shoveling eggs and sausage on. He took a sniff. "Oh man, Kurama, this really smells great!"

Blushing a bit, Kurama took a bite of his toast. "W-well, let's hope it tastes good..."

Laughing, Naruto forked up some eggs. "Ah, don't worry about it, Kurama," he assured the fox, taking a mouthful and chewing. "I'm sure it's..."

He stopped suddenly, his eyes bulging. Slowly, he chewed some more, than swallowed. Worried, Kurama looked towards him. "I-is it not good? Did I put too much salt, or..."

Suddenly...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: Naruto is awakened by some wonderful smells...

choices: Naruto keeps on chowing down.
Naruto stops to wash down all he'd eaten thus far.
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
Before Kurama knew what was going on, the elder teen Naruto was chugging through his eggs like he hadn’t eaten in days. Naruto’s cheeks practically bulged outward comically from the sheer influx of eggs he was chewing down on, beaming as the perfect blend of salt and zesty lemon pepper coated Naruto’s taste buds. Kurama, meanwhile, merely watched, a bit taken back.

“…Erm…s-so…does that mean you like it…?” the young fox asked, a bit tentatively and with an adorably hopeful expression on his face. His long ears soon twitched as Naruto took a hearty gulp, causing that mouthful of scrambled eggs inside his mouth to form an equally comical bulge down his throat and disappear into his chest, and down into his flat, eager belly. Smacking his chops clean, Naruto smiled down at Kurama.

“Kurama, I just…I mean…I dunno how you did it, but those, right there? Those were THE BEST scrambled eggs I’ve ever eaten in my life!”

Kurama’s ears twitched again as he glanced up, legitimately surprised and said, “R-Really…? You think so?”

“You kiddin’? I KNOW so, kiddo!” Naruto practically cheered, clearly energized fully, compared to his earlier groggy state. “Seriously, you scrambled everything just right. Nothing tastes extra yolky. Ya put just the right amount’uh salt, and don’t even get me STARTED on that lemon pepper surprise, that one caught me off guard in the best way possible!”

Watching his best friend go on, Kurama couldn’t help but smile a warm, grateful smile at Naruto, before rubbing his bicep a bit bashfully. “H-heh, well, the lemon pepper, I just know most people like just a little bit of kick here and there, and I remembered you really loved zesty stuff. Ramen, the roasted cuckoo, the list goes on, hehe. Still, I’m really glad you like it, Naruto.”

“Like it? I LOVE it! I’d gush about it even more, but I just wanna…”

Rather than finish his sentence, Naruto opted to dig right in for more, scarfing down more and more of his eggs at a seemingly record pace. Snickering with amusement, Kurama eventually grabbed his own fork and dug in, smiling at the flavor himself.

“Mmmm, you’re right, things did come out nicely,” the young tailed beast remarked, before digging in for more, albeit at a slower pace than Naruto, who, by the time Kurama had barely gotten half way into his eggs, had already demolished his. Wiping his mouth clean, Naruto took a bite of some sausage, and just like before, his face went comically blissful at the flavor, much to Kurama’s amusement.

“Kurama, I…just…I don’t even…HOW are you this good at cooking?? I know it’s only been a few years for you, but even then, you’re still so young, but can cook better than most restaurants I’ve been to!”

“Aww, now y’er just being too nice,” Kurama replied, once again, rubbing the back of his head bashfully after gulping down a hefty mouthful himself. But Naruto shook his head.

“Nah, I’m serious, this is AMAZING. The cooking, the books, the talent, the new kickass lifestyle, I just…” After a moment, Naruto’s gleeful grin softened to a much gentler, brotherly smile as he added, “You’ve come so far in such a short amount of time, and…I just know, in my heart, you’ll only go further and further in life, excelling and going on to do great things. I’m proud’uh you, kiddo. I just want you to know that.”

Once again, Kurama felt that warmth in his heart; gratitude, love and pride, all in one. But this time, he simply smiled back at his best friend, then held out his fist and said, “I had a great role model.”

Chuckling despite himself, Naruto extended his own fist and bumped it playfully against Kurama’s.

Before long though, Naruto’s grin turned mischievous as he said, “Now, how ‘bout we save the mushy stuff for later, yeah? I’m willin’ to bet every single dish here tastes amazing…and I aim to cram as much of it in my face as I can.” He then winked and added, “wouldn’t wanna be rude after all…”

And with that, Naruto once again resumed chowing down on sausage, and loving the taste. Kurama grinned back at Naruto, chuckling softly before once again resuming his own breakfast, picking up the pace a bit as he did so. Even he was impressed by how good everything turned out.

The two eventually got into the rhythm, cramming more and more food into their all too eager maws, and scarfing it down merrily, with Naruto stuffing especially more in his maw than Kurama. Polishing off the rest of his sausage, Naruto grabbed some bacon, and chomped down heartily with a resounding CRUNCH!

…Somehow, some way, the little fuzzy tailed beast managed to get the bacon to just the PERFECT degree of crispy. It practically shattered in Naruto’s mouth with each hearty bite, not that he was complaining. Rather, he was practically inhaling one strip after another, much to Kurama’s pride as he scooped up some egg and bacon and went to town himself.

Man, I really DID outdo myself this morning, huh... Kurama thought to himself, unable to suppress a grin of pride for his own work. Oblivious to this, Naruto just kept wolfing down more and more of his breakfast. Even Kurama was surprised by how fast the blond was putting everything away. Not that he was surprised by how fast Naruto was eating. After all, the teen's appetite was FAR past established to Kurama for a good long while now. However, they weren't having an eating contest, to see who could pack away the most first. Rather, it was simply breakfast, and Naruto was packing it away like it was the end of days. Clearly, Kurama must've done SOMETHING right, which only reinforced that proud smile across the orange fox's muzzle.

Gulping down another hefty mouthful, Naruto let out a little sigh of relief before once again wiping his mouth with his forearm and grinning down at Kurama as he said, "Seriously, lil buddy, I swear, if you ever learn how to make ramen, then I'd probably be a beached whale if it's anywhere near as good as this stuff."

Snickering, Kurama waved his paw dismissively and said, "Ah, getting ramen right's been, well, a bit trickier." He gave Naruto a knowing wink and added, "What, you thought that hadn't crossed my mind? Lest we forget that contest we had yesterday, SOME of us like them some ramen too...just saying..."

Naruto just laughed and nodded to himself. "Alright, fair enough. But hey, y'er a fast learner. I'm sure you'll get the hang of it in no time at all."

"Hehe, here's hoping, right?" replied Kurama before grabbing his milk and taking an ample drink from his glass.

Rather than drink, Naruto instead turned his attention to something he'd been eyeing for a while; the sticky buns. Licking his chops, Naruto grabbed one and took a hefty bite, not even needing to wait to see if it was good. Even still, his face lit up like it was Christmas morning. It was amazing how sweet and gooey it tasted. Without even finishing his first bite, Naruto eagerly took his second, then his third, chewing only momentarily before taking yet another bite.

Seeing this, Kurama couldn't help but snicker at how much Naruto's cheeks were bulging as he gleefully chewed away at the vast amount of sweet pastry currently in his mouth.

"Hehe, storing for the winter, are we?" joked the young fox, but Naruto was too enticed by the flavor to do much else besides roll his eyes playfully. After a while, he took yet another hefty gulp to send the treat down his throat as he winced, thumping his chest a few times to help get it all down, before sighing with relief when it finally did. "Phew, h-heh, man, it's hard to stop when ya start with stuff this good. Kurama, I ain't even trying to be nice here, I'm dead serious. You could make a FORTUNE if you ever opened a restaurant."

"Y'know, I've actually been told that by a few people...ESPECIALLY Natsu, hehe. But honestly, I prefer just making food for my friends. It's more satisfying seeing people I care about enjoy what I make. Plus, I get to actually enjoy it WITH them, instead of just in the kitchen."

"Hehe, yeah, I can imagine it'd be weird cooking something then sitting down with the customer, huh," joked Naruto, but nonetheless, the sincerity of Kurama's reasoning was just as endearing as always. It only served to remind Naruto that Kurama was still his little buddy even after all the changes, new skills, and the time passed. Nonetheless, his attention was once again beckoned by the aroma of the sticky bun still on his plate. Needing no second heed, Naruto resumed scarfing it down until it was reduced to crumbs on a plate. Crumbs Naruto licked clean before grabbing more food, all too eager to wolf down as much of what Kurama had cooked for them as he possibly could.

As more time went on...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: Naruto tears into his plate with gusto...

choices: Naruto continues to freak out over his new form
Overwhelmed by shock and guilt, Kurama begins furiously apologizing
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
"Phew!" Naruto exclaimed, setting his fork own and patting his stomach. "I'm practically inhaling this stuff!"

Kurama, swallowing a bite of toast, giggled. "Considering you've already wolfed down three plates, I can believe that."

Indeed, Naruto had powered through three plates of bagels, sausage, eggs, sticky rolls, and other goodies, and he showed no sign of slowing down, in spite of the slight curve that had formed under his shirt. Through it all, he had had a huge smile upon his face, something that had sent a warmth into Kurama's heart. H-heh, guess he really DOES like my cooking, huh...

Naruto wiped his mouth with a sleeve. "Damn straight, and I'm ready for more!" He paused for a moment. "Still..." he smacked his lips a bit. "...all those goodies kinda made me thirsty..."

Kurama grinned. "Waaaay ahead of you." Grabbing one of the pitchers of milk on the table, he tugged it toward himself, raised one of his tails above the table, and began gathering a bit of chakra into it.

Naruto's contented expression turned to one of confusion. "Huh? Kurama, what're you..." He sputtered when the chakra leapt from his tail to the pitcher, hitting the milk and soaking into it. "Uh, Kurama...?"

Kurama, giggling, grabbed the pitcher with a tail and held it near Naruto, who took it, albeit with a bemused expression. "It's a little trick I learned when I was fooling around with my abilities. If I put a little bit of my chakra into a drink, it brings out the flavor and makes it super yummy!" He laughed at the unspoken question. "And no, I haven't put my chakra into any of the food. I've tried that before, and the results were kinda, ummm..." he glanced away, blushing a bit. "...explodey."

Naruto blinked. "Ex...plodey...?" He shook his head. "W-wait, Kurama, your chakra's really strong. Are you sure that's..."

Kurama beamed, folding his arms behind his head. "Safe? Oh yeah, totally! Natsu and a whole bunch of my other guild-mates taste-tested it, and they said it was the best milk they'd ever had!" He shrugged. "Sure, some of the more reserved ones were a little more energetic for an hour or two, but its not like they were bouncing all over the place." He scratched his cheek sheepishly. "Besides, you're pretty energetic as-is, so it shouldn't be much different."

Though still a bit unsure, Naruto smiled and poured himself a glass of the chakra-enhanced milk. "Eh, well, if you say its fine, it's fine." With that, he raised the glass to his lips, paused...but at Kurama's look, took a sip....

...and his eyes bugged out. Kurama smiled hopefully. "Jury says....?"

In response, Naruto downed the entire glass in one go, licked his chops...then picked up the pitcher of milk and began chugging it down. This went on for a good few seconds, and by the time Naruto slammed the pitcher down for a break, at least a quarter of it was depleted.

Kurama blinked. "So...you like?"

Naruto licked his lips, then turned to Kurama and grinned. "Damn, Kurama, you weren't kidding! That chakra really DOES bring out the flavor!" Kurama, blushing, grinned and folded his arms behind his head. "I mean, its cold, really creamy, really refreshing, and..."

Suddenly, Naruto stopped, an odd expression contorting his face. "And I'm feeling kinda weird right now..."

At this, the smile fell from Kurama's face. "Weird...?"

Naruto frowned. "Y-yeah; I mean, it's kinda hard to describe, but I'm feeling sorta..."

Suddenly, his eyes widened, and with a "GAH!", he fell sideways out of his chair and out of sight.

Kurama's eyes bugged out, and immediately, he rose out of his seat. "Naruto!" Hopping down, he rushed over to the other side of the table. Kurama, you stupid idiot! he berated himself as he made his way over. He has the...other you inside him! Who knows what kind of reaction your chakra caused when he swallowed it? Stupid!

Tails swishing in worry, he finally reached Naruto's seat. "Naruto!" He looked down at where Naruto had fallen. "Are you..."

His words immediately died in his throat as he beheld Naruto's prone form. Wha....

Almost to compound his thought, Naruto groaned. "Ughhhh....." He groggily sat up, rubbing the back of his head. "That was...that was weird."

He blinked his eyes open, and started a bit when he saw Kurama. "Kurama, hey. What's..." He paused when he saw Kurama's muzzle gaping wide open. "...what's wrong?" Something clicked suddenly in his head. "Wait a second....what's that in front of my face?" As his eyes crossed, another thing occurred to him. "And...why do my ears feel like they're way higher than they should be?" He winced. "And why do the back of my pants feel so cramped.....?"

He trailed off as he finally got a look at what was in front of his face: specifically, a muzzle. "Wha..." He brought both hands up to the muzzle to examine it further...only to gasp when he saw their current appearance. "Wh-what the hell...?!" His hands were now paws, albeit ones with extended digits to act as hands, almost like Hunter's had been, complete with pads and blunt claws. The paws themselves were covered in black fur. Stretching his arms in front of him, he paled as he saw the black fur ended at his elbows, becoming blonde fur from that point on. Right afterwards, his arms stretched to the top of his head, and he felt ears not unlike that of a dog sticking up out the top of his head. "H-how...?!"

He looked toward Kurama, who was now wincing rather guiltily. "Kurama, what..." he gasped for breath, starting to feel panic seep in. "What the hell's going on?!"

Kurama winced again. "Erm...." He faltered as he struggled for a way to explain what he was seeing, and failed. "It, erm, might be easier to just show you." Concentrating, he Requipped a large, full-length mirror in a flash of light. Slowly, he turned it around so it faced Naruto...and the ninja gaped at the sight that met him.

What he saw before him was not a human, but an anthropomorphic fox, much as Hunter was an Anthropomorphic wolf. Much of his fur, including the fur covering the vulpine ears sticking out the top of his head, was the same blonde as his human hair, save for his feet and hand-paws, which were covered in black fur. In addition, the fur on the bottom of his vulpine muzzle was a creamy white that travelled down his chest and under his shirt; a quick, experimental lift revealed that his belly area was covered in white fur as well. As he was gaping at his white-furred something, something forced itself free out of the back of his pants with a FLOOF; looking back, he saw that he was now in possession of a large, bushy, blonde-furred tail with a white tip.

Upon seeing this, he gaped at the tail for a while longer, before turning back to his reflection in the mirror. Staggering to his feet (and having difficulty doing so, owing to his new digitigrade legs), he stared at himself for while longer, not saying anything. Then....

"WHAT THE HELL?!"

Slowly,
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: Naruto stops to wash down all he'd eaten th...

choices: Naruto once again gushes about Kurama's cooking...
Naruto. Chows. DOWN...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
Still all but hyperventilating. Naruto; still resembling a yellow furred, white bellied, humanoid fox, gaped down at his hand-paws, without words to properly express himself. Kurama, meanwhile, stood forward, holding his paws forward, trying to be as assuring as he possibly could. Unfortunately, the situation was trickier than most.

“…Kurama…what…the hell…!” Naruto finally choked out, still in utter disbelief at his current form. “What happened?! I-I’m a freakin’ FOX now???”

“N-No!” Kurama insisted, before wincing and adding, “…w-well…KINDA, but-“

“-KINDA?! I CHANGED SPECIES!!!” Naruto blurted out in shock, eyes still practically bugging out of his head as he continued to process his new, animalistic form, heart still beating like a jackhammer. “Kurama, t-this doesn’t any sense! What the hell happened?? HOW the hell did it happen?!”

“I-I don’t know, I just…I SWEAR I didn’t know that would happen! I-I just thought I was making your drink yummier! Nothing else!” Kurama insisted, feeling steadily more nervous and guilty. He hated seeing Naruto in such an uncertain state of shock, and so bewildered and fearful, especially when just mere moments before all this, they were having the time of their lives.

Immediately, Kurama was kicking himself for being so careless with his powers. He should have foreseen some strange side effects. Or better yet, he should have just let the two enjoy their breakfast as originally planned. Kurama found himself wishing he wasn’t always so overly eager to spice things up, as this was hardly the first time his eagerness had landed him in trouble before.

Still, this wasn’t the time for all that. Right now, Kurana needed to be strong, especially given the circumstances. “Just…trust me, this won’t last, Naruto. None of the effects from my energy have ever had permanent changes on anyone. You don’t gotta worry about being a fox man forever. Trust me.”

Naruto, still trying to catch his breath, eventually let that news sit in as he nodded, still expression shock and fear and disbelief all at the same time.

“…O-Okay…” Naruto began, trying to calm down, “…okay. I mean, this…this is freakin’ NUTS, but…I do trust you, kiddo. So…okay…sure. J-Just temporary, right?”

“Right!” Kurama assured the elder fox, as he just nodded again, taking a deep breath.

“…Alright, okay…it’s just for a lil while. I can manage this, sure, yeah…” the blond fox remarked, to try and assure himself things would be fine as he slowly rose to his feet. “…Just…just gotta stay calm, try’n-“

Unfortunately, with his new digitigrade legs, Naruto; who has now and always been a biped, fell flat on his rump as soon as he stood. Wincing, Kurama immediately rushed over to his friend to help him sit up.

“…W-What the hell??” Naruto began, rubbing his backside in discomfort, before looking down at his legs and realizing what had happened. “Crap, I can’t even WALK like this, can I…urgh, whatever, no problem…don’t need to walk, I guess…”

Kurama wasted no time reaching over to Naruto and helping him up to his seat, where he once again sat before the table, unable to do much else. Seeing Naruto this helpless to things, however, was steadily becoming too much for Kurama.

Looking down shamefully, Kurama shook his head and said, “…Naruto, I’m so sorry. I-I didn’t mean to do all this. I SWEAR, if I knew adding some of my chakra to your drink would make you…kinda like me, I never would’a done it! Honest! I dunno how I could’a been so stupid…”

But after a moment, Naruto, who was steadily managing to calm himself, glanced down at the saddened young fox, then, instinctively, he wrapped an arm around the pre-teen Nine Tailed Beast, and tugged him close as he gently ruffled the young fox’s head.

“…Hey, c’mon, man, don’t do that,” Naruto insisted, voice more calmed. “It was an accident, they happen, right?”

“But accidentally turning your best friend into a walking, talking FOX??”

Chuckling a bit uneasily in agreement, Naruto nonetheless cleared his throat and shrugged as he said, “Hey, we live in a crazy age, kiddo. It’s not like this is even the weirdest thing that’s ever happened to me, lest we forget the de-aging…or those freaky magic masks from Termina?”

Even in this situation, Kurama couldn’t help but chuckle softly at the memory.

“Plus, I mean, more I think about it, it’s not like this is the WORST thing that could temporarily happen to me.”

“How do ya mean?”

“Well, think about it. I get to spend…however long I’m gonna be stuck like this, as another species. I mean…”

Naruto’s muzzle lifted a bit as he sniffed the air, and licked his chops with a notable and toothy grin.

“For starters, my sense of smell is WAY enhanced. I bet even more so than Dog Breath’s,” Naruto said with an impish grin. “And if your food smells even better than it already did, I bet it’s gonna TASTE even better too, right?”

Even in this situation, Kurama couldn’t help but smirk knowingly as he gave Naruto a wink to confirm on that part. “Not only that,” Kurama started, “but if you’re like me, then that means your gonna probably be able to pack away more at a quicker pace than ya already do.”

“Well, h-heh, suddenly being a Fox doesn’t sound all that crazy after all, huh,” Naruto remarked, before smiling a bit more softly and adding, “n-not only that, but…now?”

His arm still wrapped around the young fox’s shoulders, Naruto tightened his one armed hug just a bit as he jostled the younger fox to get his attention as he looked down at Kurama and added, “…Now, we actually do kinda look like brothers.”

Taken back by these last words, Kurama looked up at his ‘big bro,’ unsure what to say.

…Somehow, Naruto always knew the right things to say, as almost immediately, Kurama felt himself get misty eyed, before wrapping his arms around his best friend, who returned the embrace in full.

“…Thanks, big brother…”

“Hey, you were willing to look like my species just to meet up with me. Only fair I repay the favor…albeit indirectly, right?”

The two snickered a bit at that, before a DEEP rumbling emitted from the new blond fox’s still mostly flat belly. Immediately, rather than blush, Naruto grinned toothily and said, “…And since I dunno how to really MOVE with my new legs…whadduya say we make that irrelevant by stuffing ourselves silly…”

“Hehe, now you’re DEFINITELY speaking my language,” Kurama said teasingly, before the two turned back to the table as Kurama sat himself back on his seat. The young fox was about to dig in, when he stopped, ears twitching, as a thought occurred. "Say, Naruto..."

The blond fox turned back to Kurama and asked, "What's up, kiddo?"

"...Well, seeing as how...you were just mentioning smell being enhanced, and flavors probably tasting different. Mind if I ask how you like my cooking...now that you're like this?"

"Kurama, you KNOW your cooking is amazing, I don't see-"

"-W-Well, I know it's pretty good, but...I so rarely get to cook for anyone who isn't human. And, well, I'M hardly the most impartial judge, h-heh..."

Rolling his eyes in a good natured way, Naruto nonetheless nudged Kurama in the arm playfully, before taking his first forkful of pancakes as a fox...

...And almost immediately after...
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.title: Naruto continues to freak out over his new form

choices: Naruto elects to keep his clothes on
Naruto caves and takes off everything but his undies
1121122221122221112222211121212111221111.content:
As soon as his muzzle closed and the pancakes touched his tongue, Naruto froze for a moment, his eyes bugging wide open. Concerned, Kurama tilted his head. "N-Naruto? Are you OK?"

Naruto didn't respond. Instead, he took the fork out, slowly chewed the pancakes, and swallowed, absentmindedly smacking his chops. Slowly, his eyes drifted to the pancakes still on his plate. Kurama winced. "I'm sorry, did your taste buds get messed up? I swear, I didn't mean to--"

Any further comment on Kurama's part was forestalled as Naruto planted his paws on either side of the table, shoved his muzzle into the pancakes, and began tearing into them.
