Heeere it comes... he thought to himself, before Ed removed his hand from his mouth and let out a tremendously loud belch which lasted a few seconds straight, shocking and disgusting many of the spectators around them, whilst earning a chuckle from the hooded observer. Sheesh, and I thought Uzumaki had bad manners...

"Rgh, wait, there's more..." said Ed, before pressing his belly and forcing up an even louder and longer belch almost immediately after the last. When it was finally over, Ed leaned back in his chair and smacked his lips. "Ahhhhhh, MUCH better!" replied Ed, patting his belly proudly, and inadvertently forcing a much lighter burp free as a result. He then proceeded to massage his still rather aching gut carelessly while the others were still recovering from the surprise eruption. Meanwhile, Al began to shake his metallic helmet of a head as he sighed to himself "Honestly, Ed..." said Al, half embarrassed, and half still in shock, "...you can be a real pig sometimes." to which Ed scoffed and replied, "Well, I'm sorry, but if YOU had a stomach full of pork chops, giant burgers, and a ton of soda, you'd probably be burping your ass off too! Besides, what's more important? Having good manners in an eating contest? Or having enough room in your gut to WIN said eating contest? Hmmm?" Ed raised an eyebrow and smirked when Al couldn't respond. "That's what I thought."

All the while, something else caught the hooded spectators watchful but concealed eyes. He noticed that from all the sudden bursting of clothing and gastric discomfort, Ed's navel had begun to tense up abnormally, which caused him to smirk as he was fully aware of what that meant was going to happen very soon. Hehe, excellent... he thought to himself.

Al shook his head and asked, "Well, do you at least have enough room to continue now?" To which Ed grinned mischievously and said, "Hehe, I dunno. I think I can push out one last big one before I finish the burgers...best play it safe and finish with as much room as possible, right?" Al rolled his fiery eyes and shrugged as Ed took a deep breath and pressed against his gut....only nothing happened. He scowled disappointed and said, "Ah crap...guess not." Though it was mostly for show, there was still a bit of excess pressure causing him some discomfort which needed to be expelled.

Luckily, he still had about half a pitcher of soda left, and immediately figured, if it helped free up some room last time, no reason it wouldn't now. But as he reached for it, Al interjected with, "Don't overdo it, Ed! You already look like you're practically pregnant! If you overdo it before you can even finish those burgers, you're going to make yourself sick!" Hearing these words, Ed glanced down at his immensely swollen tummy and considered the notion. As it stood, he couldn't recall the last time his belly was ever this immensely swollen before, and maybe it would be best not to add more to that when he still had three more burgers to go.

However; knowing that downing the rest of the soda would help Ed free up enough room to finish the burgers, as well as bust another appendage adding some unneeded pressure to the elder Elric, the hooded spectator decided to give Ed a boost by egging the short tempered alchemist on further. He cleared his throat and masked his voice as he called out from the crowd and said, "Awww, what's wrong? Is the pipsqueak's tummy too itty bitty for a little more soda?"

Like before, despite all discomfort, Ed's temper got the better of him as he immediately hopped on top of his chair and flailed his arms in the air angrily as he shouted, "PIPSQUEEEEAK?!!!!! ITTY-BITTYYYYYYY?!?!?!?!!! GGAAAAHHHH!!! WHY DON'TCHA COME UP HERE AND SAY THAT TO THIS ITTY BITTY PIPSQUEAK'S FACE!!!!!!!!!!" As Ed's furious rambling continued, the hooded spectator couldn't help but snicker to himself at the overly animated display. Though he didn't really mean his insulting remarks, he knew it'd be the motivator Ed needed to push himself further....the fact that it was absolutely hilarious to watch was just an added plus.

"Rgh! Itty-bitty-pipsqueak...!" Ed continued grumbling angrily to himself as he snatched the pitcher and looked furiously at the unseen crowd member heckling him. "Could an itty-bitty-pipsqueak do THIS?!" Without hesitation, he proceeded to scornfully chug down ther emaining contents of his soda pitcher in an effort to free up the last bit of pent up pressure ailing him. While Ed was busy chugging away, Al was glancing curiously at the crowd of spectators around him. That kind of sounded like the same person from before...why would someone be trying to heckle Ed like that...? Al thought to himself as he looked amidst the crowd of people, hoping to match a face to the voice, but to no avail, was unable to find the culprit in question.

Still suspicious, Al nonetheless turned his attention back to Ed, whose belly was continuing to swell further. As he watched though, he couldn't help but shift his attention to a strange occurrence from Ed's belly. His belly button seemed to be shifting and vibrating unusually as he relentlessly chugged more and more soda out of spite. ...Please don't make yourself sick, big brother... Al thought, still concerned for his older brothers well being.

Sure enough, as Ed continued to chug the remaining contents of his soda pitcher...
13312211222.title: Ed finishes the burger, then belches and rests up.

choices: Ed finishes the burgers, winning the contest
Ed finishes the burgers, but there's one more course left  to go
133122112221.content:
Ed, even as he continued pouring the cola into his mouth, winced; the area of his belly around and including his navel was now feeling unbearably tight, but he pressed on, unwilling to give up now. And besides, he thought angrily as he continued to chug, there's no way I'm slowing down in front of that asshole, whoever he might be!

Said "asshole" was watching the young alchemist with rapt attention. Thaaaaat's it.... he mentally encouraged. Just a liiiiittle more... He watched eagerly, the bulge in the back of his jeans shifting and moving about as the blonde chugged away, slowly inflating his stomach and causing his navel to tense up even more....

*POP!*

...until, finally, his belly button violently inverted, transforming within the space of a second from a small pit to a fleshy nub of comparable size. The hooded spectator smirked. Heh; Check. And. Mate.

Lowering the now nearly-depleted pitcher, Ed belched, slammed it down on the table, and leaned back. "Oh man, that felt sooooo good..." He closed his eyes and sighed, mentally preparing himself for Al's inevitable scolding at his lack of manners. When nothing was fortchoming, Ed opened his eyes and looked up at his little brother. His fiery eyes were wide, his metallic face staring directly at his belly. "Uh, Al? What's wrong?" Instead of answering, the younger Elric simply raised his arm and pointed at his distended navel. Ed followed it, his eyes widening as he beheld his popped-out belly button. "...huh. That's new." Experimentally, he raised his non-metallic arm and prodded the small protrusion, a slightly goofy smile appearing on his face as he did so. "Heh, that feels sorta funny..." Al groaned and shook his head; he loved Ed dearly, but sometimes he could be so immature...

The spectator, on the other hand, chuckled to himself. Ah, it's always fun to watch them do that. Making sure no one was looking, he slipped one mitten off, slipped the uncovered hand up to the top of his head beneath his hood, and scratched a spot on his head that had been bothering him. "Oooh, yeah...that feels nice...heh heh..." Once it was scratched to his satisfaction, he retracted his hand (being careful to tug his hood further over his head), slipped the mitten back on, and got back to watching.

To his delight, Ed had tired of playing with his belly button, and had now started on the last of the three burgers. Oooooh yes...got your second wind, don't give up now...

Unknown to him, his impromptu scratching session had drawn Al's attention, who was now glancing suspiciously in his direction. Now he was sure of it: the strange noises had been coming from the spectator wearing a hooded sweatshirt, jeans, and mittens...on a Spring day.

Al's eyes focused on him for a second, before turning his attention back to Ed to make sure he didn't make himself sick. He'd worry about that weird guy later...
133122112221.title: Pop goes the navel

choices: A giant sundae with the works...
A massive jug of milk (AKA Ed's worst enemy…ever…of all time...)
1331221122212.content:
Given his second wind, Ed ravenously proceeded to scarf down his burgers as quick as possible. The quick paced eating caused his still slightly but steadily increasing gut to jiggle and vibrate, which; in turn, caused his now inverted belly button to wobble around comically as the young man continued to hungrily stuff his face. Some spectators stared in awe, others; disgust, and some, even amusement, as a few began to cheer for the kid to keep up his momentum.

But Al's shifted focus remained on only one particular spectator; the overly hooded individual who Al was certain was the culprit heckling his older brother. [i]I wonder what that guy's deal is…[/i] Al thought to himself as he examined the individual in question. [i]Why's he picking on brother? And why the heck is he dressed like he just stepped out of an igloo…? What's he hiding underneath all that stuff?/i] The hooded individual, oblivious to Al's musing, and continued to watch the alchemist soldier through his burgers.

Though he still pissed at the remarks from the audience members about his height and would love nothing more than to find the jerk in question and make him eat a metal fist, Ed nonetheless was too busy chomping down his burgers to care for an extended period of time. And so he continued to chomp away. Finishing his eighth burger with ease and spite, and moving onto burger number nine. All the while, as the burgers' size grew smaller and smaller; little by little, Ed's stomach grew larger and and larger.

Occasionally, Ed would stop to catch his breath momentarily, but jumped right back to more of the remaining burgers, until he'd successfully polished off all ten burgers with eventual gusto.

Leaning back in his chair, Ed burped loudly and patted his belly victoriously. "Ahhh, FINALLY!" Ed exclaimed with pride, before grumbling to himself, "Hmph! Bet an itty-bitty-pipsqueak couldn't polish off those burgers…"

The waiter smiled and took the plate from Ed's table. "Nicely done, young man. Looks like you've just about got this thing in the bag, huh?"

Ed smiled and said, "Yup! Just about in the-errr…w-wait, whadduya mean "just about" in the bag?" Ed glanced at the waiter quizzically as he stepped aside and smirked at the young alchemist, and said, "Come on, kid. What kind of competition ends after just two rounds?" Ed gaped and said, "Ummm…the kind with a bunch of pork chops in one round, and ten giant burgers in the next, perhaps…?" The waiter smiled as another stepped towards Ed, causing the young man's jaw to drop. "And what better way to close our escapades off than with this?"

Even some spectators murmured to themselves at Ed's final venture standing between him and victory. The spectator in question smirked to himself. [i]Well…THIS should be interesting…[/i]

Ed's final challenge was none other than…
1331221122212.title: Ed finishes the burgers, with one round left...

choices: Heckle Ed some more, in the hopes he'd at least get started
Start cheering; maybe positive reinforcement would work better...
13312211222122.content:
Ed gaped for a few seconds at the evil, evil thing that had been placed on the table before him. Oh, you have GOT to be kidding me... the young alchemist thought, turning slightly green in the face. Al wasn't much different; though he was physically incapable of gaping, his own fiery eyes were widened greatly. Wow...what are the odds... The hooded spectator, on the other hand, shook as he fought to restrain his snickers. Oh man...whatever happens, this is gonna be EPIC...

What was eliciting this reaction from the three? Shortly after revealing that there was one course left to go, the waiters had brought what was, quite possibly, the largest jug of milk any of them had ever seen; it had to be at least several gallons of what appeared to be whole milk, and the table was even beginning to creak a bit.

"Milk," Ed muttered in a tiny voice. "Out of all the things in the world, it had to be MILK..." The hooded spectator fought harder than ever to restrain his laughter; thanks to his contacts, he was well aware that the young alchemist loathed milk; he'd hated it his entire life.

Al, obviously aware of this, tried to lighten the mood a bit. "W-well, brother, you know Granny, Winry, and me worry about you not getting enough calcium in your diet..."

Ed slowly turned his head toward Al. "It's MILK, Alphonse," the boy replied, deadpan. "It is a disgusting liquid secreted by a COW." He turned back to the massive jug on the table. "Oh man, why did it have to be milk...?" Al, seeing his attempt at lightening his brother's mood fail, simply sighed.

The spectator smirked underneath his hood. Giving up already? I think not. He frowned; how to go about 'encouraging' Ed, though? He could insult his height again, but considering Ed's complete and utter hatred of the beverage, he wasn't sure how far that would take him. "Hmmm," the spectator muttered to himself, folding his arms (and taking care to conceal as much of his mittens as he could). What to do?

He thought for a few seconds; luckily, it wasn't long before an idea came to him. Hmm...that might work. Smirking, he decided to....
13312211222122.title: A massive jug of milk (AKA Ed's worst enemy...

choices: Ed powers on, trying to get this over with as soon as possible
Ed needs to catch his breath.
133122112221222.content:
Well, it won't be as fun as teasing him...but if I can get him to take on his least favorite thing on the face of this planet, then it's worth a shot... the hooded spectator thought to himself. He then proceeded to shift amongst the crowd of spectators and cleared his throat, before speaking out once more. "COME ON, PIP-errr...FULLMETAL! YOU CAN DO THIS!"

The cheer caught both Ed and Al's attention as they turned to the crowd. "It's just milk! Might be a LOT of milk, sure! But if ANYONE'S tough enough to drink it all, it's you!" Ed faced the frighteningly tall jug of milk while Al kept his focus on the crowd. He glanced for the hooded spectator, and sure enough, he spotted him hiding amongst the crowd as he proceeded to start a chant.

"Full-Metal! Full-Metal!" The hooded stranger started. Sure enough, other members of the audience proceeded to join in, chanting for Ed to go all the way. It's the same guy! Al thought to himself. Why would he go from taunting and being mean to Ed, to cheering him on...? He knew he'd have to get to the bottom of this. But as the chant 'Full-Metal' continued to grow from the crowd, Al shifted his focus back to his big brother, seeing him glare at the jug with a bit of determination. H-he's actually gonna try and drink it...

Sure enough, Al stepped forward and held his arms up as he began to chant with the crowd. "Bro-ther! Bro-ther! Bro-ther!" Looking around, and seeing that everyone believed he was tough enough to finish this, Ed glared with certainty at the milk. They're right! I can do this...I'm the FullMetal Alchemist! If I can lay the hurt on psychotic homunculus, renegade alchemists, and tolerate Mustang's big mouth for more than six seconds, then I can handle a little bit of m- his thought halted mid-sentence, remembering the beast he was now up against. He then glanced down at his own immensely bloated stomach as it began to gurgle in protest, causing him to wince slightly as he clutched his stomach briefly in pain.

But nevertheless, Ed shook it off, and kept his determinations high. "No, I can do this! And I WILL!" he said to himself with certainty as he grabbed the jug and hoisted it off the table, catching everyone's attention. He glared angrily at the jug of milk and said, "Milk! You're going down!!"

A moment of stillness passed, as Ed began to sweat nervously, despite the fierceness in his face. Finally, the young alchemist took the jug and slowly forced it to his lips. Al and the crowd gasped as Ed tilted the jug up, and began to take big hearty gulps of his least favorite substance on the planet. The spectator smirked to himself as the strange bulge from the back of his pants began shifting left and right before he halted it and grinned beneath his hood. I knew that would work. Wow, look at you go, Mr. Elric. At the rate you're chugging that jug, I would have assumed you LIVED off of milk...well...no, then you wouldn't be so fun-sized, hehe.

Al, meanwhile, simply stared as his fiery eyes grew wide eyed. He's...actually drinking milk... he thought to himself. Ohhh, if Winry could see him now...

Meanwhile, Ed chugged away. One hearty gulp of milk from the massive jug bulging down his throat and into his gargantuan and growing gut at a time. As more time went on...
133122112221222.title: Start cheering; positive reinforcement might help.

choices: Ed finishes the funnel and leaves, the spectator following close behind
Ed finishes the funnel but has trouble getting up, but is aided by the spectator
1331221122212222.content:
In spite of the massive gulps he was taking, Ed only made it about a quarter of the way through the jug of milk before he set it down, groaned, and leaned back in his chair, gently rubbing his aching tummy. "Damn it..." he moaned, letting out a rather queasy-sounding belch. "Tastes like vomit..." Sluggishly, he reached up with his sleeve and wiped off his milk mustache. Al merely looked down at him in concern

The spectator, on the other hand, raised an eyebrow. Hmm, looks as though Ed's starting to flag... He grinned mischievously under his hood. Well, I know how to rectify that... Doing his best to mask his voice, he called out, "Oh, c'mon! You're already a quarter of the way through, pipsqueak! Don't tell me you're giving up now!"

Ed's face reddened, and Al's eyes zeroes in on the spectator. Wait...so first he's heckling Brother, then he's cheering him on, and now he's back to heckling? Is he schizophrenic or something?

Ed, oblivious to Al's musings, opened his mouth to retort...until another queasy belch escaped. Groaning, he settled for a comparatively subdued but still rather loud "Oh, go to hell!" Scowling, he turned back to the jug of milk, glaring at it with a mixture of hatred and dread. Damn it...if I drink any more of that white sludge, I might puke, but I don't wanna give that bastard the satisfaction of seeing me fail... Ed's face screwed up in thought. What do I...that's it! A massive grin lit up his face; why hadn't he thought of that before?

Al looked down again at Ed, still concerned, but now more than a little confused. "Um, Brother? What are you planning?"

Ed smirked up at Al. "Just something the crowd's gonna love..." And hopefully something that'll shut that jerk up, too....

With that thought, Ed dragged the jug closer to him, smirked...and clapped his hands together.

Al blinked. "Uh, brother...?"

The hooded spectator's eyes widened. A transmutation? Can't wait to see where this leads...

The crowd, equally intrigued, watched with rapt attention as Ed slammed his hands on the sides of the jug, lighting up the room with the crackling energy of an alchemical transmutation, causing some of the crowd to shield their eyes. Within a few seconds, the light died down, revealing that the jug had been changed, though the vile liquid inside remained the same.

The crowd fell silent as they gaped at what the container had been transformed into. The hooded spectator grinned widely, the bulge in the back of his jeans moving back and forth. Oh ho ho ho, this is gonna be EPIC....

Al simply stared at the new object on the table. "Brother...is that what I think it is?"

Ed nodded, grinning. "Yep, sure is."

The object, in question, was a metallic funnel that had been created from the glass jug. It appeared to be a normal jug, save that it had a small catch towards the bottom that kept the milk from leaking out. Once the catch was undone, however...

Grinning widely, Ed hefted the milk-filled funnel up to his mouth, placed the tip in his mouth, and flipped the catch. Almost immediately, thick, creamy milk began pouring down the funnel into his waiting gullet. Ed almost gagged, but managed to avoid spluttering.

Al's eye twitched a bit. "Brother..."

Ed threw an apologetic look Al's way, but nonetheless kept the funnel where it was, pouring milk into his gargantuan but still-growing tummy. The crowd watched, flabbergasted, as the young alchemist's already-overpacked midsection continued to inflate, almost like a water balloon being filled. His fly, already forced all the way down (and exposing his light-blue boxers in the process,) began to strain as his stomach grew bigger and bigger.

The spectator chuckled silently, even as the bulge in the back of his pants began wagging even faster. Well, Mr. Elric, it appears as though you've persevered... He smirked. Excellent job, sir; excellent job...
1331221122212222.title: Ed needs to catch his breath.

choices: The hooded individual trails a little longer then finally introduces himself.
Al spots and confronts him.
13312211222122221.content:
There was near silence amidst the crowd of people observing the scene.

The eyes of all watching widened with a mix of awe, disgust, amusement, and even bewilderment, but none more bewildered than Al as the young suit of armor leaned in, almost unable to fathom what his fiery eyes were now baring witness to.

"I-I don't think I've EVER seen anyone's tummy get that large before..." Alphonse said to no one in particular as they continued to watch Ed relentlessly chug down more and more of his least favorite substance from the bottom catch of a funnel. More notably, few people were able to take their eyes off of the young alchemists unnaturally distended belly as it inflated to obscene amounts, pressing outward like a water balloon that should have burst a long time ago.

The hooded spectator grinned as he watched Ed; despite a strained and disgusted look on his face, chug relentlessly. Goodness, he's drinking more milk in one sitting than most people do all year round. I wonder if drinking all that milk at once'll make him any taller... He thought, chuckling to himself from beneath his hood, but quickly regaining composure on the off chance he caught anyone's attention.

Ed's face began to redden from exhaustion as the milk flowed almost uncontrollably down his mouth, but the bloated teen toughed it out and continued to chug as steadily as he could without so much as spilling a drop. Rgh, if Winry ever gives me crap about milk ever again...I SWEAR...ugh, c'mon, you got this, just a little more... he thought to himself as he soldiered onward. I better at least be taller when this is over...

Several minutes passed as his stomach continued to inflate to ridiculously large proportions. Ed's tummy had distended so far past his pants zippers limit, that the fabric began to tear ever so slightly as Ed chugged on and on.

Finally, Ed leaned back and began to pull the funnel upwards from his mouth as the final rush of milk visibly rushed from the bottom catch of the funnel and down into Ed's reluctant but awaiting mouth. A few more drops followed, then a few more, then, nothing. Weary, Ed held the funnel outward to show that it was now bone dry, and dropped it with a hearty THUD!

"....He...he actually did it..." Al said with amazement.

A moment of silence passed as Ed groggily sat in his chair, both hands rested atop his amazingly distended stomach, groaning slightly. "Brother...? A-are you okay...?"

As if to answer Al's question, Ed's mouth flung open as he let out the loudest and queasiest-sounding belch anyone in the audience had ever heard. The sudden eruption carried enough force to cause his belly to vibrate and jostle, and sure enough, the sudden motion had pushed a further strain on the front of his pants, until finally...

*RRRRIIIIIIIIIIIP!*

...If Al still had a face to blush, it would be redder than seven hundred roses as the front of Ed's pants finally gave and tore wide open, exposing his light blue boxers and causing his belly to distend outward, free from any restraints.

The hooded spectator started visibly jerking himself as he fought the urge not to bust out laughing hysterically. Ohhhh my, I KNEW this would be epic... he thought as he continued to force back his amusement.

When it was over, Ed leaned back against his chair, utterly dazed as a weary smile grew over his face. Instead of laugh or be mortified, the crowd stood in yet another moment of silence, then erupted into a cheer of congratulations for the young alchemist finally beating the challenge.

Too dazed to fully hear the applause he was receiving, Ed simply muttered "...So...much...milk..." to himself as he continued to massage his immensely swollen gut. Shaking his head, Al nonetheless chuckled to himself and said, "You goof..." then approached his brother. "Need a hand, brother?" he asked. Ed belched then nodded weakly. Al offered his hand and was about to help his brother up, when he glanced down and remembered something. "Err....brother...?"

However dazed, Ed glanced curiously and looked down, almost immediately blushing with embarrassment as he saw his pants had ripped. "...I was wondering what that sound was..." With one hand clutching his pants for dear life, he took Al's hand with the other, as Al gently hoisted his brother up to his feet. Ed took his free hand and held up his swollen tummy as best he could.

The attendant then approached Ed, applauding softly himself. "Well done, young man! Seems you've got the appetite of a champion afterall!"

Ed groaned and said, "...Milk--*BURP*--is not the drink of champions..." The attendant simply laughed and said, "Don't be so sure." He then held out a Golden Trophy Bowl. Inside it, several wads of cash. Both Ed and Al's eyes lit up at the sight. "....Soooo much money..." Ed muttered, almost forgetting how full he was for a split second, before reaching towards the Trophy and wincing, immediately clutching his stomach for support once again. "Heh...eh, Al? You mind?" Still bewildered, Al shook his head and accepted the prize on Ed's behalf. The attendant smiled and said, "Let's hear it one more time for him, folks!"

The crowd applauded once again as Ed, a bit more present this time, smiled wearily, still clutching his pants for dear life as he leaned towards Al and said, "Let's get the hell outta here before my pants bust even more...or my auto-mail leg does trying to hold me up..."

Distracted, Ed looked up and saw Al glancing curiously at the crowd, unable to find the hooded heckler. "Al? Did you hear what I said?" As if snapped out of his trance, Al looked down and nodded, then the two took their leave from the scene. The spectator in the hood watched still hiding from within the crowd, then proceeded to take off as well.

Both Al and Ed walked onward, with Ed still clutching his pants and stomach for dear life, occasionally groaning and burping from all the discomfort the prolonged movement was causing his distressed tummy. "I still can't believe you actually drank all that milk," Al noted, before chuckling and adding, "Winry would be so proud." Ed grunted to himself and said, "Pffft, I almost wish she WAS there. I'd have taken her tossing wrenches over my head for not wanting to drink the milk than that jackass who kept giving me crap the whole time." Al nodded and said, "Yeah, he sure was obnoxious...but..."

Ed glanced curiously at Al. "But?"

"But believe it or not, at one point, he got people cheering for you too, when it looked like you were getting ready to call it quits with the milk." Ed raised an eyebrow, and said, "Wait, you SAW this jerk? Why didn't ya tell me? We could'a kicked his ass after the-" Before Ed could continue, his stomach gurgled loudly, causing him to wince and reel back again. "...Oof...fair point..."

Al shrugged and said, "It was really weird. One second he was heckling you, the next, cheering, then heckling again! And I didn't even tell you the weirdest part. He was dressed like he'd just walked through a blizzard."

"In THIS weather...?" Ed asked. Al nodded. "From head to toe. Honestly, if I didn't know better, I'd say he was trying to disguise himself." Ed glanced curiously and said, "Unless he's from central or some kinda big shot, what would it matter if people saw him?" Ed stopped and asked, "...You think he was a fugitive?" Al shook his head and said, "Why would a fugitive risk getting caught just to watch you stuff your face?" Ed scowled slightly, but eased up and said, "Ehhh, fair point..."

Unbeknownst to them however, was that the individual in question was trailing just out of their sights behind them, until...
13312211222122221.title: Ed wins and leaves, the spectator follows closely.

choices: The three reach the warehouse, and Ed immediately collapses on a mattress
The three reach the warehouse, but Ed still has some questions for Hunter
133122112221222212.content:
Ed and Al continued soldiering on, the latter sighing as Ed staggered along, supporting his weight on his younger brother. The young, overstuffed alchemist groaned as they walked, holding his busted pants with hand and supporting himself on Al's arm with the other. "Oh geez, Al; my stomach's really hurting..."

Al rolled his fiery eyes. "Well, I'm sorry, brother, but it WAS your decision to stuff yourself at that eating competition." He looked down at his big brother's ridiculously swollen, distended midsection, inverted navel wobbling with the slightest movement. "Seriously, I've never seen someone's stomach get THAT big..."

In spite of his discomfort, Ed grinned at his brother. "Heh; ya think maybe I set some kinda record?" He belched, groaning a bit, before continuing. "Actually, even though I'm kinda feeling sick now, it was kinda fun just stuffing myself..." his grin turned mischievous. "Who knows? Maybe you can try it once we get you your body back."

Al laughed nervously. "Uh, thanks, but I think I'll pass..."

Clack.

Al's eyes went wide. "Brother, did you..."

Ed, in spite of his immense discomfort, nodded. "Yeah, I did."

Some distance behind them, the spectator cursed as the sizable pebble he'd accidentally kicked bounced off the street a couple times. Damn it! How did I not see that? He took a breath. Alright, calm down; just duck behind an alleyway, let 'em look this way for a second, and everything'll be...

His thoughts trailed off as both Elric brothers turned their heads behind them, their eyes narrowing as they caught sight of him.

Aw, crapbaskets.

Ed scowled. "That... that jackass was actually following us?!"

Al said nothing for a second. Then... "Brother, could you support your weight on my leg for a second?"

Confused, Ed nonetheless complied. "Uh, sure Al, but what..." His eyes lit up as Al clapped his armored hands together. "...ah, I got it."

The spectator's eyes widened under his hood. H-he's transmuting? Almost to confirm this fact, Al slammed his hands down on the street. Realizing he'd already wasted too much time, he backed away, intending to run...

...only for the ground beneath him to warp, rising up and wrapping around his legs. Crap! he thought, struggling. Crapcrapcrapcrap!

Ed looked up at his older brother, undeniable pride in his eyes. "Wow...nice one, Al."

Al chuckled. "Thanks, Ed; been working on that one for a bit." His eyes moved towards the caught stranger, and his tone turned serious. "Now, let's see what this is all about..."

Ed cackled, an undeniably wicked gleam in his eyes. "And then I can show that jerk what happens when you insult the Fullmetal Alchemist..." Al sighed, but otherwise said nothing. Together, they loped toward the stranger, who, upon seeing this, struggled even harder, but it was no good; his legs were stuck fast.

Upon reaching the stranger, Ed wasted no time berating him, even as he marveled at his unseasonably thick clothing. "Alright, you bastard, talk! Who the hell are you, why were you calling me pipsqueak," his eye twitched slightly at this, "and why the HELL were you following us?!" The stranger merely stood still, more than a little terrified.

Al put a calming hand on Ed's shoulder. "Ed, take it easy." He turned his attention towards the stranger. When he spoke, it was in a calm, but very stern tone; Ed noted it to be not unlike the one he used with him whenever he was scolding him. "Who are you?" Upon seeing the stranger still frightened, he softened his tone the slightest bit. "Relax, we're not gonna hurt you..." Ed gaped at Al, shocked, but the animated armor disregarded this. "...we just wanna know who you are."

This, thankfully, seemed to calm the hooded stranger a bit. "W-well," he stammered, still composing himself, "before I introduce myself, it might be best if I take the mittens and hood off first." He gulped. "Just, uh, promise me you won't freak out, OK?"

Ed scowled. "You don't get to make demands, jerk...!"

"Ed!" Al exclaimed, giving his brother his best reproachful look (a somewhat difficult task when one's face was made of immovable metal.) Nonetheless, Ed seemed to get the message, and settled back into a sulky silence. "We promise."

Their prisoner nodded. "Alright..." Holding up both of his hands, he grabbed one of his mittens and tugged it right off.

Ed and Al's eyes widened. "Wh-what the hell..." the stuffed Alchemist muttered, staring.

The stranger's hand was very odd, to say the least. Specifically, it was covered in brown fur, blunt nails like a dog's jutting out from each finger. As he brought the newly-uncovered hand to pull off his other mitten, the brothers noted that he also had canine-like pads on the underside of his hand; one large one on his palm, five small ones on each of his fingers. Upon pulling off the other mitten, they saw it was the same as the other one. Then, bringing his hands (or were they hand-like paws?) up to his hood, he gripped it and threw it back, exposing his face and head in its entirety. Upon catching sight of it, Al's eyes got even wider, while Ed's mouth dropped open a bit. The stranger, seeing their reactions, laughed a bit nervously. "Uh, hi; how ya doin'?" Ed and Al didn't reply; they were too busy staring at what had been revealed: specifically, a long, lupine muzzle and nose, pointed ears at the top of his head, and, oddly enough, a pair of glasses perched upon the bridge of his muzzle that covered a pair of hazel eyes. His head, like his hands, was covered in brown fur. In addition, he had a messy crop of fur at the top of his head, of a slightly different shade of brown than the rest of his body, giving it the appearance of hair. He appeared to be, quite simply, a bipedal wolf.

Al found his voice first. "You're...you're a wolf?"

The strange wolf-person laughed, this time a bit more easily. "An anthropomorphic wolf to be exact, but yeah." His lupine face suddenly contorted in discomfort. "Which reminds me..." Reaching behind him, he reached into the back of his jeans, rooting around a bit. "Let's see...ah!" Grinning triumphantly, he grabbed something and pulled it out, revealing it to be a long, bushy tail. "Ahhh, that's better..." he sighed, releasing it and letting it wag about happily. "I swear, it felt like my tail was jammed up my ass." He turned back to the brothers, looking a great deal more at ease. "Alright, now introductions." He grinned widely, extending a paw/hand. "The name's Hunter; I'd ask you for your names, but your reputations precede you."

Confused, Al nonetheless extended his hand, but was stopped by Ed. "Al, what the hell are you doing? This guy was heckling me and stalking both of us!"

Al looked at Ed a bit reprovingly, but held his hand where it was. "Yeah, we wanted to ask; why were you making fun of Brother at the contest?"

Hunter blinked. "Oh, that?" He laughed a bit nervously, scratching the back of his head. "Well, it's no secret Ed's a little...sensitive, about his height..." this earned an infuriated glare from the young State Alchemist. "...so I thought calling him pipsqueak would help motivate him to keep going."

Al couldn't help but chuckle a bit at this. "Well, you thought right..." A thought occured to him, and the stern tone returned. "I still have to ask, though: why did you dress up like that just to see Brother stuff his..." He gasped. "You...you were making sure he stuffed himself so you could eat him, didn't you?!"

"Wh-what?!" Hunter exclaimed, jerking in surprise and causing his glasses to slip down his muzzle a bit. Pushing them back up, he continued, "N-no! I just like watching guys like Ed stuff themselves and make fools of themselves!" He grumbled, folding his arms. "Seriously, why does everyone always think I'm gonna eat them?" He saw Ed opening his mouth, but interjected. "Also, I was following you so I could see your gut bouncing and jiggling as you walked; looked pretty damn funny." Ed blushed wildly and looked away. "And, uh...once you've digested a good bit, I figured I could treat you some more."

Ed blinked. "Treat? You mean..."

Al stared at the anthro. "Brother just got done stuffing himself, and you wanted to encourage him to do it again?"

Hunter nodded. "Eeyep; even found an abandoned warehouse to set up shop in; it's got some really comfy mattresses Ed can sleep everything off on, plus I've brought and prepared a ton of food for ya." He chuckled. "Who knows, we might even get to know each other a little better."

Ed, in spite of himself, considered this: as much as he still wanted to pummel this freak for making fun of him, he WAS tired, and the hotel was a ways away...

Swallowing his pride, Ed asked, "Is it far?"

"Brother!" Al exclaimed, looking at Ed in horror.

Hunter chuckled a bit. "Nope; it's just a block or two down." He winced a bit. "I'll show you the way, but would you mind...?" He gestured to his legs.

Al followed the gesture. "Oh yeah; sorry!" Clapping his hands together, he placed them on Hunter's bindings, causing the restraints to sink back into the street to reveal his booted feet.

Hunter sighed. "Thanks. Now..." Reaching down, he unlaced the boots and kicked them off, revealing a pair of elongated, lupine feet, the back of the foot sticking up in the air. Now that the brothers looked closer, they could see that Hunter had a digitigrade stance. "Phew, glad those are off; my feet like friggin' ovens." He turned around. "Now, then, let's head to the warehouse. The sooner we get there, the sooner Ed can start sleeping the food off..." he tugged at the collar of his sweatshirt. "...and the sooner I can change into something a bit more comfortable." Gesturing for the two to follow, he began heading off. Ed and Al, though reluctant, nodded at each other and followed him.
133122112221222212.title: Al spots and confronts him.

choices: Ed sleeps off his massive meal and gets some answers from Hunter.
Ed sleeps off his massive meal, only to wake up hungry.
1331221122212222121.content:
The trio headed towards this suspicious sounding 'abandoned warehouse'.

"Shouldn't be much further, fellas," Hunter exclaimed as he merrily led the way with a bit more pep to his step than prior, while Ed and Al followed not so closely behind, with Ed still sluggishly leaning against his younger brother for support. His massive exposed belly still jostling and bouncing with each step they took. Neither one took their eyes off Hunter as they spoke amongst themselves.

"...So, a walking, talking, wolf..." Al said, scratching the back of his metallic head. Ed grumbled and added, "More like trash-talking. 'It's no secret that Ed's sensitive about his height...' I wonder how sensitive his face would be after I punched it into oblivion..." Al rolled his fiery eyes and looked down at Ed. "Are you still mad about that, Brother? He DID say he was only doing it to motivate you. And that motivation DID help you win quite a bit of cash." Ed grumbled and said, "You're just defending him cause you thought it was funny too."

Despite himself, Al snickered a bit and shrugged. "Guess you got me there." He then turned his attention back on Hunter and asked, "Still...a walking, talking wolf..." Ed turned back to Hunter and noted, "Yeah, I wonder what his story is too. Think he could be a Chimera?" Al scratched his metallic head and said, "I suppose it's possible. He's definitely eccentric, but he seems to advanced, too comprehensive to be someones experiment. Plus how many Chimeras get a kick out of watching people stuff themselves and make fools of themselves?"

Ed immediately scowled and said, "Hey! We were strapped for cash, and I got us some! That's called being responsible, you dope!"

Unbeknownst to them, Hunter could hear everything they were saying and couldn't help but snicker a bit at their constant back and forth bantering. Heh, almost reminds me of watching Naruto and Kiba go back and forth....cept neither of them are anywhere near as bone-headed as Naruto...

Regaining his composure, Al spoke a bit more seriously and whispered, "Still, setting up shop at an abandoned warehouse is pretty suspicious. We can't rule out the possibility that this is an ambush and that they're luring us in because you're too full to fight back." Ed nodded and said, "It's not like I can't perform a transmutation on a full stomach, Al. So if we ARE walking into an ambush, we can take whatever he or his masters can dish out. And then I'll finally have an excuse to show that jerk what happens when you MOTIVATE Edward Elric by mocking his shortness!"

Scowling a bit, Hunter was tempted to interject and assure the two that he meant no harm, but figured he'd let the warehouse do the talking for him. Smirking a bit, he said, "Welp, we're here!" He then opened the doors nice and wide for the Elric brothers. The two alchemists entered cautiously, expecting bandits, other chimeras, or something nefarious.

Sure enough, it was just an abandoned warehouse, furnished nicely with modern accommodations and necessities, several bags, some items that neither Ed nor Al had ever seen before, but more importantly, a nice cushy mattress just as Hunter had promised. Ed's eyes immediately lit up as he hurried towards the mattress and leaned against it, and noted, "Wow, these things ARE comfortable!" Hunter smiled and proudly said, "Nothing but the finest."

Regaining some composure, Al turned his attention back to Hunter and said, "Yeah, it's all very nice, but we still have questions! First of all-"

THUMP!

Both Al and Hunter turned to see Ed plop backwards onto the mattress, already snoring heavily as his massive belly stuck outward like a fleshy bouncing hill atop the young alchemist's middle. Al facepalmed as Hunter snickered a bit to himself at the ridiculous sight. "Hehe, didn't realize the little guy was THAT pooped." He then gulped a bit nervously and pleadingly turned to Al and said, "Ehhh, actually, please don't tell him I called him that."

"I won't, but we still have questions that-"

Hunter waved his hand, acknowledging Al's inquiry but dismissing its' urgency. "I hear ya, Al. Really. And when Ed sleeps off that massive gut, I'll answer whatever you guys want. Honest! Just, take my word on it, I mean neither'uh Centrals top alchemists nor anyone else any harm. In fact, I think once you guys get to know me, you'll see I'm not such a bad wolf-guy afterall. Buuuuuut for now, I think I'm gonna change into something a bit more comfortable. That okay with you?"

However, reluctant, Al nodded as Hunter grinned, and grabbed a duffel bag. "Heh, it's funny. Even though I'm a wolf, people still get all freaked out when I get changed. I keep telling 'em I got fur all over and no one's gonna see anything they shouldn't, buuuuuut you know how folks are." He then headed out of sight to get changed, leaving only Al and a heavily resting Ed.

Al scratched his head, still processing what was going on. What an unusual individual...
1331221122212222121.title: They reach the warehouse, and Ed hits the hay.

choices: Ed is awestruck by the array of goodies, affording Al an opportunity to ask
Ed, upon seeing the goodies, immediately begins gorging himself
13312211222122221211.content:
Ed yawned widely, sitting up on the mattress and stretching his arms far above his head. "Oh man, what a great nap..."

"Oh hey, look who it is! Welcome back to the land of the living, Sleeping Beauty!"

At the cheerful voice, Ed's eyes snapped open. Glaring at the speaker, he leaned back on the mattress, resting on his hands. "Oh, it's you..."

Hunter only grinned and wagged his tail in response as he squatted by the side of the mattress, his digitigrade legs bending easily. "A good afternoon to you too, Mr. Elric." He'd changed out of his overly bulky clothes earlier, and was now clad in a rather comfy-looking pair of khaki shorts and a sleeveless black tank top. He wore no footwear or socks of any sort, showing his feetlike paws for all the world to see, though he still had his glasses perched on the bridge of his muzzle. "Ya slept well, I take it?"

"Yeah, I slept fine," Ed grumbled, pointedly looking away from the wolf.

Al, who had been carefully looking through some of Hunter's belongings nearby (with an earnest instruction NOT to handle anything too much,), looked towards his big brother reprovingly. "Brother, be nice! He brought us here so you could rest and gave you a comfy-looking mattress to sleep on!"

Ed glared at Hunter. "Al, for all we know, he could be trying to lull us into a false sense of security!"

Al rolled his fiery eyes. "Are you really that worried he'll do something, or are you still upset that he called you pipsqueak?"

A vein popped in Ed's forehead, and he looked away, folding his arms. "...maybe." Hunter chuckled a bit, but quickly stopped when Al turned his attention towards him. "Still, Ed does have a point: why are you doing all this? Why were you following us?"

"And what the hell are you? Are you some sort of Chimera?!" Ed piped up, looking back at Hunter.

The anthro-wolf sighed. "All valid questions, and I DID promise your little brother I'd give you answers when you woke up." With a grunt, he stood back up, walking a bit away from the mattress to give Ed some space before turning around.

"Alright, here's the deal: like I told you, my name's Hunter, and no, I'm not a Chimera. Do you see a snake tail or a goat head anywhere?"

Ed blinked owlishly. "Snake? Goat? What the hell..." His confusion swiftly turned to annoyance as Hunter burst out laughing.

"I jest, I jest," the wolf managed through his snickers. "Seriously, though, I'm not an alchemically-created creature, and I'm DEFINITELY not the other kind." He snickered a bit more. "I was born like this, and my whole family's like this, too." He got himself under control, clearing his throat and folding his hands/paws behind his back. "What else ya got for me?"

This time, it was Al who spoke up. "Why were you watching Brother stuff himself? I won't deny it's a spectacle, for better or for worse, but I've never seen someone get a kick out of it like you seem to do."

Hunter nodded, smiling as much as his muzzle would allow. "Ah yes, that. Well..." He looked towards the ceiling, appearing to be in thought. "I suppose I've had a fascination with watching folks like Ed stuff themselves for quite some time now; a good few years, at least." He smirked. "Ah, I was a strange little pup..." Ed and Al exchanged an utterly befuddled look.

"O...Okay," Ed finally spoke up. "A-anyway, why were you following us?"

Hunter looked down from the ceiling. "Well, there were two reasons for that. One," he held up one furry, padded digit, "It's absolutely hilarious watching folks like you try to make their way around after anice, big meal. Second," he held up another finger, "I was kinda hoping to reveal myself to you anyway and get you to stuff yourself some more." At Ed's bewildered look, Hunter grinned, wagging his tail. "Hey, I never said I stopped being strange." He looked at Ed's midsection. "Speaking of, you have a rather impressive metabolism, it would seem."

"Huh?" Ed inquired, looking down at his stomach. Sure enough, the massive amount of food that had been packed into it had all but vanished, and the appendage had retreated completely beneath his black shirt. It still made a slight indentation in the fabric, but it was barely noticeable unless one looked at it from the right angle. Curious, Ed reached under his shirt and felt his navel, confirming that it was once again a pit. However, Ed noted with a blush, his pants, button, and belt were all still very much busted, and his boxers were still showing. Yelping, he pulled his legs in front of him in an attempt to hide the damage. Hunter, for his part, only chuckled a bit. "Litlte drafty there, Ed?" Walking over to his duffel, he began rooting around in it. "Don't you worry; I got you some new clothes to change into." Finding what he was looking for, he tossed the bundle of clothes to the young alchemist, who caught them as the sailed towards him. He examined the garments in his grip, unsure of what to think. "Um...thanks?"

Hunter smiled. "Don't sweat it; what sorta host would I be if I didn't accommodate my guests?" He gestured towards the back of the warehouse. "There's a little room back there you can change in, if you'd like."

Ed blinked, confused, but smiled a bit in spite of himself. "...heh. Thanks." Tucking the clothes under one arm, and gripping his pants with the other one, he got up off the mattress and made his way towards the room Hunter indicated, vanishing inside it.

Al looked towards the wolf. "That...that was really nice of you."

Hunter shrugged. "Eh, you two have been through enough crap in your lives; figured it couldn't help to throw you guys a bone, so to speak."

Al chuckled. "Thanks, we really-" He did a double take. "Wait, what did you..."

"Something up, Al?"

At his brother's voice, Al looked towards Ed as he approached them, as did Hunter. The young alchemist was now clad in a solid red, short-sleeved T-shirt with a flamel emblazoned on the front. Instead of pants, he now wore a pair of white khaki shorts, exposing both his flesh leg and his automail leg. And, instead of boots, he now wore sandals.

Hunter whistled (very odd, considering he didn't have human lips, but that's neither here nor there). "Lookin' good there, Mr. Elric!"

Ed smirked. "Heh, thanks!" He tugged on the fabric of his shirt. "Where did you find a T-shirt with this pattern on it, anyway?"

Hunter smirked in return. "Let's just say I know a rather skilled, generous seamstress."

Al, remembering what Hunter had said, spoke up. "You look really good, brother, but..."

Without warning, Ed's stomach growled suddenly. Putting his automail hand to it, he blushed. "Heh; guess the nap sorta worked up an appetite."

Hunter beamed, tail wagging rapidly. "Well, Mr. Elric, I daresay that won't be a problem." He gestured with his head. "Follow me: I prepared a load of goodies for ya on the floor right above us. Multi-layered cakes, brownies drenched in vanilla ice cream and powdered sugar, cupcakes, all that good stuff." He started walking towards a passageway that presumably led to the stairs, a salivating Ed following close behind. Al, disgruntled at having his question interrupted, nonetheless stayed silent, even as he followed them and privately resolved to find out what Hunter knew.

Upon reaching the second floor...
13312211222122221211.title: Q and A with a wolf

choices: Kurama breaks the ice
Al snaps Ed out of his befuddled trance
133122112221222212111.content:
Ed gaped as Hunter led him and Al into the room where all the goodies were being kept. Much like the first floor, the room was quite nicely-furnished; there was plush carpeting on the floor, a couple of comfy-looking chairs in a couple of the corners of the room, a long, well-stuffed couch at the opposite end, and a large screen of some sort, below which sat an odd-looking box with multiple wires coming out of it.

What caught Ed (and Al's) attention, however, was the large table in the center of the room, which held which was, quite frankly, the largest array of sweets, snacks, and goodies either of them had ever seen. Brownies drenched in powdered sugar were stacked so high they teetered precariously, cakes ranging from three to five-layers with multiple kinds of frosting loomed above the table, piles of ice cream, hot fudge, and every other conceivable topping sat in multiple large sundae dishes, and large, delicious-looking cupcakes were piled on top of one another, with towering plates of cookies beside them. Together, they all emitted an absolutely intoxicating smell, which only made Ed's stomach grumble ever louder.

Hunter looked back at them, chuckling at the sight of Ed's jaw dropping and Al's fiery eyes all but encompassing his eye-holes. "Not bad, right?"

Al was the first to regain his power of speech. "Wha...how...where did you get all of this from?"

Hunter mock-frowned. "What, you think I bought all this?" He swept an arm across the various goodies on the table. "All this stuff's baked fresh!" He winked at Ed. "Like I told ya guys, nothing but the best." The young alchemist could only nod numbly, still taken aback by the bounty before him.

Al, on the other hand, only glanced at the table for a moment longer before he turned his gaze to Hunter. "Look, I won't deny it's really nice that you made all this stuff for Brother," he began. He narrowed his eyes, albeit slightly. "But that still doesn't explain what you meant downstairs."

This snapped Ed out of his trance, and he glanced up at his younger brother. "Meant by what? What're you talking about, Al?"

Al began to say something, but Hunter cut in. "While you were changing downstairs, your little brother told me it was really nice of me to give ya new clothes, and, well..." he rubbed the back of his head, looking somewhat nervous. "...I was telling him that, after everything you've been through, you didn't really deserve any less."

Ed only paused for a moment before the thought processed. "Wait a second!" he demanded, clenching his fists and rounding on Hunter. "What the hell would you know about me; about EITHER of us?!" Hunter recoiled a bit, in spite of the fact that he'd somewhat anticipated such a reaction.

Al, in spite of his own suspicions, looked down at Ed, surprised at the vehemence of his reaction. "Ed, calm down! I was just asking how..."

Ed turned on Al. "Al, what're you saying? This guy comes outta nowhere, acts all nice, and then all of a sudden he says he knows stuff about us?" He turned back to Hunter, glaring. "Have you been spying on us?!"

Hunter winced. "W-well, erm...that's kinda a tricky question..."

Ed, gritting his teeth, was about to demand that he answer the question, when...

"Hunter? You in here?"

The voice was faint but audible, suggesting whoever it belonged to was inside the building, but downstairs. Ed and Al's eyes widened at the voice, the former's anger temporarily forgotten. "Who the hell was..." It almost sounded like a kid's voice, albeit one in its preteen years...

Hunter, on the other hand, smiled, his ears twitching a bit. "Don't worry, it's just a friend of mine who came with me as a sort of 'field trip', as it were," the wolf replied. He headed for the door, opening it. "I'll be right back." Then, before Ed could renew his accusations, Hunter walked out, closing the door behind him.

Once Hunter had left, Al looked at his elder brother. "Ed, what are you getting so upset about?" he asked. "I mean, yeah, I don't know if I appreciate our privacy being invaded, but he didn't seem like he meant anything by it..."

Ed looked at Al, his anger renewed. "How would you know? We've only just met the bastard!"

Al sighed. "Look, Brother, I understand you're upset, but I don't think a 'bastard' would give you a nice mattress to rest on, or get you new clothes, OR offer you a feast..."

"That's not the point!" Ed yelled back, startling Al a bit. "Ever since I became a State Alchemist, we've both done everything we could to hide the fact that we attempted human transmutation, then this guy waltzes along and says he knows about what we went through?" His eyes intensified. "What if he talks? What if I get my State Alchemist position revoked? What if..."

At this, Ed's expression softened, and became one of sorrow. "What if we can't gain access to whatever we need to to get you your body back?"

Al's eyes widened at this. Brother... he thought, internally kicking himself; why hadn't he thought of that?

Mentally, he fumbled for something, anything he could possibly say in response...

Suddenly, a knocking came at the door. "Um, guys?" Hunter's voice called out, sounding oddly subdued. "It's me." He paused. "Can I come in?"

Ed and Al looked at each other, shocked; had he heard everything?

In spite of this, Al looked toward the door. "S-sure," he replied, inwardly puzzling at the fact that he'd felt the need to ask.

The doorknob turned, but before the door opened, they heard another voice.

"Hunter, are you sure you're OK?"

Ed and Al started; it was the voice from earlier. From here, they could tell it definitely belonged to a preteen.

Hunter's voice spoke back."Y-yeah, I'm fine. I guess I just, err, didn't expect quite THAT violent a reaction..." Ed, in spite of himself, felt a pang of regret. He was still a bit pissed, true, but he sounded so guilty...

When the other voice spoke, it was full of warmth and reassurance. "Hunter, you didn't mean anything by it; I know you."

Hunter's voice sighed. "Yeah, but they don't..."

Silence reigned for a moment. Then...

"Hey, kiddo...I'm really sorry to ask this, but...could you maybe come in with me and help smooth this whole thing over?"

The voice promptly replied. "Sure thing!" it piped. "What kind of friend would I be if I just let ya go in there alone? Besides, " it added, a bit of eagerness entering its voice, "I've kinda been wanting to meet them."

To the brothers' surprise, Hunter chuckled a bit. "Well, I'm sure they'll absolutely love you. Just, uh, lemme prep 'em..."

The doorknob turned the rest of the way, and the door opened slightly, Hunter's head poking in. "Uh, guys?" he began, looking down a bit. "I'm, err, bringing that guy I told you about in with me. Just, uh, don't freak, OK?"

Ed and Al glanced at each other confused. Nonetheless, they looked back at Hunter and nodded. Sighing in relief a bit, Hunter opened the door the rest of the way, walking into the room. Right after, though, someone else walked in behind him. And, in spite of having just met the anthropomorphic wolf, Ed and Al's eyes widened. "Wh-what the hell..." Ed muttered, disbelieving.

Hunter's companion, for his part, only giggled, squinting his eyes shut and folding his arms behind his head. As expected, he appeared to be in his preteen years...and, like Hunter, wasn't human.

The young creature was covered, head to toe, in bright orange fur, with a long, slender muzzle and black markings around his eyes that extended upwards into his oddly rabbit-like ears. The eyes themselves, which he blinked open, were red, with slitted pupils that nonetheless shone with curiosity and energy. His hands were oddly human-esque, albeit with claws at the end, and digitigrade legs much like Hunter's. And, like the wolf, he wore clothing: specifically, a sleeveless red t-shirt, with an open vest over it that had a long sleeve on one side, with a red armband worn around the wrist of his exposed arm. In addition, he wore baggy orange trousers, with a black belt looped around the waist. Owing to the structure of his legs and feet/paws, he wore no footwear of any kind. However, the most startling feature about him had to be the nine large, bushy tails sticking out from his backside, waving about a bit behind him. He appeared to be, in short, a nine-tailed fox.

"Hiya!" the young creature exclaimed, lowering his arms and walking towards Ed. He extended a hand. "I'm Kurama! Nice to meetcha!" Ed, for his part, could only gape dumbly at the young creature.

Then...
133122112221222212111.title: Ed is awestruck by the array of goodies, afford...

choices: Al asks how Kurama met Hunter
Al tries to get to know Kurama a little better
1331221122212222121112.content:
"Brother...! Where are your manners?" urged Al as his metallic elbow nudged into a still gaping Ed, promptly snapping him out of his dumbfounded trance. "H-huh?" sputtered Ed, before Al gestured back at the young nine tailed fox; hand still extended outward. "Oh...OH! H-heh, y-yeah, sorry..."

Promptly, but somewhat cautiously, Ed shook Kurama's hand, working up a slight smirk while the young Tailed Beast beamed happily at him. "Nice to meet you too, Kurama. I'm-"

"-Edward Elric!" Kurama interjected eagerly, catching Ed off guard as Kurama turned his head upward towards Al and offered his other hand towards the suit of armor. "And you must be Alphonse Elric!"

Chuckling somewhat at the young creatures' eagerness and pep, Al promptly shook his hand. Hunter; for his part though, snickered as he watched the eager young fox shaking the hands of both befuddled Elric's at the same time. Finally, Kurama released their hands and once again wrapped them behind his head, smiling at the two as Ed turned his attention over to Hunter somewhat and said, "So, your buddy Hunter filled you in on us, huh?"

Kurama happily bobbed his head. "Yep! Sure did! And I gotta say, I've been REALLY excited about meeting you guys ever since!"

At this, both Elric brothers glanced at one another, before Ed turned to the fox and asked, "...You have?"

"Well sure! Alchemy sounds really awesome! Ya see, where I live now, we have magic. My mentor; Natsu, taught me how to manipulate fire and combine it with my own natural chakra abilities from where I initially came from!" As Kurama explained, things just seemingly went right over both dumbfounded Elric's heads, until Kurama demonstrated, by summoning a tiny flame in his palm, startling Ed somewhat. "See? I mean, it's still just the bare basic stuff, but Natsu says I'm a REAL fast learner!" Kurama added, squinting his eyes shut as he grinned with no small amount of pride.

Despite himself, Ed snickered slightly, catching Al's attention.

"What's so funny, Brother?"

"H-heh, nothing. Guess I just figured all Fire Alchemists were jerks...turns out, it's just Mustang..."

Al rolled his fiery eyes yet again. "Brother..."

But nonetheless, Kurama wiped his hand clean of fire and turned his attention back to Ed. "But see, the ability to create stuff; turn somethin' in another thing entirely? That's incredibly cool! And your title? I can't think of anything more cool sounding than 'The FullMetal Alchemist!'" Upon hearing that, Ed couldn't help but grin with pride. "Heh...guess it IS a pretty heavy title, huh..."

Kurama nodded eagerly. "Sure is! But..." At this, Kurama's expression softened a bit, "...the biggest reason I wanted to meet you guys was because...Hunter told me what you guys have been through." His expression seemed genuinely saddened as he looked up at the two young Alchemists.

Sighing to himself, Hunter stepped in, palm rested gently on Kurama's shoulder as he glanced apologetically at the two brothers. "Look, I'm...I'm sorry you guys didn't appreciate the whole 'spying on you' dealio. But I travel a lot, see; not from place to place, but from world to world; dimension to dimension. I'm a bit on the...eccentric side, sure, but I'm very much a people person, and I like meeting interesting people in whatever world or dimension I visit. I also have a lotta friends who can, touch up and look into people..."

At that, a look of anger once again returned to Ed's face, but it was notably softer as Hunter went on.

"...But it's only so I know what they're about. And...when I heard what you guys had been through, it...it broke my heart..." Both Elric almost recoiled a bit, knowing exactly what Hunter was getting at. But there was genuine sadness in Hunter's expression...and doubly so for Kurama. Something that wasn't lost on either Alchemist, despite their own current expressions. "That's the biggest reason I wanted to meet you guys, above all else, above even watching Ed stuff his face and be all goofy...because you guys have had it really rough, and, well, I just wanted to show you guys a real fun time. To help take your mind off the heavy stuff for just a lil bit, and, just have fun. Honest."

Neither Elric knew what to say at this point. It all seemed very suspicious on the surface, sure, but Hunter seemed so genuine and sincere, as did his young fox friend. Was it possible that this stranger really did just want to give these two overworked Alchemists a break from the stress of the day to day? To just kick back and have fun for a bit? Only one question kept popping into the elder Elric's mind, until finally, he asked it.

"...Why? Why would you care about showing a complete stranger; no matter how rough their lives might have been, a good time?"

Before Hunter could answer, Kurama stepped forward, smiling a warm, genuine smile and said, "...Because he's a good person."

Both Elric's turned their attention back to Kurama who looked up at Hunter, smiling; what they perceived to be, a smile of pure gratitude, before he turned back to the Elric's and explained.

"You're not the first ones he's visited to try and show a fun time. See, when I was a kit...Hunter helped save me from..." Kurama winced noticeably...the memories and nightmares of a horrible future that could have been, still burdened his mind, but nonetheless, he went on. "...H-he helped save me from something...something really bad. He went out of his way to help me find a home where I could have an actual future...have friends...have a life..." And as the young fox thought back to a certain blond boy who stood besides him all the way, he smiled warmly and added, "...and thanks to him, I know what it means to have a brother. He didn't have to do all that stuff for me, but he did, because he's one of the most caring, kindest, people you can meet...and someone I'm incredibly grateful to call my friend...because without him...I wouldn't be here now..."

Even with things being as tense as they were, Hunter's heart welled up exponentially as he heard the young fox tell his side of things. He fought hard not to wrap his arms around the Tailed Beast and hug him tightly then and there.

Nonetheless, his words were genuine, that much was all but certain to the Elric's. Considering that, Al looked down at Ed, whose expression had softened exponentially, and asked, "...Well, Ed? What do you say? Should we trust him?"

Glancing back at Hunter, then back at Kurama, Ed sighed softly...then smiled a reluctant, but genuine smile...

"...Well, Al...this kid doesn't seem like a liar, and Hunter DID make one helluva tasty looking feast here. So, I guess...if Kurama here says we can trust him...then I trust him."

Ed eventually smiled warmly and offered his hand to Hunter, who smiled gratefully and shook Ed's hand right back.

"...Oh...and...call me pipsqueak again...? And you'll be eating steaks through a straw..." added Ed with an almost eerily demonic tone in his voice. Gulping nervously, Hunter nonetheless smiled and nodded. "C-Consider it a deal...h-heh..."

But nonetheless, Hunter regained composure and smiled back at the Elric brothers. "Really, though, I appreciate you guys giving me a chance. And I think once you get to know me, you'll see that I'm not such a bad wolf. In fact, I think we'll all get along pretty damn well."

Ed smirked and said, "Guess we'll see." He then turned his attention to Kurama and added, "...Buuuut something tells me you might just be right, Hunter..." For emphasis, Ed playfully nudged Kurama in the arm, causing the young fox to giggle and nudge Ed right back, earning a chuckle from him and Al.

Until a loud rumble once again emitted from Ed's stomach, causing him to chuckle before turning his attention over to the table and licking his lips. "Well, I dunno bout'chu guys, but I see some goodies with my name on it...soooo if ya don't mind..."

Almost comically, Ed darted over to the table, and wasted no time stuffing his maw with whatever sweets he could possibly fit into it, much to the amusement of the others.

Then, Al turned his attention to Hunter and Kurama, and; after rubbing the back of his metallic head...
1331221122212222121112.title: Al snaps Ed out of his befuddled trance

choices: After a bit, Ed has to take a break
While Ed eats, Kurama asks Al about himself
13312211222122221211122.content:
"So, Kurama," Al began, looking down at the young Nine-Tails beside him, "if ya don't mind me asking...what exactly are you?"

Kurama grinned cheekily. "I'm a nine-tailed fox; what's it look like?" Hunter chuckled at this, and even Ed snorted a bit...before coughing violently, having aspirated some powdered sugar on the brownie he was eating.

Al looked over at his brother with concern, but upon seeing he had recovered and was once again cramming goodies into his mouth, he returned his attention to Kurama. "N-no, I just meant, what exactly are you? I mean, Hunter's a wolf-person, but..."

Kurama giggled, squinting his eyes shut. "Heehee, I know what you meant; I was just bein' silly." Turning all the way to Al, he folded his arms behind his head. "Well, before you ask, I'm not a fox-person...at least, not in the way that Hunter's a wolf-person." He glanced over at Hunter, who smiled. Smiling in return, Kurama looked back toward Al. "Heck, I didn't even learn to walk on my hind legs 'till a while after I met him."

Al blinked. "So...what kind of nine-tailed fox are you?"

Kurama smiled at Al, then took a deep breath, as though preparing to launch into some sort of explanation.

"See, the thing is, I'm actually one of nine creatures-the Tailed Beasts-beings of pure chakra." At Al's confused look, he giggled. "Basically energy."

Al, confused, simply nodded...then poked at Kurama a bit. Squirming, Kurama playfully swatted Al's hand away. "What'cha doin', Alphonse?"

A bit taken aback, Al nonetheless replied, "Pl-please, just call me Al. A-anyway, I was just seeing if you were solid. I mean, you don't SEEM like a being of pure energy..."

Kurama snickered. "I'm not just a mass of energy shaped like a fox; I got bones, organs, skin, fur...pretty much what everyone else has." He winked at Al. "They just happen to be made outta solidified chakra instead of...whatever most people's bodies are made out of." At Al's slightly bemused nod of understanding, he continued. "Anyhow, we all used to be part of something called the Ten-Tails...basically an ancient, primordial force of destruction..."

Al was sure that if he still had a mouth, he'd be gaping at this revelation. Ed, for his part, paused, his eyes wide open and a spoonful of ice cream halfway to his mouth. Hunter, on the other hand, simply snickered, putting a paw to his mouth.

Grinning a bit himself, Kurama went on. "Anyway, someone the humans called the 'Sage of Six Paths'..." at this, an expression somewhere between fondness and pain flitted across his face, but he wiped it from his face before Al could comment. "...came along, defeated the Ten-Tails, and split its chakra into nine separate pieces." A warm smile came across his muzzle. "Then, he used his powers to take each of those pieces, give them new forms, new personalities, new souls, and, well..." he gestured at himself. "Basically, the Old Man created all of us."

Al, noticing the fond look on Kurama's face, asked, "...you really cared about him, didn't you?"

Kurama sighed wistfully. "Yeah. He...he was like a dad to all of us." Kurama turned his head away, but Al could still see his eyes beginning to moisten. Eager to steer the topic in a less melancholy direction, Al "cleared" his "throat." "So! Erm, you said someone was teaching you magic?"

At this, Kurama looked back up at Al, a bright smile coming to his face. "Oh yeah! Where I'm living now, there are so many wizards, they end up forming their own guilds to study magic." Smirking, he jabbed a thumb at himself. "Me, I'm a member of Fairy Tail, the greatest guild in all of Fiore!....that's the name of the land where I live now."

"Oh," Al replied, nodding. "And...what exactly does your world's magic do?"

"Oh, all kinds of things!" Kurama replied eagerly. "There's fire magic, like I showed you guys earlier, Maker Magic--which is basically manipulating any kind of element, from ice to wood and everything in between---, Celestial Spirit Magic, which is summoning beings to fight for you..." he grinned. "And my personal favorite, aside from fire..." He closed his eyes and concentrated. Internally, Al raised an eyebrow....before Kurama's clothes lit up and emitted a flash of light. Al recoiled, and Ed, noticing the flash, glanced over, an eclair sticking out of his mouth. "Wh-what in the..." Al stammered. Hunter, knowing what was coming, merely smirked. Confused, Al looked back at Kurama...only for his eyes to widen once again.

Kurama stood there, grinning cheekily...and wearing a completely different set of clothes. Instead of the ensemble he'd been wearing previously, he was now clad in a sleeveless tank top much like Hunter's, save that it was red, with orange lining around the neck. He wore a black, opened button-down shirt over it. with sleeves that stopped before the wrists. He wore light blue trousers that were noticeably less baggy than his previous ones. And, around his forehead, he wore a long, white piece of cloth wrapped below his ears, the untied ends of which dangled down to his upper back.

No one said anything for a moment, between Kurama's grin, Ed and Al's dumbfounded expressions, and Hunter's struggle to not crack up. Predictably, it was Ed who eventually broke the silence.

"What...what the hell was that?!" Ed exclaimed, holding his half-eaten eclair in one hand.

Kurama turned towards Ed, smirking good-naturedly. "Requip Magic," Kurama answered, rocking on his feet a bit. "Basically, you can store anything, from weapons to clothes, in your own personal pocket dimension and bring it out whenever ya need it." He chuckled a bit. "There's this one mage in my guild, Erza, who's REALLY good with Requip Magi; she's got dozens of armors, tons of weapons...and she KNOWS how to use 'em." He rubbed the back of his head, smiling sheepishly. "I'm nowhere near as good as she is; I can only store a few outfits and some knicknacks..."

Hunter walked over to him and put a hand on his shoulder. "I think you're sellin' yourself short, kid; you're still young, but you've already learned a lot." He winked at the young Nine-Tails. "Just imagine what you'll be able to learn in ten years, twenty years...heck, for all you know, you might end up being the next Guild Master!"

Kurama looked back at Hunter, his eyes widened, but his expression undeniably grateful. "Y-you really think so?"

Hunter winked at him, giving him a playful slug with his other hand. "I know so." His expression turned mischievous. "Heck, you're already multi-talented..."

Kurama tilted his head. "Huh? What're you talkin' about?"

Chuckling, Hunter looked back over at Ed. "Hey, Ed?"

Chomping down on what was left of a doughnut, the young Alchemist glanced back at him. "Yeah?"

His eyes glinting, Hunter continued. "Whaddaya think of the goodies?"

Gulping the mouthful down, Ed nodded, smirking. "Heh, they're actually really damn good! I feel like I'm inhaling everything!"

Hunter chuckled. "That so?" Kurama's eyes widened, realizing what Hunter was getting at. "H-Hunter, do you hafta..."

Winking at the young creature, Hunter pointed at Kurama. "Well, if ya wanna thank someone, thank the fuzzball here."

Ed and Al both gaped at Kurama. "Hold on...you...you MADE all this?!" Al exclaimed. "It looks like something you'd find in a bakery!"

Ed scoffed. "A bakery? Pfft, these things taste WAY better than anything I ever got from one!"

Kurama reddened under his fur, grasping his hands behind his back and glancing away, unable to keep a smile from his muzzle. "Aw, c'mon, you guys are too nice..." Besides, they're nothing compared to Rocket's goodies...

Laughing a bit at Kurama's expression, Ed turned around and immediately went back to stuffing his face. Hunter, for his part, gave Kurama a companionable shake of the shoulder. "Kid, we gotta get you to take compliments WITHOUT turning red as a tomato..."

Al, for his part, simply chuckled a bit. "Don't worry too much, Kurama; a little humility never hurt anybody..."

Kurama glanced up at the animate suit of armor. He said nothing, but shrugged, giggling as he did so....
13312211222122221211122.title: Al tries to get to know Kurama a little better

choices: Suddenly, someone else's stomach rumbles hungrily
Ed needs to take a break
133122112221222212111222.content:
Kurama looked back at Hunter and giggled some more as he turned to Al and said, "Y'know, Hunter here's been telling a friend of ours that for a loooooong time, cause he's...err..." Kurama's expression screwed upwards as he looked skyward almost in deep thought. "Gee, how do I put this...the exact, literal opposite of humble..." he added with a snicker. Hunter chuckled along with the young fox and added, "To be perfectly fair though, kiddo...Rocket HAS earned the right to be cocky about how great his cooking is..." And at that, Kurama licked his chops and rubbed his stomach fondly. "...Boy has he..."

Al couldn't help but chuckle, while Ed continued to greedily stuff more baked goodies into his all-too-eager maw. Then, Kurama turned to Al, smiling back at the suit of armor and with notable interest, asked, "So, Alphon-err...Al, could'ja tell me a lil bit about yourself?"

At this, Al almost nervously pointed a finger up at his helmet and asked, "M-me? You want to know about me?"

Kurama bobbed his head eagerly and said, "Well sure I do! You seem like a really nice and really smart guy, and I just wanna, get to know ya a lil better!"

Chuckling as he rubbed the back of his metallic head somewhat, Al shrugged and said, "W-well, my name's Al, as you know. I'm Edward's younger brother, and; like Ed, I'm a State Alchemist."

Kurama beamed and said, "H-heh, sorry if it seems like I'm kinda overly eager...but I just find the whole concept'uh Alchemy to just be sooooo cool, y'know?"

Despite himself, Al chuckled. "Well, I suppose it is pretty cool, in all truth. It's not only a great means of defense, but in our case, it's also really helpful with shelter, construction, anything really. I don't think we'd have survived this long were it not for Alchemy."

Grinning impishly, Kurama looked up at Al and added, "Hehe, bet'cha kick tons'uh butt when jerks try'n mess with you guys, huh..."

"MPH THRN SRMPH!" replied Ed with a mouthful of sticky buns. Rolling his fiery eyes, Al shook his head and added, "Brother, please don't try and talk with your mouthful." Nodding, Ed winced and gulped heartily, sending the rather large bulge in his cheeks, full of pastries, right down his throat and into his gullet. Sighing with satisfaction, Ed licked his lips, grinned cockily and said, "And THEN some, was what I was tryin' to say.
