Seriously, you guys wouldn't believe the amount'uh dumbasses Al'n I come across, pulling scams, terrorizing innocent people...or being a certain jackass named Mustang..."

"Brother, honestly..."

"Whaaaaat?" Ed inquired innocently, before eagerly returning to his meal, earning another round of giggles from Kurama as he looked back at Al and noted, "Hehe, guess that means y'er the 'mature one' of the two, huh."

Chuckling despite the fact, Al shrugged his metal shoulders and said, "Without question...y'know, a lot of times we first introduce ourselves, people often mistake me for the older sibling. Time was, I used to just think it was because my current body is...errr...a bit taller than Edward...but these days, I think it's more about how we carry ourselves. Don't get me wrong, I don't mean to say my brother's immature...but compared to me...?"

Both Kurama and Hunter snickered a bit as the wolf added, "...Compared to you, he's like a smaller, way smarter version'uh Naruto." This once again earned another round of snickers from the two, while Al tilted his head, curious who this 'Naruto' was. Nonetheless, he looked back at Ed greedily stuffing his face and smirked some more.

"Nonetheless, when push comes to shove, Brother always knows what to do. He takes charge when needed, he's there for anyone who needs him, and he works harder than anyone I've ever known in my entire life. Frankly, he's the best older brother someone could hope ask for...I can't even imagine where I'd be if it weren't for him...so I suppose it's hard to ever really fault his immaturity."

Literally no sooner than Al said that, Ed winced for a moment, thumped his chest a few times, burped loudly, smiled to himself, and dove right back in for more, causing Al to sweatdrop a bit with embarrassment.

"...Case in point..."

Giggling some more, Kurama soon stopped for a moment and really thought about what Al had said, before smiling warmly at the suit of armor and saying, "...Y'know something, Al? I know exactly what'cha mean. My best friend in the whole world means everything to me. He's the closest to a big brother as I'll ever have, and if it weren't for him, I...well, let's just say, I'd rather not imagine where I'd be without him in my life either..." He giggled a bit more and added, "...And trust me, no matter how immature YOUR big brother may seem...he doesn't even COMPARE to Naruto..."

Now, at this, Al raised an 'eyebrow' and added, "...I wouldn't be too sure about that, Kurama. Brother once went on a two minute screaming rant fit until he ran out breath and passed out, cause someone called him a 'little fella'..."

Kurama raised an eyebrow himself, grinning cockily as he added, "Oh yeah? Naruto and another friend; Kiba, would argue before and after every single meal over who could and did eat more than the other..." Hunter snickered to himself, recalling a lil Naruto and Kiba going back and forth at every turn; each one cocky and confident in their abilities to outdo the other...despite everything almost always ending in a tie.

The two stared at each other for a moment, then both burst into a fit of snickers for a good while before Al said, "Hehe, guess all big brothers are the same, huh..." Kurama bobbed his head and said, "...And I wouldn't have it any other way!"

Then, Kurama's smile faded a bit as he saw Al turn his attention back to Ed, and more specifically, all the baked goods Kurama had made for the young alchemist.

"...Umm, Al? C-can I ask ya something...?"

At this, Al once again turned his attention to Kurama, a bit surprised by his sudden apprehension. "Sure, what's up, Kurama?"

Kurama rubbed his arm a bit nervously and asked, "...W-what's it like, having that suit of armor for a body...?"

Ed gulped down his current mouthful and stopped eating as he looked back at Al with concern and sympathy.

Al; for his part, sighed softly as he examined himself. "...Honestly, it's...it's difficult. Don't get me wrong, there's plenty of advantages. For instance, I never get tired, so I have infinite endurance. It's quite sturdy, so I can take a hit as well as I can deliver one. I don't need to breathe, ever need to use the restroom, get hungry, thirsty, and I don't even have to worry about falling apart, since I can reform this armor with alchemy...provided my blood seal isn't damaged. But..."

Kurama looked up sympathetically as he saw Al's expression darken a bit. Hunter was painfully aware of what the two had endured as children, but to hear first hand what Al was going through, filled his heart with sadness as Al went on...

"...Those things are as much a burden as they are a benefit. I miss so much about life that I took for granted. Being able to enjoy a nice meal, smelling the fresh air and life around me, feeling a simple breeze against my skin...or just...being able to sleep...and to dream. I could dream about our mother...the good times...even dreaming about what the future could have in store of me. It's difficult...but I endure, and I will continue to endure..."

"...Because no matter what it takes; no matter how LONG it takes, I WILL find a way to give Al his body back..." added Ed with determination and fire in his words.

At this, Kurama's eyes went a bit misty as he smiled at Al and warmly rested his palm against the younger Elric's metal body. "...I'm so sorry. I...I can't imagine what that must be like...but I know for a fact with 100% certainty that you're gonna get'cher body back. Because your big brother said he'll help you get your back back, and trust me when I say this; big brothers will move Heaven and Earth to help their younger siblings. Mine helped me have a chance at living...and yours will help you live your life again." Despite himself, Kurama grinned somewhat playfully and said, "...I can spot a great big brother a mile away, and your big brother is as great as they come, because he clearly cares about you with all his being. Just never forget that."

Both Elric's were completely taken back. Not only by the sincerity in the young fox's words, but the certainty...the matter-of-fact assurance that came from his young voice.

If Al still had eyes, they'd be welling with tears. Instead, his fiery eyes looked down, gleaming with gratitude as he 'smiled' at the young creature, placing a palm gently against the Tailed Beast's shoulder and rather softly, said, "...Thanks, Kurama."

Kurama looked up at the younger Elric and smiled right back. Hunter simply watched and smiled warmly at the scene. Part of what he loved about Kurama wasn't just his kind and gentle nature, but also how empathetic he was towards others, even if he'd just met them the way he had the Elric Brothers.

"Y'know something, Kurama?" remarked Ed, breaking the silence, before smiling back at the young fox and adding, "...You're alright..."

At this, the young fox beamed happily, causing both Elric's to chuckle softly, when suddenly, Ed's stomach decides to break the ice by growling almost angrily as he chuckles a bit sheepishly and says, "Eheh, sorry. Kurama's baking is so damn good, I don't think my stomach'll even LET me stop eating..."

And so, Ed licked his lips and dove right back in for more, much to the amusement of the others.

"...Wow, he even EATS like Naruto..." noted Kurama, earning another fit of snickers from him and Al. Hunter's focus shifted to Kurama and Al. It was nice seeing them bond as Ed stuffed his face comically...
133122112221222212111222.title: While Ed eats, Kurama asks Al about himself

choices: "Wouldja mind telling me a bit about yourself?"
"After you're done resting up, you mind if I join in? I'm a little hungry..."
1331221122212222121112222.content:
Hunter, Al, and Kurama watched as Ed continued stuffing his face, none of them able to tear their eyes away...albeit for different reasons.

Al was equal parts amazed-Ed had just finished sleeping off a MASSIVE meal, and here he was cramming baked goodies into his mouth like there was no tomorrow-and exasperated. It was bad enough when Ed had been stuffing his face in public, broken his clothes, and popped his navel, but here, where there was no one else besides the four of them present? If Al still had a body, he knew he would have shuddered. Brother...how far are you planning to go...?

Hunter, on the other hand, was smirking. Heh, lookit him go, the wolf thought, tail wagging. Guess eating for both him AND Al really works up an appetite...then again, he was probably like that even before...

The wolf's expression fell slightly at this, remembering what he'd learned about the brothers...but then the smile quickly returned to his face. And if he's enjoying himself NOW....? His gaze wandered over to Al, still too engrossed by the sight of his elder brother gorging himself to notice. Wait'll they see that this is only the tip of the iceberg in regards to what I've got planned...

As for Kurama, he found himself flushing a bit with pride when he saw the enthusiasm with which Ed was eating his goodies. W-wow, he thought, smiling a bit, he really DOES like my goodies, doesn't he? He rubbed the back of his head a bit. I'm nowhere NEAR as good as Rocket is...but it's nice to see people enjoying the stuff I've made. He giggled a bit, remembering exactly how much Natsu and Happy had enjoyed a spread he'd prepared for them; by the time they'd finished, Natsu had busted his belt, his belly pressing into the table, and Happy had been splayed out on his back on the table, swollen belly sticking up and an expression of delirious contentment on his face. And if Ed eats all of THAT....hee hee, his tummy's gonna be REALLY big...

Eventually, though, after Ed gulped down a large piece of cake, he sighed, slouching back in his chair. "Oh man," he muttered, turning his chair around so he could face the others. "That stuff's amazing, but...whew...really fills ya up quick..." To punctuate this, he brought a hand up to his belly, gently rubbing it as he licked his lips.

Though the grand majority of the goodies on the table remained uneaten, enough had been consumed to have a visible effect on the young alchemist's stomach. His belly had bulged visibly underneath his shirt; not enough for any flesh to be peeking out, but enough to appear as a distinctive round shape underneath his t-shirt.

Upon seeing this, Al facepalmed. "Brother..."

Hunter gave the younger Elric a playful smirk. "Oh, come on, Al; just goes to show how much he's enjoying his 'little' meal..." He turned toward Kurama and gave the fox a playful jab on the shoulder. "Well, kid? Looks like a positive review, don'tcha think?"

Kurama flushed red and laughed, sheepishly rubbing the back of his head. "Y-yeah, I guess..."

Hearing this, Ed opened his eyes and looked toward Kurama. "Ah, c'mon, learn to take a compliment!" He happily patted his belly. "These are some of the best damn desserts I've ever eaten! No reason to be so shy about it!"

At this, Kurama flushed redder and looked down, folding his hands behind his back. "M-maybe..." He looked up, somewhat reluctantly. "You really like 'em that much?"

Smirking, Ed once again patted his bulging belly. "Why don't ya come over here and take a closer look at this; maybe that'll give you your answer."

Chuckling sheepishly, Kurama nodded. "Well, I guess it can't hurt..." Still flushing a bit, he made his way over to Ed, who was still rubbing his belly. Looking down at the appendage, Kurama's eyes widened. "Wow...you musta really enjoyed my baking..." Almost on reflex, he reached out and poked the still-concealed flesh....then flushed even redder as he realized what he'd done. "E-Ed, I'm so sorry..."

To his (and Al's) surprise, Ed laughed. "Heh, you think THAT'S impressive?" He patted his belly with both hands. "You shoulda seen me after I won that eating contest..."

Kurama grinned. "Oh yeah, Hunter told me you were competing in one! How big was your tummy then?"

Ed smirked. "Weeeeelll....broke my pants and belt, popped my navel out...you tell me."

In spite of himself, Kurama giggled. "Heh, that IS way bigger!"

Ed looked back at the goodies still on the table. "Yeah, and "way bigger" is what my gut's gonna be once I finish all this stuff!"

Al's fiery eyes widened. "Brother...are you SERIOUSLY gonna eat EVERYTHING on that table...?"

Ed looked back at his younger brother, giving a playful grin. "C'mon, Al, food this tasty? It'd be a crime NOT to eat it." Al rolled his eyes, shaking his head in exasperation. Laughing a bit at his younger brother's resigned mood, Ed patted his belly with both hands. "Still, I gotta rest this off for a few minutes first; wanna be at my best when I dig back in."

Kurama tilted his head. A few minutes? he thought, his ears twitching. He smiled. Well, might as well ask while he's not eating...

Clearing his throat, the young fox looked at the resting Alchemist. "Hey, Ed?"

Ed paused in his ministrations, looking up at Kurama. "Yeah, Kurama?"

Taking a breath, Kurama replied...
1331221122212222121112222.title: Ed needs to take a break

choices: "Welp, I'm all rested up.  Let's eat!"
"...Whadduya say to an eating contest of our own...?"
13312211222122221211122222.content:
Rubbing the back of his fuzzy head somewhat timidly, Kurama worked up a nervous smile as he turned his attention back to Ed. "Umm, I...I know I made all these goodies for you'n stuff, but...um...w-would'ja mind if I...joined you?" Ed glanced at Kurama curiously, and was about to ask what the young fox meant, but before he could, a loud rumbling emitted from the Tailed Beasts' stomach. Face flushing red with embarrassment, Kurama chuckled sheepishly and grasped at his stomach protectively, as though attempting to shut it up.

Ed blinked for a moment, then laughed heartily, much to Al and Hunter's surprise.

"Why would'ja need to ask? You MADE these goodies, Kurama! Course ya can join me!"

Kurama's tails started to wave behind him happily as his face lit up with a hopeful smile. "Really? Ya mean it?" Once again, Ed laughed as he said, "Course I do! Besides, you seem such like a nice person, and this could give us a chance to talk a bit." Eagerly and gratefully, Kurama promptly sat across from a smiling Ed, much to Hunter's amusement and Al's relief.

Phew...well, at least now Brother won't be able to eat EVERYTHING on the table anymore... The younger Elric thought to himself.

"Seriously, how'd ya get to be so good at baking? I mean, I don't think I've ever met anyone so young that could bake stuff better than nearly any bakery I've ever visited!" Ed said, giving his belly a hearty pat for emphasis. Chuckling, Kurama rubbed the back of his head and smiled bashfully at the elder Elric brother. "Hehe, weeeeeell, I guess it all started with Termina. See, my friend; Rocket, he's WAVELENGTHS better than I am at cooking. In fact, he's the greatest cook I've ever been lucky enough to know! And after I made it to Fiore, I kinda wanted to see if I could learn to cook even half as good as him. And one of the guild members; Elfman, he cooks amazingly too! He showed he some of the bare basics, but then he told me there were tons of cook books at the Guild Library. So I studied those long and hard. Tried, failed, tried some more, and gradually, people started really liking what I baked or cooked!"

Hunter smirked and added, "Any books in that Library teach ya how to accept complements, kiddo?" At that, Kurama once again blushed and chuckled sheepishly. But Ed nodded in agreement and said, "He's right, you know. There's absolutely nothing wrong with being proud of what you do, ESPECIALLY when it's as undeniably delicious as all this stuff has been!"

Kurama giggled somewhat uneasily and nodded slightly as he said, "I know, really, it's just...kiiiiiiinda hard to accept when anyone says anything I've baked is the best anything they've eaten. Cause I know no matter how good what I make is, it'll NEVER be anywhere near as good as what Elfman and Rocket can make."

At that, Ed scoffed and added, "So what? I mean, I've never tasted what those two can make, and if you say it's as good as it is, I'll take your word on it, but just because someone else is better at something, doesn't mean you shouldn't be able to appreciate your own efforts. Hell, you should never have to compare yourself to anyone regarding ANYTHING. Appreciate what you do for YOU, cause that's all anyone can ever hope for. Nothing should ever lessen your accomplishments just because you think someone else is better. The only thing that matters is that you do your best, and no one could ask for anything more."

Kurama stopped for a moment, and appeared as though in deep thought. "Huh. Y'know, I...I never actually thought of it like that before. Y-you really think that?"

Ed chuckled and said, "Look, there's no harm in wanting to be better at anything. Hell, that's GREAT that no matter how good you are, you're always striving to be better. That shows you have drive and are willing to learn, and that's important, because we're ultimately NEVER done learning anything. But that doesn't mean you can't appreciate where you are at any given step." Ed stopped and smirked back at Kurama as he added, "...especially when it's undeniable that you've got the skills."

Kurama glanced back at Ed and smiled an appreciative smile. "...Thanks, Ed."

Despite himself, Al couldn't help but smile at the scene. For all his goofiness and crassness, Ed always knew how to talk to people, and how to help them appreciate themselves a little better.

Suddenly, the young fox's stomach rumbled HUNGRILY again, causing his face to flush bright red beneath his orange fur, once again causing Ed to burst into a fit of laughter while Hunter and even Al began to snicker with amusement.

"Jeez, ya really ARE hungry, aren'tcha, kiddo! I thought that was a freakin' lion for a second there," remarked Hunter as the young Tailed Beast rubbed the back of his head and nodded slightly. "Eheheh...w-well, baking DOES work up an appetite..."

Still chuckling as he regained composure, Ed wiped his face and glanced back at Kurama. "Sounds like it works up more than that." Then he thought for a moment and asked, "Say, Kurama...when you asked me how big my belly got at the eating contest, why were ya curious?"

Kurama scratched his fuzzy cheek and shrugged, "I'm always curious when I hear someone's eating lots'uh food! I mean, I always figured the only ones who did that were my friends and I."

Ed blinked, taking a closer look at the lean young fox, then added, "Wait, YOU stuff your face too?" Kurama giggled and said, "Course I do! I LOVE food, and I love having as much of it in my tummy as I can possibly get! Why, first thing Hunter and I did when we arrived in Fiore was go to this one buffet and eat so much that our tummies actually got wedged between the booth and the table! And THAT was when I was still just a kit!"

Al blinked dully and turned almost blankly at Hunter. "...Et tu, Hunter...?"

Hunter grinned toothily at Al and gave his stomach a hearty pat. "Guilty as charged!"

Al sighed to himself and slapped his palm against his face. Great...I'm literally surrounded by gluttons...

Ed, on the other hand, just laughed. "Damn, wedged into a booth? Now THAT'S awesome! But didn't that hurt?" Kurama shrugged again, still smiling. "Eh, it wasn't the most comfortable experience. Buuuuuut I didn't mind, cause it just meant I got to spend more time with one of my closest friends. And how could I complain about that?"

Immediately, Hunter once again felt a hitch in his chest as his heart warmed up exponentially. He smiled fondly at the young fox and thought, ...If ever there were a sweeter kid in the whole damn universe...our hearts would literally melt into pudding...

Kurama then grinned somewhat impishly and added, "Plus, Hunter knew how to speed up the process so that way our tummies would deflate enough for us to slip out, and MAN was it awesome...course I was still embarrassed about it back when I was a kit, buuuuut less so these days..."

Al once again turned to Hunter, and; in a completely deadpanned voice, asked, "...Do I even want to ask...?"

Hunter grinned playfully back at Al and shook his head. "You do not."

At this, Ed sat back for a moment, then with a grin, turned back to Kurama and said...
13312211222122221211122222.title: "After you're rested, can I join you...?"

choices: Kurama quickly establishes a lead
The two start off keeping an even pace with each other
133122112221222212111222222.content:
"Say, Kurama," Ed began, a mischievous glint entering his eyes, "you said you loved eating, right?"

Beaming, Kurama folded his arms behind his head. "Yep, sure do! I love tasting everything, and I love when I eat so much I get a big tummy...and the best part is, combined with my metabolism-part and parcel of being a being of pure energy-and the fact that I live a really active lifestyle, I don't hafta worry about gaining any permanent weight!"

Ed's eyes lit up. "That right?" At Kurama's eager nod, his grin widened. "In that case...why don't ya show me?"

Kurama blinked his eyes open. "Show you?" He repeated. It took only half a second for the question to process...then a mischievous gleam of his own appeared in his eyes. "You mean..."

At this, Al let loose with a long-suffering groan, already figuring out what Ed was suggesting. Hunter, on the other hand, snickered. "Brother..."

Smirking, Ed leaned forward. "Yep. Feel like an eating contest?"

Kurama's eyes lit up, even as he adopted a mock-thoughtful look. "Hmm, lemme think about that...Sure!" He finished the exclamation by bringing his arms down and placing his hands on the table. Ed, unable to help himself, laughed at the young tod's exuberance.

Kurama's grin became cocky. "Before we start, though, I just wanna give ya fair warning..." At this, Ed stopped laughing and looked at Kurama curiously. Al blinked slowly, dreading what he was going to hear. Hunter? Well, he was trying not to burst out laughing.

"Back home, in Fiore," Kurama went on, smirking, "I have a reputation as one of the guild's biggest eaters, second only to my pal and mentor, Natsu. In fact," he added, getting into it, "when it comes to eating contests on a job," he jabbed a thumb at himself, "I'm my guild's trump card." He allowed himself a cocky grin. "You know what my opponents call me?"

Ed smirked in return. "What?" he challenged, even as he felt eagerness brewing within him.

Kurama grinned widely, exposing his sharp teeth. "Fairy Tail's Bottomless Pit," he replied, his voice dramatically hushed.

Hunter beamed, knowing that statement was 100% true...and then some. Al, on the other hand, only groaned and slammed both palms to his face. This is going to get out of hand, isn't it...?

Hunter, seeing this, looked over at Al. "Ah, c'mon, Al," the wolf said lightly, slugging him on the arm...before wincing and shaking it out. "It's all in good fun..."

Al gave Hunter a "look"...or at least, as best he could given his metal body. "No offense, Hunter, but seeing my big brother stuff himself until he looks like he's having babies isn't my idea of 'fun'..." He sighed. "Plus, him getting a tummyache won't be any fun either..."

Hunter, for his part, only chuckled, turning his head away. Ah, don't be like that, he thought. A grin lit his face up...one he was sure to hide from the brothers AND Kurama. Who knows? You might be changing your tune very, very soon...

Oblivious to any of this, Ed whistled. "Bottomless pit, huh?" he repeated. "Gotta say, that's pretty impressive...buuuut as you probably figured, I'm not exacty a slouch myself." He patted his somewhat stuffed, yet still-concealed belly. "You forgetting your opponent just won an eating contest earlier today?"

Kurama giggled. "Nope, I didn't...but you better bring your A+ game to this one, Ed," he retorted. "Fairy Tail members never do anything halfway..." He grinned. "...so I'm gonna give it everything I got!"

Ed laughed, sitting upright and pulling himself closer to the table. "Well, then, you're in luck...cause I'm not gonna pull my punches either!"

Kurama sat back, folding his arms and smirking. "I'd be insulted if you did," he said casually.

Ed smirked in return....right before both their bellies rumbled loudly. Blushing at the sheer volume, they clutched their midsections. "Erm...maybe we should stop with the pissing contest and get right to stuffing our faces..." Ed mumbled, slightly embarrassed.

Kurama, his cocky, dismissive demeanor vanishing, did the same. "Y-yeah, that might be a good idea..."

Sharing a laugh at their embarrassment, both "contestants" focused their attention on the table. "Hunter, can ya give the word?" Kurama asked, eying up a pile of doughnuts.

"H-huh?" The anthro started. "Sure!"

Grinning, he raised his paw up in the air. "Three...two...one..."

The paw cut down through the air. "GO!"

With that, Ed and Kurama fell upon the goodies...
133122112221222212111222222.title: Alchemist Vs. Fox

choices: Ed manages to catch up to Kurama
Ed gets a stomachache
1331221122212222121112222221.content:
Al watched with a deadpanned expression to his fiery eyes as both his older brother and the young tailed beast had ravenously begun to tear into the goodies on the table like there was no tomorrow. As he watched, however, he couldn't help but note just how much faster Kurama was managing to pace himself. The young fox was scarfing down several doughnuts at a time, chowing down voraciously and promptly gulping them down before stuffing even more right back in. Hunter, meanwhile, having seen what both were capable of; specifically Kurama, simply grinned eagerly as he watched the two go at it.

As Ed was still working on a pile of doughnuts that he too had his eyes on, Kurama had already blazed through the one pile he initially had his eyes on, and was now grabbing a hand-pawful of brownies in each hand and scarfing them down a few at a time. Catching this, Ed almost sputtered, but nonetheless, forced himself to eat faster. The teenaged alchemist was now plowing his way through the remains of his doughnuts, and now focused his attention on a chocolate cake that was positively lathered in milk chocolate frosting and vanilla frosting in the shape of the Fairy Tail Guild Mark atop the cake. Competitive as he was, even Ed had to stop and marvel at the rich flavor looming from the cake.

"H-holy crap!" muttered Ed as he gulped down a massive mouthful of the cake. "Seriously, Kurama, this is better than store bought bakery cake! The GOOD kinda bakery too!"

Kurama beamed proudly at the elder Elric brother, even as he was continuing to stuff his maw with as much goodies as he could cram down it. "Heh, thanks! Glad y'er enjoying it so much!" Even in competition, Kurama wasn't one not to be gracious. Though, that remark was about all he'd afford as he resumed stuffing his craw instantaneously, much to Ed's frustration.

On top of that, the sheer rate in which the young fox was scarfing down treats was already having an effect. Ed glanced across the table, and past the vast array of sweets and baked goods, he could see the young tailed beasts' stomach had been so packed, that it was already beginning to protrude through his shirt.

Meanwhile, Kurama wasn't even aware of how drastically the sweet baked delights had already impacted his midsection. He was simply enjoying the food too much. Al on the other hand, would be gaping if he still had a mouth. Which certainly wasn't lost on the anthro wolf next to him, who saw the expression across the metallic helmet and chuckled softly to himself.

"Speedy lil bugger, ain't he," remarked Hunter with no small amount of pride.

"...You can say that again," replied Al, still dumbfounded. "How on earth does someone even THAT much, THAT fast...?"

Again, Hunter laughed, rubbing the back of his head as he said, "Hehe, weeeeeell, the kid IS largely pure energy afterall. Only makes sense that he'd be able to put so much more away at that rate than the average person, right?" Hunter turned his attention back to Kurama, smiled, then added, "Plus...well, in his 'early years', we all spent a LOT of time stuffin' our faces again and again."

"Why?" asked Al.

"Pffft, why not?" answered Hunter, earning a roll of Al's fiery eyes. "We just had tons of fun together, and tons of fun eating as much as our guts possibly could, hehe. Don't need much more reason than that. And after Kurama ended up with Natsu and the Guild up in Fiore, hehe, let's just say ol' Salamander managed to really light a 'spark' to the kids' competitive side..."

"It'd almost be a wonder how he stays so thin...but I suppose being 'mostly pure energy' has a hand in that."

"That, plus he leads an incredibly physically active lifestyle. Least, that's what his job demands most of the time."

Al nodded to that, then chuckled despite himself. "We can certainly relate to that. Which...might have a hand in just why Edward's tummy hasn't ballooned to the point where I'm rolling him across Central...yet..."

Hunter snickered at that, though in the back of his head, he felt for Al. It was one thing to often be embarrassed by the overeating antics of his brother. But to watch two individuals stuffing their faces with as much deliciousness as their bellies could handle...knowing Al himself couldn't eat a bite or know that kind of satisfaction...it had to be difficult...

...And it was something Hunter; if at least for the briefest of moments, hoped to change...

Meanwhile, Ed, determined not to be shown up so quickly by Kurama, began stuffing his maw to the points where his cheeks bulged comically, before he'd ravenously chomp down on the baked goods in his maw and; with a hearty gulp, send a large mouthful down his throat with a more than noticeable bulge that traveled down his throat, sinking into his chest and down into his stomach, causing it to slowly but surely expand with every few gulps. Much to his delight, this comical and utterly ridiculous display had given him the opportunity to catch up with Kurama, who was still just too rapt by the flavors of his own baked goods to even notice how far either he nor Ed had gone.

Smacking his chops, Kurama soon turned his attention to a strawberry milkshake. He grabbed the pitcher with one hand and promptly brought it up to his maw, gulping down a good fifth of it in one go before setting it back down, licking his lips and beaming. "Mmm, that's almost as rich and creamy as the ones Elfman made!" Kurama muttered to himself with pride, before digging right back in. Not one to be shown up, Ed; having gulped down a doughnut whole and needing to thump his chest a few times to get it down, gasped, turned his attention to a vanilla milkshake before him, and promptly began chugging it down.

Al watched this and rolls his eyes as he noted, "...He won't so much as LOOK at milk, but mix it with ice cream and he can't get enough...?"

Hunter chuckled and added, "Hey, who knows? Maybe if ya slip in some extra milk to his ice cream every once in a while, he might actually end up being taller than a six year old..."

Despite himself, Al snickered at this, watching Ed chug and chug, which caused his belly to slowly but surely expand and expand, and in doing so...
1331221122212222121112222221.title: Kurama quickly establishes a lead

choices: "Yep; let's get back to stuffing our faces!"
"Might need a little longer...."
13312211222122221211122222212.content:
Suddenly, Ed's eyes snapped wide open. Lowering the shake, he groaned, wiping his mouth with his sleeve as he did so. "Urgh...mighta gone a little too fast..." Groaning again, he leaned back in his seat, resting his hands on his swelling tummy and gently rubbing it.

Kurama, noticing this, set down the danish he was tearing through and glanced at Ed. "Ed? Are you...are you feeling OK?" the young fox asked, worry evident in his voice.

Ed cracked open an eye and smirked weakly. "Y-yeah, I'm fine. Just, uh, a little overpacked is all..."

Hunter smirked. "Well, that and the fact that you're horking down those goodies like there's no tomorrow is probably a factor..."

Al, on the other hand, groaned. "I just KNEW this was going to happen...Brother, you really need to pace yourself..."

Ed sat up a bit, glancing over at Al. "WEll, what am I supposed to do, eat slow? It's a competition, Al! Besides," he added, winking at Kurama, "with food THIS good, it's hard NOT to cram as much in as I can!" Kurama beamed at the praise.

"Aww, thanks, Ed!" Kurama exclaimed, touched. He frowned as Ed once again winced in discomfort. "Still, since your gut's hurting right now, why don't we put the contest on hold till you're feeling a little better?"

Ed's eyes widened at this as he looked across the table. "What, you don't wanna just keep eating while I rest it off?"

Kurama shook his head. "Hey, it's no fun if both of us aren't on our A-game; I want ya to give it the best you've got."

Ed blinked, surprised at Kurama's graciousness. Hunter, already well used to this, simply sent a warm smile the young creature's way.

Al, though he was also surprised, nonetheless added, "Brother, I think it'd be a good idea if you rested for a bit; these goodies aren't going anywhere."

Laughing a bit, Ed sat up. "Alright, alright, we'll take a break. Twist my arm, why don'tcha..." Kurama only giggled at this, as the two lapsed into companionable silence as they relaxed, marveling at how much their stomachs had already bulged. Ed's belly had swollen a bit more noticeably, with a tiny bit of flesh peeking out from under his shirt. Kurama, though his stomach was still concealed beneath his shirt, appeared as though he'd swallowed a melon whole.

It wasn't long before Al broke the silence. "You know, Hunter..." he began.

Hunter glanced up at him. "Hmm? Yeah, Al?" he replied curiously.

Al rubbed the back of his head. "If you don't mind me asking...what exactly ARE you? I mean, you're not a Chimera, and you're not a being of pure energy..."

"Chakra," Kurama piped up.

"...chakra," Al amended, laughing a bit at the young fox. "So, I hafta ask...what are you?"

At this, Ed looked over at them. "Ya know, I'm a little curious about that myself...."

Hunter smiled. "Ah, now THAT'S something I don't get to explain often..."

Kurama's hand shot up. "Ooh! Hunter! Can I tell it?"

Shaking his head and laughing a bit, Hunter indicated the young Tailed Beast. "Sure thing, Kurama; you always manage to tell it good."

Kurama gave a wide, toothy grin at this. Then, shifting his chair so he could easily look at Ed and Al, he began speaking.

"Hunter comes from a world that's pretty mundane on the surface," he began. "Yeah, they've got pretty advanced tech, but a lotta people think stuff like magic, ghosts, and the supernatural are just fairy tales." He giggled a bit at his little pun before going on. "But see, if you're willing to keep an open mind and consider every possibility...you'll find more than you've ever imagined."

He gestured at Hunter. "He's part of the 'more'. Hunter comes from a race of anthropomorphic canines that have existed almost as long as the humans of his world have. No alien intervention, no experimentation, no dimensional travel..." He winked at the wolf. "Nope, it's their home just as much as this world is your guys'."

Kurama paused to gather his thoughts, while the brothers stared at him, not quite sure what to make of this revelation. Hunter took this opportunity to add, "It's not just wolves either; dogs, coyotes, dholes...if it's a canine, there are gonna be anthro versions of them." He smirked and jabbed a thumb at himself. "The wolf's just one of many subspecies of canine anthro."

Nodding at this, Kurama went on with his tale. "They were always very sociable, with both each other AND humans. In fact, in the early, early years of his world's existence, they often co-existed, living alongside and helping one another."

"Pretty eloquent for a kid, huh?", Al repeated to Hunter.

Hunter chuckled. "Kid likes to read."

Blushing a bit, Kurama went on. "So yeah, everything was fine at first..." His expression fell. "But as with any race, there are always gonna be a few bad apples. Those bad apples got into some bad situations with humans, and, well...people started to fear them." He winced, the story hitting too close to home for him. "People started creating legends and myths about them, like werewolves. Hunter's...people...tried running damage control; interacting with people, helping where they could...but the damage was done."

Kurama winced again, but still went on. "Things got worse and worse for years, until one of them went crazy and started killing humans left and right..." Ed and Al's eyes widened at this, and even Hunter shut his eyes and looked to the side.

"Th-they called it 'The Beast of Gevaudan', 'cause that's the name of the place where it attacked," Kurama explained, face dropping when he saw Hunter's expression. "And, well...after that, Hunter's people saw which way the wind was blowing, and they basically scattered. I mean," Kurama added quickly, "they're still plentiful; they've just spread so far across his world you'd be lucky to meet even one during your lifetime."

Ed and Al's eyes widened. The story sounded incredible, outlandish, even ridiculous...but at the stone-cold sober expression on Hunter's face, they realized it was the truth.

"Lotta places to hide on my world," Hunter picked up, opening his eyes and looking at the two brothers. "Undeveloped forests and woods, mountains, caves...you name it, we found it."

Al's eyes widened. "Didn't...didn't your people ever try to re-integrate?"

Hunter nodded. "They did, centuries ago...but then the witch hunts went down, and they decided not to bother; not if it meant getting burned at the stake."

Kurama, never having heard this part, widened his eyes. "B-burned at the..."

Hunter shook his head. "Trust, me, you don't wanna know. Don't worry,"he added when he saw the look on Ed and Kurama's faces. "We haven't completely severed human contact. For those of us who live in the woods, we often do business with folks coming through. They usually go well...but we have to make sure they don't tell anybody about us."

"How do you do that?" Al asked, not sure he wanted to know.

Hunter grinned evilly. "We threaten to rip their throats out."

At this, Ed, Kurama, and somehow Al's faces went white. Hunter blinked dully for a moment...then burst out laughing. "Oh, c'mon, we'd never do anything like that! Sure, we THREATEN to, but we'd never actually follow through on it." He lifted up the side of his muzzle to expose his rather sharp teeth. "Usually, all it takes is a look at these to ensure mum's the word."

"But still," Al added faintly, "ripping throats out...?"

Hunter smirked. "Hey, it gets the job done, don't it?"

Clearing his throat, he went on."Anyway, even living as families, we're still very social, and still really in-touch with one another..." The wolf smiled fondly. "My mom and dad...they're the best parents anyone could ask for, and I had a great puphood thanks to them." I definitely need to visit sometime....it's been too long, the wolf mused internally. "Anyway, their names are Sage-she's my mom-and Garwood, Gar for short-my dad. So if you're ever in my world..." he winked. "Look 'em up." He nodded to Kurama to finish the tale, and the young Tailed Beast was only too happy to oblige.

"So yeah, THAT'S where Hunter comes from, and THAT'S what he is. Still," he added, his voice turning warm, "that's not NEARLY as important as WHO he is."

Hunter smiled softly. "And what would that be?"

Kurama beamed and held up a fist. "My friend."

Feeling his heart hitch, Hunter nonetheless managed a smirk. He strode over to Kurama, held his own fist up, and returned the fox's fist bump. "Aww, thanks, fuzzball."

Ed and Al only watched, gaping...though Ed could have sworn he felt something melting inside his chest....

Noticing his brother's discomfort (though he couldn't deny that his armored chest felt oddly soft), Al cleared his throat. "S-so! Erm, you feeling better, brother?"

At this, Ed got a thoughtful look on his face....
13312211222122221211122222212.title: Ed gets a stomachache

choices: One of them gains the upper hand...
The two remain steadily matched...
133122112221222212111222222121.content:
Rubbing his rounded belly idly with his organic hand, Ed looked down at his stomach thoughtfully, then back at Al before a grin rose over the young alchemists' face, saying all that need be said. "Heh, y'know what, Al? I think a lil waiting was juuuuuust what I needed..." Ed replied, giving his belly a few eager pats,

Kurama, of course, beamed eagerly.

"Finally, waiting felt like it was gonna be an eternity..." the young fox joked, much to Ed's amusement. "...Now that'cher gut's not hurting anymore...ready to try'n fill it up with more goodies?"

Grinning slyly right back, Ed gave young Kurama a wink and said, "MORE than ready..."

And without another word uttered, both Ed and Kurama dove right back in, scarfing down various baked goods and chewing voraciously as their cheeks filled to the near comical brim with pastries. Al, meanwhile, watching from the sidelines, simply chuckled softly and shook his head.

"The lengths brother will go through just to stuff himself with as much food as possible..." the younger alchemist remarked, much to Hunter's amusement. "Hey, to be fair, when it comes to the fuzzball's baking, no lengths are too great. I swear, if I took this kid to this other realm I frequent, he'd kick so much ass at 'Cupcake Wars.'"

At this, Al's fiery red eyes seemed to blink dully.

"...'Cupcake...Wars'...? People have wars over cupcakes...? Or have these people learned to weaponize cupcakes somehow...?"

At this, Hunter cracked up and waved his paw dismissively.

"No no no, it's nothin' malicious or violent. It's...hmmm...think of it as...ANOTHER contest. Only, instead of stuffing their faces with cupcakes, the contestants are trying their best to make the best looking and best tasting cupcakes for the judges."

"Oh, so it's a bake-off?"

"A more extreme and dramatic one, but yeah, more or less. I've debated taking Kurama to this realm a few times, since he has the means to look human after all. Buuuuut something tells me this particular realm might be a bit too...erm, adult oriented. So, maybe when he's older."

"Say, Hunter," Al began.

"Hmm? What's up, Al?"

"These realms you speak of...how often do you traverse them?"

"Honestly, as often as I can. I mean, it's not a realm a minute or anything like that, y'know? But I like seeing new places, and meeting new people especially. Part of what keeps me from just realm jumping again and again are all the cool faces I come across, present company included."

While Ed and Kurama were too busy scarfing down more and more pastries to hear, Al chuckled softly and rubbed the back of his metallic 'head.'

"That's nice of you to say, but still, doesn't it ever get dangerous?" asked Al, to which, Hunter nodded and rubbed the back of his head almost uneasily. "...And THEN some..." he said in a smaller voice, before perking back up and adding, "but the risks are worth it, I say. If I didn't take those risks, I'd have never met some of my best friends..." Hunter then glanced over at Kurama, watching the young pre-teen fox stuffing his muzzle with as many of his own pastries as he could manage, and smiled warmly as he added, "...including the fuzzball over there."

Said 'fuzzball', meanwhile, had just gulped down a heaping mouthful of danishes and licked his chops clean before pulling an armful of doughnuts his way, and promptly snatched them up, pulled them to his maw, and began taking sharp chomps out of each one, face beaming with each delightful bite. "Mmmm, man, I almost forgot how perfect Elfman's Vanilla Glaze recipe tastes on these bad boys!" beamed the young fox, before chomping down on more.

Ed, on the other hand, had just polished off a plate full of cookies and was now working on a cherry pie. Tearing a huge chunk out, the teen opened his own mouth nice and wide and shoved about half of his slice into his eager maw before chomping down and chewing voraciously. Taking a hearty gulp, he sighed and shoveled the rest of the 'slice' right back in, smearing cherry sauce all over his lips, much to Hunter's amusement, and Al's bemusement. The FullMetal Alchemist then wiped his mouth clean and licked the cherry and crust residue from his lips, before grabbing another slice from the pie and doing the exact same thing, earning the same cherry smeared result within bites. Al simply shook his head at his older brothers uncouth eating habits.

"Honestly, brother, where are your manners...?" scolded the younger suit of armor.

To which, Ed grinned impishly at his younger brother and said, "Dunno, but wherever they are, I hope they can hear this..." And to emphasize what 'this' meant, the elder Elric took his automail fist and thumped it against his chest a few times, causing Ed to let out a HUGE belch, much to Al's embarrassment, while Hunter and Kurama snickered with amusement at the boorish display.

"Hehe, good one, Ed," Kurama remarked between his snickers, holding his fist towards Ed, who smacked his chops, smirked at the young kyuubi, and bumped his fist right back.

"Thanks, heh, was kinda waiting on that one for a while actually."

Al simply sighed and hung his head into his palm.

"...I'm surrounded..." he murmured to himself, earning a pat on the 'back' by Hunter. "Yep! Ya suuuuure are!" he said jokingly, which only exasperated Al's sigh. While Al facepalmed though, Ed and Kurama once again resumed voraciously wolfing down more sweets. Polishing off his doughnuts with gusto, the young fox licked his chops clean, and followed Ed's example, grabbing a still fresh apple pie from the table, ripping out a huge chunk designated a 'slice', aaaaand just like Ed, shoved it messily right into his maw, wasting no time chewing and gulping before repeating the same motion.

As more time passed, both Ed and Kurama's tummies continued to steadily swell up. Ed's T-Shirt hiked up a little more and more to the point where the bottom was resting just below Ed's belly button. And Kurama had finally consumed enough for his own shirt to hike up enough to expose some orange fur from his belly. But neither one showed any signs of slowing down.

As more time passed...
133122112221222212111222222121.title: "Yep; let's get back to stuffing our faces!"

choices: Kurama continues telling the story
1331221122212222121112222221212.content:
Ed and Kurama pressed on, neither willing to let up and give the other an advantage....and too enticed by the delicious flavors and textures to go any slower. Donuts, cakes, pastries, milkshakes, pies...it was all grabbed, savored, and devoured, with no notable end in sight. Hunter and Al continued watching, the wolf with a wide, amused grin, and Al with a growing sense of resignation (and a growing desire to massage his temples, even if it wouldn't have really done anything.)

Obviously, this caused their stomachs to swell up further and further; Kurama's shirt continued pulling upwards, exposing more of his orange-furred belly. Ed's shirt, on the other hand, pulled up to reveal his navel, and slowly continued hiking up. All the while, their pants slowly but surely grew tighter. And yet, neither one let up...

...at least, until Ed drew a pie towards him, took a bite...and widened his eyes. "Kurama," he began slowly, the forkful still in his mouth, "What kinda pie is this...?"

"Hmm?" Kurama mumbled through a mouthful of cake. Gulping it down, he looked toward Ed. "Oh, that?" He laughed, rubbing the back of his head. "It's a butterscotch-cinnamon pie; this is my first time making it, so if its a little dry or under-baked, sorry..."

Ed's eyes widened, even as he gulped down the pie. "Are you kidding?" he exclaimed. "This pie tastes awesome!"

Kurama tilted his head, ears twitching a bit. "Really...?" he asked, unable to keep his surprise and gratitude completely out of his tone.

Ed grinned, ripping out a huge forkful and cramming it into his mouth. "You bet!" the young alchemist exclaimed eagerly ("Brother, swallow before you talk," Al murmured in exasperation). "It's sweet, thick, rich..." he chewed a bit more before gulping it down and getting to work on an even BIGGER forkful. "Can't believe I've never had one of these before!"

Blushing a bit, Kurama scratched his cheek. "H-heh, well, don't be TOO impressed; you can take it from me, it's nowhere near as good as Toriel's pies...."

Ed smirked. "Well, I've never had her pies, so I wouldn't...." he trailed off as Kurama's statement fully clicked. "Wait...Toriel?"

Kurama nodded. "Yep; she's a sorta goat-monster Hunter and me met a while back." Hunter grinned and nodded, but Ed and Al only looked even more confused. "...monster?" Al asked faintly.

Hunter shook his head. "N-naw, it's nothing bad or anything; in her world "Monster" is just a catch-all term for a variety of strange creatures."

Kurama nodded eagerly. "Yep, and they're no more malicious than anybody else. I mean, they have homes, jobs, families, just like anybody else...."

Hunter perked up. "And speaking of family...she also has a son, and he's probably THE sweetest, kindest....CUTEST little fella you'd ever have the pleasure of meeting," he exclaimed, face lighting up.

"Hey, what about me?" Kurama protested playfully, putting on his best mock-annoyed look.

The wolf smirked. "OK, OK, SECOND sweetest, kindest, cutest little fella you'd ever have the pleasure of meeting," he amended.

Kurama giggled. "Heh heh, thanks. But you're right, he's one of the nicest people I've ever met..."

Suddenly, Kurama sagged a bit. “Poor guy didn’t deserve to go through what he did…” he muttered under his breath. Hunter’s ears twitched, and he nodded sadly.

However, Kurama hadn’t spoken as quietly as he thought he had, and Ed and Al looked at him, curious. “What he went through?” Ed asked. “What happened?”

Hunter and Kurama shared a glance, the wolf gave the young Nine-Tails a nod. Nodding in return, Kurama returned his attention to Ed and Al.

“Well…” he scratched the back of his head, trying to figure out how to begin. “It’s a really long story, and I don’t know if I wanna go into exact detail, but…” He took a breath. “A long time ago, he befriended and trusted the wrong person…and he died because of it.”

That caught Ed and Al’s attention. “He…he died?!” Al exclaimed, fiery eyes widening.

Kurama nodded, bowing his head a bit. “Yeah, and what’s worse, monsters in that world turn to dust when they die. His parents…” He felt tears pricking his eyes, but he continued on. “…his parents saw him turn to dust right in front of their eyes.”

Ed gaped. “Wha---seriously?!” Kurama nodded again, and the young alchemist grit his teeth. Losing Nina had been hard enough, but if they had actually seen…he shook his head vigorously; that train of thought always led to places he didn’t want to go.

The fox carried on. “Later on, he was accidentally restored to life…but it was as a flower, and without a soul.”

“And before you say that people don’t come back from the dead,” Hunter cut in, when it looked like Ed was about to interject, “That’s a different world, with different natural laws,” his eyes narrowed, “and the same rules don’t apply.”

Both brothers fell silent at this, slightly taken aback; the wolf’s voice and expression were intense, and brooked no room for argument. A far cry from the easygoing, friendly wolf they’d begun to know, to be sure…
1331221122212222121112222221212.title: A Goat's Tale, Part 1

choices: They start demolishing the goodies, and remain evenly matched
They start demolishing the goodies, but one of them establishes a lead
13312211222122221211122222212121.content:
Giving Hunter a surprised yet undnerstanding look, Kurama continued. “Without a soul, he couldn’t feel compassion, hope, or love…and he became a sociopath hell-bent on destroying everything.”

Al winced internally at this; as difficult as his current situation was, he felt emotions just the same as he did when he’d had his human body. To be stripped even of that…it didn’t bear thinking about.

“Eventually,” Kurama continued, “he absorbed enough souls to regain his true form, but he quickly transformed into an older, stronger version of himself. He aimed to gain complete control of his world’s timelines, but Frisk-a human kid who’d stumbled into the monsters’ underground world by mistake-faced and fought him, and eventually managed to bring him to his senses. He once again assumed his true form. He released all the souls he’d absorbed…but that once again left him without a soul, and it was only a matter of time before he became a flower again.”

He paused, and Ed took this moment to interject. “You’re kidding,” he began, noticeably upset. “After all that…the poor kid still…?”

“Wait ‘till he’s finished telling it,” Hunter informed him calmly…though there was a hint of a smile tugging at his muzzle. Ed glanced at the wolf, once again taken aback by his directness, but nonetheless complied.

Giving Hunter a small smile, Kurama continued on. “Some time after that, Hunter and I met Asriel in a…special place, which I’ll tell you about later.” He smiled warmly. “We hit it off pretty quick; he was pretty nervous and shy at first-understandably, of course-but it wasn’t long before we were all playing together, exploring…and hanging out as friends. And…”

The smile faded a bit. “…when je told us about what he’d been through…what was going to happen to him once he left that special place…” Kurama’s smile faded further. “…we both knew we couldn’t let that happen to him, not after everything he’d been through. And me… I was still just a kit then, but I promised him I’d find a way to help him, no matter how long it took. And a few years later, in my world’s time…I was ready."

He chuckled a bit. “Luckily, some worlds run on different laws of time than others, so what was a few years for me was only a couple months in Asriel’s world. Anyway,” he continued, the smile beginning to return to his face. “Once I was ready, I got one of Hunter’s friends to take me to Asriel’s world, and I tracked down Frisk.”

“The kid who fought him?” Al asked, surprised.

Kurama grinned. “The very same. As it turned out, he wasn’t any happier about leaving Asriel to his fate than we were, and he’d been trying to figure out a way to save him…but nothing he tried worked. So I told him who I was, and that I had an idea about how to save him. We both traveled to the mountain that served as the entrance to the monsters’ former home, and we found Asriel. It…wasn’t easy when we did,” he admitted with a pained look on his face, evidently not wanting to go into further detail than that, “but once we brought Asriel back to his senses…”

“Sorry to butt in, fuzzball,” Hunter suddenly spoke, “but can I take over from here?” He grinned widely, showing his sharp teeth. “I’m just so damn proud of what you came up with.”

Kurama blinked, a bit surprised, but nonetheless smiled and nodded. “Sure, go ahead.”

Giving the fox a thumbs-up, Hunter turned his attention to Ed and Al. “Once they got Asriel calmed down, Frisk was able to give a piece of his soul to Asriel, and Kurama gave some of his chakra to supplement and strengthen it. It was touch and go for a bit, but…”

A warm smile came to the wolf’s muzzle. “…it ended up working like a damn charm. The kid had a soul of his own again, and he could go back home to his family.”

Kurama smiled just as warmly, even as tears once again pricked his eyes…albeit for a very different reason. “I stayed out of sight when Frisk and Asriel got back home, so I didn’t intrude…but I saw everything. And when Asriel’s parents saw him, alive and well…”

He closed his eyes, a couple tears running down his cheeks as he remembered Asriel’s parents crying tear of pure disbelief and joy and embracing their son. “…I don’t think words would do it justice.”

Ed and Al stared at him, lost for words. Finally, Al said, “You…you really did all that for him?”

Kurama opened his eyes and looked at Al, a few tears still dripping. “Of course I did; I promised him, didn’t I? Besides,” he added, wiping his eyes on his sleeve, “it wasn’t all me; Frisk gave a part of his soul, too, even though we didn’t know what would happen…”

“Heh,” Hunter laughed good-naturedly. “I think you’re selling yourself short; if it weren’t for you, you two wouldn’t have been able to devise that plan, and Asriel would still be suffering…”

Kurama shrugged. “Y-yeah, I guess that’s true…”

Internally, he winced. Still, he wondered guiltily, would he still be so happy and proud if he knew I gave Asriel more than just my chakra…?
He hated keeping secrets from Hunter, especially after all the anthro had helped do for him…but he knew how Hunter would react if he told him the whole truth. But he deserves the truth, Kurama thought, not for the first time. Before we leave Ed and Al’s world, I’ll tell him…

“Kurama? You still with us, pal?”

Kurama snapped to attention. “E-eh?” He looked toward Hunter, who was regarding him with an amused yet somewhat curious look. “O-oh yeah; just kinda got overwhelmed thinking about it.” He smiled at Hunter. “I’m fine, though.”

Hunter flashed Kurama a grin, then turned his attention back to Ed and Al. “Anyhow, Asriel’s living a happy life now, with his friends and family. We check up on him every now and again, and we’re never disappointed with how he’s doing.” He brightened. “I see a lotta great things in his future…”

"...and his friends and family will be there to help him, every step of the way," Kurama finished, smiling warmly.

Ed and Al were silent once again, trying to decide how or even if they should respond to that. It was all so much to take in...

Luckily, Kurama spoke up again. "After all, if you have people you love by your side, what can't you do?" To punctuate this, he drew another pie towards him and took a bite, beaming happily. Seeing that Ed and Al were still lost for words, though, he smirked as an idea came to him. "Just like how, with Hunter here, I'm totally gonna eat more than you!"

That snapped the brothers out of their stupor. "N-not if I'm eating with Al here!" Ed sputtered, causing the animated suit of armor to groan a bit and facepalm.

Kurama's eyes gleamed. "Bring it on!"

And, with that, fox and alchemist were at it once again, shoveling as many goodies as they good down their gullets, and their midsections slowly expanding as a result with Hunter and Kurama watching on....
13312211222122221211122222212121.title: A Goat's Tale, Part 2

choices: ...In the form of a HUGE belch...
...It passed, but Ed was now eating notably slower than prior...
133122112221222212111222222121211.content:
It wasn't long before the young alchemist and younger fox were clearing out the pies the two had drawn towards them, leaving behind a pair of empty tins. But neither one was going to stop there, so both Edward and Kurama grabbed the nearest pie by either ones vicinity and; without so much as even taking a slice out to at least eat cleaner, both just stabbed their forks down, and practically began shoveling the baked goods into their eager maws. It was liking watching a blur of pure high speed motion...on fast forward while their pies slowly diminished. Though, in this case, one may imagine 'slowly' being used rather loosely.

Hunter just smirked at the sight and lightly nudged the large animated suit of armor with his elbow.

"Hehe, so, any bets on who ya think is gonna come out on top?" the wolf inquired, to which, Alphonse simply sighed and replied with, "At this rate, I can envision some pretty bad tummyaches for both of them. Edward already had to take a break earlier on after all."

At that, Hunter snickered and shook his head.

"I dunno, Al, you saw how Ed managed at the contest. And, not to gush or anything, that lil orange fuzzball puts it away like no one's business."

"I just don't see why they can't just enjoy their meals like ordinary people."

And naturally, Hunter began snickering as the answer was just too perfect.

"Ehehe, yeaaaah could be cause neither one of these two are the least bit normal, am I right?"

Which, naturally, earned yet another sigh and a shake of the metallic head from the younger Elric brother. Still laughing, Hunter just playfully patted the suit of armor on the back and said, "Ah, c'mon, these two're smart enough to pace themselves a lil bit. But so long as they're having fun, that's what matters most, right?"

And indeed, for all the competition brewing between Ed and Kurama, both; even with the competitive glint in their eyes, couldn't help but occasionally beam at the flavor of their respective dishes. As for their steadily swelling stomachs, that was another matter entirely. Watching the scene, Hunter couldn't help but reflect back on a few things, which caused his smile to soften a bit, which; naturally, Alphonse caught wind of.

"Everything alright, Hunter?" asked Al.

Glancing back at the suit of armor, Hunter flashed a grin and said, "Oh, y-yeah, heh, I'm cool. It's just...h-heh, this, and everything Kurama was talking about, it kinda reminds me of the time we first spent with Asriel. Hehe, I swear, for such a reserved, gentle creature, I tell ya, that kid could REALLY pack it away."

And naturally, this drew Alphonse's attention as well as he asked, "...Wait a minute, you mean, even Asriel-"

"-Ate til he looked like his gut was the size of a friggin' medicine ball? Yyyyyyep. And you better believe he can still pack it away to this day now that he's got his soul and body back. It's funny because, at first, the kid didn't want to eat a whole lot. H-heh, we kinda egged him on, but eventually, he came around, and man oh man did he put us to shame."

Alphonse simply sighed and shook his head. "Is there anyone out there who DOESN'T eat like it's the end of the world?" Which earned a hearty laugh from the wolf as he shook his head and replied with, "Ah, haha, I hope not, pal."

The younger Elric sighed again, but eventually chuckled a bit himself, thinking vacantly himself. "Well...I'm just glad he got a happy ending in the end. I mean, to imagine one could endure so much...be dealt such a horrid hand in life...and still end up just...lost..."

"...Yeah, I hear ya, Al, more than you can imagine..."

"...But for Kurama to go through such lengths to save him, with his friend, Frisk...h-he...he's a good guy...a truly good one..."

Hunter glanced back at the young fox, who was shoveling yet another whole pie vigorously into his maw, and despite himself, Hunter smiled a warm, proud smile at the Tailed Beast, nodding ever so slightly. "...He truly is..."

And so, Al just watched as both his older brother and new fox friend consumed and consumed....

...The pans began to pile up as one pie after another was demolished without hesitation. And all the while, both their bellies steadily swelled up little by little. Even Ed had to admit, he was impressed by Kurama's relentless speed. After all, when they began, Ed had already eaten considerably more than the young fox, yet, here the two were, on the same level with no stops in sight. And to cap it off, after hearing his tragic story about their friend, Asriel, he only grew to respect Kurama more and more. Still, for as much as he grew to like the young, orange furred fox, he wasn't about to lose anytime soon. So, he soldiered on, stuffing more and more various pies into his maw, barely stopping to chew for more than half a second or two with each gulp. But those brief moments were all he ever needed to truly find himself rapt by the sheer wonderful flavor bursting with each bite. Which, of course, only encouraged the young alchemist to chow down further as his belly swelled up just a bit more with every few mouthfuls wolfed down.

It wasn't until Ed's rather bloated stomach let out a DEEP gurgle that he was forced to stop for a moment, which caught Al's attention almost immediately as he glanced at his older brother with slight but still fairly noticeable concern and immediately asked, "Erm, Brother...? Are you okay...?"

And of course, upon hearing that, Kurama gulped down his current mouthful and glanced back at the grimacing elder Elric.

"Yeah, are you still feeling up to it, Ed? Because, we can take another break if you need us to for any reason, really." remarked young Kurama...

Ed didn't want to keep slowing down whenever his bloated belly seemingly reached another apex. After all, that would start to look pathetic, in his mind. But, on the other hand, he really didn't want to...'lose his lunch' either, as that would be a less than pretty sight, and would, no doubt, put a hamper on the whole outing...not to mention, prove Al right, which Ed did NOT want to do...at least, not in regards to stuffing his face...

And with an even deeper gurgle, Edward Elric had his answer...
133122112221222212111222222121211.title: They start demolishing the goodies, evenly matched

choices: Hunter accepts and joins Ed in eating the goodies he'd prepared.
Al wants answers before anything else.
133122112221222212112.content:
"...S-s-sooo much fooooood..." was all Ed could incoherently mutter upon reaching the second floor of the warehouse and baring witness to the holy grail of snacks and desserts. Everything Hunter had mentioned below and then some, was just sprawled on a large table, practically begging to be consumed. Hunter, seeing Ed in his near trance-like state, practically drooling, simply laughed and said, "Bon appetit, Mr. Elric."

Al, upon reaching the sight, couldn't help but be impressed, as he turned to Hunter and asked, "Wow, you prepared ALL of this for Brother...?" Hunter smiled proudly and said, "Like I said, nothing but the finest."

Ed slowly approached the table, still gaping in dumbfounded awe at the feast to be. Sitting down, he just examined all the goodies around him, unable to decide where to start, until his stomach roared impatiently. Scowling a bit, he glanced down at it and said, "Alright already, sheesh!" He pulled a brownie out of a bowl of vanilla ice cream, then took a nice, big bite. After chewing for a moment, he stopped as his eyes lit up. In no time at all, he immediately wolfed down the brownie in his hand, and wasted no time ripping into another, then another.

Smiling widely, the young alchemist proceeded to grab a spoon, and lather his next brownie with even more vanilla ice cream on top, then took a gaping bite, enjoying the burst of chilled and warm flavors mixed together. "Mmmm! Oh man, this stuff tastes incredible!" Ed exclaimed, before smothering the rest of his brownie with more ice cream and stuffing the whole thing into his mouth, enjoying the plethora of flavors surging from the pastry, ice cream combination, but only momentarily before reaching for another hungrily.

Both Al and Hunter watched as Ed was reaching for whatever he could and immediately stuffing it straight into his more than eager mouth. Gulping down a mouthful of various delights, Ed sighed happily and said, "I'm tellin' ya, Al, the SECOND you get your body back, we're gonna get all the smooth, warm brownies and ice cream money can buy! I can't believe we never tried combining the two before!" Al simply smirked, only half paying attention to his older brother. However, he hadn't forgotten what Hunter had said to him downstairs, and decided to address Hunter on that issue before any more distractions could arise and interrupt him yet again. "Say, Hunter..."

The wolf immediately turned to the large suit of animated armor. "What's up?"

"About what you said downstairs," Al stopped for a moment, gathering his thoughts as his tone grew a tad more serious. "Exactly what do you know about what Brother and I have been through in our lives...?"

"Oh, that?" Hunter proceeded to rub the back of his head as he went on. "Well, see, another thing about me is that I can get access to a considerable amount of information on people, courtesy of-"

"Hey, Hunter!"

Both Hunter and Al; slightly annoyed at being interrupted yet again, turned to Ed, who was in the process of digging into a layer cake. "I just wanna say...thanks for all this. I know we didn't exactly get off on the right foot, with the height thing and the whole me wanting to bash your face in for the height thing...but this right here?" he said, gesturing towards the table of food and the slice of cake still in his hand, "...I don't care if it IS just all to get a laugh outta watching me eat myself silly, this goes BEYOND awesome. Soooo...thanks!"

Hunter smiled, tail wagging as he said, "Happy to serve, Mr. Elric." Chuckling a bit, Ed added, "Do me a favor, just call me Ed."

"Sure thing, Ed. Hope you enjoy!" He then turned his attention back to Al and said, "But yeah, like I was telling you, back where I come from, see, I have-"

"Y'know, come to think of it," Ed added, earning an annoying groan from Al as he facepalmed immediately after.

"There's more than enough stuff here to go around, y'know? Much as I wouldn't mind eating every last drop of it, I've always enjoyed eating with company, and since Al can't eat anything, how would you like to get in on this, Hunter?"

Hunter thought for a moment while Al fought the urge to shout angrily for answers as best he could...
133122112221222212112.title: Ed, upon seeing the goodies, chomps away.

choices: Hunter and Ed go faster and faster, each trying to outdo the other
Ed, not used to eating so many sweets at once, has to take a break
1331221122212222121122.content:
Hunter looked at Ed, smiling. "Well, if you insist..."

"Wait a minute!"

At Al's exclamation, Ed stopped midway through a brownie and turned in his chair to face his little brother. Hunter, in turn, looked towards Al; knowing exactly what was bothering him, he winced.

Ed blinked, confused. "Al, what's the deal? I know you're not crazy about me stuffing myself, but it's not like I'm gonna back out in public once I'm done!"

Al shook his head. "No, Brother, it's not that." He looked towards Hunter more than a mite suspiciously. "While you were changing, Hunter was talking about how, considering what we've been threw, it was only fair to throw us a bone."

Ed's eyes widened. "How would he know anything about us?" He looked at Hunter, his eyes narrowing. "What aren't you telling us?"

Hunter sighed, rubbing the back of his head. "Ah geez..." He looked apologetically towards Al. "I was gonna tell Al anyway, but since you're both here, I might as well tell both of you." Taking a deep breath, he composed himself as best he could.

"Generally, whenever I'm following someone, I make it a point to know as much about them as I can. To that end, before I even came here, I had some...acquaintances run some recon on you two."

Al tilted his head. "What kind of 'acquaintances'?"

Hunter shrugged. "The kinds of acquaintances that know how to avoid being seen and are very thorough in their investigations." Before Ed and Al could inquire further, Hunter hastily continued. "Anyway, after they got back to me with the info they dug up..."

To the brothers' shock, he actually winced, looking somewhat pained. "I gotta say, I was shocked to hear what a raw deal you guys got. I mean, losing your mom at such a young age, losing parts of your bodies...can't imagine what that was like."

Ed's shoulders slumped, his eyes downcast. "Y-yeah..." he muttered, notably pained att the mention of his and Al's past trauma. The younger Elric said something, but he clenched his fists, trembling a little bit.

Hunter winced again, immediately regretting bringing up those events, but he went on. "A-anyway, it's no secret the following years weren't exactly a picnic for either of you..." An image of a little, bright-eyed brunette girl came to the minds of both brothers, and they fought back the memory. "...and I know trying to get your bodies back has been an uphill battle since then."

He smiled a bit. "I know you've no shortage of friends to help and support you, but I figured, what could it hurt to make make things a bit easier on ya?"

Ed and Al gaped at the wolf; there was still the tiniest chance he was jerking them around, but he seemed so sincere...

Ed was the first to speak up. "You're...you're really doing all this just 'cause you wanted to be nice
to us?"

Hunter shrugged. "Well, part of it is just 'cause I like watching guys like you stuff themselves, but yeah, that was a big part of it." He paused for a moment. "So...you guys mad? I mean, you've got every right to be..."

Al thought for a moment. "Well, I'm not too happy you invaded our privacy, but if you're really doing all this just because of what we went through..."

"...well, I guess we can't be TOO mad," Ed finished, smiling.

Hunter grinned. "That's great to hear..." he looked towards Al. "...and don't worry, Al's secret is safe with me." He licked his chops. "Now, what was that you were saying about eating those goodies with you?"

Ed grinned, motioning to the table. "Yep! More than enough here for two of us!"

Hunter's tail wagged happily as he made his way over to the table, pulled a chair over, and sat down. "Awesome. In which case..." He grabbed a cupcake in each hand and crammed them into his mouth. "...I'm gonna show you just how much I can put away!"

Ed, not to be outdone, smirked, pulled a triple-decker cake closer to him, and rather than use a fork, grabbed handfuls of it and crammed them into his mouth.

Al groaned, facepalming. Brother, where are your manners?

Heedless of Al's exasperation, Ed and Hunter continued chomping away, the latter gaining momentum as he grabbed brownies, slices of pie, and anything else that came within his reach. Ed, seeing Hunter start to catch up, started shoveling goodies into his mouth even quicker. Hunter, not to be outdone, drew a bowl of pudding towards himself and grabbed a spoon, tucking in right away.

Al watched the two go at it, shaking his head. I can't believe Brother's doing this again...

Almost against his will, another thought came to him:

By the time Hunter's done, is he gonna need a belly rub?
1331221122212222121122.title: Al wants answers before anything else.

choices: The two take a break to catch their breath.
One of them starts to flag as the other takes lead.
13312211222122221211221.content:
More time had passed as both the wolf and alchemist continued to joyously stuff their faces with virtually whatever was within arms length. Al, watching besides the table, shook his metallic head at his older brothers display as he continued to use his bare hands to scoop up chunks of layer cake and stuff it right into his all-too-eager maw. It's a wonder how either one hasn't accidentally bitten off a finger yet... Al thought, as he bared witness to the piggish sight. Still, despite himself, he couldn't help but chuckle at the thought as another crept into his mind. Actually, seeing Brother try to ever explain that to Winry could be worth a laugh. Least it'd teach him to never go this overboard again... His train of thought was promptly interrupted as a slab of cake splattered against the younger Elric's 'face'. Or not...

Chuckling a bit nervously, Ed rubbed the back of his head sheepishly as Al wiped his helmet whilst giving Ed something of a death glare and said, "Ehhh hehe, sorry about that, Al. Went kinda nuts with the cake for a second there." Hunter snickered to himself as he wiped his own maw and added, "You'll have to excuse your brother, Al." He then grinned slickly and added, "He's trying his very best to keep up with yours truly, and I think that perhaps it might be a little easier said than done." Ed cocked an eyebrow up as he retorted with, "Oh ho ho, is THAT so..."

Knowing all too well how competitive Ed could get, Al took the hint and preemptively took a good few steps back to avoid any more mishaps. Al raised his hand up and cautioned, "Brother, just try not to go a little too-" Before he could finish, Ed immediately began shoveling more and more cake into his mouth. Grinning, Hunter also wasted no time picking up the pace as he tore into more muffins at a surprisingly quick pace for such a heavy pastry. At this point, Al had given up on trying to keep Ed from going TOO overboard, so he shrugged to himself and noted, Well, at least he didn't call Ed a pipsqueak again...

The two carried on for a good while, consuming an ample amount of pastries and treats each. As time pressed on, the two began to slow down a slightly noticeable amount, as the volume of food consumes had become a bit more apparent. Having eaten an ample amount thus far, Ed's stomach was now bulging out noticeably still contained from beneath his red t-shirt. Even Hunter's own tummy had expanded to a similarly distended state from beneath his black tank-top, though it was still a tad smaller than Ed's tummy since Ed was still just slightly bloated after working off his previous victory at the competition.

Nevertheless, even in their slowed state, neither one had flagged just yet. Glancing back at Hunter, Ed smirked and said, "Boy, you weren't kidding. You can sure put 'em away, can't you?" Hunter patted his stomach proudly and grinned as he said, "Well, they don't say 'wolf down' for nothing, y'know."

Watching the two continue a bit of idle back and forth chatter, Al eased up slightly, seeing that at least this little mini-competition of theirs was good natured, and not likely to end with Ed making a scene.

"Y'know, it's too bad you didn't enter that eating contest. I think you could'a done pretty well in it," Ed said. Hunter rubbed the back of his head and grimaced as he said, "Ehhhh, I'm not so sure that'd go well with some people seeing a wolf-guy at a crowded eating competition," he then jokingly turned to Al and added, "SOME have a tendency to assume I'm out to eat them."

Al chuckled a bit and said, "Heh, yeah sorry about that." Hunter waved his hand-paw dismissively and said, "No biggie. First impressions tend to be a mixed bag for me anyway, so I'm used to it." Al laughed a bit more mischievously and added, "Still, I actually think people would be a little relieved to see you eating yourself silly at a competition. Because at least that way, even if you wanted to eat anyone, your tummy would be too full to fit anyone else inside."

The three laughed a bit at the remark, seemingly less tense than prior, before Ed and Hunter resumed scarfing down the goods still remaining on the table, all the while, both their bellies continues to expand as more and more content occupied them.

As time went on...
13312211222122221211221.title: Hunter and Ed speed up, neither one to be outdone.

choices: Al is still rubbing Hunter's tummy, so Ed decides to go ahead and eat some more
Al finishes, and Hunter gets some milk to drink with his goodies
133122112221222212112211.content:
Ed and Hunter continued scarfing down whatever they could put their hands (or paws) on, their cheeks practically bulging as they shoveled as many sweets as they could into their waiting maws. Al, though he was now standing a good distance from both of them, still had to duck out of the way of a particularly large chunk of pie. Brother, where are your manners?! He shook his head at the strange wolf-person happily stuffing his craw. Hunter certainly isn't helping matters, that's for certain...

By this point, their stomachs had expanded some more, bulging out even further, to the point where they looked as though they were hiding basketballs under theirs shirts. They were still concealed, thankfully, but it wouldn't be much longer before their midsections were seeing the light of day...
